reviews.name: Becky C.
reviews.review: I have been eyeing this place since I moved into the neighborhood a few weeks ago and finally went today.  So happy I did!  I had a bean/cheese pupusa, pork/cheese pupusa and a horchata drink.  Delightful!! I will be a regular of this place.  Very sweet staff and extremely reasonable with price.

reviews.name: Adams C.
reviews.review: I went here today to spend a delightful afternoon with pork and cheese pupusas, which are flavorful, gooey, filling, and a steal at 2 bucks each. I am looking forward to our next date, pork and cheese pupusas.

reviews.name: Brandon G.
reviews.review: Nails the Jimmy Buffett vibe in the middle of downtown Nashville. Eclectic mix of live music, which was a very cool experience.A special shoutout to stilts-walker extraordinaire Natasha who's also a self-taught balloon artist. The hat you made me was one-of-a-kind. My parents and I were downtown for one night only, and you helped make it the best experience of the trip. Thank you!

reviews.name: Crystal K.
reviews.review: Pros: Great GF options, awesome server, friendly service, affordable prices, short wait on a busy weekend night. Cons: food was just mediocre.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: Sat at the bar for dinner.  I had the shrimp wedge salad which was nothing spectacular.  The dressing that comes with it is very similar to thousand island... this is one of my pet peeves.  If it is a spade call it a spade.  I can't remember what fancy name they called the dressing on the menu but I was kicking myself for not asking what it was. It is thousand island, people!!!  YUCK.  The shrimp were pretty good but too greasy for them being blackened.  This wedge salad desperately needed some bacon on it.  And ranch dressing.  The lettuce wedges (3 of them) were obnoxiously huge.  Really who is going to eat all that?  They were so big there was no room left to cut them up on the plate.  And the capers were just out of place and weird.  Anyway...my friend is a vegetarian and ordered the veggie burger which looked a lot like a beef burger from my angle.  Luckily he checked it out before biting into it...  Not cool.  Wasn't impressed. The atmosphere was really loud.  I know it is Nashville but it was overbearing and the band wasn't all that great.  The bartender seemed to personally know the guy sitting next to me so I had to listen to her almost constant conversation with him which was her loudly talking (almost yelling) over the band.  It was annoying.

reviews.name: Steven M.
reviews.review: I went here with a big group of people, about 50-60. We were served buffet dinner with very generic food on it. Grilled chicken, grilled salmon, jalapeno mac & cheese, salad and corn. It got the tummy full but nothing to rave about, but what do you expect from a place that specializes in margaritas. The atmosphere was okay and the wait staff was good. Maybe the experience would be better visiting on my own, but for now, don't think that'll happen.

reviews.name: Annie A.
reviews.review: Good venue,  Great food,  handicap assemble,  Great music.  I had the chicken quesadilla,  it came with guacamole,  Pico,  and a line flavored sour cream. Delish

reviews.name: Monica H.
reviews.review: Great appetizer, and great drinks. Our server was extremely attentive abd friendly. The only down side was the overpriced everything. I got the a drink that was 10$  but in all honestly it was probably worth only 7, and it wasn't very big. On top of we got the pretzels as our appetizer and we only got 4 pretzels and 2 small sides of dipping sauce. The mustard sauce would have been better if it was honey dijon mustard instead of just plain mustard.

reviews.name: Tim T.
reviews.review: We didn't eat here but all the food on the plates looked very good and had big servings, we just stopped in the check out the store and use the restrooms.

reviews.name: Jenny A.
reviews.review: It's so terrible that I'm writing a review as I sit here. Awful service. Tables are so sticky. It took about 45 minutes to get our food. Food just came and my fries are cold and my bun is burnt. How do you screw up a chicken sandwich and french fries? Also, my margarita was all sour mix. Do not suggest. Go down the block to the Tin Roof instead.

reviews.name: Shanda O.
reviews.review: Atmosphere is fun. Service is excellent. Food is decent. I loved my burger and margarita. My group's enjoyment of their food was hit and miss. We had fun. I'm not sure if we will choose it again, because of the hit and miss food enjoyment. But if it opportunity came up I would try it again. After all I enjoyed my food and drink:0). Maybe we will enjoy it more as a whole next time.

reviews.name: M.G. G.
reviews.review: My friend and I had a horrible experience here. The chips and salsa were taken back twice because they were stale and tasted like thick stale uncooked taco shells. The 2nd time the waitress assured us the manager dolled out the next batch and they were the same yucky chips only these weren't warm. The margaritas are watered down and extremely pricey. I felt so giped that I couldn't wait to get out of there and find some place to get real food. We left starving and broke! The one star is for the location only. If I had Jimmy Buffets email I would tell him he needs to to get in there and sample some of that he would flip.

reviews.name: Jordan M.
reviews.review: Sat in open seating at the bar, purposefully picking a table near the large open window at the front of the restaurant. I came with my mother and we were looking for drinks and a quick bite to eat. We ended up going with the margarita flight and a quesadilla. The margaritas were amazing and the quesadilla was delicious. We ended up getting a second flight of margaritas because we couldn't settle on just one from the selection. Our waitress was sweet and attentive. She had a lot of recommendations both for drinks at Margaritaville and other places on the strip. Live music arrived about 20 minutes after we had and had a good sound and playful interactions with those in the bar. Our bill was approximately $50, which initially was shocking but I left happy, full, and feeling good from my drinks so it was worth it. Overall a nice experience; good drinks, food, and environment.

reviews.name: Josefin F.
reviews.review: A very crazy place! Very friendly bartenders and great music. We mostly had drinks but also the fried shrimps and it was amazing!

reviews.name: Steve B.
reviews.review: Venue: MargaritavilleDecor:   NiceService:   Pretty good, FriendlyEnvironment:   Pretty size restaurantFood:   Lot of options:  American, SeafoodPrices:   Not too badDebbie Downers:   This location, the beverages are slightly higher than the chains in the south and Caribbean islandsConclusion: All in all, Margaritaville is an excellent option to hang out on the town.  Lots of people, plenty of seating, place gets jammed pack.  Unique house beverages, good food and service.  Definitely a good chain to have right on Broadway in the heart of it all.Overall: B

reviews.name: Micah C.
reviews.review: The food was good but a bit expensive.  The margaritas were fun and plentiful! The best part was the music! I'm in love with all the live music in the area. It was a Monday night and the main road was still alive it music when we headed back to our hotel around midnight. I can't wait to come back to Nashville!

reviews.name: Dennette S.
reviews.review: We are having a great time, good food, great drinks and best of all our waiter Jesse stevens. He is the best. Stop by and ask for him he will make sure you have a great time. Thank you Jesse Stevens!!!

reviews.name: MacKenzie T.
reviews.review: Takes over 20 minutes to get a drink from any of the bar tenders, also not a set last call time and as soon as they called for last call they would no longer serve anyone in my party that was there. The only reason they are even getting a star for me is the band. The bar tenders are extremely rude, service is disgustingly slow and they don't have the words customer service in their vocabulary. Will not be going back and I'm extremely disappointed that my large party was treated that poorly, I will make sure that any other large groups do not visit this business, they can spend their money at a better bar with actual customer service.

reviews.name: Paul G.
reviews.review: Always good no matter where you are at  Even though I love Margaritaville it seems a shame to pass up all the other great bars in Nashville  It is always a great experience, I love to come here  I do however consider it a commerical chain and will be looking for a good local bar ( problem is its had to find a good one) !You always know you will be happy with Jimmy !

reviews.name: Chrissy S.
reviews.review: Great live music, friendly staff, good food (love the taco salad) best sweet tea around!

reviews.name: Vincent H.
reviews.review: Getting a table here was a little difficult. There was no wait but the servers couldn't decide where to put us so we ended up just going to the bar area. Kiersten took great care of us. Came here to take my friend for his first marg! Prob will just sit at the bar from now on, they seem very attentive and friendly.

reviews.name: Tyler U.
reviews.review: Came here on a whim after exploring Nashville for the day.  Typical tourist trap with overpriced food.  The food was OK but for the same price I could have a much better dinner elsewhere.  The music was good, not great.  I'd come back only if I had family begging me to visit this place.

reviews.name: Andrea P.
reviews.review: Great gluten free menu. The service was fabulous and the live music was awesome! Definitely recommend.

reviews.name: P M.
reviews.review: Cool place with great service, but the food was average and way over priced . Live music was pretty good though.

reviews.name: Millah J.
reviews.review: Music and margaritas were great - my cheddar BBQ burger was ok...nothing special. In fact, my homemade burgers taste better. The sweet potato fries also left room to be desired. Thankfully, the Fins to the Left and Tropical Waters were tasty. I probably won't be back though...

reviews.name: Brittany P.
reviews.review: Can I say we had the best waiter ever - Chris. Very friendly, helpful and accommodating which hey I think is a rarity at most places anymore. Nice restaurant on Broadway. Very clean, open, and not too loud. If you're getting an appetizer go for the $16 nachos...they will not disappoint.

reviews.name: Ryan S.
reviews.review: My friends & I ate here for dinner. The staff was polite & friendly. The food was filling but a little on the high side you pay for the atmosphere. The drinks were delicious & averaged priced.

reviews.name: Katie A.
reviews.review: My friend and I stopped in here while we were bar hopping along South Broadway. We sat in the bar section by the band. Our waitress was Kiersten and she made our experience a great one! She was extremely friendly and had some great recommendations on the menu. I would send friends and family there for a fruity cocktail or beer, and a burger! The live band they had playing in the bar area was great and created a nice atmosphere.

reviews.name: Erin R.
reviews.review: Though it was a little pricey, our group had such a positive experience.  We walked in as a group of 18 without a reservation knowing we would likely have to split up.  After only a 25 minute wait (while we grabbed drinks at the bar) we were seated all together on the second floor.  The wait staff was quick and attentive.  There was another large party that sat near us and placed their order at a similar time, so there was some confusion with our food coming out.  A few of us had to wait a while, but everyone was so apologetic and even brought out 3 dessert platters for our entire table.  Great wait staff, friendly hostess, and accommodating management.  Get the fish tacos. We will be back!

reviews.name: Renee H.
reviews.review: Proximity to the Ryman was the initial draw to this restaurant.  We had valeted the car there and with the frigid temperatures, we wanted something close by.  As soon as we stepped through the doors, we felt good about the choice.  We were seated immediately and the life music was wonderful.    Our server was reasonably attentive and even told us about other events going on in the area.  I ordered the shrimp trio and enjoyed it but since the grilled shrimp was my favorite of the trio, I was wishing that I'd just ordered those. It is definitely somewhere that we'll go again.

reviews.name: Joy C.
reviews.review: Loved this place...1st wedding anniversary here...a mountain of nachos and margaritas!!!

reviews.name: Jose P.
reviews.review: Really good.hardly had to wait for a table.and the food was great. Try the chimichurri steak.

reviews.name: Farron V.
reviews.review: Lager Fish & Chips was really good, especially with lemon. Nice atmosphere with good live entertaining band, but long wait. It's was worth it.

reviews.name: Amanda D.
reviews.review: Three stars is pretty much on the money. I don't understand a Margaritaville in Nashville but I also am probably not the actual target demographic of these places...see: my dad who sometimes makes me think he can't find anything else on his XM radio other than Margaritaville. So we've of course been to the one in the Caymans and on Key West. Since clearly these are out of the way places, I didn't get in the way of my parents having their experience here. I was kind of hoping to avoid listening to music...or at least if I was going to have to listen to covers, NOT "Call Me Maybe" gone country. It's somewhat loud in here and I imagine as the night goes on it's louder. We were here prior to a hockey game but it was still pretty busy. Since I procured my family a free app coupon I decided I was worthy of the 5 o'clock somewhere which is a take on a Hurricane, which somehow in five years of legal drinking I have never had before. It wasn't bad. I imagine it's one of those things where you're like "oh this barely tastes like alcohol, I'll have another" and then suddenly you're hitting on someone you shouldn't be hitting on. Wait what.For that free app, we had the spinach artichoke dip. It wasn't bad, I certainly wouldn't have let anyone pay full price for it though. I wasn't feeling like having a full on sandwich or anything but there aren't really any smaller sized options. I guess a cup of soup but I had had soup for lunch and it was like obscenely hot for December so that was out of the question. I decided to just get the chicken quesadilla app and if I didn't finish it then whatever. The rest of my family had burgers or a chicken sandwich. The burgers were liked all around, although my brother got the diablo one and complained that it wasn't spicy enough. But I don't think he understands that poblanos aren't that hot.The quesadilla wasn't bad, there were some spots though where the chicken was a bit tough. Nothing you can't fix with a good bit of salsa though. Even though like I said it was pretty busy, we were there only about an hour. Service was great. Would I come back on my own? Probably not. In my case it's really one of those places where once is enough for the experience but if I were asked to come again, I wouldn't say no.

reviews.name: Tina D.
reviews.review: We visited Margaritaville and had a wonderful lunch. Our server, Ethan T. was very helpful and even entertained my 2 year old daughter. The band that was playing was pretty good too. Overall the atmosphere was good and the food was great. I would highly recommend visiting this restaurant/bar if you are in Nashville.

reviews.name: Julie L.
reviews.review: When in a city where there's a Margaritaville, one must stop and soak in the atmosphere.You can hear the live entertainment wherever you might be in the establishment.  The staff is super nice, and really ready to make your visit memorable.  I had picked up a shirt and one of the associates told me a story that involved one of the best country singers (Toby Keith) and how he related to the saying on the shirt.  It was awesome to the connection.It never surprises me that each location has its own unique merchandise items to call their own.  Who doesn't want a sign that says, "I'm the woman to blame" ?The food is good, but the margaritas are better.

reviews.name: Mike H.
reviews.review: Nice bar with live music and a cool gift shop right in the heart of Nashville.

reviews.name: Mike P.
reviews.review: Hey I was there last night   experience was so so. First time I have been there  sat at the bar .  the feel of the room was bad no music going on was told artist was on break . ordered the cheeseburger in paridise  came out. Looked pretty but too messy once u picked up to eat it . used silverware to eat it .. Music was playing artist Making up lyrics to songs  bartender was good. JJ I think was name  was nice  two servers were making jokes about Christmas party that was bout who would sleep with each other ' . disappointing time

reviews.name: Logan T.
reviews.review: The waitress Liz is phenomenal. Very pleased with the food. Service. And drinks. If downtown, and need a cold beer and some grub. Go see Liz.

reviews.name: Joe B.
reviews.review: We had not one but two Great experiences here during our weekend trip and Jeff was our server on both occasions!  Our experience was excellent from the food, drinks and the timely and consistent service during both visits! Thank you to Jeff and Mitch!

reviews.name: Kirstan S.
reviews.review: Absolutely no complaints about this location! Our server was Chris Rhodes. He was wonderful. Friendly and fun. Recommended a great drink that I had never had before (not a menu item). With our drinks we had the crab dip, and it was delicious! I would definitely love to visit this location again next time I'm in Nashville, and I recommend Chris as your server!

reviews.name: Andrew N.
reviews.review: Went here for dinner and ordered a hamburger. It took almost an hour (or at least it felt like it) to get our food. And it was a Tuesday night.I ordered the Cheeseburger in Paradise." So for $12.99 you get a cheeseburger with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, sliced (not the little circles) pickles, their secret sauce with a side of fries. The hamburger was pretty bland - I don't know how to describe it, but I felt like I was just eating a piece of meat with bread and some toppings. The fries weren't any better - they were about the thickness you'd get at a fast food joint, but they were too crunchy.Would I go there again? Probably not. It wasn't bad by any means, but for the time it took to cook the food, the underwhelming nature of the food, and the prices I will try something else next time I'm in Nashville.

reviews.name: Je'Taime C.
reviews.review: I was there with my husband and son for dinner and the food was very good...all but the crab dip. I would pass on that one. My husband had the jambalaya and loved it. My son had the shrimp and crab mac and cheese and really liked that too. I had the chicken sandwich and it was very good.Service was a little slow but your on vacation right?!

reviews.name: Smitha P.
reviews.review: Best part - the band played started at 9:30 and went almost until 1:00. They were great and kept the audience engaged. The dance floor was never empty - everyone heard something they could dance to. Service - we were a group of four and we were seated promptly after we walked in. We got lucky with timing and got a table right in front of the stage. Food service - was extremely slow and each round of food (appetizers and main course) ended up being served after a long period  waiting. Almost 45 minutes between our order and receiving the food. We also wanted to order dessert but when I tired to our server said they're not serving dessert anymore. I wish she informed us they were changing their menu. Food - decent shrimp dishes. Everything else tastes mediocre. Drinks - decent drinks although I've had better margaritas. Most of them ended up being more sour than I expected (blueberry margarita, watermelon margarita, tranquil waters, and last mango in Paris. )Although it was a great place with a talented band, the service did not match up to it.

reviews.name: Julie C.
reviews.review: Rarely do I go with four stars without eating but this is one of those times. How can you go wrong with a margarita at a place called margarita like margaritaville?? The reason this place is getting 4 stars is the music! We followed Matt Rausche and Jet Huffman from Baileys. We couldn't get enough of them while eating outside at Merchants, great food!!! They charmed me....Anyways, it's a typical margaritaville and the bartender is attentive and pleasant, bathroom is clean too. The decor is chain but not over done or old per se. I'll be back in sure. Alright, I've been here almost 3 hours! Not once did a server ask if we were OK!!! I'm still in love with the band but the service definitely missed out... The band got a round, the bartender got tipped... They got nothing!!!!
reviews.location: Downtown St. Paul, St. Paul, MN

reviews.name: Christopher R.
reviews.review: We were very excited to come for a friend's show but between low quality food that is barely above McDonald's quality, overly expensive watered down drinks, flies everywhere and some idiot stilt walker wandering around and blocking the stage... We will not be back. Out of all those the stilt walker is the one thing I could really not forgive. Really inappropriate to have a side show when people are singing their hearts out on stage.

reviews.name: Becca H.
reviews.review: So the food was good but a little overpriced but it was all worth it, our server Darrell was awesome! He was super attentive and seemed dedicated to our experience! He was so fun and he had us laughing the entire time. He had suggestions on where to go afterwards and we tried to get him to meet us but he still had a few hours left on his shift. Anyway, we had a great time.

reviews.name: Kayla F.
reviews.review: My 8 girlfriends & I decided on Margaritaville on a Thursday night around 6pm because the menu looked like there was something for everyone. (2 vegetarians, 2 who loved seafood, all of us who love tequila etc.).We put our name in for a table & it was ready in under 10 minutes which went by so fast because we sat outside & enjoyed the live music playing. Our waitress was phenomenal, 9 hungry & thirsty girls seemed like a breeze for her. We let her know right away we wanted separate checks & she had no problem with that at all while many restaurants make you feel extremely guilty for asking. I ordered the veggie burger with fries which was good but I have had better. My margarita however was one of the bests I've ever had but I can't remember the name.Service was excellent & ticket times were running quick for it being so very busy. While it was pricey for me, ($30 including tip), I would still recommend this restaurant.

reviews.name: Brian K.
reviews.review: I am for sure not a fan of chain restaurants, especially one that is known for cheeseburgers and the burgers are not made fresh on site - just a frozen patty grilled up in house.  Come on!  If you want a good hamburger - make it in house people.NOTE - I am giving one star for food but a total of three stars because the location on Broadway and the live music make this a pretty cool spot if you're at the bar.Service is as expected.

reviews.name: Bella B.
reviews.review: Crab sliders were good and the Original margarita !!!!

reviews.name: Stan D.
reviews.review: We were here on a tour.  They knew we were coming, they only offered us three choices on the menu, and, yet, it took them over an hour to get food on the table.  Granted, the food was pretty good, but the service was pathetically slow.  i would cut them more slack if we had just wandered in, and were ordering off the regular menu, but that was not the case.  They really dropped the ball on this one. The only reason they got three stars was because the veggie burger we ordered was pretty darn good.  Both the roll, and the patty itself had good flavor and texture, and you don't always find that in a veggie burger.  The fries were tasty, too.  I like the food, but they could have done a whole lot better job with the service.

reviews.name: C A.
reviews.review: We went in once.  The food was okay, had the 1/2 chicken in BBQ sauce or style, the breast was okay, but the leg and thigh undercooked. Bill was pricy, mostly because we had 4 drinks, at about $11.00 a pop, and just average (barely adequate) margaritas which were on the specialty menu, not great, and definitely less than expected for the price charged.  Paying for the name Jimmy Buffett.   Waitress was the best part, Annie took good care of us.  Music, fair to middling.  Would not spend time to go again, better places.

reviews.name: Jennifer L.
reviews.review: My rating is based on the over-priced food & drinks, however the quality was good. I had the hummus appetizer & a lager. Great live music most nights & the bartenders are friendly. Great spot to sidewalk watch the crazy downtown scene. Seems like a good date spot too. Consistency is a plus. We will be back but I wish they had happy hour!! Come on Buffett!! It's 5 O'clock here!!

reviews.name: A C.
reviews.review: Stopped in for a couple of Bahama Mamas during Memorial Day weekend. Interior design was very tropical and authentic. The bar area had large bay windows that were opened to the street. The restaurant location is a corner spot right in the heart of all the action on Broadway Avenue. I didn't eat anything but had a great time, loved the drinks, decor, and location. Definitely stop by and get your favorite beach drink and sit in the bar area/cocktail tables.

reviews.name: Dawn J.
reviews.review: This was our first stop in Nashville and the Margarita's were good as well as the appetizers.  We sat at the bar and the bar tender was friendly and very helpful recommending other sites to see and restaurants to stop in while we were in town.

reviews.name: Rhonda M.
reviews.review: Started off badly when the hostess wanted to seat the two (my mom and i) of us across from the kitchen when the entire establishment was 1/3 full. I objected and we were placed in a better spot. we both ordered the fried chicken. Chicken tasty and lots of it. Could have used more gravy. Server nice and attentive.

reviews.name: Aaron Kocourek K.
reviews.review: We went here to see a friend's band play live. The atmosphere was great. It is kid friendly yet also a place where you can go with friends to hang out. The food was good but the server we had was awful. The other servers seemed to be more attentive to their tables and seemed live we just got a bad one. The portions of food they serve are huge.

reviews.name: Mudbank U.
reviews.review: I was craving something other than beer and bbq. Jimmy delivered with a decent margarita and the best ever coconut shrimp / orange marmalade. Only reason for not getting a 4 is the boring "island" loop they play on every tv. It was fine the first 10 times .... but come on. At least have some in the bar and some on the floor with a game on.

reviews.name: Ashley B.
reviews.review: Pro: The environment and service at this restaurant was fun and inviting.   Enjoyed watching the girl on stilts making balloon creations. We did order some type of crab dip as an appetizer and it tasted good...best thing we consumed on our visit.Unfortunatly, the cons far outweigh the pros (at least on our visit).Cons: The food I ordered (seafood mac & cheese) had a good taste, but was over priced for what I recieved. Four pieces of shrimp and supposedly crab meat (however, I didn't detect any in my bowl).  My friend ordered a Cobb salad with fried chicken tenders.   Within three bites she was feeling ill. As a second opinion I tasted her food because she said something just didn't taste right to her. And she was right, something seemed off with the taste of the dressing and her chicken was bland and so dry that it was almost unedible. The manager did take her entree off of her ticket, as she should have and was very polite about it. The last con I have is that we ordered mixed drinks ($8+ a piece) and they were not mixed well at all. I left wondering if they bartenders receive proper training. Was really looking forward to eating here, but was highly disappointed :(

reviews.name: Bruno S.
reviews.review: Came here with my wife and some friends to celebrate a birthday and it was our first night out in Nashville and first time to a Margaritaville...We didn't have any reservations and waited about 20 minutes to be seated...however it wasn't really that bad of a wait and we ordered drinks and waited by the bar. We were a party of five so there wasn't seating at the bar for all of us... however for a party of two we would've been fine.The bartender was friendly and the drinks were made good and strong; the great customer service continued upstairs where we were seated and enjoyed a live band performing. The food didn't come all that quick but we weren't in a rush so it worked out great for all of us. To my surprise there were plenty of families eating dinner there with young ones and everything blended just fine. The food was really good but wasn't anything special of course, but that's to be expected here it's more about the experience, atmosphere, margaritas, and live music. I definitely recommend this as a place to stop by or definitely a starter if you plan on going bar-hopping.I will definitely would come back with my wife here for a night out in town again! Definitely will sit by the bar though. Didn't have a problem with the kids...but a date night away from the kids for us we would like to truly get "away" lol.

reviews.name: Tabetha M.
reviews.review: When we got our food, it was good.  The ups:Live entertainment, that rotates between floors, when they aren't on your floor, there are tvs that you can see it.  Food was goodThey give kids these neat wiki stix packets instead of coloring stuffOur experience negatives:I ordered the Al Vacado burger, without the jalepeno mayo.  They literally brought me a plain cheese burger.  They brought me tomatoe and lettuce on a plate, when I mentioned it. After everyone was done with their meal, my corrected meal plain.Someone in our group ordered a steak, med-well.  He got med-rare.Our second round of drinks came 40 minutes later.  What they did:The didn't charge us for the steak meal, which was a more costly than the hamburger meal.They gave us a round of desserts.

reviews.name: Brandon H.
reviews.review: Alexa is the bees knees son she hooked us up.Got her section on my first time in here in nashville. I hope to see her again she made my visit feel like home.

reviews.name: Dhara P.
reviews.review: We walked in not knowing what to expect and loved it! Servers were very friendly, helpful and efficient. The food was great (try the Island Rice!). Drinks were dangerously good. The live music was entertaining and not at all overbearing. The piano stairs was an added bonus!! Check it out if you're in the area.

reviews.name: Heather A.
reviews.review: Went to Jimmy's this past weekend for dinner. Only went because it was a 45 minute wait without reservation. It actually took longer than expected, which is understandable, it was just an estimate. Had a Bahama mama margarita as we waited. It Was surprisingly weak. 1.5 hours later we were seated. Had an awesome waitress, we all ordered chimichurri flat iron steaks, it comes with French fries as a side. The server brought our food out & all of them were missing the chimichurri sauce. She apologized & went back & brought us some. We finally get to eat & kid you not, the steak had NO flavoring, just char from being grilled. Even with the chimichurri it was still missing something. So basically we paid $20 for a small steak & small order of fries, that was completely bland. They sell rubs & marinades in their gift shop but they do not even use it on their own meat. It was very disappointing & upsetting that we spent over $70 for two: for bland food & weak drinks. It got two stard bc the wait staff were amazing.  Definitely wouldn't return & definitely do not recommend.

reviews.name: Mke D.
reviews.review: We visited Margaritaville this weekend.  We are Margaritaville veterans, as we have been to 10 or 11 different Margaritaville Cafes and have visited this location many times since it's in our hometown.  The food is almost always consistent.  In my opinion, it is slightly better than other themed chains.  However, the menu did change a while ago when Margaritaville sold the restaurants to a Brazilian company.  For instance, the Cheeseburger in Paradise now includes a "paradise island sauce"...I must have missed that ingredient in the lyrics of the song.  "I like mine with lettuce and tomato, Heinz 57 and paradise island sauce..."However, as mentioned, the food is usually very consistent...it's certainly a notch above other chains.  On this trip, I had the Cheeseburger in Paradise (minus the aforementioned island sauce) and my wife had the quesadilla.  Both were fine.  My burger was underdone, but not to the point of being inedible.  Normally, I might have said something, but this trip was unique.  The NRA's national convention was in downtown Nashville and the restaurant was definitely packed.  We didn't see a waitress for about 10 minutes after being seated.  Then, our initial waitress handed off our table to a new waitress (who you could tell had not been working there very long) about halfway through the meal.  It just seemed like it would be easier to deal with the undercooked burger than trying to get the problem corrected.  My wife's quesadilla was fine according to her...nothing to write home about, but there were no problems either.Also, a warning for Parrotheads - this location does not play much Buffett music.  There's usually a live band (which is necessary on Lower Broadway), but, even when the band is on break, you will be lucky to hear one Buffett song during your meal.  We were in the restaurant for close to 2 hours this weekend between waiting for a table and eating and heard 3 Buffett songs the entire time (and one was actually a Zac Brown song that Jimmy sings on).  But, we did get to hear Bon Jovi, Jason Mraz and several other things that (in my opinion) have very little to do with Jimmy Buffett.  The playlist won't impact your meal...but it's just a pet peeve of mine about the Nashville location.

reviews.name: Michelle F.
reviews.review: Wow, Margaritaville.  I am all about tourist traps, and you disappoint me.Oh the stories I could tell you about the horrible service we received here the other night.  Wrong food, delayed service, forgetting to put in an order, our waitress not getting the food, missing parts of the meal.this was all over the course of one hour.  I am WAY underwhelmed by this location!  Jimmy Buffet would be ashamed...

reviews.name: Melissa M.
reviews.review: First time here, was pretty pleased. We had a group of 7, but didn't have to wait long for a table, staff very friendly. I got a chicken Caesar salad that was delicious, and more than enough! I went with our waiters suggestion of some Margherita w/o sour mix and some citrus flavor...it wasn't all that great, could've stuck with a regular and been happy. Also, two of our party's food came out late, so they comped their orders! Very accommodating and not many complaints for a chain restaurant.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: Excellent nachos!  But our waiter Chris M. Made them even better!  His service was excellent and he shared some great Nashville history with us as well as some wonderful ideas for our next trip.  If you visit, be sure to ask for Chris.

reviews.name: Nancy L.
reviews.review: Meh, its a chain... what do you expect? Mediocre food, fun crazy atompshere. Been to one, been to them all. Balloon hats made by girl on stilts was entertaining.

reviews.name: Lauren M.
reviews.review: They have margaritas.  They are good.  Prices are fair.  Nothing really stands out about the place.Fins to the left, fins to the right.

reviews.name: Bret A.
reviews.review: Great, large portions of food with live music.  Margaritaville is a fun, beachy place with food ranging from fish tacos ($17) to burgers ($16.)  The music is good if  a bit loud.  Service was excellent.  You can people watch from the window tables and they angle to let in a nice breeze.  Lunch is a bit high, but that may be the area pricing as well.  Live music pours from all of the establishments along Broadway.  Nice lunch place!

reviews.name: Joshua A.
reviews.review: The atmosphere of the restaurant is wonderful! The service has always been up to par when I dine here. The wait is acceptable for an average dinner time, so long as Nashville isn't hosting a special event. The drinks are delicious, but can be light on the alcohol at times. The food, although delicious, seems pricey for the portion size. I could get a larger burger at Cheddars or even Applebee's. It seems you pay more for the ambiance of the restaurant than you do the food.

reviews.name: Mary H.
reviews.review: One of the best experiences that we've had in Nashville!! The waitress Kim was just outstanding!!! The food was excellent and the live music was very nice!!

reviews.name: Michael B.
reviews.review: Great atmosphere that anyone can love even if you are not a parrot-head. HUGE QUANTITIES (nachos) the servers are great and funny. They have a very funny balloon maker that made it much better.

reviews.name: Shumaila P.
reviews.review: Had the clam and corn chowder, sat by the window people watching while the live music played along. Loved this place. It was less hole in the wall and more standardized restaurant compared to other stops along that street. Loved the music, excellent waiter who helped guide us as to what places ee should be seeing during our stay in nashville. Go to place if u need good food and a second to relax from the noise.

reviews.name: Gary H.
reviews.review: We went there before a concert. The atmosphere was wonderful. Great music, great decorating, and excellent music. The food was good as well. However, we ordered cheese curds, and a burger with a salad instead of fries. We got our curds quickly. However, the burger took over 30 mins to come out and they gave us fries instead of our salad. Had such high hopes. Just fell a bit short.

reviews.name: Steve A.
reviews.review: As a update to an older review-I want to take a second to say how insulted I feel after the rude treatment by the female manager on Saturday. As someone who comes in once a month even though I don't live in Nashville, her attitude, rudeness and actions will make me think twice before spending $300 weekend there. Sad as we really enjoy coming here.

reviews.name: Manuel E M.
reviews.review: Loud as fuck. If you're into loud live music and a bunch of drunks singing, this is the place to go. The food was excellent and the staff were really good.

reviews.name: Hanna N.
reviews.review: My husband and I stopped by for a drink and ended up staying for three and appetizers. Loved the food and the drinks were awesome, but what was really above and beyond was the service. Our waitress, Stephanie took really good care of us, made the visit very personal and made sure we had a great time!  Really didn't expect this level of friendliness on a busy tourist destination.

reviews.name: Tara S.
reviews.review: We were wandering around aimlessly downtown, looking for somewhere to go that has live music and good drinks. Jimmy Buffet's had an open area of seating and live acoustic music so we decided to stop in. There were 2 guys doing some cover songs which made for good background music. Buffet's music was everywhere...in the menu, written on the walls, on the tv, etc. Our server, Monte, was really nice and was on top of everything. I would give him 5 stars but I can only give Jimmy Buffet's 3 for being so mediocre. I ordered a cheeseburger and for almost $11, it was comparable to fast food. I ordered a hurricane which was very weak. This is a very touristy spot. As a local, I've learned my lesson and will try somewhere else for a good cheeseburger and stronger drinks. This place is nice for live music and people watching if you sit in the front out in the open.

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: We met family here for dinner.  The staff was great and the atmosphere was fun.  The kids had a great time.  There were people on stilts walking around making balloon hats and balloon animals.  The kids loved that.My husband and I had the calypso mahi mahi which was very good.  I stole a fry and it was great also.  If you haven't been here yet you should make plans to visit.  Very fun and enjoyable evening.  It is difficult to find a touristy fun restaurant with good food but this one delivers it all.

reviews.name: Kristin W.
reviews.review: Bad food, GREAT margaritas... Excellent ambiance, like you are on vacation in the tropics, and they had live music all afternoon.  I had a blast when we were here.  I will definately come back to this one next trip

reviews.name: Bryan R.
reviews.review: It's my own fault for coming in.  I mean, what was I expecting?  "Margaritaville".  Who the heck goes here when you're on music row in Nashville?  This idiot.  Revel in my tragedy.Looking for a good beer?  Forget it.  Standard bud-lite garbage (you can salvage a Blue Moon out of the ordeal).  Good music?  Nope.  The guy (Dusty) was certainly personable and nice, but the selection (and I ended up seeing him play the next night and he was AWESOME) was super vanilla crap that you'd expect from a chain restaurant.  And, of course, they had to play "Margaritaville" while a guy on stilts danced around shaking a cardboard cutout of a salt shaker.  The beers took so long to come out that we almost dipped out the large picture window (so as to avoid our dancing stilted friend), but I didn't feel like getting into trouble.  Perhaps it wouldn't have been so bad had the entire experience not come with the opportunity cost of exploring another awesome bar in one of the nation's music capitals, but what can you do.  Well, you CAN just avoid this place, which I recommend.  If you're a tourist looking for a safe, generic, experience, here's your new haunt.

reviews.name: Andrew D.
reviews.review: I was disappointed with the food. The grilled chicken salad tasted like they pulled the chicken out of the freezer. Definitely not fresh. We went at 6pm with a group and couldn't hear each other talk.

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: Overpriced for this type of food.Meh.

reviews.name: Daphne A.
reviews.review: I visited this location having never been to a Margaritaville.  Was looking forward to having some island inspired (in an American way) food.  A friend and I met up with our group (8 total) for dinner, we were a little late due to the parking mess in that area.  They had been seated pretty quickly after arriving on a Sunday evening.  Only drinks had been ordered.  We added our drink orders to our waiter.  Other group members reported that the waiter had said they were out of a many items.  Overall, I can't remember how many things they were out of, but it was quite a lot.  Our group orders - one young lady isn't able to get seafood mac and cheese without seafood, seems....fishy.  Another young man gets wings with two sides.  A few minutes later, waiter returns to say they're out of wings (the young man had attempted to order several other things that were also out that night).  Later, he returns to say they did have wings.  Manager follows up to tell him they did have the wings.I settled for the BBQ chicken sandwich with fries. Everyone's food comes out and manager (there may have been two, or one in training) says "enjoy!"  My friend and I that had been late did not receive our meals.  Manger asks what we had and clearly has to place the order again.  Our party had pretty much finished eating by the time we got our plates.  We were going to ask for them to go at this point, but I was ravenous enough when the plate was placed in front of me that I devoured it in about 5 minutes.Chicken was moist and bbq sauce had nice flavor.  Cheese was not worth the calories, but I ate it anyway, along with the bacon.  Fries were satisfactory.  I took the bun completely off the sandwich bc it was enormous.  No report from anyone else's food.Manager did comp the late meals along with the wings of the young man.  Apologized we were not able to eat with our friends.Did not take part in the libations, can't give a review of that.Wish I would have tried the nachos - saw a couple of plates of them walk by and they were heaping!  They do add chili instead of just beef which always makes me a little weary and is probably why I didn't order them.  If you have friends that want to come, go ahead....but I'd rather find something local.  However, I have to commend the manager for comping 3 out of 8 of our meals.  Cannot complain of a free meal on my graduate student budget right now!

reviews.name: Su I.
reviews.review: When you are in town you have to stop by Margaritaville because it's well-known, and you got to try one of their best margarita flavors!!!  Well, we did and I was not impressed.  First of all, the glasses were so small (8oz) for $10, it was filled with alot of ice cubes and almost no room for the actual beverage.  There were four of us, and after our second round, we asked if they have a pitcher that we could buy and they don't.  I think the restaurant should consider selling them in a big pitcher, we would be more likely to hang around and buy more food and drinks.  I have had better experienced at other Margaritaville in Key West and in Vegas.

reviews.name: Jennifer V.
reviews.review: Margaritaville's atmosphere, service and quality of food have always been good. My favorite room to dine in is the Tiki Room. Though upstairs in the Cowboy Room is fun as well, but might only be arranged for larger groups. If you are going for a drink and app, I would suggest the Lava Lava Shrimp. It is sweet with the right amount of spice. If you get the Volcano Nacho make sure you are hungry and ready to share. It is an impressive stack of covered nachos. For entrees I would recommend their Fish Tacos or Jerk Chicken. If you save room for dessert, you can't go wrong with the Key Lime Pie or Cheesecake.

reviews.name: Courtney M.
reviews.review: I like Margaritaville, I like all of them, and I'm not a chain restaurant fan usually. But something about those baby blenders with a huge straw and a frozen strawberry margarita inside does something to me. I only order the fried pickles, which are a must. My friend and I started our day here at around 11:30 (him the fins out margarita in a blender, and me strawberry marg in a blender) and listening to music and drinking margaritas at the bar this past Sunday. Good spot to stop at, Jimmy Buffett does it right always. Don't forget to write on a dollar and stand on the bar to staple it on the wall!

reviews.name: Jimmy G.
reviews.review: The food was decent, when we did get it. The drinks were way overpriced for premixed drinks, but that's where they make their money, so I'm not focusing on that.Our "waitress" was Brandy. She came to our table three times during our meal, had no personality, and forgot to order my second drink after she came and brought us our food. So I ate the whole meal without a drink. The food runner didn't know which table to bring our food to, and tried to give our food away twice. The food was ok. Fish tacos were OK, small and the fish was definitely frozen. The dipping sauce for the coconut shrimp was horrible, and should have never been paired with the shrimp. The only highlight of the evening was the fact I was able to catch up with a friend.

reviews.name: Michael D.
reviews.review: My wife and I went here on Thursday 6/26 while exploring downtown on our honeymoon. We were seated very quickly despite the place being extremely busy. Our server was excellent and very prompt. The atmosphere was very nice and the musician was very talented. Here's our problem. We ordered the Valcano nachos and the pretzels which alone came up to $23.00. I can understand that being a touristy restaurant and in a downtown area that the prices are going to be inflated but the real issue was that not long after we left and were heading back to our hotel we both became sick. We have to assume it was the nachos because I didn't have but 1 bite of the pretzels. Not only did we have to spend the whole evening/night in our room but it ruined plans that we had. Our total bill with the 2 appetizers and 2 teas came to $36.00. I'm not sure where the other charges came from but it definitely was too much money to spend to end up sick and miserable.

reviews.name: Mister T.
reviews.review: Both our friendly hostess and our nice waitress (Colleen) were quick and helpful.  Nonetheless the recommended Margarita was super sour, although Colleen gladly replaced it. Cajun chicken Caesar salad provided chicken so dry it seemed like jerky.  The medium-cooked burger was so overcooked, it was like a hockey puck.  My daughter enjoyed her veggie burger while my fried chicken salad was fine.

reviews.name: Sara R.
reviews.review: Best fish tacos I've ever had, and I was born and raised in Southern Calfornia - where fish tacos are abundant in authentic and fast food form, from very fresh to food-poisoning-in-waiting.  You get two good-sized tacos of Mahi Mahi (or tilapia) seasoned in a cajun influenced way, in a corn tortilla ... with large chunks of grilled fish inside, cabbage, and a white sauce drizzled over it all.  In-freaking-credible!  It comes with a side of black beans and an almost milky tasting rice.  Amazing.  Out of all the fantastic foods I tried and loved, these fish tacos are something I'd come back for and try to recreate at home.  We also ordered the fried pickles.  Just do it!  Skipped the drinks because I was driving, but there's live music up front by the bar...open air windows to the outside - we were lucky to get to listen to Eric Von.  He's awesome!  He'll play almost anything you request (someone requested Lady Ga Ga's Pokerface as a joke... and he made a country version of it that blew her lame song out of the water and back again!)  Prices are a bit on the high side, but it's Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville.  I wasn't expecting $4 tacos.  But for the quality and portion, the pricing makes it worth it.  The fish tacos were I think $16.99, but they don't skimp on the fish.  They take care of you and your belly in Nashville!

reviews.name: Sidney B.
reviews.review: Buffett, I love you.  I've been to Margaritavilles all over.  This is unfortunately, the worst.  I know I'm in Nashville but I don't go to Margaritaville to hear country music.  I go to Margaritaville to hear Buffett or at the very least, trop rock.  Not in this location.  Here not only do you get live country that blares out, but it overrides the videos of Buffett.  If I wanted country I could go to the dozens of places all over downtown.  I don't want country.  I want either Buffett or trop rock. I've given up on ever being able to hear that in the Nashville Margaritaville.

reviews.name: Ann E.
reviews.review: We usually go to the restaurant in Myrtle Beach and  a few years ago had decided not to go back since the food and drinks were really not that good and certainly not worth the usual long wait. However, this is Nashville and it was lunchtime and we were hungry and there was no wait. Glad we went. We got seated right away and had some delicious Landshark on draft which is always a good start! My daughter had Coconut shrimp which was delicious. I ordered the Fish Tacos. Our server recommended upgrading to Mahi Mahi which I did- great choice!

reviews.name: Laura M.
reviews.review: Nothing special, probably wont return. Expensive for lunch and two drinks $50. Probably would have rated it two stars, but the music was very enjoyable, and we had great service.

reviews.name: James W.
reviews.review: Very disappointing. Last year I would have given it 4 or 5 stars but not now.Prices seem to have increased while value has decreased. $13.99 for a salad that is about 1/2 the size (and of no better quality) of ones you would pay $9-10 for at other restaurants (and server said we could not share a salad). $13.99 for nachos that are mostly dry second-rate tortilla chips with little in the way of toppings.Service was slow but music was pretty good.We have enjoyed visiting Margaritaville Nashville over the past couple of years and looked forward to this time but this was the last time for us.

reviews.name: Cordell S.
reviews.review: The staff is friendly, and the music is decent. The food was edible, but not worth the price. A vegetarian salad with little more than lettuce was $15. My mom had a cheeseburger and thought it was okay. The margarita was fantastic though! People beside us ordered nachos and it looked like the kitchen used a full bag of tortilla chips, so the portion quantity is definitely not small.

reviews.name: Abby H.
reviews.review: Fine

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: Stopped by in Aug 2011 for a drink at the new Margaritaville in Nashville. I have been to a lot of the Margaritaville places around the world, This one was not as fun as some of the others. Vegas, Turks and Caicos, and a couple more. It is nice place for a drink and talking with friends

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: Hmmmm....Why did I come here again? Oh yea, it was for an "afterparty" for the Southern Ground Music Festival. I'm not tryin' to hate on Mr. Buffett but this place does not reek of a Cheeseburger In Paradise. Did you like my horrible pun? Yea, me either. The bar staff was a bit abrupt in the upstairs "VIP" area but the drinks were stiff and the space is rather spacious if you're planning an event or party. I did dig the stage and acoustics were rather nice too. I'm sure that many would have a pretty nifty time here but the menu and atmosphere just doesn't parlay with my personal taste. Otherwise, you should pony up to the bar to hang out with the tourists while guzzling Buffet approved margaritas and cheeseburgers.

reviews.name: Veronica J.
reviews.review: I love Margaritaville. The service was great just like at every other Margaritaville. Booze in a Blender is always good.  Live music is great too.

reviews.name: Bob S.
reviews.review: I really like the atmosphere We had a good time! Just planned on some drinks but ended up eating dinner. The buttermilk fried chicken was delicious. I would go back here.

reviews.name: Fredo B.
reviews.review: The place is a joke. 6.50 for  Coors Light. 12.50 for a watered down lousy margarita. Don't forget the overpriced 15.50 no taste nachos. This place is strictly for tourist with no brain who will spend 30.00 on a t-shirt.

reviews.name: Erin H.
reviews.review: Hmmm... I've been here a couple of times now.  The drinks are on the pricey side (this is downtown Nashville, so that's to be expected somewhat), but have always been pretty darn good.  They have a skinny margarita that I like, which is only 95 calories or so.  The midori margarita is good.  And, I tasted my friend's Coco Cabana drink and it was delicious.  I'd say it's definitely a cool spot to have a drink or two and either sit up front and people watch, or hang in the back and listen to the band.  I wouldn't make this my all-night destination, but it fits in nicely as part of a bar crawl down Broadway.  I haven't been overly impressed with the food, but it's not horrible either.  You can certainly find something to help soak up some of the alcohol and keep you going.

reviews.name: Nick G.
reviews.review: Stopped here one night to have something to eat.  It was nice to eat (and drink) with a live band playing right in front of me, and the band was pretty decent too.  I ordered the Mahi over wild rice, and it wasn't the greatest.  Rice was kind of hard, and fish seemed bland... not the best food actually.  I also ordered a Top Shelf Margarita, and it was pretty good... My advice would be to just go and eat elsewhere, there are plenty of better options in the area to get something to eat, and plenty of other places as well to watch a live band. Its the combination of the two here that make it appealing, but maybe not really worth it.

reviews.name: Edward P.
reviews.review: We had been to the location in Las Vegas so we just had to try this place out too.  We stopped in after having dinner at another restaurant down the street.  Since I had already had dinner, I decided to get a dessert.  Decided upon the "Chocolate Hurricane", it is a Huge ice-cream chocolate brownie.. The menu describes it as "Warm dark chocolate brownie layered with Edy's Vanilla Bean ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream, and chopped macadamia nuts.  Came with a whopping bill of $7.99, which is a little pricey for a dessert, but I thought, what the heck..  It was loaded with tons of whipped cream, so make sure if you get one, just push the majority of it aside so you don't fill up on the creme.  Let me warn you, don't try this alone, you must have someone else to help you eat it because it was huge.  There is a very nice atmosphere here at this restaurant, but very packed.  I would have rated a 4 but we were given a pager and told it would be about 20 - 25 minutes for 2 people and so we decided to wait.  After 45 minutes, the pager never went off.  So I went up and they said they sent a page, but it never went off.  They said they have problems with them and acted like it was no big deal, like it always happens.  The hostess told us to go over to the other counter and talk to the lady there and she would seat us.  Low and Behold there were several tables available that they weren't seating for some reason, so they took us right to a table.  I thought due to the technical issues, they would have offered a discounts on our bill, but nope, no offer came.  Overall this is a nice place, just don't go on a busy night.

reviews.name: Rami B.
reviews.review: Good food and amazing island drinks! I had the Bahama Breeze and Bananas and Havanas. If You like coconut blended drinks, then you will love these drinks! It reminds me of being somewhere tropical! They always have great live music too. Friendly staff who like to get to know you while you are there.

reviews.name: Kevin K.
reviews.review: There was a 45 min wait when we got there, but we were seated quicker than that. My first margarita was say too sour and not good at all, which is disappointing considering it was Margaritaville. The 2nd margarita, a more expensive one, was better. The food was good and I love the atmosphere. Our waitress was very nice and friendly. I'd go again.

reviews.name: James H.
reviews.review: Some friends from Chicago who had gone to college in Nashville several years ago were in town and had their young children and some friends of their children. Don't remember who made the selectionof Margaritaville, but I had my doubts. Would it be too loud, too bar-y, too many tourists? It was good that we went on a weeknight, as it wasn't too terribly busy. We had a couple of drinks at the bar while a few from our group browsed the gift shop. My Margarita was good but not great. Took about 25 minutes to get a table.Before I saw the menu, I already had the Cheeseburger in Paradise on my mind. It, or course, was on the menu. Before it came though, someone at our table ordered some nachos and there were plenty to go around. My burger was big and tasty and staying true to the song, went well with the Heinz 57 that I generously applied to it and with the french fried potatoes and with the big kosher pickle that came on the plate. The kids really loved the stilt walker / baloon artist. They can't wait to go back next time they come down. The adults in our group had mixed reviews on the food. Serving sizes were great but not everyone happy with the taste or quality, with someone saying something negative along with the "C" word (Chain), but overall experience was very good and I will go back, especially when taking other out of town guests downtown.Only thing that kind of puzzled me is that we gave one of the kids a five dollar bill to give to the stilt walker and still don't know if he was or was not allowed to take tips. He didn't want to take it in his hand but my friend finally slipped it in his pocket as we left. Maybe they should put something on the table or menu about tipping these guys.

reviews.name: Natasha G.
reviews.review: I love Margaritaville!  I've been to the one in Vegas quite a few times, so when I noticed the one in Nashville I decided I had to stop in!  Best thing by far on the menu?  The NACHOS!  They're big (there will be a delicious-looking mountain on your table) and covered with everything you could possibly want.  I would recommend sharing it with about 4 people though (unless you're really THAT hungry).Margaritaville has a very fun, lively atmosphere, with live music, a guy on stilts wandering around making balloon hats for the guests, and an upbeat friendly staff.  Also, it's right in the heart of Nashville, so after stopping in for dinner you can hop over to one of the many country bars surrounding it.

reviews.name: Courtney T.
reviews.review: Never been to a Margaritaville but it sure felt like I was in Cheeseburger in Paradise when I walked in.  It was super cool in the restuarant so it was welcoming after being outside in the heat and humidity of Nashville streets. Not super busy but there was a steady flow of people.   The wait staff was friendly.  The drinks were pricey. My friend and I split a quesdilla as we didn't want anything to heavy and weren't to hungry and it was perfect in between late breakfast and dinner.  I'm not a fan of the food at Cheeseburger in Paradise but this was good.  There are other options on the strip in Nashville but this is good if you aren't sure what you want and just want to get it over with.

reviews.name: Ray H.
reviews.review: We had a great time on Broadway, the music strip in Nashville, and enjoyed a great dinner at Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville. My wife had the chicken Caesars salad, but my son and I enjoyed the steak teriyaki. It was phenomenal. Best of all is e service. They just did enough not to be annoying, but helpful. And they have a guy on stilts who makes complex balloon designs for the kids. A MadHatter top hat with a fish. never severe that great. We enjoyed the dinner and also enjoyed the live music. The restaurant is on the best entertainment strip in Nashville. Loved every minute of it. Average pricing made it even more enjoyable.

reviews.name: Matt U.
reviews.review: I was out waiting on my friend to get off work so I decided to come grab a drink at Margaritaville while I waited.  To be honest, I was really craving their Third Coast Margarita.  It's the house margarita mixed with sweet tea and Jack Daniels whiskey.  It's my favorite drink and what I order almost all of the time when I visit.  Tommy P. was bartending the Chill bar up front and got me my drink quickly.  The house band was performing on the stage in the back so I went to go check them out for a bit.  Overall, a great time.

reviews.name: Alexandria N.
reviews.review: We only went to the bar here to listen to the live music. They had a couple of guys playing acoustic guitars -- they took requests and interacted a lot which made it fun. I got a strawberry blended margarita which was delish & we shared a slice a Key Lime Pie which was heavenly. The waitress was friendly and attentive. We had a great time here!

reviews.name: Sandy B.
reviews.review: We love this place! Food is great (alittle expensive) but the atmosphere is fun and the servers are great. The balloon lady is always smiling & the servers hi five her as she walks by. We always bring family here when they visit. LOVE the clothing & giftcshop. Wish I could afford it all!!!Much better than Dick's Last Resort!

reviews.name: Shannon Q.
reviews.review: We went here at 230 on a Saturday afternoon, just in time for our 3 & 1 yr olds to see the stilt walker & get balloon hats.   We've been to the Margaritaville in Panama City Beach & Vegas & this one was comparable even though it's in the middle of downtown.  We had the fried pickles (which were DELISH) & ordered the bacon cheeseburger & turkey burger for us & chicken tenders for the little guys.  The food was great & our server, Tommy P, was fantastic too.  Only complaint would be that it's pricey ($3.25 for a soda-really???) but what do you expect for a tourist chain...

reviews.name: Brian C.
reviews.review: While the locals don't make M-ville a staple place, you have to be glad there's one here in Nashville.  As home to some of the world's best live music, M-ville hangs tight in the Nashville tradition with a world-class stage, lighting and sound system while you dine.  Check out the super tacky gift shop to feel like you've taken a beach visit.

reviews.name: O. C.
reviews.review: Was here on New Year's Day 2013, and had a wonderful experience. My dad & I road-tripped from New York the day before and this was one of the only places open. We were sat immediately and our waitress came over right away. I had a chicken quesadilla and a margarita - I can't remember what my dad ordered. I do remember that we both had fantastic meals, and our server was absolutely amazing. The place was packed and yet she was friendly and attentive, but not pushy. Having been a server for 3 years, I know it's not easy especially when most of the patrons are hungover. Halfway through our meal a musical duo came in which was great and not something that happens often (at least mid-day) where I live. We stayed to listen a bit and our waitress still paid just as much attention to us even after we settled the bill and left our tip. She asked us where we were from, etc. and seemed genuinely interested in our answers. If ever in the area again, we will be back.

reviews.name: Emily N.
reviews.review: Great nachos.  Our 4th margaritaville we've visited and it was very pleasant and clean except the women's bathroom,  that was gross.  Quick wait and very quick service.  Perfect for live music when on Broadway with young children.

reviews.name: Karli W.
reviews.review: The volcano nachos could feed an army. The margaritas could knock out an army. Otherwise, nothing too spectacular.

reviews.name: alana v.
reviews.review: Food and drinks were really good! Service wasn't! At one point we couldn't find our server. But the live music was really good! If our server wasn't MIA we would have stayed the whole night!

reviews.name: Rupard M.
reviews.review: I've eaten here 3 times now.  Twice back in February and it was Fantastic.  I tend to not venture out too much once I find something I like.  All three times I've gotten the Fajita Taco Salad which normally comes with beef but substituted chicken instead.  It comes with the dressing already mixed up in the salad and it was superbly blended.  However, I ate the same thing just recently and it was just mediocre.  I was disappointed.  Overall though, the service was excellent, we were able to walk right in and sit down at the bar and it was on a weekend when we went.  We did get there early though.  I would still recommend this place!

reviews.name: David P.
reviews.review: I get the feeling that Mr Buffett is pulling a Krusty the Clown.  Beer, rums, tequelas and mixers he has sold his soul to make a buck.  I ordered the coconut shrimp, 6 shrimp, a scoop of mashed potatos, 12 green beans.  It was good but not good enough for $15.

reviews.name: Nina I.
reviews.review: I've been to Margaritaville in Canada and I really liked it because it was HUGE! Three floors and the bar on the third floor balcony was open late night, usually at the same time the city had fireworks so imagine I had a front row seat way up high! They also had people on those really tall wood stick they walk on and had live music, overall everything was so superb that I can't find many other Margaritavilles to match it.And now for the one in Nashville... Well I wasn't as big of a fan as I was for the one in Canada but it was still pleasant. At first, though, we were told we were going to be seated in twenty minutes but it turned out to be a forty minute wait which aggravated me from the start especially because I bought souvenirs from their shop. When we finally got sat there was live music and the guys were REALLY good! You could tell they were real artists, but the waiter seemed to not be as excited to take care of us as we had hoped and had seen at other places in Tennessee.The food was good but I wasn't too hungry and I wasn't too happy with the wine selections.

reviews.name: Doug W.
reviews.review: I know, a chain! While in Key West last year couldn't get in the door, but mid day, mid week Nashville after the Fourth, no prob! Noisy, yes, Jimmy screaming from every TV, yes!Our waitress, Anastasia suggested the "Fried Green Tomatoes" which were as she said "fabulous"!I had the "Cuban", eh glorified ham sandwich but tasty and my bride had the "Cheese Burger in Paradise" and it was very good with their signature onion rings.We had lots to take back to the Club Hotel to enjoy with their free "happy Hour" and Hors d'œuvre.It is a tourist trap worth stopping at wherever you are, after all isn't there a little "Parrothead" in all of us?Off to the Bourbon trail in Kentucky  mañana!

reviews.name: Julie M.
reviews.review: Decent food. Cheesey atmosphere. Great service! :) I ate at a few better places in Nashville. Definitely go somewhere else and have some BBQ if you are visiting.

reviews.name: Megan H.
reviews.review: Visiting Nashville and as a margarita drinker, I figured I pretty much had to stop here. All in all, decent, but pricey. The drinks are stromg, but I've had strong drinks for much less. I had the Teriyaki Chicken; it was delicious, but again, pricey. The bartender, JJ, was very nice. He's the reason I gave four stars instead of 3.

reviews.name: Joel A.
reviews.review: Food was delicious. Steak cooked perfectly. Wait was short. Love land shark on draft. Bathrooms were a sad mess. But the food is delicious!

reviews.name: Mark H.
reviews.review: Well all my friends know I'm a huge buffet fan. And if you read any my reviews on the restaurants  you see I gushed all over them. This is going to be the exception however. The wife and I decided to stop in for a quick bite before the CMA's. They had a private party downstairs but the upstairs was still open for business. They should have just  closed the restaurant. "My man Jimmy, get some people in the restaurant that know what they're doing from managers and servers". This was a lesson for any restaurateur on how not to handle running a shift. Once we got upstairs we're told we have to wait which was no big deal, except 50% of the tables were empty or empty and just not bussed. It was like everyone was on slow-motion the manager just kept wandering around looking at things looking at dirty tables I don't think once he even pick up a glass to help bus off the table or get a customer sat. I realize this is a little bit of a tourist restaurant but hey you know us locals like to go there sometimes too. "Very, very disappointed Mr. Buffett, having been in this business for over 35 years operations like this is a sure way of sending your business to being cash flow negative".

reviews.name: Scott C.
reviews.review: Wish I had checked Yelp before eating.  Lot of options in downtown Nashville.  Not sure why I thought a Jimmy Buffet restaurant would be a good one.  Place was busy.  Service good, decor excellent.  Nice videos playing on many tvs with good sound.  The problem - the food is bad.  Kind of link a mash of everything you find in a Chilis, Applebees, etc.  Unfortunately, it's insulting Chilis and Applebees to draw a comparison.  One of us got sick, the other just had an upset stomach.  Seriously, can't listen to Jimmy's music without remembering this place:-(Try something else when downtown...

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: I've eaten here a few times since it opened. The food has been great...the nachos are the best ever! They even beat out my favorite Mexican restaurant for nachos! However $11 for nachos is crazy (I know, I know huge tourist trap). The burgers are good! I also love the margaritas here and I think they are priced fair for Broadway! However here is my one and only complaint:The live music has stunk the times I've been there! I'm sorry but a country girl singing Lady Gaga = huge mess and a guy that was in there while I was dining was way off key and just did not sound great! My ears were going to bleed it was that bad....C'mon Margaritaville your location is Nashville and Nashville is FULL of amazing talent and that I have not seen at your location...I'm sure your entertainment only gets paid on tips but there are several great artists out there just trying to get a break! Seriously plz book some great local singers! I may just stick around longer and spend more money in your bar!All in all Margaritaville has been my first choice to dine when going to events in downtown Nash because the food is great! By the way did I mention how much I love your nachos ;)!?!?

reviews.name: Peter W.
reviews.review: Horrible, awful, terrible, worst margarita ever. Bartenders choice, something off the menu. One would think it would be good, I asked this to which a reply I received "it's strong". I asked again, "is it good" and again "its strong". Strong of fake lime and gross triple sec. There we no less than 5 bottles of something I didn't want in my margarita. This place should be ashamed of itself.

reviews.name: Dom G.
reviews.review: Huge Parrot Head here!Have to visit every time there is one available and drink with the local band playin' the good tunes!Not much to say since we drank a few, danced a lot and had a blast...Thanks to a good staff and awesome band for making a good night!

reviews.name: Jen W.
reviews.review: Went there this one weekend with a large group and was very disappointed with the establishment. We had reservations and still had to wait over an hour, we were seated separately in the bar. Management came up to us later and said people were complaining that we were too loud, we were in the bar where loud music was playing. Out server was slow and just plain terrible.

reviews.name: Charles L.
reviews.review: I ate here at lunch today and ordered the crab cake sandwich. Bread was hard, and there was waaaayyyy too much lettuce. And on top of that, it was bland. NO flavor. It was NOT worth the ten bucks I paid for it. Service was decent, however, but I won't go back.

reviews.name: Lee G.
reviews.review: My sisters and I went to Jimmy Buffet"S Margaritaville In Nashville, TN..Had a Great time..everyone was Friendly,the service was great..The Food was awesome:)

reviews.name: D D.
reviews.review: Not good at all. The only good thing was that for a Saturday night we only waited about 30 minutes to be seated. Then it went bad from there. Once we put our food order in it was over an hour before we got it, and this was after I flagged down a manager. They ran out of some menu items (at 8 o'clock). Menu is very limited and I can get a better Margarita at Cinco De Mayo! Such a waste. Had a much better experience in Vegas. I will not be going back. Overpriced for the food

reviews.name: Susan K.
reviews.review: Just stopped in for a quick bite. The staff was helpful and friendly. The food was delicious and served quickly.I had the Mango Chicken Salad. Diced mangoes, chicken breast(tender), sweet pecans, tossed with greens and a jalapeno ranch dressing. It was wonderful!Had a drink that had banana liqueor in it..Havana Banana? It was delicous, too. Similar to a banana daquiri.

reviews.name: Jess M.
reviews.review: Service was okay. But I'd definitely go back for the bleu cheese burger. Best burger I've had in a long time!!

reviews.name: Deb S.
reviews.review: Your typical tourist trap...for a Friday night we were able to get a table at the bar with no problems...the server was good...not sure why I was expecting more...if you've been to one you've been to all.

reviews.name: Kevin A.
reviews.review: Tommy and Melissa are awesome.  Sit at the bar for great service from these two and a great seat for the music!

reviews.name: Dwayne G.
reviews.review: Worth a stop if you're a JB fan.  But sadly, the margarita's are average at best.  Come On Jimmy --- make the staff mix up a good one!  Food is average at best, but could have over looked it with a good rita.  Overall a disappointing experience, but they do have some cool stuff in the gift shop

reviews.name: Dee B.
reviews.review: The nachos is huge. Margarittas does no justic for me. I like em' on the stronger side. Have a few before you go.

reviews.name: Noelani P.
reviews.review: We found ourselves in this part of downtown to grab dinner after arriving at Nashville International airport. My friend had the Italian Margarita and I had their Pink cadillac - BOTH of which were VERY good - they were strong enough to leave you with a "just right" buzz but were fruity enough to be both tasty but not too sweet. The wings, ribs and shrimp pasta were decent and I saw (but did not have) their helpings of nachos which was monstrously huge. Older kids and adults who are into balloon shaping and performers on stilts would find the place entertaining. There was no live band when we were there so I cannot comment on that - in the bar area there were some acoustic guitarists which would appeal for those who do not want the more raucous environ behind the bar.

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: Not gonna have the Cheese Burger, the Jerk Salmon with a Mango Salza was good, served with Rice & Green Beans. Even land locked in Tennessee,  Jimmy's music takes you to the islands.

reviews.name: Mrs. P.
reviews.review: We ate here on Mother's Day. (Party of 5 plus one munchkin) The restaurant was not busy by any means however our food took approx. an HOUR to arrive at our table after placing our orders. Other patrons dined and exited as we waited for our meals.  When our food finally arrived it did not include my meal. My family graciously waited until I received my food (Cuban sandwich which was very tasty, btw) before they ate and by then all of their meals were cold. Our waiter was very apologetic and swore up and down that he turned in my order with the others and blamed it on the kitchen. My sandwich ended up being comped which I felt was fair. However I was really worried about the fact that we had parked in a pay by the hour parking lot since we waited so long for our food to arrive. When we were finished with our meal we headed to the parking lot only t o find a $40.00 parking ticket. I returned to the restaurant and asked the manager if he would be so kind as to help me out with it since we had waited exceedingly long for our meals. He said there was nothing he could do and compared it to me expecting him to pay for a speeding ticket?! Thank you Margaritaville Nashville for making my Mother's Day one to remember.

reviews.name: Vernon D.
reviews.review: I stopped in here on a Friday for lunch and decided to go with the Jerk Salmon dinner and of course a Margarita.  The Jerk Salmon was delicious.

reviews.name: Holly C.
reviews.review: Over priced..un enthusiastic bar tender!! Buffet would not be happy!!

reviews.name: L.G. S.
