reviews.review: First to write a review, yay!I was able to attend the "soft open" and even on that day, when they had a lot of kinks, limited menu, etc, it was wonderful!!I went back opening night and they were slammed but seemed to handle the rush very well.  I had a steak and fries and one person with me had a typical cheeseburger and fries, the other person shrimp. Everyone loved the food. I think the fries are the best!!Great job with the atmosphere. It's very typical Buffett with some Nashville touches.  They will also have local musicians playing 7 days a week. Like they are supporting Nashville artists.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Went for birthday party, completely average in every way, coconut shrimp and sliders, top shelf margarita made with gran gala, was very sweet, not limey and just about drinkable.  Service minimal effort.  Noisy, tacky and touristy..but of course.

reviews.name: Rachel A.
reviews.review: I was prepared to be underwhelmed as this kind of place is not my first choice, but we all agreed that it exceeded expectations.  The food was really good and the service as well.  We were seated quickly and our server was attentive and helpful.

reviews.name: Judith S.
reviews.review: It was a fun place to get our bachelorette party started. One of the bridesmaids is on a bucket list quest to have a shot in every Margaritaville so we started off here on a Saturday night. Dinner was all right (read: bar food with a few healthy options), but waiter was cute and the live music was fun. There were some tacky, trashy acting folks in the bar area, but we were able to get the musicians to play Sweet Home Alabama for a few bucks.

reviews.name: Dustin W.
reviews.review: When the bartender tells you the top shelf Margarita is strong believe him.

reviews.name: Kristyn A.
reviews.review: Don't waste your money. The food tastes cheap and is overpriced.

reviews.name: Sara C.
reviews.review: Food and beverages overpriced and not good.  There are better places to go downtown.

reviews.name: Ashley P.
reviews.review: This was a great stop for lunch. The staff is very energetic and very helpful with the menu and helping for directions around town. The food is phenomenal!! If you like nachos this is the place to get them because they are like 2 ft high! Great Entertainment Venue at night with a live band!!

reviews.name: E S.
reviews.review: Worst experience ever! I went here this past weekend with a large group of girlfriends. We had high hopes and were disappointed quickly. As we were waiting at the bar to order drinks, a server walked by, bumped into a different patron, and spilled an entire tray of drinks on me! My hair was soaked, my dress soaked and ruined, and my cowboy boots were drenched. The server walked away without saying a word. Another patron came up to me with napkins to help wipe me off and ask if I was okay to make sure no broken glass was on me. (Seems like everyone else in Nashville was sweet and respectful..just not the workers at this bar.) A few minutes later another server came over to clean up the mess. I explained to her what happened and said that I knew it was an accident, but asked if there was any way I could get a free drink for the inconvenience. She first replied saying it was the customers in the bar's fault for never moving out of the way. (Nice customer service- if your bar is so full, follow your capacity limits.) I then explained that I understood it was an accident, that I wasn't the one in the way, and that I didn't think she was a bad server or anything, I was just asking politely for a free drink. She explained that she was a server there and wouldn't get me one. I then asked if there was someone else to talk to, which she said she would go find. 5-10 minutes later nobody came so we asked the bartender for the manager. The manager was just as RUDE! I explained that the server spilled a tray of drinks on me and he said it was my fault since I bumped into her. I explained it wasn't me that bumped her since I was at the bar. He then followed through with trying to say that I didn't even look wet. I asked him if he wanted to come over and feel my soaking wet dress which he then followed up with saying he wouldn't give anything to me for free. I asked if anything could be done for the inconvenience, I was open to any ideas, but he said there was nothing that could or would be done. Worst part- he never even apologized for the way I was treated, for blaming me, or anything. I would NEVER go back to this location! Don't plan going there...there are way better places in Nashville with the sweet southern charm and respect that everyone hears about.

reviews.name: Amanda K.
reviews.review: We didn't eat but the drinks were good. The band was good as well. Definitely could get super loud because the few seats they do have are really close to the stage.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: When the blizzard of '15 hit, CPK didn't fail to disappoint, merely by being open. So, pro #1: Opens when it snows. Not a positive to be taken lightly in Nashville.Other positives:# 2. Delicious gluten-free pizza, complete with a little wooden gluten-free flag of isolation ("Oh. I guess you won't be trading pizza slices").# 3. Decent portion sizes. I don't feel like they are trying to feed the small nation that I have apparently hidden under the table, but I don't leave hungry, either.#4. Fresh and tasty food.I ordered the gluten-free pepperoni pizza. While no gluten-free pizza will ever be quite as delightful as gluten-plus pizza, this was hot, crispy, and tasted a lot like pizza. Can't argue with that. For people who prefer to be unhappy, there are also quinoa salads and other vaguely healthy options.While I do find the food here to be a little pricey for what you get, it is not a completely unreasonable deal. Especially when they are the only place open in a five-mile radius on a mildly snowy evening.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: Slightly below average CPKWait staff should understand if there's a party of six adults and a toddler who really wants apple juice, serve the toddler first. Not deliver the adults drinks and then leave us to try and explain to a two year old that the waiter forgot them for eight minutes.Other than that, pizza doesn't pop like at other CPKs I've attended. It was good, just not as good as an average CPK and it's flippin pricey for drinks. I walked out with a "holy hell" and slightly disappointing pizza aftertaste.

reviews.name: Terry V.
reviews.review: We came here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon and it took awhile for the hostess to get all the guests sorted and seated. We were the third party in line and had to wait longer than necessary.Once that was settled, we sat down and our waiter asked for our drink orders immediately. Thankfully we knew what we wanted- Iced tea and strawberry mango lemonades. I liked my lemonade- it's super tart but I love it that way.For our meal. We ordered the BBQ chicken salad and then the Hawaiian BBQ pizza. The food didn't take too long. I  love a good BBQ chicken pizza with pineapples and CPK missed the mark. Castrillo's has my vote hands down. A few pieces of my chicken was fatty which I cannot stand and didn't taste good. I eat chicken A LOT and I felt that it was a low grade chicken. The presentation of the pizza itself wasn't appetizing and I couldn't believe they left the onion slices as round instead of diced that would be much easier to eat. I wish they would have put more pineapples on the pizza. Actually, I wish the pizza would have been more flavorful with fresher ingredients. I was very disappointed in my pizza.  Our waiter was OK and needs more training on how to properly close out customers. We declined on desserts and I thought it was odd when he returned with two checks. He didn't ask us prior to bringing the checks and just assumed that we were separate. Just take a second to ask if the bill will be one or split. I felt rushed to leave even though I wasn't finished with my lemonade. I definitely won't be back when there are a ton of other pizza options here in town.

reviews.name: Carly B.
reviews.review: Why must this place be so pricey?! Food is deliciously addicting. High quality and super flavors will kick yo butt!Caesar salad is the best you'll find anywhere with cravable croutons - yep, that's right it's possible to crave croutons. The chicken Caesar sandwich hiding on the back of the menu deserves your attention. I have yet to dine here with a party member who was disappointed with his/her order.

reviews.name: John F.
reviews.review: Party of 4 around 6pm on a Saturday night, quickly greeted and seated, prompt service. Waiter was very professional and nice. Food came out hot and withing 10 minutes or so. Food was very good, really tempted to give a 5 stars. The manager even came by to check on us.We will be back!

reviews.name: Nashville T.
reviews.review: Cpk also known as child play kitchen.  Worn out parents bring hords of tired noisy kids so staff can apologize to the other diners.  Can't the manager stick the families in back so shrieking screaming and crying is in one place?  I like the food but hate the atmosphere.I like the rhubarb martini.  Helps with noise level.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: I love this place. It's quick and conveniently located near my office. The pizzas and salads are delicious. I love their Thai salad and bbq chicken pizza (a true CPK classic). Come here if you need a quick bite to eat. Service is usually great too!

reviews.name: Mary V.
reviews.review: They have more than just pizza!  Although the pizzas I have tried there have all been good.  I especially like the Wild Mushroom thin crust pizza.  Every time we dine here, service is good and managers are always nice to check on our table. This place is convenient to our office so we do lunch here quite a bit.  We sometimes start with the Avocado Eggrolls which are SO good.  There are 6 of them so it's best to split between 3 people - one is not enough and more than 2 is too much.  Their salads are good.  I usually get the Thai Crunch salad with avocado.  Half salads are good portions, especially if you've already had an appetizer.  Their seasonal menu is usually yummy.  During this summer they have a California Fields salad with strawberries and watermelon that is refreshing.  CPK has a small plates menu with a few good choices.  If I order from that menu, I get the Asparagus and Arugula Salad paired with Shaved Mushroom and Spinach Flatbread. Nothing beats their Buttercake - nothing.  If you're watching your calories, you still need to eat at least a couple of bites and feel okay with yourself because it is GOOD.  Don't forget the ice cream on top.

reviews.name: Lorenzo K.
reviews.review: Pizza is not the best. Pretty dry. But the butter cake is the best dessert I have ever had. No joke. My family came here full of Vietnamese food and we still scarfed down 2 butter cakes between 4 people as if we haven't eaten dinner. Wish I could have some now but there's no cpk in Murfreesboro:(

reviews.name: Katie G.
reviews.review: Wonderful dining experience. The bartender Shane makes a killer raspberry lemondrop. Service was phenomenal.

reviews.name: Jinesh P.
reviews.review: the quality and quantity of food has deteriorated ever since I had it after couple of years.They seem to have added wheat based pizza bread, but no thin crust. Also, the order was less than tasteful. We used to be excited to visit this restaurant once for it's variety of vegetarian pizza options, but not anymore. Would pass this any day over other fusion italian restaurants

reviews.name: Jennifer L.
reviews.review: My husband and I love coming here with our son. There are lots of great fresh healthy choices. Additionally we are a military family and appreciate the military discount and amazing Veterans Day freebies. Their pizzas are unique, beer selection well-rounded, and we always leave satisfied. The service has also been stellar in the past; not sure why there aren't more good reviews on here. Strange. It's also in a great location attached to the Whole Foods garage & across the street from the Bluebird.

reviews.name: Russell M.
reviews.review: So I have been wanting to try this place and finally had the opportunity.  It did not disappoint.  Had the Avocado Wraps for an appetizer and they were great. I then ordered a thin crust half Jerk Chicken and half Habanero. Service was exceptional, I believe his name was Jason. If he is your server you will be glad. So the only reason for the missing star was the inside was boring and looked like a Shoney's with a bar. They need something to make them distinct. Other than that great place for lunch.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: I've been here quite a few times in the past and enjoyed the Pizza.  I decided on my most recent visit to switch it up and get a sandwich. Heresy perhaps but I enjoyed it none the less.Now, realistically this place is NOT somewhere you go looking for some authentic Pizza. If you are one of those people where finding the best Pizza in the world holds some special charm you will probably be disappointed.  This place is purely "Gimmick" Pizza at its very best.  It tries to be trendy, and from the look of how busy it is on a Friday Night it succeeds.The last two times the Better half of the "Yelp Couple" and I have been here we have opted to sit at the bar because the place is PACKED.  If CPK wasn't adjoining a nice big parking structure, it would be a nightmare to find somewhere to park!  Fortunately its rarely difficult to find a spot.  Overall if you are looking for some trendy pizza at a trendy restaurant, you are not going to be disappointed at California Pizza Kitchen.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: I'd like to call it meh, but it's better than that.  I've had a lot of Pizza described as California style, and it's all overdone.  Too nutty, not saucy, not cheesy: it doesn't have the richness or savory flair that New York or Chicago offers.  The Pepperoni Pizza at CPK was actually pretty tasty.  The cheese had zip, the crust was not too focused on the whole grain, the pepperoni itself was very good.But the place was too expensive.  I wasn't surprised but I was disappointed.  The $12.50 for a small pizza and the $9.50 for a salad with cold cuts all came off as priced twice as high as it should be.And they were a little too zealous in up-selling.  Did not like that at all, and my wife totally fell for it.  If you dig California-style pizza, and have money to burn, then this is probably pretty good, but I'd rather eat second-rate Little Caesars, and not feel cheated.

reviews.name: Kristina L.
reviews.review: A few days ago I ordered three items online for a business meeting.  I placed the order around 10:30a with a request for an 11:45a pick up time.  I arrived at 11:45 for my pick up and called to let them know I was curbside.  I was told they were "running behind" and it would be another ten minutes.  Okay, I can deal with that since they told me a time.  Ten minutes pass, then fifteen minutes pass.  Finally, after twenty minutes have passed, I call again.  The person on the other end of the phone tells me it has "only been five minutes" since I last called.  Not so...  There's this handy little thing called an iPhone that actually lets you know what time you placed an outgoing call.  My calls were placed twenty minutes apart.  Finally, after waiting an additional five minutes (I'd almost been there for half an hour) a manager delivers my food with the apology that they were overwhelmed that day and not prepared for so many online orders.  So I get back to the office and deliver lunch.  Lo and behold, the order I waited all that time for was missing an item.  I immediately call and tell them.  I also explain that after all the waiting I've been through that I expect this to be delivered in the next few minutes.  To their credit, it was delivered within fifteen minutes.  However, the only apology made this time was to credit my credit card for the missing item.  Overall, I was very displeased with the wait time, the attitude of the person on the phone and their online ordering system.  If the system is overloaded, why does it allow for me to select a pick up time?  I selected a time a full hour and fifteen minutes later for three items and still wound up waiting for an additional half an hour for 2/3 of my order.  I used to order business lunches there frequently, but after this I will be rethinking about where to take my business.

reviews.name: Dan O.
reviews.review: Horrible management. We went for Mother's Day and we had a bunch of kids with us we called ahead and still had us wait. When part of the table was out together we asked to seat some of our party but the manager said "that's against the rules." Completely inept...

reviews.name: Bridget S.
reviews.review: Yummie field green salad with salmon..salmon a bit overcooked....

reviews.name: Megan W.
reviews.review: I'll be really upfront with you in my review of this place.I loved the atmosphere, the hostess was nice, our waiter was on par with service, and the food was good--not the best pizza I've ever had, but it was good.To try and be a bit adventurous, I got one of their appetizers, something with pork dumplings and ginger chili sauce (or something along those lines...) and that was actually very tasty. I ordered their BBQ chicken pizza and asked the waiter to leave off the cheese (all my lactose free buddies say 'holla!!'). After ordering, the manager (I'm assuming) came over before the food came out to ask me about my order; she said I'd requested no cheese and wanted to make sure I meant no cheese at all, not just the mozzerella on top. I said yes, I'm lactose-free, so she informed me that our waiter hadn't asked for the gouda to be taken off and that they were making me another pizza right at that moment, but they'd go ahead and bring the other one out since they'd already made it and they'd take that pizza off of the ticket (I think...)HEY. AWESOME CUSTOMER SERVICE AWARD THERE.The pizza was okay, not the best BBQ Chicken pizza I've had, but that type of customer service gets this place 5 stars in my book all day long. Go on with your organic self, CPK!!

reviews.name: Kaleena 'Kala' H.
reviews.review: Although I do eat the pizzas that they sell at the grocery store, going to the actual restaurant is always an amazing experience. Their food is delicious and the service is always excellent! Some of my favorite foods include the 4-cheese pizza, the BBQ Chicken pizza, and their garlic fettuccine alfredo with chicken...all very delicious. Just recently I also tried their hot fudge sundae on a whim, and it was awesome. :DI also like how they offer healthy options, such as thin-crust or gluten free options, along with multi-grain pasta.Next time I go, I hope to try their new Small Bites selections...mainly the Crispy Mac and Cheese ones. I have heard they are delicious and it makes my mouth water! :D

reviews.name: Cherie M.
reviews.review: The food is good that is my only reason for returning. Sometimes I can get a bartender to make a good mojito. The customer service is the worst even from management. You walk in and you may or may not be greated. IF  walkbin for takeout forget about it. Today I was in for takeout. I stood at the counter for 10 min before a random waiter asked me if I had been helped when I said no he let me know je couldnt but would find the girl that could. Finally the manager walks over but only to gather receipts that are printing,he does not ask if I need help until I set my phone on the counter with the timer on. After he takes order he says 15 min so I decide to buy one of their over priced drinks after 30 mins I ask if my food is ready instead of the rude as manager bringing me my food its been sitting over on the take out counter. I have eaten CPK for years its been in the last few cities I have lived in but this is my last straw with this place.

reviews.name: Ally E.
reviews.review: My disgusting experience that I had with some friends at CPK in Nashville (Hillsboro Pike) on Saturday, September 15, 2012.  I guess we didn't see the red flags, but it started from the time we walked in the door. We waited 7 minutes to be seated. I know this exact time, because I received a phone call as we walked in, so I excused myself and came in after that. That call was 7 minutes and 42 seconds. My party was still standing at the hosteess station. The restaurant was not half full. It appeared to be a slow night. There was no hostess or greeter on hand. We were asked had we been helped, and were finally seated by our server. I went directly to the restroom. Upon returning to the table within a few moments, drinks were being brought to the table. I immediately asked, "Don't you all wait until all parties are at the table before taking orders. " Our server, simply stated sorry. I ordered a strawberry lemonade as did the rest of my party. I was then informed, "It may take a while, since we just ran out of lemonade" so I ordered a sweet tea and water. We all placed our orders and waited patiently. We sat chatting amongst ourselves and drinking our drinks. Our server came and brought refills of water, to 2 of the 4 glasses at the table, while our lemonades and sweet teas were not refilled. Our food came, still no refills. At this point, I'm thinking did they run out of sweet tea as well? Finally I asked can I have a refill to either my water or sweet tea. Both of my glasses had ice only at this time. So I was given a refill of water. WOW!! Finally after waiting long enough I asked another server to ask my server for a sweet tea refill. Our food came, and I immediately asked for extra parmesan and croutons. A male server brought me croutons and dressing. The most upsetting part was the MOUSE that ran across the floor. At this point we asked for checks and were ready to go. While we sat there, my husband drank a sip of his water, and said it's time to go now in an upset voice. I asked him what's wrong, and he showed us a dead fly floating in his water!! As we walked out a CPK employee said thanks for coming, hope you enjoyed dinner and the show in a joking voice. This was a very upsetting experience. I don't see anything funny about it. Seeing a 4 legged critter race across the room while you are eating and the dead fly in a drink, plus the lack of service makes me never want to step foot in this restaurant again. Whether $5 or the $46.43 that we spent, I am a paying customer and expect better.

reviews.name: Kaitlyn K.
reviews.review: The Spinach Artichoke Dip and Hummus are great starters.  The BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad and the Thin Crust Pizzas are my favorites here.  The soups are also delish - especially the Tortilla.  The Key Lime Pie is also very good to close the meal.   If you want a drink, be prepared to spend $4.75 on a beer, and $10 for a well drink.  I recommend their iced tea.  (UNsweet.)  ;) My gripe with this place is...the prices over the last few years have gone up TREMENDOUSLY!  It used to be a place for a relatively inexpensive to average priced date...now, we're lucky if we escape for less than $50 + tip.

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: So I feel like its uncool to like this place, but I really don't care. I gave it another shot and was quite pleased. The meatlovers was really good. It's a speciality style pie, and the ingredients are all tasty. Had a delicious Korean taco small plate as well. Dessert was the outstanding butter cake.My only gripe is its a tad pricey, but not too bad.

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: Enjoyed the pear and Gorgonzola pizza...looks a little weird to have a salad ON TOP of a pizza but it is tasty.  The avocado BLT egg roll appetizer was a unique bite that we enjoyed sharing too.  A little slow on the drink refills, but overall a very nice experience with a large group.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: I'd rather save money and eat their frozen pizzas at home. I'm not knocking the food here, but it's really not *that* much better eating at the restaurant, especially for the price.

reviews.name: Nathan K.
reviews.review: Love the BBQ & other Chicken pizza options.  Had the jerk chicken today...it probably brought a tad too much heat for my taste (although they provide a salsa which seems to cut it).  It does have a nice apple cinnamon taste, however.Oddly--not sure why they have this particular salsa except to cut the heat from the jerk chicken.

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: Very good pizza whether out of the freeze section OR the restaurant! lol I tried the four season pizza without the meat and it was just right! Great service and attentive wait staff.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: Growing up I would go to their location in Houston and I have always loved the food here. CPK has a wonderful spin on traditional pizza and their non-traditional pizzas are an experience all in themselves. I have had the BBQ Chicken, Garlic Chicken, the Mushroom Pizza and their 5 Cheese n Tomato. All of them are really tasty and worth having again.Recently they changed their menue and though they kept many of my favorites, they dropped 1 or two of my favorite pizzas as well as the mushroom ravioli. This can be forgiven though as their quality has improved with this menu change.Yes, they do have the pizza's in the freezer section; however, you just can't beat the quality you get for the extra money in the restaurant, it is that good.

reviews.name: Heather H.
reviews.review: My husband and I were on a Sunday afternoon mission to find spicy ethnic food to battle our head colds, and finding nothing, gave up and stopped at CPK. Much to our surprise, we were able to get just that, and a great waiter.We ordered spicy approximated Asian dishes (ie, "Thai Linguine," pad thai with Italian noodles.) and bloody marys. Our waiter sensed this theme and scoured around for a dish of chili paste which helped immensely. Everything tasted awesome, and the service was quick. I'll definitely stop in again.

reviews.name: LM P.
reviews.review: I had very high expectations for the California Pizza Kitchen and the location in Green Hills definitely met those expectations.  Every pizza joint I go to, I always make a point to try their version of the BBQ Chicken Pizza.  A-MAZING! We also ordered the Jamaican Jerk Chicken, Traditional Cheese, and the Chipotle Chicken pizzas.  Each pizza looked so great, that we found ourselves dipping into each other's pizza.  They were all delicious.  The service was wonderful as well!  Our server was very accomodating, and knew her stuff about what beers and drinks went best with each pizza.  The only thing I'll say that is a negative is their "Small Craving" plates are very small.  We ordered the White Corn Guacamole with chips and while it was very fresh, it was not enough for the table of four like we thought.  It's more like a spoon full of guacamole and we felt jipped out of $9. Overall, I would definitely visit the California Pizza Kitchen again.  Great pizza, great location, convenient parking, charming service and a nice atmosphere.

reviews.name: Wayne H.
reviews.review: Despite being a native Californian myself, I have never tried this place before coming to Nashville and I now have to say, while this place is a fair introduction to Californian food, it is expensive as heck, and these days you can find comparably unique and interesting pizzas elsewhere (including the frozen aisle of your local supermarket).California Pizza Kitchen is famed as the inventor of the BBQ chicken Pizza. That pizza is well done, the BBQ sauce slightly sweet but not overwhelmingly so, and the red onions adding a bit of kick to the slices.  Still, it's not too different from other places that sell BBQ chicken pizza these days such as Boscos. The restaurant does have a wide variety of pizzas to choose from, ranging from Classical and Hawaiian to a Jamaican Jerk and Pear and Gorgonzola Pizza.  The Wild Mushroom pizza did impress me with its deep savory flavors coming from the four different types of mushrooms. Personal pizzas are a somewhat eye-opening $11-$15 dollars for around a 10" diameter plate. For those not interested in pizzas (why are you here?) there is also an extensive list of pastas, salads and other dishes, which may be done gluten-free.  CPK's wide variety of veggie options was also greatly appreciated by my vegetarian friend.  These also range from $8-$15.In conclusion, I guess if you've wanted to experience "California cuisine" or have a taste for some more exotic pizza selections (and aren't cheap like me), this is a nice place to go.  Still,  I'd just as likely go to one of our local restaurants like Boscos or Wild Cow instead-the cuisine of my home state is more pervasive in Tennessee than you think.

reviews.name: Matthew S.
reviews.review: For what you get, this place is dreadfully overpriced.  The best pizza we got was the white pizza, and the orig chop salad was nice but not worth thirteen bucks.  It's a nice place but has an overinflated view of itself.

reviews.name: Brandon W.
reviews.review: Went back a second time with my girlfriend. Really impressed overall with food and service. We split a pizza and a half salad and both left full. Definitely recommend the four seasons pizza, a little different but very good.

reviews.name: Carol C.
reviews.review: If you do take out, know that it is going through a national call center. Try to avoid it....mistakes more likely that way! When you get the voice recording, hit 3 and you will be connected to the local restaurant.

reviews.name: Kim L.
reviews.review: I LOVE this place. Great for a Sunday, after-church lunch! There's just something about this pizza that has me addicted to it.

reviews.name: Tonya O.
reviews.review: I've been to the restaurant twice now, and both have been good experiences. The first time I was there, the server was almost too professional, but the second time the server was very personable and made the experience much more laid back. We happened to go on a very busy night because of a promotion they have right now, but we received our orders in a decent amount of time.  I've tried two pizzas now that are outside the 'norm' of pizzas for me. They weren't 'to die for' pizzas, but the cool thing about California Pizza Kitchen is that if you don't find the best pizza ever on one visit, then there's several others to try.  Definitely an awesome place to go if you're bored with pepperoni or the regular pizza toppings.  However, I still can't make myself like lettuce on any pizza. Oh, and definitely sit at the bar at least once if you're a fan of watching how things are made. It most certainly added to the whole experience.

reviews.name: Brit H.
reviews.review: Ok food, overpriced, no ambiance but there's an effort...

reviews.name: Christopher M.
reviews.review: Abysmal. Both me and the person I was with agreed it was one of the worst meals we've had in Nashville.The pizza tastes EXACTLY like the frozen CPK pizzas you can find in your neighborhood grocery store. Which, for frozen pizza, is pretty good. But not when you are actually paying $12 for it in the restaurant.The ambience of this place just doesn't sit right with me either. It's just overall not a good place to eat for any occasion.It was about 8pm on a Saturday night and it was maybe 20% full. I wonder why...

reviews.name: Chris K.
reviews.review: i love going to California Pizza Kitchen. If you go, you must order the Avocado Club Egg rolls for an app. It is my favorite. The Original BBQ chicken chopped salad is by far the best salad on the planet.The host staff is always so friendly and the servers are attentive. Even the take-out is an exceptional experience....

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Nice menu selections. Food (pasta and pizza) is good but not great. Service was pretty slow. Cold draft permeates the open floor plan in the winter so I left my heavy coat on for the entire meal.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: Ahhh, I could take it or leave it. I've been a few times and I just think it should taste better than it does. The menu is exciting and there are tons of things to pick from BUT I don't know it just ends up being make me close my eyes and moan good. I mean it's not the rip off that say Cheesecake factory is but still there are plenty of mom and pop places in Nashville that are way better that use fresh vegetables and such. Sure you can't get 43 different themed pizzas but the ones they have are tremendous. This is just good and it will always be consistent. With that said, their ambiance is kind of fun with the diner vibe so I could see the appeal there. I also will say the service is always very good which is worthy of the star. So one star for the service, one star for the diner vibe, one star for the pizza, and what you have is a good restaurant.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: So I finally tried this place last night. I was really surprised on a Thursday night at 6:30 that I was able to get seated immediately (party of two of course). The waitstaff seemed to have their hands full though. It didn't take a long time to get food, drinks, etc. but it wasn't snappy either. I found the pizza to be mediocre, unique but not special. We tried their avocado rolls, which were weird. They are basically southwestern egg rolls but with chicken, bacon and avocado that you dip in ranch. We ate them all, but I don't think I'd order again. I also got the half BBQ chicken salad and it was so covered in dressing you couldn't taste the lettuce. It was weird. I don't know if I'll go back - we spent 40 bucks on two ppl, which is a bit much in my opinion.

reviews.name: Sid G.
reviews.review: I've been here a couple of times now and this is a great place to get some pizza. I've had the Sicilian and the BBQ Chicken and liked them both. It's in a good location with plenty of parking and has a great atmosphere.

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: I knew this was a chain when it came to Nashville, because I'd eaten the frozen version from the grocery store and thought they were better than most of the frozen pizzas I've eaten, so when a friend suggested it, I was excited to go. I tried the Jamaican Jerk pizza and it was very tasty. The most difficult thing was choosing a pizza from the many choices. I want to go back and try some more, although I did get a chance to try some of my friend's pizzas.The individual pizzas are big enough to eat some and then have enough to take home and heat up the next day (I thought it tasted even better the next day). It is nice to eat a good gourmet pizza and have a nice glass of wine in a good surrounding with good service.

reviews.name: Krystal L.
reviews.review: I love the atmosphere at cpk. The field green salad with grilled shrimp is always a good choice. And surprisingly the cheeseburger pizza is top notch its one of the best pizzas.....

reviews.name: Cathy L.
reviews.review: This is the 2nd or 3rd time I've eaten at California Pizza Kitchen in Green Hills.  There are many things that impress me about this restaurant.  The staff is incredible!  They are patient, helpful, and attentive.  Basically, they are super!  The menu is wonderful.  I'm a vegetarian and the choices are suburb.  Pear and Gorgonzola pizza -- YUM.  The food is quality also!  I highly recommend it.

reviews.name: kristen p.
reviews.review: California Pizza Kitchen is good for what it is. They have a large menu with all kinds of pizza choices that you couldn't find anywhere else. Plenty of options for the vegetarians. But I would still rather drive a few more miles and eat at Pizza Perfect. Don't take a group here. They only have a handful of tables that accommodate more than four. And do expect to see everyone that you have ever met yet didn't care to see again.

reviews.name: doug d.
reviews.review: We have been a few times, and it was good when the pizza came hot out of the oven... BUT!...  we got pizza togo from there, and for whatever reason, it was -not- good once we got home with it and tried to eat it.Could be that we got the thin crust, which for some reason is only good right outa the oven.  We tried to bring it back to life by reheating in our oven (not microwave!), and it still did not help.

reviews.name: Brent W.
reviews.review: I was amazed at how the building interior was designed very much like the diners we grew up with in the 1960s and 1970s...except it was upscale looking, clean, and fresh. Lots of booth and counter space. It has cocktails, but not a loafer's lounge type of bar feel. The food is fresh and you can actually eat a pizza without feeling guilty. There are several choices of pizzas that aren't greasy American style corporate pizza...and they have real fresh vegetables on them. The service is average Nashville service...aka...who's in charge and what if they really were...but if you've got an hour and want to relax and eat good food...this place is real fine.

reviews.name: Cory J.
reviews.review: Great food for all! As far as the pizza goes it doesn't get much better. We had drinks (moderately priced) and the cheese bread for starters. For our main course we had the white pizza which was a little bland but still good, and their version of the "meat lovers pizza" which, in our opinion, was incredible. A generous meal for two left us penniless at $52 plus tip, but that did get us two (alcoholic) beverages, the cheapest appetizer, and two pizzas. All-in-all ill defiantly go back to California Pizza Kitchen.

reviews.name: Deri P.
reviews.review: A++ customer service and food quality.My husband LOVES this place! The Dagwood custom sandwich with all the fresh ingredients that he loves makes this his go-to lunch & dinner spot several times a week. Melissa, the manager quickly learned his name and exactly what he orders so when I go to pick up a sandwich to go for him, I don't even need to rattle it off. We also like their fresh-cut fries and chocolate chip cookies.We wish they served Coke products instead of Pepsi, but that's our only gripe and it's a personal preference so I can't really knock Penn Station for that. I love that Melissa makes a point of getting to know her regular customers. She makes you feel right at home. They train their staff well too. Occasionally you may get a new person who is in training, but once they are up and going, they provide above average customer service. Better than Subway. Check them out!

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: First time ever to a Penn Station today. I just wanted to try the sandwich to test the place out. Had the 8" Philly Cheese steak with onions and mushrooms and adult man(probably the owner) was making the sandwich, not some kid. It was SO GOOD. I will be returning again fo sho. Hope they have consistency here. Good sandwich. Glad to have finally try it out.

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: Food was great had the original Philly cheese steak loaded and it was awesome.And the fries were the best

reviews.name: Jennifer G.
reviews.review: This is my first time at a PennStation. I ordered a chicken salad sandwich from the "light" side if the menu. Ick.  I could see the employee behind the counter take out an industrial tub of chicken salad, scoop it out and schlep it on the bread. It was swimming in mayo and tastes just like chicken salad that would be scoped from a tub. The bread was good and the service was good. I may try PennStation again but I will stay away from the chicken salad. An 8" sandwich of mediocre quality and a small soda for nearly $10 is not a good value.

reviews.name: Billy H.
reviews.review: Grilled artichoke with chicken & mushrooms is my go to sub. The fries are always fresh here. The staff is friendly. I've never had an issue with my food. Always hot & fresh. A great Penn Station location.

reviews.name: Susan T.
reviews.review: After having only one in Mt. Juliet,  I was so happy to see one is open in Hermitage now. Had to try again. Glad I did. This is my new sub shop. Still remember how hungry you are before you order fries. My Lord they give the largest portions of fries. And since many other sub shops only offer chips not fries, well that is one more reason the are better than the other sub chains.

reviews.name: Bryan L.
reviews.review: Solid 4-Star performance by the crew at Penn Station!!Stopped in Friday before Poker-o-rama for a quick bite. Ordered the Veggie sammich.It goers like this:Me-"Veggie sammich please".Sammich maker dude-"This, that this?"Me-"Yes yes yes"Sammy bro-"This that and the other"Handsome guy- yep, of course, definitely"This goes on and on for about 20 ingredients, all fresh and tasty. Sandwich ended up being really good!!!  Quick friendly service goes a LONG way with this guy! Good food just makes it even better!!!I the words of a leather jacketed alien robot: "I'll be back"!

reviews.name: Ang E.
reviews.review: What can I say about Penn Station in Hermitage? Great food,  friendly staff, clean, laid back atmosphere.  I was waited on by Chris, a very nice young guy, very pleasant and all smiles. He called me by name several times which made it more personal.  He took my order at the beginning of the line,  then ran to the other end to checked me out. They were super busy but he was super fast and I was sitting and waiting on my food within a few minutes. The food took a little longer than usual to get today, but as I stated, they were super busy. The Titans game was playing on the big screen and all the customers seemed to enjoy watching the game while waiting for their food. When I was ready to get a refill on my lemonade, the three or four people behind the counter were very pre occupied and busy waiting on customers and making sandwiches. At which point a young guy by the name of Ray, even though he was clearly off the clock and on his break, came up from behind me and said can I get you a refill on your lemonade. Rays willingness to come over and wait on me while on his break shows that he has superior customer service skills. Both of these guys are an asset to the restaurant and I hope that their management realizes this. I asked them their name as I was leaving so that I could put it in this review. This is the only sandwich shop that even comes close to the delishiousness of a real Philly steak and cheese. I highly recommend it.

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: Fairly tasty.  Not sure if it's a chain or not.  It kinda seems like chain food.  Not the best, but by far not the worst.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: I love Penn Station! Everyone is always so friendly and the grilled sandwiches are unbeatable in Hermitage for the price. Yum!

reviews.name: Nicole N.
reviews.review: You ABSOLUTELY MUST try the artichoke sub don't forget the mushrooms. You will not miss the meat...I'm a true meat eater but this is so good and satisfying.  The fries are great aa well. You can call in but they will not make your fries until  you get there and that's a good thing:-) priycy though.

reviews.name: Brian K.
reviews.review: I've been to Penn Station twice and both times it was awesome!  I went to Penn Station in both Cincinnati and Nashville and both times I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak.  The sandwich was great and the fresh cut fries were as well.  I always get my cheesesteak with mushrooms and banana peppers which makes it even better.  I'm gonna have to try another sandwich one of these times, but I'm really digging the cheesesteak at this time in my life!  Check it out!

reviews.name: Jamie D.
reviews.review: I love Penn Station SOOOO much, but this experience was just gross.Ordered a 12 inch Italian for the wife and I to split. Older, larger gentleman makes my sandwich, without gloves and without washing his hands first. I know this is a violation of the TN bare-hands contact code. A tall blond girl that works there walked by and I noticed a GIANT hickey on her neck.Talk about the gross-out factor. This happened Saturday Sept 7th at approximately 2:30pm. I have written to their customer feedback department and I'm hoping their standards of sanitation will improve. I want to go back, I want to enjoy those delicious sandwiches, and I want to update this review in a positive way.Till then, I'm staying away.

reviews.name: R R.
reviews.review: Not too bad for a fast food sandwich shop! The chicken salad is very yummy and far better than Firehouse Subs. Their fries are AWESOME and don't taste like fast food fries at all! The employees are nice and they have a lot of menu options

reviews.name: Justine F.
reviews.review: This is my favorite sub shop. I know it's not the healthiest choice, but it hits the spot. The Philly Cheesesteak and Artichoke & Chicken are my absolute go to orders. However, I do have one complaint: Everytime I order, I add on tomatoes. And Everytime, without fail, they forget the tomatoes. Have complained but it's like they don't read the order!

reviews.name: Natalie D.
reviews.review: Good sandwhich (needs a bit of salt) and great french fries! The chocolate chip cookie is good but more like a bar than a cookie.

reviews.name: Derek D.
reviews.review: Been going there since they opened in Hermitage. The food is good but more than that the staff is great. They always seem to be enjoying their selves and the service always comes with a smile. Good energy in that place.

reviews.name: Melissa C.
reviews.review: I'm a Boston girl, so Penn Station is a little slice of home for me =) They have great subs, amazing fresh cut "flash fried" potatoes, and friendly service. You won't be disappointed at Penn Station!

reviews.name: Rob T.
reviews.review: Great grilled subs! Much better than the other nearby sub shops. Had the Reuben, and it was excellent.

reviews.name: Coco F.
reviews.review: I love Toyama!!!!!! One of my favorite places to eat in Tennessee. Clean kind and above all a fun atmosphere. The food is great and the bartenders know how to mix one hell of a drink! I took my friends 4 year old with me the last time I went all she will eat is chicken nuggets. So I ordered a few things off the menu and told her it was chicken. Now she asks me to take her for sushi every time I see her. Just writing this review makes me want sushi right now. Toyama is the best.

reviews.name: Matt A.
reviews.review: My family loves it here.  The food is good, the hibachi chefs are very entertaining, and we are always treated well.  We will continue to go here.

reviews.name: Dee a.
reviews.review: Love this place. We always enjoy our meal and the servers are friendly.

reviews.name: Alison S.
reviews.review: I wish this place was better because it's so close to our house. We have tried multiple times to give this place a shot but there service is super slow every time. I would order more drinks but they never come by to ask if we want more. The food is not great either. This last time I had the chirashi and most of the fish smelled fishy and was rubbery. Definitely not how it was supposed to be. The staff is really nice just not very present.

reviews.name: Taplino D.
reviews.review: This place has great service, and the sushi is the best I've had in Nashville so far. My server's name was Will and he was awesome! I literally couldn't tip him anything under $10.  I'm not sure what the food is like, because I only go for the sushi, but my experience is always great. I love this place!

reviews.name: Chris J.
reviews.review: We stopped by for lunch and never made it to a table. We asked for a table for five for hibachi and the guy, who I assume is the owner, just looked at us and said "no."  It was a very strange and rude response. Needless to say, we won't be back.

reviews.name: FoodCritic 6.
reviews.review: Apparently the staff there found out who I was and that I gave a bad review and I'm not allowed back to the restaurant. WellNot like was going to return after when happen last time.

reviews.name: Candace C.
reviews.review: Overpriced, low quality. We went for hibachi. We were first served salads with brown iceberg lettuce. I'm kicking myself for not taking photos but my phone was completely dead. Then the clear soup was chicken broth/soup based....EW! My 7 yr old normally loves clear soup and wouldn't touch it. It was like a ramen noodle chicken packet was used with freeze dried mushrooms. The chef was friendly, took 30 mins to come to us in an otherwise dead restaurant. The soy ginger sauce was great. Had a very good flavor. The veggies were great as well. My filet mignon had a weird kind of "soapy" taste. So on the menu they have green tea ice cream, a fav of mine, which I tried to order,  only to be told that they had rainbow sherbet only. I was so disappointed. So 70$ later for two adults and a child, I knew I'd likely not be back to this place....like....ever.

reviews.name: Naeveah O.
reviews.review: If I could put negative stars I would! This place is utterly ridiculous. We just left about an hour ago for the following reasons:1) Place is old: menus are falling apart and ranges are gross. If you're charging about $20/plate or more you can afford to get your ranges cleaned. I mean come on...2) Salad has thousand island dressing and looks like the salad you can get from Costco in a big bag for under $2 we've been to a ton of Tepanyaki Grills and salad should be served with ginger dressing -I tried it and fiancé refused to eat it... What a waste3) Onion mushroom soup is a joke... It tastes like cup of noodles soup with a few pieces of green onion and 2 pieces of mushroom... Gross... Another waste...What did it for us was the service. Not by our waitress but by the owner! There was one couple seated to our right and then there was the two of us. Another couple came with their baby and the owner came to our table to seat them and "shoo-ed" my fiancé to move. Then he sat a larger group across from us and was pointing at a person and pointing at the chair for them to sit... How rude! And he was frowning the whole time! After this, my fiancé was fuming... If you're not grateful for your customers then you don't deserve any business.We asked for our check and the waitress brought it and asked what was wrong but my fiancé didn't want to deal with the owner. They charged us $15.27 for two sweet teas we didn't drink, 1 untouched salad, 1 half eaten salad and 2 untouched soups. If you owned a restaurant and $70-100 ticket is about to walk out the door, wouldn't you go and try to fix the problem? We know our waitress told the owner because we saw her go up to him and he just walked off.DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME AND EAT HERE!We just finished eating at another Steakhouse and got much better service and food was so much better.

reviews.name: Shannon M.
reviews.review: So wonderful! Great quality in food and the chefs couldn't be more entertaining. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Brettaney V.
reviews.review: Had dinner here last night. Awful. I've been here plenty of times in the past. So after hearing from a close friend that it was bad last time she went-- I was curious to see if it was just a bad night. I'm now certain that this place has went to complete crap. The soup has changed & it's disgusting like the miso soup at sushi o sushi (which I described as toilet water). The fried rice had a weird after taste. There are 'help wanted' signs all over .... This is a sign of horrible management. I won't be going back. Can't believe I used my calorie intake on that.

reviews.name: Thomas F.
reviews.review: Service has gone completely downhill.  Will not be back.The service failures are too great to mention.  Owner spends all his time sweeping the floor so he doesn't have to interact with customers.  They keep wedging people in to try to make more money. This place absolutely stinks now.

reviews.name: Danielle S.
reviews.review: Not the best food in the area. For what you're getting there are much better restaurants less than a mile away.

reviews.name: Melissa M.
reviews.review: 2 words: ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING!!! Been to this place before & it was decent. My recent visit involved small & slimy sushi rolls and greasy entrees. I had severe stomach pain all night & couldn't sleep. Worst meal I've had in a long time.

reviews.name: Elizabeth F.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I LOVE this place! It's can be a little pricey but we always do the for two option on our meals and always end up having leftovers. The staff has always been great when we are there. As usual when you sit at the hibachi tables you do have to wait for them to fill up but it doesn't usually take long. We've also eaten at the bar and loved getting to talk with the bartenders, they were great!

reviews.name: Veronica S.
reviews.review: I absolutely love this place.  The food is good every time we go. I definitely recommend this place to my friends and family! Veggies are awesome!!!

reviews.name: Keith H.
reviews.review: I'll give this restaurant a 4.5 star rating. I would not call it gourmet food. However, the wait staff are always friendly and courteous and prompt along with the cooks and the host.  The hibachi grill is the best I've found in Nashville. It is a little pricey but if you go at lunch time the price is well worth the portion and flavor of food. The sushi I would only give a 3 star rating, it is a little pricey and very inconsistent.

reviews.name: Phil C.
reviews.review: I've eaten here at least 25 times. Each time it is great. Other Japanese Steakhouses just don't compare. Their sauces and dressings are amazing.

reviews.name: Natalie M.
reviews.review: My husband and I recently moved to the area and, much to my dismay, I had to begin my search for a "replacement sushi place" since my absolute favorite was in the town we just moved from. After spending some time on yelp and other review sites, I told my husband we would try Toyama. (It's close, decent reviews, moderate prices and attractive looking sushi rolls pictured on the menu) Walking in, the space is a lot smaller than I expected and I've also never seen a restaurant with the hibachi and dining tables all open and in the same room. You don't even have to spend the hibachi money to see the show! (Definitely a plus for me) There's also a bar/sushi bar area which is great for grabbing a beer and a roll.The service is alright. You can tell which people are new and are not and, being in the restaurant industry myself, it always makes me feel bad when I see the vets of a restaurant (usually a tall man with dark hair and a deep voice) always picking up slack of newbies who don't want to work very hard. You can also see the language barrier plays a role in the miscommunication of service which is a very difficult thing to overcome. (My husband and I have both worked for bosses where English definitely isn't a first language) All in all, this is my new sushi spot. The titans roll is my favorite and my husband LOVES the spicy volcano roll. Definitely worth giving it a try!

reviews.name: Roze G.
reviews.review: Hands down the best hibachi !!! Servers are nice and the Chiefs are always entertaining . Good sushi too! I recommend the Kirin roll one of my favorites !! Good price good amount of food too ! Love this place

reviews.name: Charles S.
reviews.review: I've been back multiple times now and I must say that the best experiences are generally had seated at either the sushi bar or at an actual hibachi grill versus being seated at a table. The service is most attentive at the bar, but then again, that's to be expected. As a note, it's not the greatest value for dinner, but the lunch portions and prices are absolutely AWESOME! It's a good way to come and try the place out and find out what you like before you drop $80 on dinner.

reviews.name: Ali W.
reviews.review: Best hibachi in the nashville area!  Cooks are great, portions are generous, and is a great family spot.  Not the fanciest place around, but it's a great spot!

reviews.name: Jane J.
reviews.review: Overall the food is just okay. The price is a little bit high given the average quality of the food. They cooked food in front of you and i think the performance is interesting and better than the food.

reviews.name: Lesley N.
reviews.review: Let me start by saying I like this place - food, service, etc. I've never had a problem. I usually go at lunch during the week with coworkers, but I thought my husband would like it so we headed over there around 2:30pm on a Saturday. I checked hours before we went, and saw 11am to 11pm.Now, maybe it's because it's the weekend and I look like a bum. Maybe they have a private party scheduled. Regardless, I'm pretty pissed at the blasé way we were informed that the hibachi was closed (mind you, there were people sitting there so wtf?), as if they could care less about my business and couldn't even be bothered to offer an excuse or apologies. So be it. I won't be back and I'll be sure to spread the word.

reviews.name: Jennifer A.
reviews.review: If I could give this establishment zero stars, I would. The manager/owner (I'm not sure what position he holds) is extremely rude to every customer that walks in the door. He's an older man with glasses and a constant look on his face as if he hates his life and job. If you see him, be prepared for a world of rude and abrasive responses. On one occasion, we went in and were told it would be a 45 minute wait even though there were multiple tables (both hibachi and regular) open. While I have worked in food service as a manager much of my adult life, I understand there are circumstances that are often out of the managers' control in terms of who is working and how many tables a server may have. However, there is an appropriate and POLITE way to address the situation. Today I called the restaurant repeatedly to see what time they served lunch till. The phone rang and went to an answering machine each time. When we arrived at the restaurant, the man, who seemed more preoccupied with his laptop and sitting on his butt, was extremely rude to the guests in front of me as well as to myself and my family. He snapped as us and said they are closed at 2:30 - it was 2:15 when we walked in. If the restaurant closes prior to the posted time, they should probably lock the door or put a sign outside to avoid any customer interacting with this so-called manager. I will never recommend this restaurant to anyone and will never be back to be treated so poorly for over-priced, sub standard food. It is pity because we live so close and would probably be frequent guests at such an establishment. Between our group and the group in front of us, the restaurant lost out on hundreds of dollars of business. This has been a consistent experience and it is absolutely ridiculous. Do not come here, go anywhere else that deserves your hard earned money. The experience and cost are not worth the time and frustration. This place should be shut down or hire new managers to run it. Ridiculous.

reviews.name: Roger S.
reviews.review: Went on a date here recently and the service was wretched, waited 10 minutes after being seated for a drink order, and another 15 after that to place our order, and the restaurant wasn't busy or full at all. Waited 40 minutes for a couple sushi rolls and noodles. We were there for 90 minutes when it should have been 45, and it was very overpriced. The rolls were tiny and a rip off, and while the food was good in taste and quality the service and price was atrocious.

reviews.name: Alexa S.
reviews.review: Best chicken hibachi I've ever had! The sauces are great, the chef was enthusiastic, and the service was prompt and consistent. The Fuji roll that my boyfriend ordered is now his new favorite sushi roll! Have no complaints and will be back soon.

reviews.name: Cameron H.
reviews.review: Best sushi in town  AJ and Rhonda will take care of you bar and sushi wise.  Everyone else who works there is great as well!  Love this place**Update**  Went there after the review above and AJ has moved to a different place :(  The place is still a good place to eat at, but AJ could work around the food allergies my wife has.

reviews.name: Dawn D.
reviews.review: We booked a big party there and requested one particular chef way in advance. When we arrived, they would not even seat our first guests even though the place was empty. Then they finally seated everyone, and we got the worst waiter one can find. He did not get our orders, did not refill glasses, when I asked to replace my fork because there was old food stuck to it, he did not bring me another one. After waiting for our hibachi chef for an hour, I finally went to talk to the manager about this. He was the rudest, most unprofessional person I've ever met! He yelled at me, and told me he did not care if the 12 of us walked out of there, and interrupted me every other word. Seriously, I could not be more appalled at his behavior, and did not know that "customer service" like this existed in America. Do not profit this guy by going to this place unless you like being treated like garbage for a very mediocre food and very high prices.

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: To be fair I didn't order anything challenging.  Just a bunch of appetizers and they were pretty good.  Evidently they have korean bbq, too, so I'll have to come back for that sometime.

reviews.name: Alisha V.
reviews.review: The food is okay. But the service is terrible. My waiter didn't even clear my plates when I was finished or ask me how everything was. He didn't even talk to me but to ask how i wanted my steak. Terrible, terrible service.

reviews.name: Onna W.
reviews.review: Best Hibachi in Nashville (or any other place) hands down!We love Toyama very much and frequent it often. It is our favorite Hibachi restaurant. It has the best sauces, ever.  Appears that most of the reviewers were more focused on sushi, but we only go for the hibachi. I highly recommend Toyama and as others have said ask for Chad, he's the best hibachi chef EVER!

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: I've been here several times and it's always been a good experience. I would give it 4 stars, but marked it down to 3 due to that whole situation with the awful health score - that grossed me out a little, but didn't stop me from eating here. They've brought it back up since then, so it's ok, right? Make sure you sit at the Hibachi - otherwise, why bother? You can eat at a table or sit at the bar, but why? Also, ask for Chad if he's available, he's the best chef I've had there. You can usually get in without a reservation if you don't have a huge group. There's a private room you can reserve for parties/large groups. The food is mostly standard Hibachi fare - pick your meat and get rice, veggies, salad, etc with it. There are other things on the menu besides the Hibachi meals, but I'll admit I've always ordered something to be cooked in front of me... otherwise, why go to a Hibachi. The portions are pretty substantial, I always leave with leftovers. The prices are reasonable and you get to watch the chef play with your food before you eat it, what else could you ask for?

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: Sometimes you just need to pig out on hibachi. My roommate and I decided to go here on just such an occasion. We both got fillet, shrimp and chicken. We also had a sushi roll and some sake. The sushi was OK; nothing special. We got cold flavored sake and it was cold and tasty. The chef we had was mildly entertaining. He seemed over the whole thing. Our food was delish. Everything was seasoned well and cooked perfectly. The portions are out of control and we had plenty of leftovers, but that's what I expected. I did see other chefs that were more engaging and entertaining. The service was a little slow and our waitress seemed a little disinterested in her job. Maybe she was having a bad day.

reviews.name: Lyle P.
reviews.review: One of my friends told me about Toyama. He said that the place was favorited by Taylor Swift and that they had the best chicken stir fry.So, I ordered the hibachi chicken take out for dinner. It was $18. For what it was, that seemed too expensive.I like yum yum sauce, but theirs tasted like plastic.Maybe their sushi is awesome. Or their lunch menu.But, I probably won't ever go back. Sorry Taylor.

reviews.name: Kaitlyn K.
reviews.review: Ugh.  I want this place to have 5 stars bc I love the sushi (usually).  But.  Oh. Em. Gee.  Tonight, my husband, a friend and I went there just for sushi and we waited OVER an hour for 2 rolls each.  Clearly the people at the Hibachi tables were getting all of the service, even though I guarantee their service was still sub-par.  Apparently (said a waiter), "a bunch" of their hibachi chefs left...so their sushi chefs filled in.  Not only did we wait for over an hour to be served, they didn't even acknowledge that it had been a long time until I told them...the manager who couldn't speak english bowed and said sorry, and we were still expected to pay our full bill.  Our waitress didn't even explain...we had to flag down a different person.  I am just so over bad customer service.  The rolls are very good, but not THAT good.  I guess we'll just do take out from now on...

reviews.name: MsJenita M.
reviews.review: Good food but needs more seasoning. Ice cream is served at the end when you request it.  Red bean ice cream reminds me of cookies and cream.  The scallops are tender. Yum yum sauce is yummy!

reviews.name: Marc M.
reviews.review: My wife and I came here once about a year ago for the hibachi experience. It was decent for a date night. We recently discovered that they also have a sushi bar, which we promptly have made a weekly dinner spot. There are plenty of good sushi options in the area, and since the chefs here know their craft, combined with the fact that it's less than a mile from our house, Toyama is a no-brainer. Try the tiger roll. If you're lucky, the chef with make you an "Amazing Ball". The name says it all. Seared tuna slices appy is great too. Haven't had a bad experience here. Solid.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: We (me + wife) initially started coming here as a friend has his birthday almost every year.  The performance cooking is sure to please anyone who has never seen it, and even those who have seen it a few times like myself.Our last visit here was on a Tuesday late October celebrating a friend of ours winning 3 Best of Nashville awards, and we came for some reason without a reservation (I believe due to too many "maybes" on the invite - don't know why really, I was not the planner).I did not expect to be seated at a grill, but was pleasantly surprised when we got there that they had more than enough space for us.  They were quite accommodating as chunks of our group could not make it on time and people had to leave before eating (too many things going on).  The waitstaff seemed to be running at exactly the right speed that night.When the majority of our party was gathered, the chef (Chad) came out, did a show that involved using spatulas to play something that resembled the music that started nearly every 1970's Kung Fu movie.  It was a cacophony of audio embellishment I had not expected or experienced before.He juggled eggs, made a flaming onion volcano, things went flying everywhere but not a single rice grain made it past the grill toward us.  The performance had the air of a professional who has done it so many times that he could be doing advanced calculus in his head and not skip a beat.He prepared the vegetarian orders first so as to not slather the tofu in meat juices.  He asked a bit about what defines a vegetarian / vegetarian food prep standards and the veggies there each had different answers with the consensus being prepping the tofu first would probably please most of the veggie world but that the vegans would probably be pissed that it was prepped on a grill post-egg.My meal was good, not excellent, but near the really good side of good.  My compatriots were all happy with theirs.  I was entertained and it did not break the bank.  The people at the restaurant were nice, attentive.  I find it odd that I have not found something to dislike there in multiple visits.The place is located 4 feet from where the front door to the old Nipper's Corner theater was if I'm not mistaken.  It's right next to a Jet's pizza, and slightly to the right of Publix if you're looking straight at it.  Parking is easy, the lot is well lit, and the only thing to watch out for is the dedicated Jet's Pizza delivery drivers (who appear to take great pains to not kill anyone)

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: My affair with the Hibachi or Teppanyaki style food has been going for more than 30 years. Benihana (out west) was my first and then Kobe's in Nashville became our standard. Because the bar was set so high with the "pros" in the business I was reluctant to try Toyama more than five years ago after it opened. However, their lunch menu prices were very reasonable there wasn't anything to lose. Wow! There was no reason to be reluctant...this place is great! Their sauces are headlined by Chad's "Yum-Yum" sauce complemented by the popular Teriyaki Sauce, Ginger-Soy, and Hot Chili Paste. The Ginger Salad Dressing is the kind with a bit a mayo and is very good. It has changed hands from the original owner but they retained their head chef (Chad) which is a huge bonus...because he is the one who makes all of the incredible sauces! All the chefs are great cooks but Chad keeps the kitchen running consistently. Each chef has their own idea of how done the steaks are and how long to cook the shrimp. On one hand the lack of consistency in food prep may bother some and on the other hand it's great the the food is somewhat nuanced by each chef. I like it. When in doubt...ask for Chad!I really enjoy the lunch at Toyama's and it's a great spot to "see" some stars that live in Nashville. However, for dinner, my affair with Kobe's just can't be overcome. The prices for dinner are similar but the ambience of a strip mall hibachi room doesn't compare with always "recently renovated" Kobe's. For those who enjoy Bento boxes and other Japanese food including Sushi they have a great menu to make your day. Also, for those who don't want to sit at the Hibachi Grill they have several 4 top tables. Sometimes, it's a bit quicker to grab a 4 top and order a meal (including hibachi) which is all prepared in the kitchen. It makes for a better business meeting as well.This place is a solid 4 stars!

reviews.name: Celine T.
reviews.review: We've been to this place once or twice and had an OK time, but will DEFINITELY not be back again. We arrived with a party of 5 on a Friday at 5:30 PM and were seated at a hibachi after about five minutes. The place was busy but not awfully so. We sat for about ten minutes and then had our drink orders taken. After another ten minutes, drinks arrived, and our food orders were taken. Then we waited for twenty minutes, were forced to move to another table so that a larger group could have our grill, and were finally brought salads and soup.. forty minutes later. We eventually left the restaurant after AN HOUR of sitting, waiting for a chef to show up. The manager, who'd told us when he moved us that we'd have a chef in a matter of minutes, absolutely knew that we'd been waiting forever yet still acted clueless when we told him we were leaving, like it was just a normal thing that you'd wait for AN HOUR before someone even shows up to make your dinner. No apology, no nothing. Our server was at least apologetic and understanding. Suck it, Toyama, I'd give you ZIP STARS if I could.

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: I have tried a few Japanese restaurants in Nashville and surrounding areas but this one is by far the best! It's pretty bad when you wake up the next morning craving the food from the night before! So here is my short story! :) I was about to eat at Madori's but the service was none existant. I asked the customers at the sushi bar, who politely offered a takeout menu in disgust as they sat down before me, what else was good around here. The customers beside me suggested that if I wanted an Hibachi styled experience, try Toyama. Afterall, I was never waited on until after 15-20 mins. without a menu or drink so my friend and I walked out and headed to Toyama! I'm so glad I did! Since it was my birthday, I wanted to dine somewhere simple but cozy with all of the charm that goes with it. The atmosphere was nice, clean, and open although not alot of privacy but I was ok with that.The food was amazing with every bite! I loved the fact the chef cooked everything with sweet soy sauce which made the food full of flavor! Unfortunately, don't expect to get ginger sauce the traditional way but their version was ok and mayonaise based. As for dessert, a cup of icecream to charm your taste buds and the birthday pineapple boat with cherries, and chocolate drizzles put a smile on my face! I'm glad that I didn't review the stars before I came here. The service was great dispite what others had to say. I was impressed and the waitresses were attentive. I'm sure on a busy night, there could be disappointing service but paitents will take you a long way!It was truly a pleasant experience!

reviews.name: L Dante G.
reviews.review: Toyama is a great spot. I've been there with my family on a few occasions and contrary to some accounts, we've always been met with smiles and hospitality. Our favorite roll there is the honada roll. Super good.

reviews.name: Kati H.
reviews.review: Best hibachi I've ever had. Their seasonings and sauces are awesome and they put sliced potatoes in their veggies! Awesome. Go at lunch, it's MUCH cheaper and the portions are still so huge you can't finish it all. Never tried the sushi so I can't speak for that, but everything else is top notch.

reviews.name: Allison P.
reviews.review: I called in and got my order to go on a Sunday night. I got there and nobody that worked there knew what my order was or where it was, it took like 20 minutes for them to round it up, and then when I got the check it was for say $8.50, I gave the lady my card, she ran it, came back with the receipt for me to sign and she had ran it for a random $9.19?! Made no sense. I could understand this craziness a little more if it was a Friday or Saturday night, but it was a Sunday. They seemed to be very short on staff. The food was pretty good, but after this experience I'm not sure I will return.

reviews.name: Ginny M.
reviews.review: This has become my favorite sushi place in Nashville.. I love their spicy mayo, as I have to eat gluten free so its the only sauce I can have. I always get an alaska roll and a cali roll and theyre always perfect and quick! Good prices as well. I eat at the sushi bar for quick lunches sometimes and the sushi chef is always super nice.I even had my birthday there this year.. great food! jAtmosphere could use a little work but atmosphere isnt what is important to most people anyway :)

reviews.name: Samantha joelle A.
reviews.review: I feel bad giving Toyama one star, because of the poor sushi chef who was all by himself working his ass off to make all of the restaurant's sushi orders as quickly as he could. They had way too many Hibachi chefs, and most of the service was aimed at their tables. Our waitress was slow, and rarely came by to check on us and to even notice that it took over an hour for us to get our sushi. I went with 2 friends, and each of us just ordered 2 rolls each. This would take about 15 minutes to produce under normal circumstances. At the time we got our sushi, it wasn't even worth the wait to me. I have been to many amazing sushi places in Nashville, and this was not one of them. However, I tried the "Hella Hot Roll" based on my friends' recommendation. It was pretty good, and unlike anything else that I've ever tried before. Maybe on a better day with better service, the quality of the sushi would have been better too. Then, maybe I would have thought about a 3 star rating. However, I will probably not be back to experience that day.

reviews.name: Robby E.
reviews.review: For the record, I'm certain this must have been a fine place once upon a time.We went with a group of 15 including a very well behaved 2-year-old.  The reservations had been made well over two-weeks in advance, and confirmed 3 hours before we were to be there at 7:00 PM.We noticed upon walking in that the place was kind of dirty.Before being seated, we were told that they were short-staffed that evening.  We were placed in the private dining room, and we didn't see another employee for over half an hour.  The waitress who found us seemed surprised.  She did not take our drink orders.About 10 minutes later a fellow came in to take our drink orders.  After collecting drink orders from the entire party, the gentleman took his leave.  He was back in about 10 more minutes with the announcement that the bartender had the night off, and we could only get soda pop or beer.  Those of us who ordered beer were served very quickly; those of us who ordered soda pop were not served at all.  We asked, and the man looked confused and said there was not a bartender available.Most of the appetizers we ordered were not received until well after 8:00 PM.  Some of us never got ours at all.  The chef finally wheeled in his mac cart at around 8:15, and he put on a pretty good show.  The chef told the same lame jokes you hear at every hibachi house (look - Japanese egg roll!).  Not the best, but by no means the worst.  We forgot for a few moments that four of us still had no beverages.The food was really pretty bland, although the 2-year-old really enjoyed watching the chef.  The kid was the highlight of our evening.  Oh yeah, and they were out of ice cream.So, disinterested servers, poor attention to hygiene, high prices, few beverages, fewer appetizers, and no ice cream.

reviews.name: V B.
reviews.review: We went this past Saturday night and waited for nearly 60 minutes for a chef to show up at our hibachi station, which was full of people who arrived even before we did!  The restaurant was about 40% full (not busy at all).  During this time, I waited 10 minutes for a beer to be delivered (I watched it sitting on the bar for 9 of those minutes).  Finally, I spoke with the waitress and owners and asked about the delay.  I was told that the "food was being prepared", but no one showed 10 minutes after that, so we decided to leave and go to Applebees instead (ugh).  The owner did chase us down in the parking lot in an effort to convince us to come back inside and eat, but after waiting more than an hour, we weren't about to wait any longer.They need brush up on their customer service skills.  If there's a long wait, come talk to the customers and tell them what is going on.  9 times out of 10, we'll understand.  Also, the bartender that night seemed to have a chip on her shoulder.  She was an unhappy brunette.

reviews.name: Christopher W.
reviews.review: Pretty good sushi rolls. Pretty bad service. It was very clear that everyone working here was completely miserable and probably wanted to kill themselves rather than provide good service. You've got your typical unexplainable decorative choices to go along with the random smooth rock radio station that both equal about what you'd expect from a local spot like this. Except in most places like this the staff is very friendly, unlike Toyama where I had to ask my waitress for chopsticks. Don't waste your time here. The sushi is good enough but not worth the price and horrendous staff

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
