reviews.review: Nice combo of "sit-at-the-grill" steakhouse and regular tables.  You can get the same menu in either position, so it's your preference.Service was really excellent - very attentive but not overly so.The fish/chicken/steak on the grill (with the usual floor show cooking) is very good, as is the sushi and the rolls.   I am not terribly adventurous on rolls - so I stick with California or Philadelphia, but others at the table had true sushi and said it was very nice.The yakatori is a tasty appetizer, too.  The salad is crisp, but over-dressed. Next time I would ask if it's possible to have dressing on the side.All in all - a tasty meal in a nice atmosphere.

reviews.name: Phil K.
reviews.review: I've lived in this area for 7 years now and have been going to this place for a long time.  It's changed a little throughout the years but has remained inconsistent at best.  The food is pretty good, but the service is not reliable.  A few nights ago I decided that I'm never going here again after my girlfriend ordered a meal and it never arrived.  When we brought it up to the server it took 20 minutes before her meal was brought out.  There was no explanation, apology, or adjustment to the bill.  If you're in this area go to Fulin's or Peter's Sushi.  Don't waste your time here.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: Best food. Best people.

reviews.name: Cash M.
reviews.review: After 2 years of living in the area went in here on a Sunday afternoon.  Sat at the bar.  It was okay.  More restaurant owners need to watch shows like Gordon Ramsay Kitchen Nightmares on how to run or turn around a restaurant and make people feel welcome.  Once I ordered the sushi it was quick and good.  If I go again will sit at the Hibachi bar which I didn't even know they had till I was leaving.  No one greeted me when I came in and so I sat at the bar and waited 3-4 minutes before someone said hi.  No one asked me if I had been here before so then I asked for sushi recommendations.  It's so easy to make people feel welcome and go from average or poor to great.  Like the one reviewer said people working there didn't seem happy to be there, just enough to appear friendly.  There are a lot better restaurants in Nashville though when I was out in the Orange County area recently was impressed by a couple out there mainly Bandera in Laguna Beach, CA and South of Nick's in San Clemente, CA..  I wish there was something close to my home area like these places as I'd be a regular customer.

reviews.name: Chris W.
reviews.review: Love this spot!  It's our go-to for hibachi.  They are very consistent with their service and quality, and the lunch buffet is cheap with just the right proportions to leave you satisfied.  No food hangover when you're done.  Awful health score? Didn't know about that one... Never eaten their sushi either.  All I gotta say is double yum yum

reviews.name: Bryan B.
reviews.review: terrible service. we waited for over an hour for our to-go food. no communication from staff what so ever. i understand places getting busy. i work in food service. at the very least as a server you stop by a table and say "sorry about the wait, is there anything i can get you?" instead we got ignored and when the food finally came out we were missing an item. my wife politely asked if we could get the salad we had ordered (an hour ago) the woman barked at my wife and disappeared. we got up and left. we left a tip to the sushi chef that had been friendly and gave her nothing. i know how big of a deal it is to stiff a server, again i work in the industry. i also know how big of a deal it is for an employee to bark at a customer and to scowl after being asked for a missing item. i even took the time to call the owner on the drive home to let him know that woman is actively hurting his business and that we wouldnt be joining them for dinner again. as for the food- it does its job, but absolutely isnt worth putting up with absurd wait times and miserable staff. if you are this close to brentwood just make the drive to peter's sushi

reviews.name: Elisabeth S.
reviews.review: I love this restaurant.  My husband and I have it as our Hibachi staple.  The sauces can't be beat and every chef we have had provides a great show.  They have fair prices and the head chef Chad is absolutely wonderful!

reviews.name: Russ W.
reviews.review: We have been here a few times before and really want to like this place because it is so convenient to where we live.  We walked in and stood at the hostess stand for over 5 minutes while the hostess remained on the phone without even acknowledging us.  We were seated and then it took an additional 12 minutes for a server to come to our table.  We both ordered hibachi dinners and were extremely disappointed.  The soup tasted like dish water and our entrees were served at room temperature (at best).   The waiter gave most of his attention to the hibachi tables, and walked by us with an "Oh Crap!  I forgot their food" look.  Granted, it looked like he was one of only two servers working a nearly full restaurant.  He was very nice to us when we brought up how unsatisfactory the food was.  At $15 for an entree, it should be served hot.  Right?  He apologized and offered to have the kitchen make us new meals, but we had already been there over an hour and could not wait through that process again.  We ate the remainder of our meals, and were really not surprised when we got the check and no discount whatsoever was there to at least attempt to make amends for our awful experience.  No manager came by the table.  If they don't care more than that, then we do not care to go back.  We'll drive out to Smyrna and got o Tokyo Restaurant.

reviews.name: Katie M.
reviews.review: Great BBQ, convenient and a drive-thru! I prefer their pulled pork to some of the trendiest BBQ places in Nashville right now. Only thing that I don't recommend is their potato salad.

reviews.name: Prudence S.
reviews.review: Whitt's is touted as the best barbeque in Nashville so we decided to give it a go last night.Meh.We ordered the pulled pork family meal that serves 8. We had four small to normal sized adults eating and four small children (7, 5, 3, 1) to feed. The meal comes with two sides and twelve buns. When I saw the amount of food I knew I would need to serve some other items in order to make sure everyone was full. So I made a salad and served some cut up honeydew along with it. This satisfied everyone although I think they were not happy with the tiny portion of baked beans and macaroni and cheese they received. The pork was very tender and a little salty. Other than that it was not particularly smokey or flavorful. They do not serve barbeque sauce with the meat, rather a sort of vinegary liquid. We all took a whiff and decided to use some hickory bbq sauce I had in the fridge. The drive thru option is very convenient and service was very quick. They do not offer any seating.I guess we might try other menu items in the future, but we all prefer Jim 'N Nicks.

reviews.name: Leslie W.
reviews.review: The pulled BBQ is just okay.  Skip unless you are really hungry and this is your only option.The sides are pretty blah.  (Some are awful.)  Skip them.  All of them.  Seriously tasteless.The ribs can be good one day, greasy as heck the next.  They leave the membrane on, which is gross, and is the difference between great ribs and just-okay ones.  (Take the membrane off, guys.)The sauce is wonderful -- good balance of tang and spice, and not too sweet.  ****Smoked Wings -- best in town.  That's right, smoked, not fried.  This is what you go for.  Balanced heat is provided by the seasonings, not sauce.  (Not sauced or breaded is what I look for.)  Some days they can be dry from sitting around, but it you catch them at the right time, they're nirvana.  Dipping sauce is just your run-of-the-mill commercial salad dressing in little packs.  They don't even bother to make their own.  But I like these wings with no dipping sauce at all.  Wings are smallish, but no smaller than those from your average chain restaurant. Ask for a bag, otherwise they'll just shove the containers at you.  Seriously, they're trying to save the extra 2 cents per order?  (You don't want to end up with the stuff all over your car, or spilled out on the driveway.)  We shouldn't have to ask for bags.They close early on holidays, but never at the same time.  This year it was 3:00 on Memorial Day, but 2:00 on the Fourth, so we missed out thinking they were closing at 3.  The website needs to post the holiday hours.So, for my money, it's 5 stars for the wings, 4 for the sauce, 2-3 for the ribs, 2 for the pulled Q, and zero for everything else.

reviews.name: Richard N.
reviews.review: Subpar BBQ. Many better options in town.

reviews.name: Austin B.
reviews.review: Goin around and trying to find the best barbecue in town and this was not good at all. Everyone should know it is a drive thru not a restaurant. Gave me a barbecue pork plate with no barbecue, corn break was stale, and worse slaw I've ever had. Not worth even paying a visit.

reviews.name: Rob W.
reviews.review: The pulled pork was just OK, not special. The sides were very nice. I would say it rates 3 stars at most.

reviews.name: Jim H.
reviews.review: I enjoy the BBQ, but I love tWings. Spicy without all the sauce, and not fried! Oh, love the cornbread too.

reviews.name: Bruce M.
reviews.review: I say this is a great and cheap way to feed the family and get some great BBQ pork.  I did the Family pack deal.  WOW.. a great deal IMHO for a meal with leftovers  Ok.. Lied ... I added a rib slab.  Nice and friendly crew here in Belle Meade.  Makes me want to be sure to come back to Nashville.   OH.. and yes.. the food was very delicious.  But not from this area... what was the vinegary sauce for??

reviews.name: Lisa W.
reviews.review: It's ok.  I have to add a disclaimer that I grew up in a BBQ town.  Whitts is ok as a fast drive through for dinner but it's just not great BBQ.

reviews.name: Wayne H.
reviews.review: Decent BBQ.  I don't know why people here like it so much.  Nashville BBQ is vinegar based and I think there is a very good reason why Nashville BBQ is not well known. The pork is satisfyingly crumbly, but really half the fun is the sauce.  The buns, coleslaw, Brunswick stew and other side dishes are not really worth mentioning. Really, that's Nashville BBQ sauce?Prices are reasonable, and I see a lot of these restaurants around town and in BNA airport. Try it if you want.

reviews.name: John L.
reviews.review: If you want a quick, cheap, authentic BBQ meal, Whitt's is the place. Their BBQ is synonymous with mid-tn southern BBQ. The pulled pork sandwich is served without sauce so you can taste the smoke flavor (you may want to add the hot sauce for flavor). In comparison to Corky's, Neely's, or Strouds, Whitt's is near the top.We've eaten at Whitt's for the past 10 years on a regular basis at their Bellemeade location (drive-thru) and at the airport, and look forward to eating there for the next 40 years!

reviews.name: Robin L.
reviews.review: Decent 'cue. We had the turkey and pork, with coleslaw and baked beans. For newbies to town, this place is take-out/drive through only. No eating in at any of their locations. If you wanna try the ribs it's only offered on Fri/Sat. Will come back.

reviews.name: Becky R.
reviews.review: Whitt's is mediocre at best. The BBQ is dry and the sides are flavorless. I do enjoy their sauce but that's just because I am a fan of vinegar sauces. If this is all you can find - its not the end of the world - but as a local Nashvillian I would suggest trying some other spots for a bit better food.

reviews.name: Nick N.
reviews.review: I love BBQ and Whitt's always seems to be able to produce a great tasting bbq every time I am there!!! I have been to several locations and this is the one I go to most as it is easy to get too on my way home. The food is always delivered fast and is always has the same great taste no matter which day of the week I go. They offer various specials such as family meals, and pulled pork sandwich day, rib day, and I have tried them all! All are great! Can't say it is the best bbq I have ever had but it certainly is the most consistent for being always good. I highly recommend their loaded baked potatoes!!!

reviews.name: Phil R.
reviews.review: Review based on pulled pork sandwich.My favorite BBQ is pulled pork and baby back ribs.  So I base BBQ on these two items.  When her during the week and had the pulled pork.  It happened to be on special.  $1.65 a sandwich.The deal is outstanding and the sandwich is very good.  I think the pulled pork in TN is the outstanding!  I will have to try the ribs sometime.  Had ribs all over the country and the Memphis style is by far the in the country.The service was friendly and fast.  Always a plus.So for a real good pulled pork for a good value try Whitt's.

reviews.name: Greg C.
reviews.review: If I were ever sent to prison and was about to be executed, this would be part of my Death Row Dinner. Whenever I fly into Nashville, I always go to the one on Nolensville Road or wherever on the drive home. And when I fly back home to L.A., I eat a sammich in the airport and get the freezer pack stuff to mow on back in the 323.I think they call it Whitt's because all the bible-thumpers would get pissed at a sign in brown and yellow script that said "Fuck Yah" BBQ.

reviews.name: Vanessa G.
reviews.review: I'm going to have to echo Greg C on this one. Whitt's does not disappoint. From the ice in their sweet tea to the vinegar slaw, this is what I'm talking about when I talk about southern bbq. Pulled pork stuff baked potato? Yes please. Side of slaw and beans? Don't mind if I do. It's good, it's cheap. go there now.

reviews.name: Karen W.
reviews.review: Whitt's motto is "We aren't fancy, just plain good!"  That pretty much sums up my experience here.  For reasonably priced, delicious bbq look no further.  The pulled pork is tender, with lots of flavor.  I'm glad they don't smother the pork with super sweet bbq sauce, since that would distract away from the taste of the pork itself.  The cole slaw is peppery and tangy.  It's vinegar based, which I prefer over the mayo-based slaws.  The baked beans were also very good, not too sweet.  A family meal is a very good deal and will feed a lot of people.

reviews.name: Christian S.
reviews.review: Awesome. Their BBQ pork shoulder sandwiches are served with slaw and pickles --- delicious.Good sweet tea.

reviews.name: Kaylin O.
reviews.review: The best pulled pork sandwich I've ever tasted.  This pertains to the one at the Airport.  On a layover in Nashville, I decided to try this place out. Although it looked dried and unappetizing, I'm glad I decided to try it out. It was super moist and delicious, perfectly seasoned.

reviews.name: Heather F.
reviews.review: I love Whitt's BBQ.  Fantasize about it.  Crave it.  Especially this location.  It's fast, cheap, and easy, and just the way I like it.  This location is drive-thru or walk-up only.  Because of this location, I never took 40 home from school or work, ever.  Instead, I took 70S so that I could drive by here everyday.  Even if I wasn't stopping, just driving by made my day better.  I love you Whitt's!  I have probably eaten over 300 BBQ sandwiches at this very location (at least 2, sometimes 3, almost every Wednesday for several years...), and many have been consumed in my car because I simply could not wait to drive the few miles home to enjoy them.  I get the pulled pork sandwich (no sauce), just coleslaw and a pickle, on a hamburger bun.  The pulled pork is always super juicy.  This isn't a BBQ place that you go for if you want a great sauce, or ribs, but for what it is, it's the best.      Whitt's BBQ was well worth the 20 lbs that settled (and apparently secured permanent residence) on my behind while living in Nashville.  Because now whenever I catch sight of my butt in the mirror, I think of Whitt's and it makes it all better.***Please don't judge Whitt's on the airport location, that one is BAD.***

reviews.name: Aaron D.
reviews.review: This is a tough one.As others have said, service is very fast and reasonably friendly.The meat (pork) was certainly tender and juicy, but I didn't feel like it had much flavor on its own. The vinegar-based sauce (NC style?) was interesting, but I definitely like tomato-based sauces a lot better. Maybe the vinegar-based sauce will grow on me if I give it a few more tries.Cole slaw seemed fresh and refreshing, but was definitely very vinegary.Potato salad I thought actually tasted pretty good, but seemed a bit too crunchy.I wasn't a big fan of the mac n cheese side.One sandwich (with the mac side) and one platter was about $11. Would I go back? Definitely.Was I blown away? Nope.I'd say this Whitt's deserves 3.5 stars, but to prevent against star inflation I'm rounding down in this case.ps - Like Misty, I wish Whitt's would ditch some of the Styrofoam in favor of recyclable plastic.

reviews.name: Natalie D.
reviews.review: I  just got back from 7 weeks in Ecuador, where believe it or not the food tastes like absolutely nothing, and when I walked off of the plane I bought two pork BBQ sanduches (espanol) and my experience eating them could be compared to a religious moment or maybe seeing your new born baby for the first time.  I may have actually shed a tear.  I know they say all the local places blah blah blah, this may be a chain, but they are reliable, Whitt's has never let me down.

reviews.name: Nathan K.
reviews.review: I'm a pretty big fan of Bar B Cutie down the road.  I recently tried Whitts after a long abscence.  From my experience, the meat is more robust and juicy at Whitts.Its all about the sauce.  Whitts does seem to focus on vinegar based sauces, however whatever sauce I had was more of the sweet variety.That said, Whitts does a great job of making quality, tasty BBQ.Wow...and that Wed night family special or sandwhich is prettty sweet. (thanks to Misty for the tip)PS.  I think this address is wrong.  It should be Nolensville Rd.  Its near Harding Road, but its not Harding Pike to my knowledge.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: I think Whitt's gets picked on a lot, but I'm a fan. It has consistently good BBQ. It's pulled pork or turkey with a vinegar-based BBQ sauce, so if you're a fan of the wet stuff, this isn't it. They have locations all over Nashville, and it's nice to support a home-grown chain.This location is in Belle Meade on your way out of town before the 100/70 split. Like most of the locations I've seen, it's drive in or walk-up; there's not any seating that I can remember. If you're looking to feed a crowd, they have great family packs with everything you need: BBQ, buns, and sides. I think my only real complaint with Whitt's is its coleslaw. I don't mind a vinegar-based slaw like Whitt's has, but if I've eating BBQ, I like a nice mayonnaise-based slaw. Their other sides are perfectly fine, though -- beans and some good potato salad. They also have a baked potato loaded with BBQ that I've heard is good, but I've never tried.If you're in the mood for BBQ, try Whitt's out. There's bound to be a location near you.

reviews.name: S G.
reviews.review: Whitt's makes a great pork barbecue sandwich on cornbread.  I'm partial to their hot barbecue sauce, and usually skip the vinegar-based sauce.  I've never understood why they don't have a dining room.  Their to go service is very quick though, so generally worth it.

reviews.name: Matt C.
reviews.review: ever since i could chew solid food, i've had whitt's pulled pork at least once a year, during every visit to my grandparents in nashville..  it's been just as consistently good during all of those years, and is definitely something i look forward to every time i'm in town.  very different from other bbq i've tried in other areas of south, and definitely not my all-time favorite, but it's really good in its own way.  always moist, finely pulled pork, with 2 heat varieties on their vinegar-based sauce.  i'm typically not a fan of vinegar-based bbq sauces, but for some reason, i really like it here.

reviews.name: Devon S.
reviews.review: This place is my go to for lunch downtown I love the drunken chicken and the price is right

reviews.name: Michelle H.
reviews.review: I don't normally like to leave poor reviews but I can't stomach the thought of people eating here and thinking this reflects real Cajun food. I sampled the gumbo and étouffée and both tasted heavily like ketchup. I asked for the crawfish bisque and they were out. I asked for the crawfish dip and they were out of crawfish. What?? So I got the crawfish dip with shrimp instead. How bad could it be? So bad. Ketchup and cheese and watery shrimp that tasted like it came straight out of a frozen bag. I asked for a fountain diet coke. They were out of it. -_- The peach cobbler was great. It's the only thing I can recommend. If any other Cajuns in Nashville can recommend a good Cajun place to eat, please do!

reviews.name: Rachel D.
reviews.review: This place is solid. Is there a cajun grandmother carefully stirring recipes in the back? No. Does this place still deliver a solid, delicious, cajun-esque, friendly lunch with infinite people watching opportunities? Yes, absolutely.

reviews.name: Damon D.
reviews.review: Had the Voodoo Chicken. It's a great spicy treat for under $7! If Nola, India & Jamaica had a threesome, this would be their child. It's inside of the Peabody Marketplace on the corner of Peabody & 4th. Give it a try!

reviews.name: Steve C.
reviews.review: Price is decent, food is tasty. Quality control could be better. Sometimes I would get a lot of meat, sometimes just the sauce with very little meat..

reviews.name: Marty D.
reviews.review: Damn good etouffee, I had it with crawfish. End of the arcade by fourth. Good place tp people watch as well.

reviews.name: Elizabeth M.
reviews.review: So, I generally die over creole food. I'm from California, living in Michigan, so when I get the chance to eat real southern food you can bet I take it. SERVICE: Fabulous. They'll let you sample everything and talk to you about the strength of each dish, as well as which toppings work best.THE FOOD: The menu is varied and awesome not to mention affordable. I got the Voodoo Chicken (WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND; INSANELY TASTY) and the Bumble Bee (would NOT recommend; too sugary by far) over rice. The portion is large without being overwhelming. HEALTHY? QUALITY INGREDIENTS? I don't think so. Don't get me wrong, this was tasty stuff but I knew I wasn't doing my waistline any favors. I wish there was some way to know which ingredients are included in each dish. THE BOTTOM LINE: Stop in and check it out, see which dishes work for you.

reviews.name: Joshua G.
reviews.review: Ok so being from SE Texas right on the border of Louisiana, I'm pretty biased when it comes to gumbo. The bowl I had was ok / mediocre. The rue was correct but it could have had a lot more flavor and spice. The bread that came with it was nice. I haven't tried anything else yet, but if your name has the word gumbo in it I would hope you knock it out of the park. The Southern's gumbo is the best I've had/found in town so far. I'll give the place another try on another day.

reviews.name: Adam F.
reviews.review: When I get a hankering for gumbo. I like to stop here while I am at work. I was not impressed with the etouffee but enjoyed the drunken chicken.I like the Mardi Gras decor.

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: Etouffee is Scrumptious!It is rare that I'm in downtown Nashville for lunch.  I was in town for a board meeting and I had to make a dash down to the arcade before the meeting started so I could finally try the cajun food here. I ordered the crawfish etouffee.  It was the perfect delicious cure for my cajun craving.  The service was fast and the staff was very friendly.  This great lunch made my day!  I can't wait to try other things on the menu.

reviews.name: Wayne P.
reviews.review: I was in Nashville for a conference and walked by this little restaurant in a corner of the Arcade (mall in downtown with many different shops),, anyway me and some guys lad lunch here and it was amazing.. the Voodoo Chicken with Bumble Bee stew was recommended and believe me it did not disappoint. We at there 3 days in a row. definitely cool little place to check out and they let us  byob.

reviews.name: Jonny Q.
reviews.review: Yum. Try the Jean Lefitte. Spicy comfort food.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: J Gumbo's is a pretty solid choice for a quick, affordable meal downtown, but if you are looking for "authentic" cajun cuisine you will most likely be dissapointed.  First thing first, J Gumbo's is basically a heat and eat establishment.  Almost all of the food is prepared off site and "re-thermalized" on site.  This is not necessarily a bad thing.  You will get consistent food that can be prepared extremely quickly with this method.  What you will not get is a very unique dining experience.  I have had a the vodoo chicken and the drunken chicken, both served over a heaping of rice with a side of toasted bread.  They were both satisfying and the portions were more than enough for a single serving.  I had almost half left over both times.  The service is very fast and efficient.  In fact, that was the main factor for choosing J Gumbos the last two times I went.  There is a great deal to be said for being able to grab a decent sized lunch for under 8 bucks in less than 5 mins when you are downtown.  Actually that would be my primary recommendation for J Gumbo's.  I think this whole review can be boiled down to a one convoluted question.  Are you really hungry/in a hurry/a little bit cheap/in the mood for kinda "cajun" food?  Right then, try J Gumbo's.

reviews.name: LaTamera W.
reviews.review: OMG! This food is so darn good! I've had the hot chicken po boy and the bourbon chicken rice bowl. I was not disappointed either time.  The food is about $7 either way you go rice or sandwich.  The location is great because I work downtown and we were/are in desperate need of variety.  And the staff is very nice.

reviews.name: Nathan K.
reviews.review: Fun.  Friendly staff.   Interesting decor & music--provides a little respite and change from your office or usual eatery.  Decent portions and reasonably tasty.  One bonus for non-hot food eaters--you get to decide how spicy your dish is (although obviously some of the spice is cooked in).  Not sure this will actually help you if you don't like any spicy, but is helpful for me who stays on the low to moderate spice scale generally.  Oh...also they allow you to taste dishes before you purchase.I don't eat cajun much, but I thought the food was heavy on rice and light on meat.  I had the jambalya, so that may be par for the course.  For folks that eat downtown on a regular basis, this is probably a nice alternative to the usual fare. I will be probably be back to try something with chicken.  (3.75)

reviews.name: Adam S.
reviews.review: Decent Cajun food.  Big portions that include lots of rice and sauce but low on meat.  I had the crawfish étouffée which was pretty tasty.  The French bread was the highlight.  Good for a cheap/quick meal.3.5 stars

reviews.name: Glenn F.
reviews.review: J. Gumbos is one of those places that you crave, but wish you hadn't.  They have a great selection of cajun flavors and entrees.  They allow you to mix and match for a great price.  Be careful on the heat, as some of it can be a little spicy. Good food, great selection and flavor and best of all it is fast, fast, fast.  J. Gumbos is a short walk from the office and one can have a solid and flavorful meal fast and affordable.

reviews.name: Devin P.
reviews.review: this place just isn't consistent yet and I hope they get it right.  Lunch today was eh... so so to say the least. I don't like the fact that they are advertising "gluten free" when they don't have a separate prep/cooking station specifically for this. Please be advised, if it says Gluten Free chances are it isn't!

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: Well I've been 3 more times, and they've been out of jambalaya every single time...  But it was now explained to me that they run out "in about an hour".  You've been consistently running out of jambalaya in about an hour and you still can't figure out to make more?  If only they could make enough jambalaya, I'd upgrade the review to 5 stars, but hasn't happened yet.

reviews.name: Jennie V.
reviews.review: The décor is really cheesy. I tried a crawfish queso.... it was not good. This place is definitely not authentic in any way.

reviews.name: Erik N.
reviews.review: Very average and bland food, Ive ate here 3 times now thinking that maybe I was just ordering the wrong things but have now given up on it. Items that are 3-4 on the "hot scale" are very mild and also very salty. I would look elsewhere unless you have a huge craving for some Cajun food

name: Ed’s Fish & Pizza House

reviews.name: Jim D.
reviews.review: A Nashville tradition. Hole in the wall, very little seating. Cash only. Fish sandwich is spot on. I am rating based on comparables. If you want a north Nashville fish sandwich, no tartar sauce, no cheese, this is your place; authentic and delicious.

reviews.name: Hattie J.
reviews.review: My favorite place to go when i'm craving a fish sandwich!  Two pieces of white bread, with a huge slab of fish, some mustard, hot sauces, and pickles. (I have them add a slice of cheese to mine).  Make sure to bring cash!  Oh, and yeah, they haven't served pizza there in at least 10 years, if not more!

reviews.name: Alneada B.
reviews.review: My mom is a proud Fisk grad who would drag me to Ed's Fish on every trip we took to Nashville growing up and I never understood her obsession with this place... That is, until I became old enough to appreciate that Ed's Fish has the best whiting fish sandwich this side of the Mississippi. It's freshly fried and always accompanied by great customer service. Ed's Fish is an underrated Nashville gem so if you get a chance, do yourself a favor and pay this place a visit. Favorites: the whiting fish sandwich with mustard, hot sauce, and onions with the shoestring fries. Two words: nom nom

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: They were nice, but really, this place is nothing amazing.It is a little strange that they are called "Ed's Fish & Pizza House", have pizzas painted on the outside, and makes it very clear that they do not serve pizza anymore as soon as you go in.  Kooky.Anyway, came here with a friend as we were hunting some new places get some fish (I generally gravitate to Bolton's) and after running back to a bank to get some cash, we got the fish sandwich.  I think I got catfish and my buddy got whiting, standard deal, fish, yellow mustard, dill pickle chips (I got extra) and white onions on top of white bread.  Skipped the American cheese because gross.Got greens and french fries as my sides, they were pretty good, and the sandwich was good too, but no spice.  When we asked if they could make it spicy as we placed our orders, they kind of looked at us funny.  But they did have hot sauce you could put on it, but no face melting would be had that day.  Bring some small bills and change too, because beverages are only served from a vending machine onsite.All in all, a good fish sandwich, but not worth the time when you live in the same burg as Bolton's.  CASH ONLY.

reviews.name: Ally M.
reviews.review: Great service and delicious fish. It may be in a part of town you don't frequent but it's definitely worth the trip

reviews.name: SeaElle T.
reviews.review: Ed's Fish sandwiches are always included in the stories that my parents tell. They attended the HBCUs in the neighborhood in the 70s. I really like the sandwiches. It's one of those cash only, everyone's parents went there when they were my age type of place. Any time that I visit home for more than a weekend, I make sure to stop by and get a sandwich. They have more on their menu but that's all I want.

reviews.name: Stuart W.
reviews.review: I decided that it was time to break free of the Bolton's routine and try some of Nashville's other fish places. Ed's was not the best place to start.As you pull in, the window has a large picture of a man (Ed?) painted on the glass and saying "We no longer sell pizza". WTF? Do they know their name is Ed's Fish and Pizza? If they no longer sell pizza, why not just change the name?The place is very tiny as it seems to do most of its business as a drive through. I was joined on this excursion by Sparky and we each got the whiting plate. To be fair, it is much the same as the fish sandwiches I used to enjoy at legendary Choo Choo hot fish in Chattanooga. A large helping of whiting between two slices of white bread with pickles, onions, mustard and American cheese. To make it hot, one adds Texas Pete as the fish is just breaded and fried.While fair, that does not make it better. The place was not bad, the atmosphere meh and the food was just OK, and thus my rating.

address: 1801 Dr Db Todd Jr BlvdNashville, TN 37208

reviews.name: Kathryn C.
reviews.review: My family adores this restaurant. We've had so many of their different dishes and have yet to try one we didn't care for. Every dish tastes different, unlike some Chinese restaurants, and the food is not greasy as is often characteristic of this genre. The family that owns this precious little hole in the wall is equally as precious.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: My family orders take-out from No. 1. We find the food to be freshly prepared, of good quality, and a nice value for the price. The menu is stacked with the typical chinese-style favorites and so far everything we have ordered is quite good. Not too greasy (a common problem I have with chinese food) and quite flavorful.I would rate the restaurant higher if it were to provide an atmosphere for dining in that I found appealing. It's just bare bones and run down. I rarely see anyone eating in and I wouldn't really consider it. The staff have always been friendly and they are very fast with their prep. Online ordering is nice and they offer delivery to the area which is a great option as well.

reviews.name: Brad Q.
reviews.review: Places like these are why I never make my own Chinese food. Delicious, fresh, spiced just right you can't beat it for the price. A real gem tucked in the same shopping center as Piggly wiggly. I highly recommend this place.

reviews.name: Amanda B.
reviews.review: Oh dear, sweet No. 1 Chinese. I didn't know what I had until it was gone. I knew your food always tasted fresh and delicious. I knew the sweet girl at the counter was always clear, patient, and friendly...but I didn't know how good I had it until my husband and I moved across town and I tried another place close to our new house. I will make the long journey to see you again some day. Just know, in the meantime, that I miss you...

reviews.name: Carol S.
reviews.review: After reading reviews. Thought it would be good to try. Wrong!! Seriously people this is not good Chinese food. Food tasted old and close to going bad. My husband got sick before we left. It's fast Chinese but not good Chinese

reviews.name: Mark B.
reviews.review: Best. Chinese. Food. Ever.I order to go or takeout from here 2-3 times a week, and the food is always awesome and fresh. The family that run the place are always friendly and nice, too.

reviews.name: Jason G.
reviews.review: This is probably one of the best little Chinese Restaurants around. The food is great and they deliver quickly. I know of several people that drive over from outside the delivery area just to pick it up.  I have never been disappointed.

reviews.name: Lara L.
reviews.review: Best Chinese on this side of town.  I've been to all of them once.   No. 1 is the one I go back to on a regular basis.  The young girl that answers the phones is very nice, always reads the order back and says it will be ready in 10-15 min (never more than 20 min).  When you get there to pick up it is just coming out of the kitchen and it is Hot!  Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Bailey L.
reviews.review: LOVE this place. easily one of my favorite places for good Chinese food. they're general tso is absolutely fantastic. they've got good beef lo Mein and I love their teriyaki chicken on a stick. they're so friendly there. food is always fresh and hot and made quickly. another plus is they're less than 2 minutes from my house so those sudden Chinese cravings are always happily satisfied.

reviews.name: Lisa R.
reviews.review: After trying several other places, we have been back here 4 times now. We are trying something different everytime we go and it has been good every time! The rice is cooked right, not sticky or hard. The Rangoon are a little sweet but still good. Spring rolls are perfect! Try it and you will not be disappointed

reviews.name: Eddy W.
reviews.review: We go here a lot. We call the order in and it is ready in 5-10 minutes.  If you want the food extra hot they will do it. The food is delicious.

reviews.name: Anthony P.
reviews.review: Ditto to everything Eddy had to say. Good solid local Chinese restaurant in the Old Hickory/Lakewood area with excellent eats. I order and pick up all the time. The shrimp with garlic sauce is as good or better than other places I've been. Owners very friendly and likable. If you enjoy Chinese take out and live near the Old Hickory/Lakewood area...  then eating here is a no-brainer and you'll definitely want to frequent this excellent local establishment!

reviews.name: Charlie N.
reviews.review: Not much to look at from the outside (or inside for that matter but the food was delicious. The lunch portions were large.I highly recommend the red curry. It was spicy with just the right amount of heat.There is the added attraction of having a go-kart track right next door!

reviews.name: Casey S.
reviews.review: Food-wise, this place is good. Flavors and selection are nice, and portions are good too. I come here during work for lunch sometimes.I get an hour lunch, and sometimes I need a good chunk of that for this place. There is only ever one server (I'm guessing one of the owners/their family). Sometimes they are busy, and having only one server makes them slow. Sometimes they're not busy, and it's fine. I don't really have an issue with it, since the food is good.It's placed oddly next to a go-cart track

reviews.name: Gregory S.
reviews.review: Will never return again.  Waked in and yes it was busy but didn't expect the one waitress in the place ( first problem ) to say "I have no table for you."  At first we were taken back and responded with "should we wait?" And she just looks at us not answering the question.  Then we continued to ask "well should we leave" and she says "up to you."  So as she rudely suggested... We left... This time for the last time taking our repeat business with us.

reviews.name: Dikla S.
reviews.review: The food is okBut everything just fades away due to the horrible serviceThe restaurant was empty yet the waitress was impatient, rushing, rude and just plain not niceI asked for wine and she just cut me off and said they don't have the kind i wanted without even offering a different option/ beverage. If you're hungry and crave thai food just pick up don't sit there.

reviews.name: Foodie G.
reviews.review: My favorite Thai food in all of Nashville. I'd often get take out rather than eat in the restaurant. Their food can take awhile to prepare so call with ample time. Check out the mini golf course and go karts next door while you wait. When I said make it Thai hot, they'd never disappoint. Fantastic curry!

reviews.name: Devin A.
reviews.review: Best Thai food I have ever had. Great Panang Curry. The spring rolls were good as well.

reviews.name: sheryl l.
reviews.review: How did this place get excellent reviews?   There was a funky smell that hits you in the face when you walk in. Like wet carpet.  I got pad see yu chicken and it was undercooked and under seasoned.  Posted a pic that shows still stuck together and undercooked.  Most of the noodles were stuck together like this.  I took four bites and it went in the trash.

reviews.name: Megha M.
reviews.review: The place is located near Opry Mills , in a not so classy location, but don't let that fool you. The interior looks good. The food was amazing ! I ordered the pacific Thai noodles and they were great. We were in a group or 6 people and each one of them liked their food. I only wish the service was better. There was only one lady taking orders and serving food and that meant our food took a good 30 minutes to come out. The lady was also not very helpful , when my friend asked for vegetarian suggestions. However, the food was very very good and I will definitely go back.

reviews.name: Hide S.
reviews.review: Negatives:1) Food took 50min to come out. 2) Wine took 30min to come out after reminding the owner/waitress that I am still waiting for the wine3) After 30min of waiting she told me no more duck and I had to order something else. Clearly the only waitress I see is scrambling to take orders, clear tables, bring water, food, stand at the cashier. Some customers were seated and left because she never came to take the order. She was also telling in coming customers that the place is full and can't handle more customers. I asked her if she is the only waitress for today and she tells me it's that way every day. she says there is only one chef too. so 2 people are managing 15 tables (x 4 seats more or less). I am giving it a one star. because if it is everyday, HIRE someone to help out. It's not like food is priced super cheap. If you are paying $12 for Pad Thai noodle dish at a Thai place, it is average. and it is Nashville, TN. they should be able to afford to hire a waitress by just looking at how much they charge for food. The only thing I liked about the place was that they give generous portion of rice. Hats off to those from Nashville who are patiently waiting for food and didn't seem to complain even if their friends' food arrived 15min ago and u were still waiting for yours.

reviews.name: Erica F.
reviews.review: Very disappointing. Everything in the area is a chain restaurant or Opryland themed. This looked promising, but did not deliver. Tom yum had celery in it that was not cooked. Spring rolls were sloppy and tasteless, vermicelli noodle dish, did not use vermicelli noodles and was very bland.

reviews.name: Joe K.
reviews.review: Stopped in for the lunch menu with my girlfriend, place was extremely clean, food was ON POINT!  And AFFORDABLE Can't wait to go back!!

reviews.name: Cat L.
reviews.review: Great service! Sukho Thai's lunch dishes are very large in portion. This is conveniently located by the Opry Mills Mall. I recommend this place if you're not feeling like cafeteria food. I always order the chicken drunken noodles or laht Na which is consistently delish!

reviews.name: Erica L.
reviews.review: Some of the very best Thai I have had in this country. Food was excellent; service was superb. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: Bill E.
reviews.review: I eat here whenever I can on my way home to Nashville. It is off the beaten path but worth the search. My favorite meal is the House Special Duck. I believe the owners run the place (wife=waitress, hostess, cashier and husband is the chef). Although the lady is not the bubbly social type, the food never disappoints. I've never regretted coming in.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: So we had a conference out at Opryland Hotel so we picked out a restaurant to meet for lunch before going in.  Since I was the ringleader, I picked a Thai place because that is what I want all the time.  And thus, Sukho Thai.This place is attached to a go cart track, you go around back to drive those.  We were a pretty large group and we were seated immediately.  The place wasn't packed at all and it was high noon.  Everyone ordered various things, I got the Angry Pork.  Just the name indicates that this is supposed to be spicy, and I requested hot.  It was meh, not that hot, not that fresh tasting, just very average.  Compared to the other Thai places I frequent, this falls waaaay short.  Someone else ordered sweet and sour chicken (I have no idea why they would do that) and it came out with this red gloppy gelatinous sauce that looked kind of scary.  She barely touched it.  Yick.  It just seemed that the ideas were there but the execution was lacking.  Our waitress was nice, but seemed scattered.  Not rude but not warm and fuzzy either.Honestly, I don't think I would ever bother coming back here.  Why waste my Thai craving on sub-par Thai?  I would rather eat somewhere else and save my Thai for somewhere worthy.

reviews.name: Christa P.
reviews.review: Pretty good thai - only had the takeout on a busy week night. Pretty good though- curry is thick and they can make it really spicy. The serve a good dipping sauce with their spring rolls which are always hot and crunchy!

reviews.name: Natalie R.
reviews.review: Here in Nashville for the NP conference, found this place close to our hotel. Was looking for something different & this delivered. WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!! Service was a little slow, only 2servers & 1chef for entire place, and full- but they were super friendly and apologetic.  But once food came, I did not care.... I had the panchang? Curry.... So flavorful, I didn't want to stop eating. My mom had the drunken noodles, one of her favorites, and she said it was great. Fantastic flavor and really hot & spicy... Great!!! Don't be thrown by the outside decor-it's by a go cart place--the food is better than anything we've had here so far!!!

reviews.name: Keith P.
reviews.review: Don't let the rather uninspiring outside fool you.  Sitting next to the Go--Kart track it is hard to even find the entrance.  But the interior is warm and inviting.  The food is more Americanized Asian-Fusion than pure, traditional Thai Cuisine.  But it was fresh, served piping hot right from the wok.  They seasoned it to the requested heat, which is more than I can say for many establishments.We had the Vegetarian Spring Rolls (good, if uninspired), the Rangoon Crab Appetizer (crab & onion in melted cream cheese stuffed inside a won ton skin and deep fried (YUMMY!) The Thom Yung Kung soup was pleasantly hot without searing the mouth and had plenty of shrimp!  The Seafood Combo Pacific Noodles were a bit oily, but, indeed, had plenty of scallops, octopus and shrimp.Overall, a pleasant place.  Good value!  We'd go back anytime!

reviews.name: Robert B.
reviews.review: In my last review, I knocked off a star for there not being any Pad Kee Mao (aka drunken noodles) on the menu. Well, the menu has been updated, and now this option is available. I could be totally wrong, but I am pretty sure the rice noodles are house made (at least they taste that way to me). Also, if you loved to get punched in the face with (spicy) heat, then you should order the Beef Yum (Native Thai). It is absolutely one of the most delicious dishes I have ever had! I also think the Thai Tea is on point here and not watered down like it is at many places.

reviews.name: Glenn M.
reviews.review: Food is very good. Place is run by two people, husband cook and wife is server and cashier. She is not rude like other reviews, just busy. Your food will be hot and fresh when it comes. Recommend the curry chicken with coconut milk sauce. To die for

reviews.name: Jackie C.
reviews.review: Solid food and the service was alright. Portions were large; we elected to eat family style and it wasn't an issue.

reviews.name: Jody R.
reviews.review: Great place near our timeshare (by the Grand Ole Opry).  Ambiance was so-so, service was slow but friendly and the food was very good.  Ample portions for fair prices.  Great beer selection...surprised to see Orion from Okinawa Japan (and gladly had one).

reviews.name: Jim S.
reviews.review: Highly recommended. Great food, reasonable priced. I really enjoyed the Panang Curry. Very nice atmosphere and clean as well. At times you can hear go-karts outside but the windows are frosted so you don't have to watch them.

reviews.name: Mary M.
reviews.review: I usually don't eat Asian when I'm traveling as it can be so variable.  I was in Nashville on business and saw this place near my hotel.  As lots of people mentioned, the little racetrack didn't inspire me - but I love Thai food.  I looked it up here and the reviews convinced me to go ahead and give it a try.  I was tired and it was late.  The lady working there didn't smile but later warmed up and was very sweet.  The place was clean and nicely decorated.  The fresh spring rolls were gie-normous and quite good.  The red chicken curry was very good too.  I got it medium and it was western medium - not Thai medium, but it was good.  All in all, a pleasant experience.  If I were local, I would eat here regularly.

reviews.name: Orlando C.
reviews.review: I'm from Los Angeles area visiting Nashville. I was near the Gaylord hotel and looking for a Thai restaurant near the hotel and I found this restaurant. The food is very good, service is good, the older woman was really nice. I think it's a great place to eat. I recommend it.

reviews.name: Amy T.
reviews.review: Was at the Opryland for a conference and wanted to have food outside of the resort. We were disappointed to say the least. The lady, which I assume is the owner, was not welcoming at all and simply glared at us. The pineapple fried rice was very oily and bland. The pad sa eww noodles were all clumped together. Dinner was very unsatisfying.

reviews.name: Eric H.
reviews.review: The food was good and the atmosphere was great.  I really wanted to like Sukho Thai, but the service was absolutely horrible.  The woman working there seemed genuinely angry that we would dare eat at her restaurant.  The dessert was good too, but if you order some, prepare for the wrath of the hostess.  It seemed to make her furious that not only did we eat dinner there, but we were also deliberately wasting even more of her time by being so inconsiderate as to order a dessert as well.

reviews.name: Robert W.
reviews.review: Don't be fooled from the less-than-beautiful exterior. The interior is nicely decorated and immaculately clean. And the food: tasty and plentiful!

reviews.name: Mark R.
reviews.review: Great food. Nice decor but nothing fancy.  The waitress seemed distant at first, but warmed up later when it was clear how much we enjoyed the food. I had the pepper Steak, the best ever; $9.95. My wife ordered Curry Pork (native spice), also $9.95.   Hers could scorch my esophagus, but she loved it. ImPorted beer was a bit pricy at $6-7.  Bud etc was $3.50. We enjoyed a glass of water and departed for $25 all included. Great value.

reviews.name: Gary Y.
reviews.review: Having had a week trip to Thailand (Chiang-Mai), and been a frequent Thai afficionado in California, I've seen my share of really good and really bad Thai restaurants. coming to Nashville, I actually didn't expect very much, but was quite surprised at how good the food turned out.The thai food was not quite as spicy as I would have liked (they served me the white man's version unfortunately), but the taste was fairly authentic and well made. The service was also fast.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Pad Thai very good. Service a little slow. The tam ka Kai soup was good but a little salty. Not sure if that is how it is supposed to be, my first time trying it.

reviews.name: Joshua C.
reviews.review: Consistently tasty: red curry and panang.  Consistently s-l-o-w: the service.  It looks like mom & son are the only servers... waiting on about sixteen tables between them.  It'd be a much better place to be if they'd learn to hire enough folks to keep a 1:5 (server:table) ratio.

reviews.name: George N.
reviews.review: Very good Thai, but woman at cashier can be grumpy. Have had green and red curries, both very good.  If you like hot, the order Thai Hot, since their Hot is not very hot. Would be 5 stars if they had brown rice and friendly service.

reviews.name: Amy B.
reviews.review: Yay!  Great Pad Thai!!!!!!!  Stopped here after a day at Opry Mills, so glad we did!  I think the owner was our server, she was super, food was faaaaast & perfectly spicy but not too hot & they serve wine (much needed after a hard day bargain hunting!)   Can't wait to go back!

reviews.name: Chris L.
reviews.review: This is one of the best Thai restaurants I've experienced. It definitely compares with, if not beats, Thai food I've had in Boston and San Francisco.I came here with a group of friends at their suggestion - a few of them have become fanatical about this place.  Two of them come here once a week during the workweek - apparently the luncheon specials are pretty good.We ordered 4 large Orions ($6/bottle). They give nifty frosted glasses for ice water, and oddly shaped (but usable) beer glasses. Adds to the fun.It is a family owned restaurant, according to one friend who knew the owner/waitress. The father cooks in the back, while the mother and daughter are waitresses/cashiers.Onto the food: we ordered family style. Pad Thai, Angry Shrimp, Basil Chicken, some kind of vegetable sautee, and Penang curry with shrimp. Prices of all those dishes ranged from $9-$13. We also got generous portions of white rice.In a word, all of the food was great. The Pad Thai was slightly saucier/oilier than I've had, but it was a pleasant surprise. All of the other The basil chicken, vegetable, and angry shrimp had similar brown sauces with varying degrees of spiciness. They were all well prepared (perhaps a bit too similar, but it was all great, so no complaints). I loved mixing the sauces with white rice.Each table is outfitted with a tiny carousel of 4 spices/sauces. My friends used these more than I did, but it's a great way to allow each person to customize to their own levels of spiciness/flavor. Incidentally, Sukho offers multiple levels of hotness for their dishes, including "Native Thai." I was curious to try this, but was warned by my friends that it was pretty insane. I'll save that for another date.A couple others have noted that it's not super authentic, which I disagree with. The restaurant does offer a mix of other cuisines (specifically Chinese and Japanese sushi). However, I don't fault them for this - after living in Nashville for a few months, I get the feeling that all Asian restaurants have to diversify a bit. Sukho definitely focuses on Thai.Overall, I'm definitely coming back here even though it's a bit out of the way. I highly recommend anyone go here, especially if you're going to be in the Grand Ole Opry/Opryland/Opry Mills area.

reviews.name: Tanya C.
reviews.review: I came here during a conference with some friends and the wait was sooo long.... this place is understaffed and for ~30 people there was one guy cooking, one women serving, and one dishwasher. So it took ~40 min to get seated, 1 hour to get our tea and food. One regular customer was really nice and helped seat people, take orders, and get water... the food was okay... most of the dishes were chinese and not really thai, but you have to adjust your menu for the people in the area so its not really surprising... Overall the food was okay, but not great Thai food, but I have high standards being Thai and all...

reviews.name: Phyllis N.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed the food the curry is absolutely wonderful. ( you need to get it native Thai hot though. The Tom Kai  soup very tasty. They are busy every time I go there tells you something hua? Price I would say would be $$ to $$$.

reviews.name: LeeAnn U.
reviews.review: After reading some of the great reviews I decided to give it a try tonight and I'm not impress.  The flavor of the food was either too salty or overly sweet.  I ordered the stuff tofu sizzler and vegatable phai thai and I didn't like either one.  Even my tea got no flavor.  As for the service, I got service period.

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: I saw this place off of the interstate near Opry Mills. Good food and great atmosphere. I'd go again.

reviews.name: Jeff H.
reviews.review: Sorry for putting rain on your parade, but I was disappointed by Sukho Thai. I am going to give them the benefit of the doubt that their food is good (although my dish - Sukho Fried Rice - was a bit bland). However, I was really bothered by their lack of service. I am NOT a tough customer, but I think this restaurant is terribly under staffed. They had 1 person (a lady) in the front of the house. She seated, served, bussed, rang up customers - she did it all... Sadly, she could not keep up and because she was clearly overwhelmed, her attitude was far from friendly. No need to give detailed examples, but just be warned.I also thought their prices were really high. I paid $13 for fried rice and a thai tea at lunch!!!!

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: Sukho is a tiny Thai restaurant next to leagues of touristy type attractions near the RV parks and Opryland Hotel. They had me going with their cute little frosted glasses that they served your water in, their metallic menu, and their elephant tapestries. I really liked the sweet and sour chicken plate I ordered, and while I wouldn't say it's the best Thai I've ever had, it didn't taste bad either. Our server was a sweetheart, even if she did have to tell me they didn't have the boba tea that was on the menu. Boo. I tried my husband's basil chicken, and unless you're really, really into basil as a whole, I'd pass, it 's a little heavy. I've said it before though, let the place be what it is. It's a little Thai joint, not a five star hot spot, and that's okay.

reviews.name: Shawn L.
reviews.review: Their rice noodles are great.

reviews.name: melissa k.
reviews.review: I am visiting from Chicago and stopped for dinner.  Food is VERY salty which any Thai cook will tell you is a big no no.  It is more Chinese style on stir fry's and they burned the fried rice.  Service very slow also.

reviews.name: Sarah P.
reviews.review: Sukho Thai is OK and unremarkable in every way, except for the fact that it shares its lot with a go-cart track.  The decorations inside are OK.  They are sufficiently "exotic" enough for people not to feel cheated, but without actually being beautiful or impressive.  The food is OK.  You can eat it (except the miso soup, which is frankly, downright BAD) but you won't be missing it afterwards.  I can't even remember what I had.  The selection is OK.  You see the things you expect, like pad thai or tom kha gai, but nothing that might be surprising or out of the ordinary.  The prices are OK... see where I'm going with this?  The whole visit was just OK.  Next time I go to Nashville, I'll try something new.

reviews.name: Jen M.
reviews.review: OMG!  This is by far the worst Thai food I have ever eaten.  The food was bland, and seemed reheated in a microwave.  The restaurant had an odd odor, the bathrooms were dirty, the phone rang extremely loud during our entire dinner, the service was slow and the employees were less than attentive and not very friendly.  In addition, I left my Maui Jim sunglasses there and called to see if they could mail (i'd pay for any mailing cost) them to me since I live out of state. they stated they were too busy and didn't have time EVER to mail them....

reviews.name: jerry a.
reviews.review: Ok, I have just a little experience with Thai food being in country several times and sampling everything from roadside rice stands to 4 star dining.  The only problem I've had with Thai anywhere else is it is usually sub par and spice for white people, not Thai spiced.  I've been 2 times in the last 4 days and both experiences were excellent.  I think i have avoided this place due to the go cart track in the front parking lot..... big mistake.  The first time I tried the Shrimp & Scallop in Thai Pacific Style with an appetizer of spring rolls and ordered it with the medium spice as I was a little skeptical on it actually being spiced Thai style which is a little hot for the average person.  I was correct and should have ordered it spicy but it was delicious none the less and there was enough for a tasty treat reheated later!  The spring rolls were delicious dipped in the wasabi mayo or simply eaten alone.  For a friday night there was no waiting, service was prompt and courteous and the atmosphere dim and quiet.(which I liked).  The second time I opted for a carryout of the Sukho Thai fried rice which was a generous portion enough for 2 but again I had left overs to enjoy the next day.  She told me it would be ready 10-15 minutes and was hot and ready when I arrived.  As much as I wanted to dig into it on the way home, there just was no easy way to eat fried rice and drive.  The rice had an ample amount of pork, shrimp, thai sausage and veggies in it.

reviews.name: Tom P.
reviews.review: Simple--great food!

reviews.name: Rob E.
reviews.review: Had the panang.  Was very good.  Not the best, but it was certainly worth the $11 for a very generous portion considering the prices in the area.

reviews.name: Mark L.
reviews.review: Mediocre Asia food, under average service. We are on our business trip in Nashville. We pick this place because of the other reviews. But it is not as good as it should be. The food is mediocre, and you may not differentiate one dish form another since they looks the same. There is only one waitress for the entire place. We order 6 drinks but we only got 4. The service is not nice for most customers that day. Maybe it is just one day but I don't recommend this place.

reviews.name: dave m.
reviews.review: A good little thai place, despite its weird/crummy location.  The staff is friendly and attentive, and it's a welcome addition to the options in this part of town.

reviews.name: Ali B.
reviews.review: What a cool model for a coffee shop.  Tart noted that Barista Parlor is in the former Golden Sound site--- not knowing that before, I thought it may have been an old mechanic shop that had been converted into a coffee shop.  Barista parlor has a small stage outside, a small coffered patio/dining area outside, and a spacious interior with ample seating and a badass coffee setup with equipment I've never seen.  Their coffee setup looks like a classy version of what Walter White's brief chemistry partner set up in Breaking Bad to make coffee in their lab.  The walls are lined with decorations and merchandise including nice travel mugs, artisan chocolate bars (at least 4 different brands), and jams.  While waiting for your order, it's fun to walk the perimeter of the shop and peruse the goods.Food: We had the BP Sausage Biscuit (biscuit, apple sage sausage, strawberry jam, added scrambled egg) and the Huntsman (scrambled eggs with white cheddar, skillet cornbread drizzled with honey, choice of bacon or sausage).  Both dishes were perfect.  The sausage biscuit is just what I loved from the ever unhealthy McDonalds or other fast food breakfast menu, but with local, high quality ingredients.  Oh, it was good.  Messy though--- you WILL end up with biscuit crumbs where you didn't imagine possible.  The huntsman was like a deconstructed sandwich--- if ever they update the menu, The Huntsman could make a kickass sandwich.  For the bacon lovers, their bacon is thick, crispy, and what I consider to be artisan.  Overall, WAY better food than I expected from a random coffee joint.  Next time, I have got to try their donuts.  They looked divine, particularly the apple fritter donut.  Mmm. Beverages:  Teas and coffees were very nice.  The price looks a bit steep at first, however, teas and coffees come with a creamer pot full with your refill of coffee or tea once you finish what is in the cup they delivered to you.  Basically, an order of coffee or tea is 2-2.5 cups of drink, not 1 drink.One small suggestion for improvement: get some salt and pepper shakers.  Though it sounds strange, I've adapted to a pinch of salt in my coffee.  It really smooths the flavor and adds depth and richness that can't compare to a standard cup.  Their staff are kind and brought me a pinch bowl of salt on request.  Especially with serving hot dishes, salt would be good to have around.I have no hesitation about returning to Barista Parlor whether I'm hungry, thirsty, or looking to people watch over a smooth cup of joe.  See you next time!

reviews.name: Laura E.
reviews.review: Delicious coffee that is lovingly and artfully presented. The shop has a beautiful aesthetic, high end industrial rustic. You will want to linger here. Now. The food. The Moto Biscuit is all the further you need to go. I never understood before now what it means to have a biscuit melt in your mouth, but now I do! They actually fold the white cheddar throughout the egg, which gives you even distribution throughout. It is streets above the biscuit sandwiches from The Gulch's Biscuit Love. Don't come here in a hurry, plan to spend a good part of your morning and enjoy it. A final thought- the baristas are very Zen  in their work, another nice departure from your average coffee watering hole.

reviews.name: Michelle D.
reviews.review: The coffee here is A++. I don't remember the name of the brew, but it was damn good. The menu can be a bit intimidating, but I went with the barista's recommendation and it was completely on point. This repair shop-turned-coffee place is housed in an old garage, and is rustic and modern at the same time. It's extremely spacious, but still has a cozy characteristic to it. I love that it's not cramped like a lot of the ones back in NYC. The garage doors were all open, and with the rainy Nashville morning that day, it was the perfect setting with the perfect cup (or shall I say two or three cups) of black coffee. I probably could've sat there all day.The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because their breakfast biscuit sandwiches were so heavy. Overpriced, and just brimming with grease and too much cheese. It was quite messy and I got over it after two bites.

reviews.name: Cassie S.
reviews.review: First and foremost, I love the atmosphere.  Especially on a nice day, when the garage door is open, it's just so pleasant!  The coffee is of course fantastic.  A little pricey, but you're in East Nashville - all of the coffee places are pricey.  I haven't had any of the food, but my friend's sandwich was huge and he enjoyed it.Plenty of seating options, from bar stools, small tables, and large tables.  Great for working solo, small meetings, or social times.  And plenty of (free) parking.  Hooray!

reviews.name: Celia T.
reviews.review: This place is located BEHIND Local Honey, so just look for those worlds on the windows of a gray building. There is some parking in front and on the side of the area for the shop.When you enter the register is in the front and has a table of chocolates laid out. If you eat there, they use these wooden football character signs that you post on the tables which all have spot for you to stake the placard to. Ordered a drip Stumptown and also got a 6oz latte. The 6oz is pretty strong so if you like it milky, opt for the 8 or 12oz. Also ordered the Moto (egg and cheese) and the sausage and chesse biscuit, as well as the 100 layer donut. Coffee was good and smooth. The biscuits were expensive for what you got. 7 bucks for a biscuit sandwich, when biscuits are plenty here. The 100 layer donut or cronut was DELISH. Would definitely get that again with a latte again next time.

reviews.name: Rachel K.
reviews.review: Cute guys serving coffee. Big airy space.East Nashville. There's a stage outside.Artisanal chocolate. If you don't like tattoos, jeans, and artisanal stuff, go somewhere else. Iced coffee was delish.

reviews.name: Erica v.
reviews.review: I'm visiting from out of town with a friend and I was looking to get a quick bite. Unfortunately the line was pretty long at 10am on labor day, and they had ran out of biscuits.We were crushed, but ordered bourbon vanilla coffee. Mine was iced and delicious!!!Then the cashier came up and told us they had biscuits. She didn't even charge us. They were delicious and it was a great breakfast before canoeing. Thank you for treating us so well. I'll recommend this spot to everyone I know.

reviews.name: Ricky P.
reviews.review: My wallet is still burning.1 coffee. 1 tiny square of fancy chocolate. 1 bag of Verve coffee, imported from Luxembourg (oh wait, sorry, California actually) = $30.$30 dollars????????? For f*cks sake. There are so many other coffee shops around town with coffee as good for a reasonable price. Even in Brooklyn $5.50 for a coffee is high. But in Tennessee???? Some people can barely spare that for a meal to feed a family of 7. Yeah this place looks really nice inside. Yeah it has coffees from other states. Yeah they bought the most ridiculous coffee equipment possible (think Dr. Jekylls meth lab). And yeah a bearded, tattooed, Warby Parker-wearing Urban Outfitters wet dream pours hot water over your grounds in a single serving coffee-snob-a-muh-bobber. But unless you're  convinced that you can't enjoy your coffee without buying velvet authenticity and think that you're grandfather's Folgers habit was ultimately what killed him, it seems nearly impossible to justify blowing the chunk of cheddar. Then again, I'm the a$$hole that spent $30 on a coffee, a chocolate, and a bag of beans. Jokes on me I think.

reviews.name: Rod O.
reviews.review: Hip and Hipster though not as Piles and Piles of Hipsters by the Miles as the other location!  Not as Bright either, still very Cool!Great Super Friendly Service, Very Good Coffee and Food!Macarons All I need for Breakfast are Macarons and that is all I want!  These were Delicious! Perfekt!Breakfast Additionally I tasted the Sausage and Corn Bread...I do NOT recommend them over the Macarons, Coffee (You can get a Great Version of Counter Culture Coffee)... They know what to do!Art Installation...Pretty Cool!  I enjoy the incongruency of a remodeled Transmission Shop and though I did not study the Art it was enjoyable to sit near...we were so close we could not really study it!

reviews.name: Sweet D.
reviews.review: Great coffee. You can watch them make your coffee right in front of you and they take their time. I got the mocha and the drop process was neat to watch. Great ambiance and music selection. They had a cool selection of things to purchase.  However, the coffee is not the cheapest. About 8$ for a decent sized one. Worth it for the taste.

reviews.name: Kayla H.
reviews.review: Delightfully hipster. If you want to get a distilled version, this is a living classroom. I haven't seen so much plaid and hightop boots since the last time I went to my Grandfather's lumber mill. I had a gluten free biscuit (because I don't eat lard) and it was so delicious, I probably wouldn't have known it was gluten free if I hadn't been told. Big 5 stars for that. The coffee was really tasty too. And, HELLLLLLLO lavender macaroon. So yummy.

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: Let me start by saying I have a unique perspective on food as I travel the country constantly and the world pretty regularly.  I've lived in five major cities and Nashville is by far the smallest.  It is also worth pointing out that I live in EN and have tried BP once when they first opened, last year, and once this year, hoping for a change in experience. BP is a beautiful establishment. There is no doubt about that. However, that is where the pleasantries start and end. The staff is beyond pretentious as is their attempt to produce adequate coffee by use of a Chemex system anyone can obtain. In the amount of time it takes them to make a burnt cup of coffee, I could drive to the airport and probably back. It is far more expensive than the most expensive chain coffee, Starbucks. The hipster revolution, which is far from original and innovative as they are merely rehashing a 1960's and early 70's look with an 1880's and 1920's twist, infest the place. Having Local Honey in front doesn't do much to cut the level of pretentiousness either. Another overpriced goodwill like establishment masquerading as a trendy boutique. On top of that, they do not use locally grown coffee nor do they roast in house. In my travels I've seen far more unique establishments without the pretentiousness,  with far better coffee, less expensive, and produced in a timely manner that Durante leave late for wherever I'm going. Do yourself a favor, don't go to BP, spend the money to get a Chemex, a kettle(which you probably already own), and by the time you've made your first cup of pour over coffee, you'll have spent less money than a week at BP.

reviews.name: Taylor W.
reviews.review: I have some mixed feelings about BP.On the one hand, the establishment and atmosphere is probably the coolest I've ever been too. The garage doors that open in the summer gives the place a very open and inviting appearance. It is also a decently quiet place, at least during the middle of the day when I have gone. Lots of people say it's super hipster, and although the employees give off that vibe, they play old school rap and T-Swift...which is def not hipster. On the other hand, their drinks are extremely expensive. There is a small coffee shop in my hometown that roasts all of their own beans and makes a mean cup of coffee (which has won national awards), for about $2 less than here at BP. So the price is really the only gripe I have, being a recent college grad without a job. But that may not be as big of a deal to other people.Was the coffee at BP good? Yes. Was it worth $6 and some change for an iced coffee? That is a question that people will answer differently. The establishment alone makes me want to come back again...and it makes me want to buy another motorcycle. :)

reviews.name: Christie B.
reviews.review: Short version: Great atmosphere, fantastic visual experience. Coffee was underroasted and had that sour stringy flavor that characterizes underroasted beans. Biscuit sandwich was delicious though. This is an expensive place; don't be shy about asking how much stuff costs. Otherwise you might end up paying $10 for a chocolate bar.Long version:Barista Parlor serves up a fancy coffee experience on many dimensions. First of all the place is too cool for words--located in a converted garage with vintage motorcycles on display and for sale. Fabulous pendant lighting, interesting seating, and cool decor. They have old fashioned radios placed in various corners, and they are wired up to their central sound system with a turntable. I was also impressed by the fact that their equipment console was a modern style stand but made out of plywood. I like that mixing of the contemporary with the low end. I kind of want to live in Barista Parlor since it is just that neat.Ok, let's get to the coffee, food, and service. As a long time coffee aficionado who roasts beans at home, seeks out coffee experiences in different cities, and pays close attention to coffee related details, I had high expectations. Luckily we arrived when there was no line and the barista could attend to all our coffee questions. The coffee menu was a bit mysterious to me...it's not entirely clear what you are looking at or what you're getting. There's an element of "visiting the sacred temple on the hill" to this place. I had a hard time deciphering the devotionals, even with the assistance of our high priestess of coffee.By the way, be careful, because the religious totems (aka coffee mugs, tshirts, chocolate bars) are expensive. Like really expensive. Like $25 for a mug, $20 for beans, $10 for a chocolate bar, and so forth. Be prepared for additional sticker shock as a standard cup of coffee is $5. Now granted they do an individual pourover for each customer (there are no ready-made pots sitting around), but still...it's pricey.Well, given some of the descriptors on the menu, I asked if one of the coffees was a wet process or dry process bean. The barista went to ask another, and (unfortunately) from the answer, I could tell they had no idea what I was talking about.  Oh well....we ordered two coffees and one of their fantastic breakfast sandwiches. At about $8 a sandwich, it's a absolute bargain compared to the $5 cup of coffee.I have read other Yelper's comments on service here, and I see where they are coming from. This place is not set up for maximum efficiency. The only menus in the place are right at the cash register, so there is no way to for you to make a selection while waiting in line. Each drink is made by hand in the most labor intensive way possible. I sometimes wonder if this "artisanal by hand" process is overly Luddite. Technology helps increase efficiency, and society benefits from it. I think Barista Parlor may tip the scale too far in the other direction, because while they do have all the fancy coffee accoutrements (good espresso machine, good grinder, etc), the process by which the coffee is made and delivered to you is quite slow. When our coffees arrived, they were served on cute little wooden trays. You pour the coffee from a glass carafe into your own cup. The breakfast sandwich was also served on a wooden plank, accompanied by a denim napkin. Practicality aside, the napkin was cute but slightly less than useful. At any rate, the coffee and food were a feast for the eyes. At this point, I'm just happy to be there, happy to be alive, and happy that places like this exist in the world.So I take a sip of coffee. And here's where the magic dies...maybe it's a reaction to the overly burnt roasted bean style of Starbucks, but I've found that every time, every single time I've been to a so-called coffee fanatic type of cafe, the beans are underroasted. Severely underroasted. The taste of the coffee is always sour, stringy, and slightly watery. Underroasted beans impart a sour taste, and make for a terrible cup of coffee. To me, coffee should have a rich, rounded mouthfeel, with a fullness on the tongue, and either a caramel or chocolate essence with a slightly earthy feel. Maybe this is just my preference, but yeah. So it goes. Again, I'm disappointed by yet another fancy coffee place that lets me down. The breakfast sandwich was great though. Lovely, crumbly buttery biscuit, delicious egg, cheese and sausage, very flavorful all around.Well overall, I give Barista Parlor 3 stars. Five stars for ambiance and 2 stars for coffee and price point. Yes, I rounded down my average score, but lovely as the experience was, I don't think their coffee merited more than that.

reviews.name: Jamie F.
reviews.review: Smoothest coffee in Nashville! I'm not a big coffee-snob.. I like the sweet stuff (call me basic).. I was nervous to try this place because of that. I assumed if I don't like serious coffee I wouldn't like this place. I Love it!! I get the iced whiskey caramel and it's perfectly sweet and goes down smooth! I Also loved my bacon biscuit breakfast sandwich! This is no Starbucks people, they definitely take their time preparing each individual order. Definitely recommend this place to everyone!

reviews.name: Michael V.
reviews.review: Excellent coffee and espresso. Service was great, although not a place to come when you're in a hurry. But that's because the process itself takes more time than most, which I was happy to wait for.Excellent.

reviews.name: Courtney M.
