Although the idea sounds good, in reality, it's not a great concept at all.7 color rainbow roll -- pretty fresh fish. Tasted good overall.Spicy salmon with avocado roll -- my husband had requested this roll and they honored his request. I was pretty impressed they'd put together a made up roll.

reviews.name: Marie B.
reviews.review: RuSan's offers adequate food with reasonable prices. I have been there twice in the past three years and found the food & service to be consistent each time. The buffet is filling with an assortment of fried & seafood sushi rolls, noodles, fried rice, calamari, four other selected dishes of the day, Vegetarian Inaka Miso Udon soup, salad, & lightly fried banana rolls. If you do not care for the buffet there is an extensive menu of your favorite Japanese cuisine(s).Very Important Tip #1: Please note to NOT waste food from the buffet or you will be charged for what you do not eat. There is a sign posted on the buffet & the server was kind enough to inform us as well. Tip #2: The weekday Buffet is best to get there before 1:00 pm. Tip #3: The parking meters in front of RuSan only allows 1 hour intervals for a maximum amount of $1.00. Bottom line save your change as the meter will only count up to $1.00 & anything more it will just take it. Now to the physical condition of the restaurant. The restaurant is as clean as it gets as I witnessed them disinfecting, sweeping, & mopping. However in all honesty this restaurant could use a makeover/renovation/upgrade. The plates and silverware are scratched, the floor is scuffed, the green tea kettle appeared dingy, the female restroom has two stalls with one missing a door, and the buffet equipment is worn & outdated. Take some comfort that RuSan's has a 97 health rating as of September 2015 that is visible in the front of the restaurant. The ambience, decor, cleanliness, quality of the food, & service are very important to me and that can make or break my overall dining experience. They did change their music (thank goodness) to more pop & classic rock genres. Four generous stars as this restaurant has the potential of being a five restaurant however; needs major improvements in the areas mentioned above sooner than later.

reviews.name: Krystal T.
reviews.review: First time here, and the fire alarm went off for a long time before anyone knew how to stop it.I love the sake blossom and the cute sake glasses. They also have a great à la carte menu of sushi and sashimi options. Definitely a trendy spot for sushi. There are only about a few tables that are good for large groups. Parking can be a bit of a pain in the Gulch area, but fun if you're bar-hopping.

reviews.name: Samar S.
reviews.review: The calamari was so-so and the food was just average. I got the chicken fried rice and it wasn't anything to write home about. The sushi was OK.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: Arrived at the restaurant at 10:30 pm after arriving in Nashville late this evening.  I had to pay $10.00 for parking but when I asked to sit at the bar, the red haired girl told me they closed at 10:30 pm.  You advertise that you're open until 11:00 tonight.  Now I'm going to have to go somewhere else and pay to park again.  You lost me as a customer tonight.  Bar Louie gained a customer instead.

reviews.name: Ashley B.
reviews.review: We absolutely love this place. Toto treats us like VIPs and takes incredible care to make sure we get what we want. A perfect end to any Nashville night.

reviews.name: Mike J.
reviews.review: Like Virago, but fun.Ru Sans has become my go-to spot for great food, cold sake and good times. Like many reviewers, my Ru Sans experience had been limited to the lunch buffet - which, as I stated in my previous review, is as good as it gets in Nashville. A few months ago I was in the Gulch and stopped by for a beer and some sushi. My attentive waitress suggested one of the "cooked" entrees (there are many to choose from), and I tried it, the lime salmon. Wow. Very good! The presentation was excellent, the salmon was fresh, and the portion was more than generous. The sushi roll that I tried was clearly a cut above the normal buffet fare, and the spicy edamame was delightful. Perhaps the most pleasant surprise was the crowd - good folks hang out at Ru Sans! If you haven't been to Ru Sans in a while, I suggest stopping by. I'm glad I did.If they are busy, sit at the bar. The bartenders can tour guide the menu, and the drinks are quick, wet, and fairly priced.And, free valet makes parking a breeze!

reviews.name: Heather P.
reviews.review: Who knew that you could find a sushi buffet in the downtown area?! Someone recommended and we check out Crafts and Hops .... but when we got there, we learned that the food options were few and far between. So... we headed out on foot for lunch with no particular place in mind. We literally stumbled into this place.When I walked in, I was overwhelmed by the fish smell, but we were hungry and it seemed like a pretty legit spot. There were so many choices of sushi, that I wonder how long that each sat out before being consumed. I can totally see food poisoning in the future of anyone who intakes too much of this stuff. Here was my way around it. I figured out the one kind of sushi that wasn't on the buffet and I asked when and if it would be available, and voila...  a few minutes later, as I was partaking in my miso soup and ginger dressed salad, appeared the California roll sushi. The host mentioned that it was ready, but I was going to wait and finish my soup and salad, instead he brought me a plate of if directly to the table. Wow, that was nice gesture and that main reason that I'll push my 3.5 review into a 4 ;)

reviews.name: Hall W.
reviews.review: This place is just wrong in so many ways.1. They are always blasting some ridiculous techno music that just completely ruins the experience...2. The sushi is just slightly above store bought sushi (especially the buffet sushi).3. The interior decorating is beyond schizo4. The servers can improve with kemptness5. Parking - good luck... I can't believe this is in the gulch of all places...

reviews.name: Andrea J.
reviews.review: Kinda hidden between 2 other restaurants and some shops, Rusan's is a great place for sushi, as well as other Asian dishes. A girl at Urban Outfitters recommended going and told us to get the rice balls, but even though they are only $2, they are large enough for a meal. My coworker and I each ordered one, as we were intrigued. We both also ordered a few skewers, and I ordered some sashimi while he ordered ramen for our main dishes. HOLY RICE BALLS! They were HUGE! And also awesome...crispy on the outside, warm, sticky rice on the inside. Covered in teriyaki sauce.  SO GOOD!! I was disappointed that the skewers were also covered in sauce. But the sashimi was fresh and large pieces, and my coworker really liked his seafood ramen. Spicy but not overpowering. I will be back!!

reviews.name: Dennis S.
reviews.review: I was told to come here for the unlimited sushi buffet. Knowing it was a sushi buffet for 11 dollars I didn't expect much and had tempered my expectations. Yet they still underwhelmed.  It was like all the sushi they had was yesterday's sushi that other restaurants  threw out. I tried every roll and none of them made me want more. Even the spicy mayo was subpar. Their fried calamari was oily and not cruchy. I didn't even try the fried rice. They don't refill the food on the buffet often at all so it looks like it has been picked over. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place.

reviews.name: Bryan H.
reviews.review: For a buffet, they provided some good sushi choices along with other items like calamari, pot stickers, etc.  Good for lunch!!

reviews.name: Kirsten R.
reviews.review: Really busy, late water (drinking alcohol), napkins missing--missed in basic expectations for a restaurant. However, the bunch does get lively with sake bombs; not the best family atmosphere.

reviews.name: Renae V.
reviews.review: I stopped in to have sushi with a friend before the Avett Brothers concert downtown. I was excited to try this place but my first impression was quickly dampened upon arrival. The place felt dirty and looked worn. We were greeted at our table by a less than cheerful server who attempted to answer our questions about the 16 page menu that appeared to be in Japanese. I felt she was put out by our questions and seemed annoyed that we were asking although she did admit the menu was one of her biggest complaints. We ordered some sushi and finally received our drink order. I asked for a straw for my water and again felt she was annoyed she had to make another stop at our table. The sushi rolls came out and mine looked, ehhh, nothing fancy, but I guess I had great expectations with a name like Tokunago or something like that. #boring After dinner I made my way to the ladies room. I'm not sure what was more disturbing; the alley way open door access, which seemed unsafe, especially at night, or the way my shoes stuck to the bathroom floors. #ew. All in all, it wasn't the best or worst sushi place I've ever been to but I won't miss it next time around. I recall the 95 prominently posted in the window and joking about what year they received that grade. This place needs a makeover and fast.

reviews.name: B D.
reviews.review: Came here today 7.22Guess their credit card machine is down and asked if I had cash - I rarely carry it since I use AMEX for everything. Even paying a mortgage, etc. Asked me if I can stay until the machine is back on line - really?!  No back up plan?  In the 20+ plus years of using credit cards this is a first. What a rookie move.  Seriously won't come here again.

reviews.name: Hannah D.
reviews.review: This place was delicious. Nashville doesn't have the best sushi, but Rusan's was probably the best I have had here. The wait staff was very friendly, and the location is great. Just know you will have to pay a couple bucks for parking. Rusan's is also celiac friendly and provide gluten free soy sauce! The nigiri selection is amazing, and each piece I had was delicious . I recommend the octopus, salmon and fish roe nigiri. The specials rolls are also very interesting and are very good portioned. No small, dainty expensive rolls leaving you hungry. I had the California Sunset and Crazy Horse. Highly recommended - tons of fish meat in each roll. Rusan's doesn't skimp!

reviews.name: Trista D.
reviews.review: I don't make it to Ru'sans often but when I do, it is usually a treat. Is it the best sushi in Nashville? No. It is a happening little spot that will satisfy your sushi craving  at a decent price though. I always order the same thing when I visit Ru'sans so I won't pretend to know this place inside out. Here's the rundown:1. It's a great place to take first time sushi eaters. They've got a ton of creative and cooked sushi options. First timers will fall in love with the Rising Sun roll.2. This ain't your typical chicken fried rice. This is hot off of the hibachi and is seasoned perfectly. I always get a little excited when I see specs of pepper in my food. 3. The music is loud.....looooud! Don't come here on a romantic date.4. Wait? Stick it out. They move fast and I've never waited the full time expected. 5. The service is good but I've always had the same waiter. He's super charismatic and hilarious.6. If you hear people yell, hit the table, and cheer - don't worry. Someone ordered a sake bomb, which is a pretty big deal. Don't hide under your table or head for the exit.

reviews.name: Noelle T.
reviews.review: Wow.  Just wow.I'm not sure what I was expecting but it wasn't what I got.   Inside of Ru San's I felt like I was maybe in a rave in Ibiza or maybe in a sushi place or maybe a night club.  It's like everything all rolled up in one.  No matter how it makes you feel there is one thing that is fact - it is loud.  They play loud club music, people are chanting and banging on tables, and then the fire alarm (with strobe light)  went off for a solid 15 minutes.  This was annoying and funny all at the same time.  We ordered a wide variety of wine, saki, sushi, and hot dishes.  The food was okay.  I just couldn't get into it because I felt dirty there.  The long walk back to the bathroom had that smell of a good night of drinks.  I just wasn't feeling it.  I won't be back.

reviews.name: D M.
reviews.review: Not a bad place, but didn't blow me away.  Perhaps it was what I ordered and would not mind going back.  I'd really like to try their buffet:) the free edamame for checking in through yelp!

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: Its been a long time since I have eaten here and there is a reason for that. I never got around to writing a review of this place. I wouldn't even give them the benefit of the doubt that they have improved since December 2012. The decor: is very nice. Love the atmosphere. Glass everywhere. It looks lovely. The music: loud blaring bullshit trance 1990's bullshit. I am sorry but no. Just no. The service: excellent. Well almost. They Effed up my order. It could have been just the language barrier but I actually pointed to the item I wanted and they Effed it up. The food: Blows. Its standard sushi like anywhere. The Nori was not at all good. it was chewy and seemed off. The people: sometimes you will get a group of rowdy buffoons partaking in their ridiculous gimmick drink called the "Sake bomb" and they make the place incredibly loud like its some kind of frat house or something. If that's your thing, then have at it. But to the average person, its annoying. I don't want to see beef heads banging on the table to facilitate what amounts to a drinking game. STFU and do that shit in the dorm room. Just my opinion of course.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: I have been to this location a couple times for lunch, but stopped in for dinner last night for the first time. The lunch buffet is ok, I don't remember being blown away or hating it but have never rushed back. For dinner last night my BF and I split the super power builder and it came with a salad, miso soup, crab appetizer, and a very nice healthy portion of mixed sushi rolls and sashimi. For $24.95 we both were stuffed and couldn't finish all of it. THEN it was $10 off for certain bottles of wine, so for both of us we got out of there for $50 total. Now that's a good deal for some sushi and an entire bottle of wine! We both left tipsy and full!Our waiter was sure to tell us immediately that he'd only been working there a week or so and it definitely showed. He had to run back and ask a bunch of questions, but he at least was quick and kept our drinks full. I thought it was good. Yeah, it's not the best sushi out there, but if you are pinching pennies, it satisfied my sushi craving and I was pleased overall! I've definitely had worse sushi for more money.

reviews.name: Charles N.
reviews.review: Great sushi, was a little leery about a Buffett but this was fresh, great food. Will definitely be coming back. If your in the area this amid a must try! The tuna was great, and the special roll is a must try!

reviews.name: David B.
reviews.review: The terrible service from our server completely destroyed my opinion of the average quality sushi and sake. The group of eight next to us never got their dinner. The only time we received any attention is when it was time to pay the bill. I award you no points.

reviews.name: Alisha W.
reviews.review: We love Ru Sans!! It is such a casual hole in the wall which makes the experience that much better.  The sushi is not always the best in town, however, that small detail can be overlooked.  The quantity is much greater than  Virago and the price is much cheaper.  We tend to get hot saki, tempora, sashimi,the spicy edamame (which is AMAZING) and roll number 15.  The only complaint is that they lost our reservation for valentines day and we had to sit at the bar.  Not very romantic for valentines day but we went with it.

reviews.name: Nito W.
reviews.review: I'm not ecstatic,  but it's definitely the best sushi place in the Nashville/ Brentwood/ Franklin area. My regular orders of spicy Tune, spicy Salmon, spicy scallops and Mackerel, were all good! Reasonable prices. Will be back here.

reviews.name: Joseph N.
reviews.review: A friend brought me in here for dinner. It was a favorite of hers because it was affordable and delicious. It is definitely both of those things. Affordable and yummy! They have a HUGE menu. I mean HUGE! We spent about 20 minutes just going through the menu. Take your time and really find something you want. The staff was great with guiding us through the many selections and helping point us to things that fit our cravings. I would absolutely come back here when I was in the neighborhood.

reviews.name: Manuel V.
reviews.review: So of the best sushi I had and very affordable prices, the service is sometimes slow but they have good quality and quantity servings!

reviews.name: Eric G.
reviews.review: Hamachi Kama is the best in town. I also get the Soft Shell crab app and a rice ball.

reviews.name: Meaghan L.
reviews.review: Excellent addition to the gulch district.  The staff was excellent and pleasant.  The food is very reasonable and they offer the option to Order half rolls so that you can try a bit of everything.  I highly recommend this sushi spot

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: I bought a great deal from living social for RuSans - $15 for $30 worth of food which is probably the only reason I went there for dinner.  In a nutshell, the whole experience is pretty "Meh."  The mediocre service is only half as annoying as the blaring techno music that makes you want to dance on the table or run out of the restaurant.  On this particular occasion, I was drinking hot tea and not having any alcohol.  I will admit that indulging in some sake bombs does make the ambiance seem more enjoyable (or tolerable.)  The menu is a bit daunting.  There are about 100+things to choose from, or at least it feels that way.  It would be really nice if they would scale that back a bit.  We ordered a couple of sushi rolls, which were good but nothing exceptional that couldn't be ordered at any other sushi restaurant.  I don't even recall the name of them.  We also ordered a grilled chicken stick and a sweet potato tempura, which were both very good.  Unfortunately, that came 15 mins or so after our rolls arrived.  It seems they just take things out to tables whenever they are ready and not in any particular order.  We did get soup and salad before the meal but that was before we got our tea.   Basically, I am never impressed with this place.  The sushi buffet for lunch is pretty good but not really worth the experience.  There are so many good sushi places in town, no point in wasting your money here.

reviews.name: Ashwin M.
reviews.review: Outstanding tofu skewers. And the miso Ramen. Two ten Jack, you have your work cut out.

reviews.name: Laila G.
reviews.review: ROACH ON THE SUSHI BAR. Right. Next. To. My. Plate. Waitress killed it. Enough to get your meal comped? Not here. 50% off. I told the waitress- that's fine but tell the manager I'll write a review. So. The happy hour was cheap and worthwhile. Atmosphere is straight 2000 sushi joint. Not clean. Decent service from waitress. Food tasted Ok until I wanted to puke. I will not return.

reviews.name: Alicia M.
reviews.review: Was hungry for sushi last night and wanted to order online.  The online menu is as busy and as confusing as the menu's they have in the restaurant. It's doesn't even look attractive.  Needs to be done over. I gave up and went to Kroger.  It's much easier.

reviews.name: Honey S.
reviews.review: Date night spot. Have been coming here for years. Saw a roach once..still great sushi.

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: Amazing lunch buffet Monday-Saturday which is less than $15 a person (think it's about $10)! Funky & fun atmosphere plays retro techno music all the time and serves soda by the can... Must enjoy! They have beer & liquor and do sake bombs! The staff is fabulous! One of my favorite places for sure!

reviews.name: Emily Myles H.
reviews.review: Ru Sans a great place to stop in and get sushi.  We tried the sweet potato tempura roll, and I forget what they were called but #29 and #39 on the menu.  Really liked 39, its grilled chicken, jalepeno and thai peanut sauce.  Unique flavor, we were very happy with our meal.  Music in there cracks me up it's like an elevator in a european club!

reviews.name: Sandy W.
reviews.review: I was pretty shocked to see all the lower ratings for Ru San's. I've been here many times over the years and never been even slightly disappointed. The food quality is always excellent, service is great, wait is never bad even when they're slammed, and their sake is my favorite. I also have to mention that they have the largest menu of any restaurant I've ever seen. They have an insane number of options! While this is a perk, it might explain some of the lower reviews(?) All I can guess is that Ru San excels at some items and falls short on others. And maybe I've just been lucky with the items I like to order?I give up. It's my favorite sushi spot in Nashville, for sure. It's definitely quirky with the loud techno music, but you can still hear the person sitting across from you. Their prices are way lower than the average sushi place too. Anyway, just give' em a chance and decide for yourself. Haters be hatin

reviews.name: Alex M.
reviews.review: They must have thought it was my first time!? Salmon smelled horrible and was sweating... After losing my appetite I sent the food back, paid for my beer and left!

reviews.name: Anna J.
reviews.review: Terrible service.  Walked in and there was no hostess around for 15 minutes, then the bartender finally came and rudely sat us down, it wasn't even busy! we went on a Tues night!Then, waited another 15 minute at our table for our waiter to come...bearing water and said "here you go, i'll be bk to take your order." We thought about leaving but after trying to find parking and waiting already 30+minutes, we were starving and just want some food.Waiter comes back another 10-15 minute later to take our order.  Food came 30 minutes later.  While we were waiting we were observing the tables around us, they were all looking around for their servers... one was looking to get his check, one was looking to get his food, and another was looking to pay.  What a mess, one guy actually got up to find someone himself.  Needless to say, we never got any refills, and prob saw the waiter 2 times, once to take our order and once to get our check (yes, we had to hunt him down too!).Our conclusion was, management needs to bring more servers in, there were only 3 for the entire restaurant that we can see. Food was good at least, but definitely was spoiled by the fact that we had to wait so long for it.  I don't think I will be back.

reviews.name: Alyssa B.
reviews.review: The best sushi in Nashville! Disclaimer: I've been a fan of Ru Sans since my college days in Atlanta. We used to frequent Ru Sans for $1 sushi every week. It quickly became a favorite! Moved to Nashville after several years in Boston and I was so, so excited to be near Ru Sans again! It is really fantastic. A great selection of sushi (if you know nothing about sushi - it will confuse you for sure) and really amazing prices! Beyond sushi, they have the best and cheapest Chicken Fried Rice I've had lately. I'm also had the teriyaki chicken sticks, and several of the tempura options. All truly delicious! Overall, the food is an incredible value for what you get and I'm all about that. The ambiance can be dicey and sometimes the music is too loud and wait times are too long. There are ALWAYS people there having a blast with sake bombs! I would highly recommend giving this place a shot if you like sushi!

reviews.name: Kendra K.
reviews.review: Went here tonight with a friend and they have a very serious nat issue. The nats are almost the size of flies and are very irritating as you eat. The chicken fried rice used to be my favorite until I discovered a huge nat mixed in with my rice as I was finishing my food. It's never been the cleanest place but this is my last time eating in there. The manager is always rude but the chefs are nice. No one is really knowledgable on the menu except the chefs. Also the one in midtown Atlanta was shut down for their cleanliness issue which says a lot. Beware.

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: Huge menu, pretty good food, very slow service.  There lunch buffet is small but usually fresh.  A good place to go in the Gulch that isn't too crowded usually.

reviews.name: Greg S.
reviews.review: I've been here a few times and it's a really good sushi spot  The buffet is OK and I'd recommend sitting at the bar for the best service.Not the best place for kids unless they really like sushi

reviews.name: Jay G.
reviews.review: This is the best sushi in Nashville. Great date spot, they play cool techno and it's just great up beat atmosphere. And the food and booze are the upmost. Crispy calamari is the best I have had anywhere. I go other places trying to find something comparable but it still stands alone. Another unique "unicorn" type food is the twiced cooked salmon...unbelievable. Like no other sushi, a must try. Also check out the purple haze sake, it is killer.

reviews.name: Alisha V.
reviews.review: I like Ru Sans. I always have great sushi here. But the service sucks a lot of the time. Especially Christopher D. He has blonde hair and glasses. He judged my roommate for the sushi she chose saying "oh.. You're getting THAT?" Brought our edamame with our meal. Didn't even give us a chance to look over the menu, as he rushed us to choose. He was in our faces the moment we sat down. Asking what we want to eat before we even looked at the menu. He also never filled our waters, not once. Christopher D, if you're reading this, that's why you got a bad tip. You were so weird and rude.

reviews.name: Chloe H.
reviews.review: The only thing that is really that great about Ru San's is its location. I have been here several times and always leave feeling pretty mediocre but generally satisfied. However, my last experience with Ru San's was horrible. I placed an order online for pickup. I wanted a California Roll with spicy mayo and a seaweed salad. I go to pick up my order 40 minutes later (per my order confirmation), and they tell me that they cancelled the order. I ask why. They say they don't know. A man tells me to sit for 5 minutes at the bar. "Just 5 minute!" I'm sitting there thinking about how ridiculous these people are. Then, the same man comes over about 10 minutes later and tells me he doesn't understand my order. What is not to understand?! He doesn't understand how many California Rolls I want and that I want a side of spicy mayo. Hmmm well this is a sushi restaurant right? That's when I lost it. I stood up and told him to re-cancel my order and thanked him for wasting an hour of my night.Overall point: do NOT order online for pickup

reviews.name: Kathleen B.
reviews.review: Confession: I rarely eat in store at Ru Sans because I'm always rushing from one place to another.  However, I've been ordering online and picking up my lunch at least once a week for several weeks.  The staff quickly learned my name and is happy to see me each time I stop in!  Yesterday, they forgot to give me two Teriyaki Rice Balls that I ordered, but I didn't even get to leave the store before they caught the mistake and fixed it.  They gave me a cookie and water while I waited and were all smiles and apologies!  Great service.  The sushi has always been beautiful and delicious.  I highly recommend getting a Teriyaki Rice Ball with your order - it's a great compliment to the sushi!

reviews.name: Shafi K.
reviews.review: I am not sure why Ru San's has such bad ratings on Yelp. I guess it really depends on a variety of things, including the day you went in, how parking was that day, how your service was, and who was the chef that day. Either way, we have been to Ru San's twice and used Groupons both times and loved our experience. I am not sure if I would return here for a full priced meal just because Nashville has so many options, and some of them cheaper than Ru San's but for half-priced these guys were great. We loved their appetizers, especially the avocado-shrimp nacho looking thing (I cannot for the life of me remember it's name). We also really enjoyed their calamari. The sushi is great. They have a lot of friend options and regular sushi options. Their speciality rolls are good too. We have never run into a problem with their service. The first time we went there, we were in and out in a matter of 1-1.5 hours. The second time, we were using a Groupon and usually you cannot use it for alcohol but the waiter let my boyfriend use it for his beer anyway. That was cool of him!:) TIP: I would park with the valet at Sambuca. It is the easiest way to find parking at the Gulch and worth the dollar tip.

reviews.name: Janette C.
reviews.review: So I tried this place on a couple of friends recommendations.   I gave it a mid score for a couple of reasons. Food - huge menu.  If you don't know what you want, be prepared to sift through the menu. It was tasty though.  I had the tuna tataki appetizer and two rolls, the kimchi salmon maki and the vegetable tempura maki.   The veggie roll was massive, too big a bite.  Make sure you ask for the six piece smaller mouthful!  Atmosphere - a bit of a hipster trendy place in my opinion but then, my favorite sushi place is a bit of a dive (Kens).  Lots of preppy young adults in there any how.  Art work - who goes to see that right? But it bears mentioning cause its actually kinda cool. Looks to be hand panted images on a large scale through out. Parking - paid lots for the most part. Yuck. I'll probably be back again but my first choice will still be Kens.

reviews.name: Heather P.
reviews.review: Leave expectations from your experiences with other sushi restaurants at the door. It's a unique environment at Ru Sans, with techno music booming and chefs busily making dishes. It gets loud and festive. Don't be surprised when the staff starts yelling and clapping -- It just means a group is taking sake bombs. The interior is pretty plain. It's quite different from its snazzy neighbor, Sambuca. It's small inside so it can seem hectic when crowded. I've waited for a check for twenty minutes or so during a busy time. The servers are satisfactory; Not over the top but not horrible. Overall, I like the sushi. I feel like you get your money's worth. I always leave there feeling really full without an overwhelming bill. I know what fish combinations I like and usually stick to those so I've never been disappointed. The menu is kind of daunting so be prepared. There's a ton of free or inexpensive parking within a short walking distance. The area is well-lit and there are usually a lot of people milling around so it feels safe.

reviews.name: Laura G.
reviews.review: love this place! price is reasonable, food is amazing, and the chefs are on point.. there are some servers that could be more friendly but other than that i love this place!

reviews.name: Keiza S.
reviews.review: I'm a fan of Ru Sans -- I've been around the sushi industry for awhile and they always have good food and service. Chris was our server the other night and he was GREAT! Very knowledgeable and helpful. Also personable. Definitely recommend this place for a dinner before hitting midtown!

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.review: Aw, man. I was hoping I'd previously posted a glowing review of RuSan's so I could prove that once upon a time, I liked it here. But, I didn't so just trust me on this one.It is with a heavy heart that I relay today's experience over the lunch sushi buffet. Cold, gelatinous, and ~$11/each. It's been a year or three but I remember this being so much better. Don't get me wrong... I love cheap, fast food-ish, ethnic cuisine and I have lovely memories of the Ginger Simmered Beef, Fried Garlic and Bay Shrimp Salad Maki (like I said, once upon a time), but today? Lackluster is an overstatement.With each bite, I kept hoping the next would be better. But, alas. It wasn't. Why, RuSan's? With all your new neighboring restauranteurs in The Gulch, is this the taste of complacency? I shake my head in disappointment because I know your potential and cherish what we once had. On the upside, my water was refreshing and the service was fine.

reviews.name: John R.
reviews.review: Try the crispy tuna.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: Came here today for an early lunch since my friend had a half off depot certificate. Ended up getting the buffet and also trying the mochi cake dessert and vanilla ice cream. So the place looks much more like a bar than sushi place, but it seems like it would really double as both during the night, which I'm sure works pretty well for the area. That being said, lets get to the sushi.I tried mostly all of the sushi I saw available except the ones that had a lot of avocado, and they changed out like 5 dishes when I was there (it was like noon so they'd been open about  an hour). Now let me start out by saying I love fried food, so the friend sushi is the kind I like best. That being said, I also feel like it's really an americanized version of sushi, done just so american get over the whole "raw food" deal. Either way, I think it's great to offer fried sushi, either with the rice fried around or just the inside fried a bit, since it adds variety. Mostly I think the sushi tasted pretty ok, but nothing really stood out as "amazing" to me, you know? If I didn't like the fried sushi so much, I might have given this place a 2 instead I imagine. Meanwhile, the mochi cake dessert was pretty delicious, although it literally had no ice cream despite saying that it did in the menu.... and it seemed a bit overpriced for the quantity provided (5.75). Still,  ten bucks for the buffet isn't too bad, so I might be back sometime if I really feel like fried sushi.

reviews.name: Amber E.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed their kushiage & yakitori. After getting amazing kushiage on my last trip to California, I was craving some fried goodness.Some of the kushiage & yakitori was not like I had expected and not authentic, but still very good. I can't comment on the sushi itself, but if you like kushiage & yakitori this place is decent to get your fix.

reviews.name: Stephanie K.
reviews.review: I last reviewed this place three years ago when the host at Ru San's refused to seat my family (with small child) on a not very busy early evening.  I actually avoided the place for some time and had long wasabi laced affairs with places like Fujiyama in West Nashville.  I recently returned for a late nite bite with a boy and it was significantly mediocre to warrant an update.  Like my crumbling relationship, RuSans chokes itself on sad attempts to dress up what was always low quality.  The washed out party techno and poor lighting is like being in the expositional scene of a romantic comedy set in New York. But not in the good way. The bloated menu is utterly ridiculous and stopped impressing people in 2004. The sushi, like our attempt to still enjoy sharing a meal together, was just pathetic. 90% rice, soggy seaweed, and overloaded with a sweet sauce.I'm breaking up with you (again) RuSans. I wish you the best but I'm afraid that the Gulch is a big sea and there are plenty of other fish.

reviews.name: Ramsey I.
reviews.review: It was ok. If you order any yakitori make sure u ask for no sauce. It is over sauced, sometimes over cooked. The hamachi kama was excellent! !! Just order a couple of those and some beer the portion size is very generous for 9$. I had won sushi roll and it was the eel. Very sloppy and disproportionate cuts. Tempura was good but you can't mess that up. Their menu was way to large and hard to navigate, around 6 pages.

reviews.name: Tiffany E.
reviews.review: Fun and trendy...but the food could be better. Quick service though.

reviews.name: Kirk R.
reviews.review: Sat at the sushi bar, did not get approached by a waiter the entire time we were there until needed our check.  We had to order our sushi with the chef at the bar in front of us.  He was good at his job and very attentive...the waiting staff not so much..aka not at all.  When it came time to get our check, the waiter responsible for our area had no idea what we ordered due to not saying one word to us the entire time we were there.  The sushi was bland and we were not impressed in the slightest.  We probably will not be returning.

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: We were the first people at the buffet, so everything was still really fresh and not falling apart. My toddler LOVES sushi, and everything met her needs (and undeveloped palette) perfectly, particularly the tempura chocolate banana slices they put out for dessert. My main complaint was that the rolls had so much glutinous rice, it was hard to taste the fish. I ended up picking the fish out of a few rolls and having a large helping of salad. Nothing was awful, it just seemed pretty obvious how they make the price point ($10.95) for the buffet work for them.

reviews.name: Tim M.
reviews.review: No way if you want serious sushi!Walking in, you could smell the steam/humidity trapped inside from lack of ventilation. None of the sushi chefs are Asian but the servers are Asian... seriously!Friend had the tuna sashimi and tempura. Tuna sashimi served on a warm, fresh from the dishwasher plate which led to the sashimi warming up very quickly such that it wasn't really edible anymore. Tempura - enough tempura to feed 2-3 people. There is no way 1 person can seriously eat that much tempura alone.I had beef teriyaki and sushi. Beef teriyaki served on simmer plate on a bed of vegetables. It looked more like a stir-fry entree from a Chinese restaurant. For the price, you'd think you were in LA or NYC paying for this beef teriyaki.Servers and customers admitted that their sushi might not be the freshest - this is an UNDERSTATEMENT!

reviews.name: Caroline H.
reviews.review: Ruh roh I tried the sushi buffet. It's probably what you expect from a sushi buffet that's 10 bucks. Especially when you hit it up 30 minutes before closing. Whoops. It's nice they also serve rice, miso soup, and noodle dishes, though. I probably wouldn't try it again. I do still like Ru San's, if only because I live nearby and enjoy their udon noodle soups for less than $10.

reviews.name: Meredith H.
reviews.review: Went here because I got a Groupon, going back because this place is the bomb! Their menu did throw me off though because they don't have the typical names for sushi that every place else has, but if you read the descriptions, you'll be able to find what you're looking for. They do have a million different kinds though, so you'll be sure to find what you like! I remember we had a problem with parking...we had to pay like $2 or $5 or something, so it's not too bad, but there's no free parking, I think. I could be wrong, but I just didn't see any. Restaurant was crowded, but it was a Saturday night, and we had to wait to be seated.  I felt bad because we did have reservations but because of the parking situation, we were late, so I don't mind that we had to wait. I'm excited about going back!

reviews.name: Lauren Y.
reviews.review: The best casual sushi experience in Nashville if you're not on the hunt for fine dining. It's not stuffy, it's fun! The food is fantastic, hop up to the sushi bar and let them know what you like and don't. They'll make a perfect roll for you happily. LOVE this place... and I'm never short on sake bombs when we go in for drinks or to dine.

reviews.name: John R.
reviews.review: As it's well known this place offers a lunch sushi buffet that can't be beat. I will talk about my dinner experience.Their regular menu items are out of this world. When I saw the prices I thought they were a little high, but the amount of food you get compared to the price your actually getting good bang for your buck No matter the dish you order you can be guaranteed that they cook it all fresh, and prepare a beautiful presentation. The staff is always friendly and take good care of me. Over all I would recommend this restaurant whether you are looking for sushi, Japanese dishes, and just some good ole sake. Rusans won't let you down

reviews.name: allison m.
reviews.review: I wouldn't go back nor would I recommend this place. Yes, I live in NYC and have all the sushi in the world at my fingertips, but that aside, it's just not up to standards in any city regardless of how big or small. As for the food, it actually wasn't all that bad - hence the two stars. We had the spicy edamame (oily, sauce-ridden, boyfriend loved it), mango tango roll and a soba soup, all were good - nothing that was particularly memorable, but definitely decent and we finished everything.  The service was horrible and slow (and no, the place was not packed - we arrived at 8:15p)  - we never could quite figure out what was going on and it seemed everyone that worked there was just as clueless. The huge food downfall was dessert - yes, you can screw up ice cream and mochi balls. There was some huge misunderstanding as to what ice cream we wanted, they deep fried everything and the ice cream they brought as a replacement - two different kinds - was gritty and gross ( and I will eat any ice cream put in front of me). We got them to comp it, but seriously, you scoop it out of a tub.Lastly, this place is just dirty and rundown. The bathrooms are gross, there were a handful of tables uncleared throughout the night, the paint is coming off the walls, the floors were dirty....not exactly what one wants to see when they're about to eat raw fish. From what I've heard there was a time this restaurant could hold its own, but I sincerely do not know why anyone would come here now.

reviews.name: Tamara B.
reviews.review: The sushi some of the best around! Order the firecracker role; it will change your life.

reviews.name: Eliza R.
reviews.review: I'm surprised Ru Sans hasn't gotten better reviews, as my girlfriend and I really like this place and it's always packed anytime we go.  True, it does get very crowded and loud at times.  Between the chatter and blaring music, it can be hard to have a conversation.  The service is decent, though, and I've never had a problem with them not being attentive or forgetting things as other reviewers have noted.Needless to say, I don't come here for the atmosphere, rather the amazing sushi.  I don't know if it's the best sushi in Nashville, but it's definitely some of the best I've tried so far!  They offer an extensive menu of nigiri, sashimi and rolls for a good price.  Their rolls are out of this world and really creative - I've never seen a lot of these rolls anywhere else.

reviews.name: Susannah B.
reviews.review: If I could give this place zero stars - I would and usually I'm very easy on rating places. Not this place. The sushi looks old. Tastes old. Smells old. My friend got sick right after. Not okay.

reviews.name: Jess Y.
reviews.review: I think my experience at Ru San's can be summed up in one word: meh. You may argue that that is not a word, but I really can't describe my experience accurately using any other combination of phonetic language.Shall we begin with the menu? You would think I would have been warned from the reviews that the menu is gigantic.  Oh naive, little Jessica, thinking I could handle the menu.  But, it really is lengthy and overwhelming.  By the time the waiter came over to our table to take our order, I felt like I needed to say, "Excuse me, I'm still on Chapter One. Could you give us a little more time to finish reading the menu?"  Apparently, however, "a little more time" turned out to be 20 minutes later when the waiter finally realized we were still alive.We ended up ordering a strange sushi ball.  Yes, you read that correctly, a ball. The description on the menu did not describe this sushi roll as a fried ball of sushi, but that is exactly what it was.  In fact, the menu only described it as a combination of what seemed to be a nice selection of raw fish.  What came out was quite literally a sphere of 9 individually rolled sushi, battered in dough, fried, and then sliced into thirds.  The sauces it came with weren't bad, but just seemed to mask the blandness of the sushi itself.  The sushi rice was not up to par and I was still appalled at eating a gigantic fried ball of sushi.  We ordered another roll as well, but clearly, it was pretty non-memorable in comparison to the fried sushi ball monster because I literally have no recollection of what was inside that roll.My friend wanted some vegetables, so we also ordered a cucumber salad which basically amounted to raw sliced cucumbers with a little sauce/oil poured over the top.  No rocket science here.We also ordered one of the udon soups which I thought was pretty good.  I love the texture of their udon, it is chewy, smooth, and soaks up all the delicious flavor from the soup.  I think the udon was probably my highlight from the night--the one redeeming moment.Anyway, overall, poor effort on the sushi and questionable service.  Also, the atmosphere is strange.  I felt like I was in a techno club and there were random bursts of people screaming for sake bombs.  Our waiter more than once tried to get us to try one as well.

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: I have been to Ru San's several times over the last 6 years, so my star rating is based on my overall experiences. THE PROS: Very big menu with a lot of variety. I usually always order the Crunchy Mui Bueno, Tuna Tempura, and Sea Bass Yakitori. I love the sauce that comes w/ the tempura, and the Sea Bass Yakitori is sooooo delicious it melts in your mouth! I LOVE techno music so the music that is always blaring is super fine with me! The fried ice cream is also to die for! Whatever you do, DON"T forget to order the plum sake! It is served warm and it gives you the best warm, fuzzy feeling ever! (if you drink enough! lol) It's usually pretty lively in there which is also fine with me because I prefer to ALWAYS feel like I'm at a party. THE CONS: Although the food is USUALLY good, I have experienced times where the sea bass yakitori is TINY and the rolls are so huge you can't eat them in one bite. And for anyone who eats sushi rolls you know having to bite into one pretty much makes it fall apart. I've never had anything that actually TASTED bad, though. I have experienced waiters at times who take forever, forget you, and leave your food on the counter 10 min before they bring it to you. A few years back they always used to sing and make  a lot of noise (literrally) for your birthday. 5 years ago they even gave me a $25 giftcard for my birthday when I celebrated there. A couple years ago I made a reservation a few days in advance for my birthday because we were going to have about 10 people in our group. When we got there they had no recollection of the reservation and it still took 20 or so minutes to even get a table. :(  Last couple of years it doesn't seem like they do much for birthdays.  Overall I think Ru San's is a fun place with good sushi and a cool atmosphere. Perfect start to a night of fun!!

reviews.name: Elvira G.
reviews.review: Deceptive practice:  Party of 5 or more, beware!I have NEVER been to a place with an automatic 18% gratuity for parties of 5 or more but Ru San states this on their menu.  And it's not true.  NOT TRUE!  They actually charge 20%!  RidiculousSpicy tuna and mussels were just horrible.

reviews.name: Hoa T.
reviews.review: I came here with a few friends and was disappointed. Yes the food was pretty cheap but there were some giant misses that the goods could not make up for.  First of, what is up with the salty pickled carrots in some of the rolls?! They just ruined the entire dish. All I tasted was some weird saltiness. Second, the vegetable springroll with asparagus was tasteless, so not worth it. The rolls overall looked great but disappoint the tastebuds.Yay for buy one get one free beer during happy hour.Another yay for having such a big selection in the menu.

reviews.name: Travis A.
reviews.review: Why can't we have a Ru San's like Athens or Atlanta?  This place reminds me of Sybil.  One time everything is great.... the next it's sorely lacking.  Ru San's is all over the place as far as experience goes.I like that they have sushi options you won't find anywhere else in town.  I like that you can get small 3 piece portions if you're looking for variety.  I like that you can order tempura by the piece.  On the flip side, I hate that their menu weighs about 12 lbs. and that you have to take about 15 minutes to look through it all.  Seriously?  Is it available in hardback?  Then again, it's a lot better than it used to be... they used to give you like 4 different menus and it was a cluster F to even find anything.I've been to the one in Athens about 5 times and the Midtown Atlanta location 3 times.  Quality experience every time.  I know this place has the potential to be great, but I feel like it constantly underachieves and they have no consistency.Up until my last visit a week ago, I had always had decent service.  This past trip was terrible.  We saw our sushi order put up on the bar for delivery and it sat there for 10 minutes before the waiter even bothered to bring it to us... and the place wasn't even half full... only 5 booths occupied.  I asked for more drinks  for our table and watched the waiter walk by 4 or 5 times before he "remembered" that I had ordered a couple more.  Strange that he came by literally every 3 minutes to refill the water glasses of the girls seated next to us.This place has a ton of potential... the owner just needs to get his head out of his arse and hire a new wait staff and management.

reviews.name: Adrianna C.
reviews.review: When reflecting on past dining experiences, this place takes the cake for worst I have ever had. My brother found a Groupon so we decided to go for dinner. We were sat in the back corner table/booth where we instantly feared we would be ignored and forgotten. Needless to say, we were there for over 2 hours, waiting and looking for our waitress the majority of the time. We were her only table! My original order was udon noodles in this watery pesto sauce, completely overcooked & slimy dish. I sent it back after one bite & our waitress fought with me that I would still be charged for the scallops used in my dish because "they were expensive". Never in my life as a server or a customer have I experienced back talking a paying/tipping customer. The second dish was tasteless fried rice, I was ready to scream and leave at this point. My brother got a simple sushi roll that he liked, but when asked what else would be good to compliment it our waitress simply took his menu & walked away. We were left with no forks the majority of our meal, he even got up to get a to go box behind the counter. Our waitress Nancy made sure we would never be back here.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: It's my own dang fault for coming back. Sometimes the idea of cheap sushi seduces me but you get exactly what you pay for.My friend and I wanted to do an early, casual, and frugal dinner so we decided to pop by here again. I usually come here for a cheap sushi fix but decided to venture out and try a fried tofu Yu Dofu dish ($4.95) and the Rice Ball ($1.95). The Rice Ball never disappoints as a cheap appetizer that consists of a Teriyaki flavored ball that is fried on the exterior but has a boiled rice center. Simple and satisfying. The Yu Dofu lacked flavor and consistency. Essentially, it was a dozen soggy cubed fried tofu pieces that sit in a basic Teriyaki sauce. No vegetables, spices, or anything else. I ate in haste and my stomach is still holding a grudge.I don't expect exquisite food from here and have real expectations for the price but come on now!

reviews.name: Tabitha S.
reviews.review: I use to frequent Rusans with my "friend" I had never had sushi before or sake and after he made me try it OMG I was in love with it. I know eat sushi frequently and I can say, Honestly, the Rusans is the best I have had! Service is great and I love the atmosphere. Their Sake is sooo good and served just at the right temperature. I visit Rusans at least once a month! If I want sushi I drive 45 minutes to Rusans! Worth it, TOTALLY worth it! My kids love it too!

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: Consistently good food, inconsistent service.  I'll preface this with I am a vegetarian, they have a decent amount of choices, and most of them taste pretty darn good.  I would give it 4.5 stars for food, currently 2 stars for service in the past year, with a pre-2010 overall service rating of 1.That said I've had service that ranges from excellent to never-come-back.  Actually 2 times I've had the never-come-back service, each time I was lured back by visiting Ru San's in another town.  I went 2 years not going back to the Nashville one once due to a waitress who seemed quite put out that if I ordered it I wanted it and if it had taken an hour and they forgot it I did not want it when it was going to be another 30 minutes, also who labeled me as a lousy tipper and said as much to another waiter in earshot (she got the wrong guy)That woman's gone now, the service has resumed to "vegetarian gets his food last", which is what it seems to have always been... during the really bad times my friends would be finished eating by the time I got my food.Leaving is still a chore, last year a group walked out and told the people behind the counter they would be back as they had a football game to get to and their waiter had disappeared.  The story seemed to be they had been waiting for nearly an hour on their check and nobody else in the place could run it for some reason.Old waiters, so many bad stories... new waiters so far are ok.  Food has always been good.  At least for me.  There's no other reason I would have gone back.Actually, after writing this review I'm still a bit wondering why I go there

reviews.name: Samantha B.
reviews.review: Why in the world are there so many terrible reviews? This place is amazing. This place should easily get five stars. The service was wonderful, I didn't have to ask for refills, napkins, or anything. The servers were very nice and polite and didn't have problems explaining anything on the menu. Their food was FANTASTIC. My father had a sea bass meal and he adored it! He's a very picky eater too, but he said it was one of the greatest things he ever tasted. My sushi was FABULOUS. Probably the best I have ever had. I've eaten at many, many, sushi restaurants too. I had the terriayki ball which was great as well as the sweet potato tempura tray.Their menu was huge. It was about four to seven pages. (I don't remember which.) The place was very clean and the atmosphere was nice. Overall, if you didn't like it, give it another try.Tip: Don't get the buffet, order your own dish! :) I can't wait to come back again.

reviews.name: Tracy M.
reviews.review: Maybe I should not have expected much from a sushi joint in Nashville. I mean, really, it's as if i'd been let down because a cuban restaurant didn't live up to my Miami standards. I didn't come to Nashville to eat sushi, but I really craved it while I was in town and my girlfriend who was showing us around said she'd been there a long time ago and remembered that it was a buffet-style place in a great location.Done deal. We get there, and she was right about the area. The food was quite underwhelming. Nothing tasted very fresh. In fact, everything I got from the sushi buffet was soggy and maybe even slightly warm (not good for uncooked food). They do have a small sake selection of sake of which we enjoyed an unfiltered bottle of. The price for 3 people eating from the buffet, 1 small bottle of sake and 1 Sapporro came out to just over $70.Not a place I'd look forward to going to again. I wish I could give it a better review and rating!!!

reviews.name: Bridget S.
reviews.review: The menu and food keep improving. Great value in the Gulch. We will return.

reviews.name: hobo s.
reviews.review: Still loud, still really good and really creative food.They have revised their (HUGE) menu and it is somehow more difficult to find what you want.  The new menus are crazy, sporadic, and not well organized.  Do yourself a favor, take paper and pencil (why do they not use a paper sushi menu?) and write down what you want so you don't have to bookmark the menu with your fingers in 4 or 5 different spots.It should tell you how good the food is when I put up with this stuff to eat there.

reviews.name: Stuart G.
reviews.review: Had a very good dinner last night.First the place was packed and LOUD. It is a hip trendy spot. We felt a little out of place but if the food is good and the service is fine then who cares.I didn't care! The food was very good, the service was good and the menu selection was HUGE!We had a shrimp dinner, sushi, sushi rolls and a sushi sampler boat. Good quality, portions and freshness.I would definitely go back.

reviews.name: Sam E.
reviews.review: Very good sushi at a reasonable price. Split a $25 plate with a friend and had more than enough to eat and a good variety of fish and sushi styles. Biggest downside is atmosphere. Loud electropop playing the whole time

reviews.name: Diane L.
reviews.review: Stopped in yesterday for lunch. Very busy at 1:00; I grabbed a seat at the bar, but wasn't there for the lunch buffet, though apparently most everyone else was. There appeared to be 2 servers and one host available for the entire restaurant, which was quite crowded, but not to capacity. I started with a spinach appetizer while I took my time to peruse the menu. When the server finally returned, I asked for an order of Toro and an order of Uni; she'd told me she'd have to see if they had any. She returned quickly, only to to advise no, they had neither. She said they were "seasonal." OK, then maybe that could be noted on the menu??? I didn't care for the spinach appetizer; the long thick stems were attached (big ones, we're not talking baby spinach) and I could handle that, but didn't at all care for the sickly sweet sauce that was pared with it. I was expecting more of a peanut sauce, shame on me for not knowing the difference. I are less than half of the spinach go-ame appetizer.   Perusing the menu was a chore, since MANY of the rolls are either deep fried or contain fried items. I typically don't like anything in my rolls to be fried, so at least half the the menu items would be off the list. I ordered a spicy tuna hand roll next. There were three pieces of nigiri tuna within the roll, with a splat of very tasty spicy sauce on top. Also included was a slice of avocado and some cucumber. Sadly, the rice was not evenly distributed on the nori, so literally the bottom 1 & 1/2 " of the cone were empty -  just the nori. Most times when I've had spicy tuna the tuna is chopped and mixed with the sauce, but not always. Served this way, it was much harder to evenly distribute the spicy sauce to all the bites. Some were very spicy, some not at all. I unwrapped the roll to try and re-distribute the rice and sauce and was a little more successful, but feel it's a shame I should have to do this with a $5 hand roll. Really? You can't even put the rice to the bottom of the nori??  I then ordered,against my typical preference,  a roll with tempura shrimp & avocado. It was tasty, but the pieces were very very large. I ate half of that, as I mentioned that fried anything in rolls really isn't my style. Finally,  finished with a sunset something-or-other roll. That one was the best, fresh salmon and tuna in very nice portions inside, and the finished that happily. The server was adequate, given how many patrons she had to cater to, though my water was completely empty and I had to flag her down for a refill. However, when seated at the sushi bar, I was forced to look at the dirty restaurant equipment, with the back stainless wall caked in splattered grease. The health food score in front showed the restaurant received a respectable 89, but I cannot see how based on what I saw yesterday. The floors are worn, servers overworked, and menu advertises items they do not carry. I've been to more than 30 sushi restaurants in and around Nashville and the immediate area. There are many restaurants less busy, with much better food and much more reasonable prices than Ru-San.   You won't catch me at this one again. Sad if this is all the Gulch has to offer!

reviews.name: Leanne B.
reviews.review: Awful service, took forever to place our order. Good food at least.

reviews.name: Sarah W.
reviews.review: Ru San's has a sushi buffet but I ate at the bar (I like to talk to the sushi chefs at any sushi restaurant I go to and watch him watch make sushi! Fascinating). The amount of different sushi options is incredible. Some of them are very intriguing and have funky names (Georgia on My Mind, Sinking Titanic). Your normal options are there but other's include catfish and tempura okra or the Pearl Harbor Bomb is a HUGE concoction of rice, shrimp tempura and some spicy sauce/other items. They give you a fork and knife when they bring it out. :)Service is friendly, the sushi chef was very chatty and after we asked questions about a roll he was making he gave us several samples to taste. Miso soup was tasty, if a bit on the salty side for me. I did really enjoy the edamame. Easy to locate, between the Watermark and the now-closed Wine Bar. Parking is, as always in the Gulch, a mini-challenge at the least. So, in a nutshell:I enjoyed it and I'll probably go back but it's not a place that I'm dying to eat at again.

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: How can one restaurant deliver the one of the poorest buffets I've ever experienced, yet serve a really exciting, inventive, and flavorful dinner?  It is a mystery that is totally beyond me, yet as I promised in my initial review of Ru San's, I have visited for dinner and the verdict is surprisingly really, REALLY positive.Now... what we ate.   The menu is ENORMOUS, and of course many of the rolls have repeat ingredients.  We had the Punk Rock Roll, Sinking Titanic Roll, the Midnight Tokyo Maki, and the Twice-Cooked Smoked Salmon roll.  I'm not going to go into detail here and tell you what's in each.  You'll just have to find out for yourself, but let me tell you - the Punk Rock Roll being the most benign, the rest were so utterly inventive and tasty.  Especially the Twice-Cooked Salmon roll.  Don't expect traditional sushi, people.  This was out of this world creative and out of this world GOOD.  Don't each lunch here.  EVER.  But I would totally recommend dinner.

reviews.name: Amanda J.
reviews.review: Went there on a groupon and got the sashimi, and was pleasantly surprised when I got some seriously big portions. Then the sushi chef came over and put more on my plate! Tasty, tasty sashimi. I also like their menu more generally--they have some creative rolls. As for people complaining about how it's not "Japanese enough," whatever that means to them, they would do well to remember that it's in THE GULCH, so it's going to have that trendy fusion vibe. Just relax and enjoy it. And if you're a stickler for authenticity on ethnic food, well, good luck living in Nashville.

reviews.name: Jennie W.
reviews.review: Go to their lunch buffet. 11:30-2:30 M-Sat, IIRC.Located between Sambuca and Urban Outfitters, it's easy to miss after you've been preoccupied searching for a free parking spot, but to no avail..you've to pay at one of those stupid Premier Parking areas.As you enter the restaurant, one of the first things you'll notice is the music. "Why is this $%#@ on so LOUD?," channeling your inner 60 year old brandishing your make believe cane in utter annoyance.The music is a miss. DDR crazy techno Asian pop that'll make you wanna dance in your seat or cheesy guilty pleasure lite rock that you'll wanna badly sing to embarrass yourself to get a laugh out of your friends, especially to Don't Stop Believin by Journey. (I love run-on sentences!) But it's lunchtime and I wouldn't think anyone will care as long as folks quickly scarf down on some yummy pieces of sushi.Finally speaking of sushi, a huge variety of raw and fried lined up waiting to be quickly consumed. Be warned: Your eyes will get bigger than your stomach as you pile on your plate. However, for me this is paradise since my childhood's staple was eating out at buffets for lunch and dinner where my Mom blatantly told me when I was 7 year old this: "I'm not cooking tonight so you better eat and not complain to me about being hungry!"Raw sushi is decent, but the fried sushi is my favorite because sushi tastes waaaaay better fried topped off with delicious sauce, fo sho. They are in a bite-off-more-than-you-can-chew size. If you haven't had fried sushi, please let Rusans take your fried sushi virginity away asap...you won't regret it!They also have a small selection of typical Chinese buffet style food. Noodles, soup, salad, chicken on stick, rice, and some light dessert. Pretty standard.It gets pretty busy..yes, what do you expect? Other folks are trying to get their money's worth. Yet, after I've finished my meal, my inner diva kicks in waiting to get a waitress's attention for the check because I've other places to go!Oh yeah, don't forget to grab a Pocky flavor stick on your way out!

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: When a coworker told me how "delicious" and cheap Ru San's Sushi Buffet was I'll admit... I was intrigued. Normally the sound of a sushi buffet would weird me out, but I've had the sushi buffet at Wild Wasabi and it was delicious. I assumed this would be about on the same level. Well, I assumed wrong.The look of the sushi alone was off putting, so I stuck with sushi I deemed "safe". However, everything was either falling apart, soggy or bland.  I ended up nixing the sushi and eating a bowl of steamed edamame. Not exciting.Ru San's for me was nothing more than a big sushi misstep.

reviews.name: Tim S.
reviews.review: I'd highly recommend this place.Negative: It weirdly feels like just a dive bar that happens to serve sushi. Really slow service, dingy decor (not like...cool dingy, just no effort put into it that i could see). I was expecting peanut shells on the floor.Positive: Possibly the freshest fish i've ever eaten. I'm kind of purist, worked at a sushi place for 2 years. I always get the sushi/sashimi combo wherever i go. Just raw fish on top of raw fish on top of a little rice. I wanted to reach around the sushi cooler, grab a side of Hamachi and just eat the whole thing. Order Hamachi sashimi if you go here, without a bunch of sauce all over it.I annihilated a $25 platter of sushi then ordered a large roll (even though i was uncomfortably full) because the fish was that good.If you're a sushi fanatic this place is for you. If you kinda like sushi but could just as well eat a chicken caesar wrap or something go to whole foods for sushi =-D

reviews.name: LM P.
reviews.review: This place had me at the Sake Bomb....the first time. The second visit was not as fun or tasty. What my review would have been after the first visit: "When I say Sake, you say Bomb! Sake! Bomb! Sake! Bomb! So much fun! When we left here I wanted to hug the server. He was so helpful and attentive, he made our night fantastic! The menu is a novel, so our server recommended some fantastic rolls, which we dove into and loved. Although it's definitely not a place you want to go to if you're wanting a nice, quiet dinner; for it is a restaurant within a club on the weekends. We had a blast eating sushi, listening to music and doing sake bombs. I will definitely be back for a girls' night out soon! My review now after second visit: We came here for dinner before a concert at the Cannery Ballroom. I had such a good sushi experience here the first time, that I thought I'd be different and order an entree. Massive fail on my part. I ordered the chicken teriyaki and it was disgusting. There was so much teriyaki sauce on it that it almost seemed like they were trying to disguise something in the mix. I forced mainly the rice down because I was starving and knew I wouldn't eat again till the next morning. Bummer. (Holding up "girl scout pledge" on right hand - that's three fingers held up with your right hand.) I promise I will not order anything but sushi from Rusan's. Ever.

reviews.name: Dee B.
reviews.review: Awful, Awful, Awful... I'm never going back. That place is filthy, the food was disguising, the all you can eat sushi buffet bar for $9.95 at lunch is not worth it.

reviews.name: Joseph K.
reviews.review: Good service... ordered 5 rolls and it was out pretty quick... the wasabi wasnt the freshest and they could stand to upgrade to fountain drinks but other than that i would recommend this place to anyone...

reviews.name: Nicholas F.
reviews.review: I, like many others, am confused by the number of negative reviews on this place. Been twice, nothing but good food and an interesting and lively atmosphere. Service is good, food is better!

reviews.name: Michelle P.
reviews.review: I love Ru San's! The service is great, the sushi is great, and the food is awesome! It's pretty pricy but its worth it. The atmosphere can get a little crazy sometimes but the servers and staff keep it under control. Mel is the best server!!

reviews.name: Derek K.
reviews.review: Poor service, rolls were only mediocre and not rolled tight (fell apart). They appeared to have some sort of sushi bar but it was half empty, lacked variety and didn't have labels letting people know what they're eating.

reviews.name: Brian S.
reviews.review: Solid downtown sushi. Lunch buffet is great.

reviews.name: Michael B.
reviews.review: After reading many of the reviews, the lower stars really seem to be attributed to the buffet. Realistically, I have a hard time judging a restaurant by a lunch buffet, and I seldom encounter a "good" sushi buffet. This is sushi that is placed en masse on a line with an attempt to keep it fresh while it is exposed to the open air.I have been to Ru San's at least 5-6 times in the intervening years, and I have always had a pleasant experience. The sushi doesn't taste "fishy" which to me is indicative of bad fish. Yes, the menu is very extensive, but I will admit to loving very simple sushi. Their basic rolls contain a great deal of flavor. Admittedly, if you are a purist, you will HATE Ru San's. The restaurant blares a lot of music that one reviewer likened to DDR soundtracks. Ru San's is not an intimate setting. It is where you go for food as part of a night out on the town. I happen to love the up-tempo music, but it's not for everyone. Ru San's is a fusion restaurant so they have a wide assortment of sushi that is not fish-based. Their ginger simmered beef maki is delicious, but most would not consider anything with beef in it sushi. Their vegetable-based maki is also quite tasty. As I said, if you are a purist, you may very well find a visit to Ru San's disappointing or downright dreadful.I think my biggest criticism is a lack of updating. I first visited Ru San's in 2003, and as of last night's visit, 04/13/2012, I cannot notice any real updates. The seating is worn, and many of the booths have some jagged places where the faux-leather is cracked and broken.Their sake is fine, but you should seriously try the unfiltered sake. This will appear milky instead of the normal clear sake. This is served at room temperature which is indicative of its quality since sake is warmed to obscure its impurities. I have tried their pork katsu dan which I absolutely love so I would recommend branching off of their sushi menu. There will be hit or misses, but the same holds true for all restaurants. An appetizer not listed on their menu is the teriyaki rice ball. The rice is crisp on the outside with a teriyaki sauce over the top and served on a bed of carrot shavings. It used to be just $0.75, and I am sure the price has increased although I doubt it has increased dramatically. I did not read over the price tab last night since my partner had the check.It is very easy to run up a huge tab here, though, when you start adding in sake and non-sushi food items. Our tab was $41.00 even after $30.00 was covered with the Living Social voucher.

reviews.name: Samantha S.
reviews.review: Somehow I got talked into going to Ru San's lunch buffet last week.  I hadn't eaten here in 3-4 years after I read about their whopping health score of 40. My mom asked me to join her so of course I said yes.  We ate some half way decent sushi (I'm being nice), had great service and left.  That night I thought my insides were falling out.  I was sick all night, got about 2 hours of sleep and continued to be sick half way into the next day.  And it couldn't have been from anything else I ate the night before because I thought long and hard about it and I remembered I was too busy at work to eat dinner the night before.Between the extremely loud rave music blaring at 1PM and the bad case of food poisoning... I won't be eating here ever again.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: Never had a chance to come here for the fabled lunch buffet, I've eaten here several times but only for dinner.First, it seems as if their seating policy revolves not around how long you've been there, but instead how many hot chicks you have with you and how much they have been drinking at the front bar.  Good thing I always travel in the company of attractive inebriated females.When you finally get in, they have a HUGE menu with a really overwhelming amount of menu options.  Their sushi has been various degrees of quality and freshness, nothing fantastic or terrible.  I have enjoyed their noodle soup bowls, but with that as well as most of their other menu options, the portion sizes are grotesquely large.Ultimately, you will never have a great sushi experience in Nashville or really any place that is not right next to the coast.  If you think that you are, you live a sad, sheltered life.  I highly encourage you to travel to the West Coast, Hawaii or Japan and see what you've been missing.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: Ouch, why the low rating, Nashville? If the mood strikes for sushi, Ru San's is my go-to place because I know what to expect every time. Your server can be a hit or a miss, though. I can look past sub par service as long as they're not downright rude... It happens. However, their rolls are excellent! And if you're annoyed by the sometimes-really-loud-and-random techno song playing, you'll find it really funny like I do.

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: Pretty good Sushi Buffett, two people ate with beverages for under $25.00.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: In recent years I have become quite a sushi fan; however, this place takes sushi to new lows. Yes, they have a lunch buffet, and it is quite nice, but even at what you pay for, which is not an insane amount, the food here is far below average. I can get better sushi for the same amount of money elsewhere.The main problem is that, in my opinion, they are trying to hard to be a fusion type place, but lack the variety to do so. That being said though, when it comes to sushi, fusion is something that should not be taken on from the get go. Even their traditional sushi lacks umami goodness and eye-catching presentation. A lot of what makes Japanese food, especially sushi, so unique is it's presentation on the plate and along with taste this place fails miserably with even the traditional stuff, so why are they trying for fusion?You would think that, being in an up-n-coming part of town, this place would be far better, but I can get better for my money elsewhere.

reviews.name: Tara F.
reviews.review: I'll have some so-so sushi with my techno... thanks :) I love sushi... love it. All kinds. I don't love Ru San's and it's not because their sushi is all that bad, it's that they play techno at decibels that literally make me want to run screaming from the building and over to the loud, but tolerable, Sambuca. Sheesh. I've been to Ru San's a few times... once for their lunch buffet (and I hate buffets) and it was nothing to write home about. I've also been for dinner and it was a little more palatable to me, I prefer freshly made sushi... not the wonder how long this has been here and who's touched it, kind. There really isn't anything remarkable about their food, their drinks, their location or their service. It's all average. I only give it two stars because I just really hate paying for sushi that's just OK and listening to music I don't really like, louder than I can stand. I can make OK sushi at home and bump to the Doors or the Eagles or maybe even some R. Kelly and save myself the Daft Punk, Justice, Showtek induced headache.

reviews.name: Tom S.
reviews.review: Every time I go to Ru Sans it is great but last night I went there for my brithday with all my best friends and it was truly amazing! I had the Volcano roll the plate looks to good to eat! But I ate every bite I also had bacon wrapped scallops and  downed lots of Saki  to! LOVE the Techno music they play! Everyone from the host servers and cooks are so nice!

reviews.name: Ashleigh A.
reviews.review: I was in town visiting my bff who has moved there recently and we wanted sushi, so dammit, we got sushi. Ru San's showed us a great time, especially since we were in the mood to par-tay (bday extravaganza followed our lovely dinner). Every time (and I mean EVERY time) someone orders a sake bomb they do the restaurant-wide yelling thing. Plus, it's generally kind of small and really loud, so not great if you're looking to chat or catch up. Whatevs, that's fine, we can chat later. haha. SAKE BOMBS!As far as the food, it was good. Nothing to write home about, but good. my bff did get an obscure roll - I can't remember the name of it for the life of me but it looked like five rolls, stuck together in the shape of a flower, were deep fried toget and then cut off as large, flower shaped slices. It was weird. And impossible to eat. And just weird. The service was good, again, nothing spectacular or memorable. Price was reasonable for the 4 people we had eating there. All in all, an A-OK experience.

reviews.name: Talon F.
reviews.review: I LOVE this place!  I have been coming here for a few years now.  Its a little funky, and I would never order say the escargot, for safety reasons, but when it comes to lots of Saki, great rolls, and mountains of rice and Sashimi, this is the way to go.  Young atmosphere, loud dance music, and SAKI!

reviews.name: April K.
reviews.review: I wanted to give this place only one star becuase of bad tasty food but another star for atmosphere. Good place to have some drink. The music was too loud and result of that, everyone had to shout. But its a bar you need to concern that. Dont waste money on foods but drinks!

reviews.name: Marc E.
reviews.review: I think I only need to say this: I've thrown up on THREE separate occasions after eating the sushi at Ru San's. I'm to blame for going back after the first time.
