The Well donates a portion of sales to worthy organizations around the globe, which makes me not feel so bad paying 5 bucks for coffee. It is in a cool neighborhood--right by Lipscomb, Copper Kettle and Rhino Books. The coffee is really good and they feature different roasts.

reviews.name: Allyson G.
reviews.review: I love the Well coffee. Black or an almond milk latte. However you take your coffee, there are options available for everyone. I have yet to visit their new location, but when they were located off of Richard Jones Blvd. across from Massage Envy and Alegria Mexican Restaurant, I just loved their atmosphere. It's a relaxing place to catch up with a friend, a great place to get out of the office and work, or perfect for a quick service coffee.One last thing! They have a wishing wall where you can write down your wishes and people can take a wish and grant it. They also work with suspended coffees. If you have yet to hear of the Suspended Coffee program, look it up - it's a way to #PayItForward.

reviews.name: Caryn R.
reviews.review: The people are super friendly. I ordered a mango smoothie and it was the best smoothie I've had in a while. Also super convenient being right across the street from my campus. Perfect for college students.

reviews.name: Mandy K.
reviews.review: First time in today and it was amazing! Staff was friendly and the atmosphere was really good. I asked for a caramel mocha and the girl made it happen. And their coffee cake was on point! Best coffee cake I've literally ever had. I will be a regular.

reviews.name: Linda A.
reviews.review: Quick stop here to get a cup of tea yesterday.  Warm, welcoming place with very friendly staff.  Sometimes coffee houses feel pretentious but not this great place.  Awesome tea too...I recommend the Apricot Green.  This location isn't the most convenient for me, but I'll definitely be back when I can and will check out the other location.

reviews.name: Nashville T.
reviews.review: Overpriced coffee with too much attitude.

reviews.name: Andy H.
reviews.review: This coffee shop has consistently good coffee. I usually just order my coffee black with no cream or sugar. Their drip coffee is leaps and bounds better than Starbucks and it is reasonably priced (I paid $2.50 for my 16 oz.) The staff is friendly, has a good atmosphere and they have some cool merchandise for sale (they even sell growlers! For beer!) All that being said, I also feel good about spending money there. They are a charity organization that helps those in need around the world. Good coffee, good people.

reviews.name: Abraham M.
reviews.review: My favorite thing to drink here is the hot chocolate. I'm not a coffee person so my next favorite thing to drink are the smoothies. All of them are perfect. This coffee shop is SO much better than Starbucks! The quesadillas are delicious. The workers are so nice! It's nice to have a place that supports a good cause.

reviews.name: Max P.
reviews.review: I really enjoy this cozy little coffee shop. Large range of drinks and they do s great pour over! Also, a portion of their profits get donated to charity and that's enough reason to come, right there! Definitely a go-to if you're in the Green Hills area!

reviews.name: Garon J.
reviews.review: Great hip place for locals to go and work or hang out. The service is great and you have to try the iced coffee brew "cold brew" if you love coffee.

reviews.name: Mary E.
reviews.review: I love businesses that give back! The Well is a non-profit that donates to great causes, helping provide clean drinking water to those in need. The look and the feel of The Well is what I'd call down home modern. The mixture of a wood-slatted entrance and polished wood plank tables with high exposed ceilings and hanging mason jar lights make it hard to call it anything else. Unfortunately as other reviewers have mentioned, there are a good deal of chatty college kids, but I'm not here for work so it doesn't bother me much. The food is decent, nothing special. I also had a Vanilla Chai tea (my favorite) which was delicious, but I'd have to guess it was at least 1/3 foam, so I suggest going for the larger size. Make it count. I'm not too jazzed about the price; a couple pieces of bread and cheese and a 16oz. tea were just shy of $9, but hey, I'm gainfully employed and it's for a good cause. All in all I dig The Well (get it? get it??) as an occasional Chai stop, but I don't recommend it for serious lunch/dinner or for working.

reviews.name: Megan K.
reviews.review: Cozy coffeehouse in the heart of Nashville. I love the prayer wall and socially conscious swag they sell in their store... I've never tried the pastries that they offer, but they always look tantalizing. It's a fabulous place to host a meeting--I love going here.

reviews.name: Louis N.
reviews.review: The well is a fantastic coffee house experience. Located by a college campus, there are plenty of students around, but all of their coffee tastes great and the people who work there always seem happy to be there. On top of that, their business does a lot of good work to give back to people. You can buy purses and mugs and stuff to help people in 3rd world countries too. Way better than a Starbucks, and better priced. I think it's one of the better locally owned coffee shops.

reviews.name: Dana S.
reviews.review: I love the Well. Their drinks are tasty (especially their seasonals), their paninis are the bomb, and mooost of the time, their music creates the perfect chill coffeehouse vibe (except last night when the baristas were singing Usher while I was studying for an exam - makes it really hard not to join them). There are a few things that exclude the Well from my perfect coffeehouse list though. First, there are only a few places where you can sit and access electrical outlets. It has wayyyy upgraded from the old Well in Green Hills, but is still lacking in the outlets. Second, I always feel like I'm paying a little much for my coffee. Their profits go toward creating water wells in third world countries, which is awesome and justifies the extra .50 to 1.00, but that means I can't make it a regular study place because grad school steals all of my money. All in all, they have a great mission with lots of good things to eat and drink, and the people that work there are especially nice. So go pay them a visit and help get some clean water to people in need!

reviews.name: Garner G.
reviews.review: Great place to get out of the office, amazing staff, great coffee and easy parking.

reviews.name: Jean S.
reviews.review: Staff was ambivalent. Coffee wasn't that great, and kinda expensive. Maybe they should let the customers know beforehand that they are having church services in the place, complete with communion. I didn't feel comfortable sitting in there to have my coffee. The bathroom wasn't as horrible as some of the other reviews described.

reviews.name: Tracy D.
reviews.review: I tried this coffee shop out for the first time today, and I will definitely NOT be returning. The coffee is decent, but I was immediately taken aback by how rude the staff is. I had a simple question about their products and I was made to feel like an idiot who cannot recognize high quality ingredients. Complete snobs, I do not recommend it.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: In Green Hills next to the Copper Kettle is the coffeehouse that cares. You are effectively part of that caring and a Good-Doer just by shopping for coffee here. Profits from the coffeehouse help others abroad with pure water wells. The Well coffee is good too. A single-cup pourover method of coffee works smoothly with several bean brews to choose. For those wanting instant coffee gratification already prepared coffee is an option. A fresh variety of pastries pair well with the drinks, and the crumbly coffeecake is one that I particularly enjoyed. Drink alternatives include strawberry or mango smoothies. I like the unpretentious friendly Well staff, and the ambience is also not too shabby. Enjoying drinks and pastries at this non-profit cafe is good, and even better knowing I'm supporting their Good-Doer mission of clean drinking water in third world countries.

reviews.name: Matt W.
reviews.review: Read Tart's review... I could not have said it better myself. Myself and several colleagues regularly meet here for work meetings and great coffee.

reviews.name: Casey H.
reviews.review: YUMMMMM!!! That would sum it up but Marcia may give me the evil eye if that was all I wrote. :p Service is always friendly and quick. They have moved since last year but still in East Nasty. They have a few tables set up but I normally pick it up because I don't want people to see me pigging out. Each pound of crawfish is $6.49 (up to 9, it's gets cheaper if you buy more) and 2lbs is usually enough for lil' ole me. They also have other items like shrimp, sausage, jambalaya and frozen crab (that you have to cook yourself). Not for me... I'm just there for the crawdads!

reviews.name: Adam B.
reviews.review: Don't judge a book by it's cover. They use the parking lot and space of an old restaurant while they actually sell everything outside in the parking lot. With that out of the way, on to the mudbugs! Good lord are they delicious. Just walk up, order 3 pounds, and start eating. We got a side of corn and potatoes, which was the only disappointing thing. They tasted great but for a $1.50, I was expecting more than two potatoes and one half piece of corn. Still, that one complaint aside, I would go back every day if I could to eat the crawfish.

reviews.name: Roy S.
reviews.review: Mmmm.. I can tell if a pizza is from Sal's or not just after one taste.  They have one of the best marinara sauces around. Bet!  And the people, everybody is always friendly and chatting it up with you when you come in. I cant always understand what they are saying but we both smile and never had any issues with them. I really like it because it's a true pizza restaurant unlike all the chain stores that just focus on delivery and don't really have a dining area. Sal's will sell you a slice or an XXLarge pizza, whatever you want.  Plus, you can grab a beer with it and chill in the dining room watching TV. Where else you gona have a $10 lunch buffet with everything from pizza to fajitas. Mmm. Shit! I'm going to Sal's right now. That's how good it is.

reviews.name: Billy H.
reviews.review: I was really exited to try out Sal's. We've lived over here by the lake for a few years & have always talked about trying it. Last weekend we decided to order a pizza to eat before we left town. We skimmed the menu & decided on the Sal's Tropical Sicilian square, which is a thick crust, square pizza with pineapple & ham for $12.99. I called it in & they said it would be about 25 minutes. I arrived at the restaurant about 20 minutes after I called. The place is kind of small. It's sandwiched between two gas stations, the parking lot is always busy with cars moving to & from. Inside, it's your average pizza place. Looks like they have an areas set up for a lunch buffet. The place could use a little editing. A lot of random stuff around. There's a large office desk up from when you come in with two office chairs & junk on the desk. I walked up to the cashier & 3 employees were there talking about something. I stood there for about a minute until I was acknowledged. I gave the lady by debit card & she swiped it on an iPad & spun it around for me to sign & gave me my pizza. I got her (the pizza) home & was ready to dive in. My boyfriend is a food blogger & we happen to have a ruler in the kitchen, you know, as you do. Maybe the 12inX12in is a precooking size, because ours was 10.5in by 11in. We lost out on 28.5 square inches of pizza!! Anyway, back to the pizza. At first bite, I thought something was a little off. I love all pizza, thick, thin, regular, extra crust, not crust, but this was odd. I ate a couple slices and decided that it was maybe they use a butter spray to line the pan, that & it's cooked in a smokey oven, maybe? The bread of the crust didn't have much of a flavor but of the butter spray & a smoke flavor. Overall I wasn't that impressed with the pizza. Lots on here seem to love it, but I guess I'm not one of them.

reviews.name: Brian E.
reviews.review: Well we ordered Sals tonight and we haven't even tasted the pizza yet because it's been almost 2 hours since we ordered. We were told an hour wait time. Now we were just told it will be another 20 minutes. I don't know if I've ever waited two hours on a pizza before. They sure didn't offer any kind of refund either. Oh yea and you pay $5 delivery fee which is not a big deal at all except the fact it's been 2 HOURS!!! I don't care if the pizza is amazing once it gets here, the service is flat out horrible. Not even an apology.

reviews.name: Jeff H.
reviews.review: MANAGEMENT CHANGED!This place used to be run by real Italians and had the best buffet around!, but now, it is HORRIBLE! Store in for lunch recently after not having been here for a while. It has changed dramatically . There are no Italians working here. All Latin Americans. Do yourself a favor. Go somewhere else. This place used to be great. It is a shame what has happened to it!

reviews.name: Cameron R.
reviews.review: The food is a little high but it was ok. I might try his place again. I don't know what the hype is all about.

reviews.name: Sandy T.
reviews.review: I've been going to Sal's pizza for over 10 years! In fact, we used to go to the old one (Picnic Pizza) before it branched out to this one. My friends from Italy introduced me to this tiny hole in the wall pizzeria...back then I think the owners didn't speak much of anything but Italian. They used to have an American cashier and server which was convenient! Ha!Their hand tossed crust has always been good...you know...that good kind that you can fold over and just take a bite out of the huge slice...and enjoy the combination of flavors and textures...without burning your mouth bc it's too hot and you can twist to eat it! Their salads are filled with black and green olives and cheese...an interesting alternative to the typical house salad. Great vinaigrette dressing I might say..simple, but just the right touch of spices in olive oil and vinegar. Tonight we had the Square Sicilian pizza crust with a savory tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella cheese and veggies!The crust is crispy...not soggy...or doughy...just perfect! Sauce is savory - Oreganoish, but simple and fresh.Fresh mozzarella and veggies to top! Excellent weekend dinner! $9.99 for small pizza! (My husband and I couldn't finish it!)During the week they also offer lunch buffet for the Italian food lovers...at a very cheap price! Oh and before you ask for the check my friends...you must "leave the gun and take the cannoli." It's just to die for!

reviews.name: Step C.
reviews.review: Great taste, buffet, atmosphere. The Stromboli is to die for. I want to live across from this place and only eat here for the rest of my life. Will be back.

reviews.name: Chad S.
reviews.review: NY style pizza. Great crust, serves Peroni, and right by my hotel! Win, win, and win!

reviews.name: Nancy F.
reviews.review: Meatballs were tender and wonderful. The 2 pasta dishes, not so good.  Listened to a male server good up an order, deliver a pizza to a table then tell the customers not to touch it because it was "goin' back". What?!?!   Wonder were the owner is?  No training here.

reviews.name: Andrae A.
reviews.review: I don't have any stars to give but I had to pick one. Planned all week to take an extended lunch with my co-workers. After paying for the buffet $11 I proceeded to the dining room to find a table. All were dirty and my request for a table wipe down went unanswered. I went ahead and cleaned the table, should have left but they were busy so I let it slide. all food bins were empty except for the meatballs. grabbed 3 of those and some tea. After 30 minutes and 4 trips to see if the food had been replenished it sadly it had not. I requested a refund and offered to pay for what I did eat. The cashier told me that he would not refund my money and that it was my responsibility to check the bar before I sat down. He further stated that since I ate the meatballs that as far as he was concerned I was fully fed. All I can say is wow and never again. My co-workers decided to wait a while longer but I excused myself and waited outside. 15 minutes later they came out disappointed.

reviews.name: Johny A.
reviews.review: How can an Italian eatery serving pizza not know what a zeppoli is? Very disappointing! Overall , at least their pizza is good , probably the best in Nashville! And that's only cause Nashville lacks good restaurants! And food chains don't count as , Pizza Hut & hooters and so on ....

reviews.name: Adam N.
reviews.review: Terrible! Don't go there, you will regret it. The absolute worst buffet around. CiCi's would be better and cheaper than this fake Italian.

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: Well i heard they stop using any pork. Sound fishy to me. How is the pepperoni?  Sausage?  Someone tell me about this?  Is it true?  If so I'll never eat here again.  Pork is awesome.

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: Wow. Glad I found this little gem. The white pizzas are fantastic. Will continue to come back for years to come.

reviews.name: Rambo C.
reviews.review: We moved down from NJ over 30 years ago.  Sal's is the closest pizza to a "local pizza joint" that we have found.  Not fancy, not unusual, just good basic pizza at a fair price.  If you want designer California pizza, don't bother.  If you want good Italian pizza with good ingredients (like enough sauce, which few offer here) then you may want to try Sal's.

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: Born and raised in New York. I moved to Nashville for work and was so worried I would not find good Italian food (other than my own kitchen of corse :)) Sal's has great food. Reminds me of home. Pizza has great crust and the canzones are on the money! Great prices and great staff. I'm really impressed. I live 2 minutes away and I could not be happier. Keep up the good work!

reviews.name: C C.
reviews.review: back in town for a visit, hosts recommended Sal's for pizza.  Had the Sal's Pesto Vegetarian, and was quite pleased with it.  Solid pesto, tasty sundried tomatoes, generous amount of spinach, and a good amount of feta to boot.  My hosts normally get Sal's Special, shared a piece of mine. and said they will definitely get the Pesto Vegetarian next time.   :-)

reviews.name: Chris G.
reviews.review: I stopped in for lunch with a co-worker who said that they used to come here a lot and it had a good buffet. I know It might sound like I'm cheap but 12 bucks for the lunch buffet with a drink was way to expensive for this place. The pizza wasn't that bad, now don't get me wrong it was nothing to write home about either. It was like Sabarro only not as good. They we're a close tie for the same amount of grease though. I do have to say that at least the banana pudding had crisp vanilla wafers, so that made the instant mix taste a little bit better.  The place wasn't dirty but it wasn't really clean either. When I went to the bathroom they had a sign that said....... " We know how many places to choose from when eating out. Our goal each day is to make sure we keep our restrooms sparkling clean ever day for our customers. Thank you for choosing Sal's Pizza today." I can honestly say that on that day, they failed miserably at their goal. The place stunk to all get out it and it looked as though it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. So needless to say this isn't on my top 5 pizza places in town. I usually visit a place twice before I give it a bad review but this place I just couldn't bring myself to spend another 12 bucks on a sup par meal that I don't like that much. Again the pizza isn't horrible, it's just not that good either.

reviews.name: Joe J.
reviews.review: I'm from NY so its hard to review Nashville pizza.  As one of the few "NY style" places here, its always been decent.  Great compared to Nashville, and the equivalent of an "edible" NY pizza. they only have slice pies it seems if you go during early lunch otherwise its stale.  They have changed management within the past few months.  Not an improvement.  As silly and trivial as this sounds, what irritated me about my last visit was after paying for 2 slices and a drink, I asked for a tiny cup of ranch.  Which they now charge 25 cents for.  A cup with about 3 teaspoons of ranch.  granted its 25 cents.  But there is just something that rubs me the wrong way when a place charges for condiments.

reviews.name: Marty D.
reviews.review: We ordered pizza and sub's when some friends came over. The pizza crust and toppings were great, fresh and proportional to the amount of sauce and cheese. So thumbs up there. I personally was disappointed with the sub's...all bread...nothing else.  Others said the sub's were "SOGGY" and that was because of the Italian dressing and grease. The pizza was good enough to cover the misstep of the sub's.

reviews.name: Joseph L.
reviews.review: In update to my prior review, I am pleased to announce that Sal is opening a new location in Murfreesboro. It will be owned and managed by him. Again Sal sold this Stewarts Ferry Location a few years ago and he cannot be responsible for the quality. You can find out about the new location at Sals Murfreesboro dot com.

reviews.name: John M.
reviews.review: This place was awful, BBQ chicken should not taste like sweet and sour sauce and for the amount of food was expensive... Avoid at all costs

reviews.name: Phil S.
reviews.review: We've been hearing about Sal's for a while but never seemed to make it in. Today we decided you just do it. So glad we did! Sal's Stromboli is the best I've ever had. The wife had Chicken Alfredo and LOVED it. We'll definitely be back! The service is equally as good as the food.

reviews.name: Charlie S.
reviews.review: This is the best pizza we've had in Nashville so far.  The crust is nice and thin and the pizza tastes similar to the little places back home in the north.  During lunch we like the slice deal and the buffet.  The service is good too.  All around we really enjoy this place.

reviews.name: Zaq H.
reviews.review: Count on reviews from people that appreciate the quality of food rather than those that rate Waffle Houses, parking and  outdoor smoking areas.  This place is great!

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: I've had Sal's pizza 'to go' several times and it's always been really good. The crust is thin and the perfect balance between crispy and floppy. The sauce definitely tastes fresh and the cheese is perfect as well. I've only encountered a service problem once and for some reason it took about 10 days to get our pizza that night. Not exactly sure what happened because my bf was the one inside dealing with it. I was in the car fuming and ready to start gnawing on my own arm. Today we tried the lunch buffet because I had 2 cards for free lunch buffets. Otherwise I would probably never pay $8.99 + tax for a pizza buffet. The pizza was pretty awesome, of course. I also liked the fried cheese raviolis. I got a piece of the garlic bread but it was dripping with so much oil/butter/grease/whatever I couldn't eat it. I didn't try any salad or the pasta salad but they looked decent, although pretty standard. I tried one bite of the lasagna and it was too watery for me. I also noticed the spaghetti and fettuccine were sitting in water. I guess it's so the noodles don't get dry and stick together but it looked pretty unappetizing. Didn't try any desserts. It's pretty safe to say I have little desire for anything else when pizza is around.Bottom line, their pizza is kind of expensive but it's really good. The other stuff didn't really look worth the effort or money.

reviews.name: Michael J.
reviews.review: Very good NY style pizza.  Nice light crust just enough gluten to hold together.  Quality cheese; not greasy.  According to our waitress,  the new owners have removed all pork products from the restaurant.   So, the "bacon" is not made with pork.  My wife thought it tasted fine.  Will definitely ear here again when we're in town.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: Well I have to admit the hype was too big for this place. I was so disappointed when I went here. I was expecting this "Amazing, WOW" food and it was such a let down. I hate to write anything bad about a place. But, I am not a fan of buffet style food.  Too many germs, too many people letting their KIDS help themselves..I hate buffet food. Anyway, here are some pictures. I am not going to say anything more, you will have to eat the food for yourself and JUDGE it..good luck !!!

reviews.name: Andy G.
reviews.review: My family has eaten at Sal's a couple of times and ordered take out a few more.  While their pizza is good, I'll stop short of calling it the best in town.  It's definitely ONE of the best though.  We've also had their Calzones and Sandwiches.  These were pretty awe inspiring.  They crust on the calzones as crisp and nicely brown and the fillings were hot and the cheese melted thoroughly.  (Yes, I've had calzones where this was NOT the case, I'm looking at YOU Sabarro)The sandwiches were nicely toasted with just the right mix of veggies and meets with a bread that wasn't too heavy.  My wife's only complaint is they wrapped the pickle in with the sandwich.All in all, we've had good experiences with Sal's and with it's location so close to us, it really can't be beat.

reviews.name: Harry B.
reviews.review: This is the best Pizza in Nashville. I've searched for the best I could find in every state I've been. Since the late 70's pizza has lost its magical taste. Its been made cheaper with less everything. I've toured the midwest and northeast where I always found the a few hiding in the wildest places you can imagine. You look in the back to see who's fixing the pizza and sure enough, its an old school guy from the midwest or the northern part of the USA.  Look no farther, Sal's over on Stewarts Ferry Pike has the real deal in the back making these beauty's. Nice people and great Pizza. Thanks for keeping it real.My Opinion, Harry Brett

reviews.name: Cynthia H.
reviews.review: Tried this lovely kept secret my first day moving in, less than a mile from Sal's. The Stromboli is absolutely delicious and makes me thing I'm in Italy!! I've continued to patronize this little establishment and we've ordered by delivery a number of times!! Always happy with our orders! Very tasty and well presented.

reviews.name: Stefanie S.
reviews.review: I have had the pizza at Sal's at least a dozen times and it's always good. The last time I had it, it was just okay - pepperoni pizza drowning in grease. It just wasn't appealing. Usually it's amazing, so I am writing my last experience as hopefully a one off.The reason I'm giving Sal's 4 stars today though is because of their lasagna. Wow. Where do I even begin? This is probably, no definitely, the BEST beef lasagna I have ever had. The sauce is rich in tomato flavor, the cheeses blend and are perfect. I had leftovers because the portion is decent sized and it was even better the next day. I will definitely be ordering the lasagna from Sal's again. Try it and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Christi R.
reviews.review: I've eaten here several times & I'm a huge fan. I usually order a pizza just for myself to take home. It's the best leftover pizza I've ever had.

reviews.name: John P.
reviews.review: Let me preface this by saying I was born and raised in Chicago so it is hard for me to give out 5 stars in this category. I stopped by Sals today because I read the great reviews on the buffet but I came in at 2:15 and the buffet was over. I wanted to try it out anyway so I ordered a slice of sausage and first of all the pizza was the best I've had down here in nashville and I've tried 4 or 5 places. I especially liked the sauce, overall it was a great slice. And on top of that when I opened the box there were 2 slices of pizza. They are good people making good food. I will be back.

reviews.name: Kristine S.
reviews.review: Not good. I've had better pizza. And there was a mix up with the bill. Don't think we will be going back.

reviews.name: Jason T.
reviews.review: What we had was great (calzone and the sweet sausage roll). They were very busy and messed up our order a bit, but gave us an order of cheese sticks to munch on while we waited. To 'apologize' they upsized the roll from a small to a large, but then charged us for a large roll. Despite all that they still deserve a good review. The food was excellent.

reviews.name: C W.
reviews.review: I was lured here by a "Pizza Connoisseur" who assured me this was the best Pizza in Nashville.  Intrigued I made the venture to Sals and here's my take:1.  Best Pizza in town?  Not even close.  Its greasy, soft and while to some that may be appealing I believe you can achieve more with less.  Less cheese, less dough, just do it right.  This is a greasey cheese bomb so if that's what you are aiming for by all means go for it.  Flavor wise I give it a big "Meh"2.  Service:  Sal's crew is friendly and down to earth.  No issues here and undoubtedly that has one them regulars.3.  Prices:  Its cheap and should be.4.  Ambiance:  Think tired 70's diner.   Am I going back?  NoLife Expectancy?  Heart attack in the next few years

reviews.name: Shane M.
reviews.review: Best pizza around! New York style! Their other food is good too! Grinders etc! They do slices during the day and evening as well. Id suggest them to anyone in the area!

reviews.name: John F.
reviews.review: Awesome changes to the place. Still the same quality and variety. Upgraded the salad bar options and now offering buffet including drink for $8.99. Great deal for the quality.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: I live right down the street from Sal's and eat here whenever I need to load up on carbs. I love that they deliver, so on days where I don't feel like putting on real clothes or cooking, I can have a yummy meal delivered. Their pizza is super yummy. All of the ingredients are fresh and they have a good selection of toppings. They also have a good selection of pasta dishes, but sometimes they stop serving pasta at a certain time during the week and it isn't very clear to me what time that happens; sometimes 7 pm sometimes 8pm. Meatballs are delicious and I'm a huge fan of their marinara sauce. Lasagna is full of cheesy goodness and probably my favorite pasta dish I've had there. Skip the Alfredo, its not so good. The service is spotty. I've had great service and not so great service. It seems like the last few times I've been in there, the server has seemed like they were confused and they spent a lot of time in the kitchen. I like Sal's. It's yummy and close to my home so I will keep going back. It's definitely worth a try.

reviews.name: Mike S.
reviews.review: Nice people, pizza was pretty good! I'll go back!

reviews.name: Piyush S.
reviews.review: I used to give 4 stars to Sals pizza. It was the ultimate pizza ny style pizza I could get in nashville. But off late, the quality of pizza has dipped a lot. The pizza base used to be fresh and you could fold the slices and eat them. Now the pizzas are not not fresh, the base is like a papa johns base. The quality of cheese used to be really good and it is pathetic now. Frankly, I am never going here again and for the price you pay here, I could get 2 large pizzas in dominos which is way better than sals. At least, there is a consistency in taste and its worth the price.Sal's has been such a disappointment.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: When you think of the combination of Nashville and Pizza, pork and run of the mill pies come to mind. Sal's... well Sal's is the first and only true New York Style pizzeria that I have found outside of NYC with great New York style pies.Yeah they are a hole in wall place between two gas stations, but then again so is Rotiers, minus the gas stations. Though I only have had their lunch buffet, I must say the food is amazing. The pizza comes in big slices and is fresh from the oven. The garlic bread is delicious and the selection of pasta and salad for a lunch buffet is really good.My only 2 gripes, hence the -1 star, are that for the buffet, they are somewhat slow to replenish the food, and that they only have marinara sauce for the pasta. Is it to much to ask for Alfredo sauce as well?Overall though, for the lunch buffet this place is still a bargain for the quality of food you get, far out doing CiCi's Pizza which though less expensive, has no where near the quality.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: Not professional.  Not very good.  Barely a buffet.How on earth do you have pizza buffet with room for only six pies, and on top of that, fill only three of the slots for lunch buffet?The pizza is nothing special.  The service was nice, but again, nothing that's outstanding, and at $10 for their tiny buffet with a drink, just not worth it.

reviews.name: David K.
reviews.review: Service mediocre, pizza 4/10, not thin crust. Lasagna was horrible

reviews.name: Laura D.
reviews.review: almost cold pizza delivered late; was told that i would get sweet italian sausage but got spicy sausage instead. total loss = $17.00

reviews.name: Brent D.
reviews.review: Off I40 at Stewarts Ferry Pike, in the connected to Mapco.  Since moving here, I've been a couple times with people from work.  Its one of the only places around that I know that does slices.  They also do a lunch buffet.  The pizza is fantastic, but on the greasy side, but I dont mind that.  I recommend this place.

reviews.name: Elizabeth J.
reviews.review: Great pizza! Thin crust but not too thin. Good sauce balance. Way better than the other chain choices near Donelson

reviews.name: Patrick H.
reviews.review: I really like Sal's Pizza. Great sauce, thin crust...the cheese is on point and you couldn't ask for a better pizza. I could have Sal's all the time, but my wallet won't allow me to do so! Please lower your prices so I can order your pizzas every time I feel the need for you! Everytime I think of pizza I think, "SAL'S!!! Oh wait, can't afford it. Jet's?"

reviews.name: RL B.
reviews.review: Great pizza! My wife and I were staying just around the corner. we read a few reviews and decided to give it a try as we ha been generally disappointed so far. We ended up with a very basic pizza margarita and several greek salads. The salads were standard fare but the pizza was something akin to what we have tasted in NYC. We had the hand tossed crust and it was great, I would recommend this place to anyone looking to grab a decenteal without having to travel back into downtown Nashville!

reviews.name: Robert M.
reviews.review: Well, when you are on the road and in airport hotels I'll give Sal's this...they deliver and is a better choice than the typical substandard chains.  It's not great, it's not horrible.  The crust falls short, I wouldn't call this a thin crust, more like an average crust.  The problem though is that it is a tough crust, not that crispy yet chewy crust that you look for.  While you can fold this slice, the toughness doesn't allow the perfect fold.  It's more like a bend than a fold.  The flavor of the crust was very bland as well, and no char on the upskirt.  Sauce was pretty good, had some spice to it.  I would like to see a bit more sauce on the pie.  The cheese was standard, not that wow cheese that pulls away from your mouth on bite.  Overall, not a bad choice if you are stuck at a hotel and are too lazy to go out.  I've had a lot worse at airport hotels (yeah, I'm talking about you Kansas City, St. Louis, Oklahoma City...and on and on and on...  I give it 2.5 stars rounded to 3 for delivery for lazy people...from the NY Pizza Guy.

reviews.name: Tom G.
reviews.review: I am a sixteen wheeler and Sal's is my diesel life-blood.  I want to live in a world where my children, and my children's children get to experience the savory nuttiness that is Sal's.  Even if I wasn't sprayed by a skunk, I would take a bath in their tomato sauce (assuming that swimming naked in it wasn't an option).  Then I would proclaim myself president of PepperoniLand and appoint Sal's as chief ambassador to awesomeness.

reviews.name: Amy W.
reviews.review: Best pizza in Nashville! Sal's is down the road from my house, so it's on my list of close, good food when I have company or don't feel like cooking. I like that its local, not some cookie-cutter chain. It's a great little hole in the wall, where the staff know my name and I've liked everything I've tried.

reviews.name: Sam L.
reviews.review: Pretty high in price for what you get, but the pizza was tasty & the upside is the place is right around the corner from where I live.

reviews.name: Pete D.
reviews.review: Maybe I'm spoiled because I live in NY, but this was a big disappointmentfor an Italian restaurant. I got the veal cutlet sandwich and it tasted like processedmeat. Next time I'll go to the Subway's next door.

reviews.name: Riley M.
reviews.review: Never been impressed with the quality of the pizza or service here. It's a quick sop in and out, but don't get your hopes up for anything worth writing home about.

reviews.name: Cara P.
reviews.review: Haven't tried Sal's pizza yet, but we were there the other night & I had the eggplant parmesan.  First, I don't know if I was just really hungry or what, but that dinner salad was DELICIOUS.  The House Italian was heavy on the vinegar, plenty of oregano.  And I like it that they cut the cherry tomatoes in half---so much easier!My eggplant parm was so satisfying.  They serve it atop spaghetti, which makes it  a little harder to eat, but even so---sigh, it was exactly what I wanted!Two comments: they need real tables & chairs instead of the fast-food-style, chair-attached-to-the-table numbers they have now.  And if you're going for the Italian theme, play more Sinatra & ease up on the Elvis pictures.

reviews.name: Melinda P.
reviews.review: I ordered a large pizza $18!!! It was nasty..mushrooms were from a can!  Nothing special about this pizza.

reviews.name: Sarah G.
reviews.review: Pizza was definitely good, and they delivered it to my hotel which was my primary motivation in the first place.  I only had the pepperoni so I'm curious about their specialty combos. A little greasy, but not excessively so.  I can also confirm that it's good for breakfast the next day as well.

reviews.name: Chris B.
reviews.review: Pretty decent pizza place in Nashville...nothing exceptional, but not a disappointment either. Had a pepperoni delivered to the Courtyard Nashville when we stayed there recently...

reviews.name: Nick C.
reviews.review: This is one of our favorite pizza's we've found since moving to Nashville.  I typically call when I leave work and pick it up on the way home.  Always delicious and I prefer patronizing family stores as opposed to chains when I can.

reviews.name: Drew S.
reviews.review: Got some cold sandwiches here on a road trip and was quite impressed. The bread dough seems lot like fluffy pizza dough (good) with some oregano. I'd order double meat, as both subs were a bit light on filling.

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: Touring a few homes the other day and a leasing consultant recommended this spot. I decided to try it and it was pretty ok. I had the vegetarian pizza. Great pizza if you are looking for a quick fix.

reviews.name: elizabeth s.
reviews.review: Huge bonus-ONLINE ORDERING!  just like papa johns and pizza hut.  and you can pay online with a credit card.  huge plus.  we got a stromboli, antipasto salad and a cannoli.  the stromboli was really good, the salad was just like any other pizza place and the italian dressing was good.  the cannoli was amazing, i wish i had ordered more than 1.  this has become our new pizza place (and we're picky-we're from NY)

reviews.name: Emily G.
reviews.review: This is the best pizza in the Nashville/Murfreesboro area. The crust is thin, crispy, and delicious. I got the vegetarian pesto pizza and it was awesome! The staff was friendly, but could be just a little more attentive. I think the prices are fair for the quality and quantity of the ingredients they use. Our large pizza was $15 but it was huge and had feta cheese, pesto, sun dried tomatoes and tons of cheese on it.

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: I'm originally from Chicago, and I'm really particular about pizza, paper thin crust is what most Chicagoans like, despite the myth that everyone from there eats deep dish pizza..I personally hate deep dish pizza.. Well let me get back on the subject which is about Sal's pizza, its good but not great, the crust was about the best thing on the pizza.. it was a little bland, and the sausage on the pizza taste like it was pre-made  from some factory, the mushrooms was from a can (at least it tasted like it was), the sauce was OK, overall I can eat there again, but it wouldn't be on the top of my list. But the pizza does taste better than most chain pizza joints.

reviews.name: Nash B.
reviews.review: just had Sal's pizza this past week.  loved it.  kept craving it for a few days.  great crust.  such fresh ingredients.  i'd recommend anyone to go there.  maybe better than soggy mafiaoza's pizza.  way.  give it a whirl.  you won't be disappointed.  i think it's true Italians running it.

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: Sal's is about as authentic of a New York pizza joint that you'll find around Nashville.  The crust is thin, and the slices are large.  For just $7.99 you can indulge in the all you can eat lunch buffet that includes a couple of different varieties of pizza, meat balls (some of the best I've had), salads, and a few different pastas.  Go hungry and leave with a smile on your face.

reviews.name: John H.
reviews.review: Coming from New York, one of the things I miss the most is great pizza.  Nashville can't seem to get it right.  But Sal's comes real close.  Got a couple take-out pies recently expecting the same old Nashville-area type flavor and was surprised and excited when I tasted that familiar flavor and texture of back home.  Not 100% there, but about the closest I've had in Tennessee and certainly the best in Murfreesboro (they have locations in both Nashville and Murfreesboro).  I highly recommend Sal's.

reviews.name: Randy J.
reviews.review: The Food at Sal's is pretty Good, but the Rude Service and Lack of Attention tells me I won't go back.Too Many places fighting for my Money.  Don't need to be Treated Rudely!

reviews.name: Jay F.
reviews.review: The pizza was bland and they use canned mushrooms ( yuck).  Service was good.

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: i have to put this pizza just behind the upper echelon of nashville pizza: manny's, the place that used to be called picnic pizza (forgot what it is now), and sicily pizza(deeeep in antioch, by the lake). it's really, really good stuff. i'd say probably the best you can find in that part of town. the lunch buffet is outstanding, better than picnic pizza, i'd say.enough reading, start eating!eric b

reviews.name: Dustin M.
reviews.review: Simply, good pizza, and  a lot of it. Sal's is my Friday guilty pleasure spot. On Friday's Sal's has crispy golden calamari on the buffet which makes it all the more attractive. That being said, the real reason I'm there is for the thin, floppy, NY style pizza. The hand kneaded dough has great consistency. It isn't cardboardish whatsoever, and folds nicely as NY style pizza should.  The dough does lack something, however. That certain subtle flavor that truly incredible pizza has, but for a buffet at $9 bucks and some change now you can't complain. The sauce is what really shines, great tang with a hint of fruit that I can't quite put my finger on. Oh, and it's FRESH. The pasta dishes aren't half bad either, but I recommend getting them to order instead of off the buffet, as well, it is buffet pasta. I could review the salad and dessert, but why? We are there for the pizza. The service is as expected, the Italo-hipsters are generally friendly but busy. Recently they remodeled and changed the layout of the buffet to accommodate more pizza and better customer flow. The extra pies really make a difference as the abundance of goodness discourages the slice hoarders. (previously people were stacking up on slices to avoid being stuck without their favorite, leaving others empty handed, or empty stomached until the kitchen could turn out more goodness)   Plan for sometimes difficult parking around lunchtime and go hungry. Your overindulgence awaits.

reviews.name: John G.
reviews.review: I saw the cheap plastic advertisement sign in front of Curious Heart and decided to follow it's arrow, and I am glad that I did.  I ended up in the small converted house that now serves as an intimate setting for the serving of quality Italian food.  For lunch today I had the Walnut Feta Chicken Risotto, and it was just as good as it sounds.  It came with a decent house salad, and two small slices of bread, but the real draw was the Risotto.  It was deliciously creamy, perfectly cooked and tasted amazing.  Even better was that there is enough left over for lunch tomorrow!!

reviews.name: Jake A.
reviews.review: Good solid pizza! Second time I've been here and will definitely be back. Created our own pizza with pepp, spicy sausage, and roasted red peppers! Good overall flavor and quality. Got a few draft beers as well. A little pricy but not terrible.

reviews.name: Simon C.
reviews.review: High priced pizzas and they are very average for the most part. The service is always hit or miss, and beer selection is very limited. The only way I eat pie in the sky these days is if it's pickup and even then you have to be willing to spend $20 after driving to pick it up. Wish something could be done to improve this place - seems to have gone downhill over the years.

reviews.name: Kaitlyn W.
reviews.review: Every time I come to Pie in the Sky I always enjoy it! The pizza is so delicious and the employees are kind! Our waitress was a sweetheart and she was on top of drinks and dirty dishes. After my awful experience at Chili's, I was impressed with the service here.

reviews.name: Deanna S.
reviews.review: Decent food but overpriced. Service is hit or miss. 5 beers on draft. We've ordered Togo a few times but it always ends up being $35-$40 which stinks.(for a large pizza and cheesy bread.?Makes it hard to justify when you can order from somewhere else for less than $20. Last time we were there our server was too young to pour our beer, so each time we ordered one it would be ten minutes before it arrived at our table. Not impressed.

reviews.name: Dan Z.
reviews.review: Food was outstanding. Restaurant was short staffed as a result of weather (actually one of only a handful of places that were open in the city) and they did a great job with our meal. Just one star shy of perfect because our initial order was misplaced; however they made amends. Quality exceeded expectations. Outstanding pizza; getting hungry for more as I write this!

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: Food is amazing! So fresh! New friendly management and helpful staff! Very addicting!

reviews.name: Holly G.
reviews.review: Went here with a few friends for a surprise bridal shower the other night. I think I was coming from the wrong way on Nolensville because it took me forever to actually find where it was. Mostly my own fault though. Definitely sufficient parking and it says it has a 2 hour limit, but in talking to the hostess they basically never enforce it.The service here was really good. Our server, Leigh (I think), was really nice, checked back often, and was just an overall excellent waitress. We got the spinach and artichoke dip to start off, which was pretty good. But you get such a small amount of dip and then basically a pound of these chips to go with it, so I feel like there should be more dip to balance it out. We still had like half the chips left after the dip was gone.I opted for the small ultra thin crust Hawaiian pizza. Since I'm from the Chicago area, I'm kind of a pizza snob so I guess I can't really be a fair judge. I just thought it was alright. I've had far worse, but I've definitely had better. The sauce was actually pretty good, and tasted like it was made from scratch and not just out of a can, so that was a plus. The crust had more of a cornmeal flavor, whereas I prefer more of the flour type dough so it could just be personal preference. Overall, this is a pretty decent place but it wouldn't be my "go-to" pizza joint with all the other good options in town.

reviews.name: Ali S.
reviews.review: My favorite pizza spot in Nashville.  I was a regular in the cool springs location but unfortunately they closed down.  This location is just as good.  I always get the Happy Family pizza and it never disappoints.  What set them apart is the higher quality topping compared to other pizza joints.

reviews.name: Tim B.
reviews.review: I love sneaking away for lunch here.  Their calzones are excellent and very filling.  Big bonus....they have a bar!They are so much better than your fast food Italian places.  The atmosphere is also very nice inside and out.

reviews.name: Jessica B.
reviews.review: Went later on a weekday night, so they were not very busy. I had bigger expectations about the place than I should have. I wanted to be surprised by the pizza and other offerings but I left disappointed. Service was okay and the pizza was average. I do like the fact they fresh toppings but there was almost an over abundance on our pizza. Sauce lacked flavor and the crust was nothing too spectacular. I wouldn't see myself going out of my way to eat here again, especially living so far away.

reviews.name: Da Deacon H.
reviews.review: Ok so after a disappointing first time visit to Pie In the Sky Pizza, i decided to give them another try....I ordered a pepperoni pizza and I must say IT WAS REALLY GOOD!!..my waitress was very polite and friendly! My last complaint was about how the cook was dressed but this time around he looked like a cook doing the damn thing! (that's a good thing!) I felt more relaxed or more so less cautious with my food this time around. Even though there were a decent amount of people in there, I didn't have to wait long for my order and the waitress made sure I was comfortable and my glass full! Sooo lesson learned, never judge a book by its cover or the first couple of pages the first time! Everyone has an off day...:) I will be returning!

reviews.name: Adam C.
reviews.review: Started out great had a spiral breadstick it was great. They sat us promptly and took our order we had the familia pie which we waited way too long for and they almost served it to another table. Then the wait staff just disappeared - really. Just gone. No one filled drinks or brought us a box, nothing. I am watching the other tables no one has food they are all looking around? I took the 10 minutes plus we have been waiting for our waitress to come back to write this review.  Honestly the pizza was not bad I liked it. But probably won't be back. The big window into the kitchen is cool but hey owners/management you gotta get some help and get faster faster in the kitchen. I know pizza takes a few but seriously.  Not real happy with the price for what we had either. I probably won't be back.

reviews.name: Lisa D.
reviews.review: Went there with my daughter and was seated promptly.  Waitress was nice. We were the only ones in there.  When our food came out it was room temperature.  I did not eat mine and my daughter ate very little of hers.  I am hoping may be it was just an off day for them.

reviews.name: Jamee C.
reviews.review: I live right in Lenox so this place is one of those, "yeah, let's swing nearby for food" kind of places for me. The food personally hasn't ever blown my mind but it's of decent quality for a casual meal. I've ordered the same thing 3 out of 4 times I've visited here which is the Firecracker pasta. I personally love spicy food and in my experience, most "supposedly" spicy pastas in most Italian places aren't spicy enough for me and this one brings adequate heat. Their cocktails are pretty decent as well.

reviews.name: Lisa J.
reviews.review: I wouldn't post as gluten free. Not celiac friendly. Can't even get a salad without croutons.

reviews.name: Allie R.
reviews.review: Had dinner with my husband here.  We ordered their meat lovers pizza and their cheesy bread.  I do not know what kind of bread they use but I did not like it.  I was tough and chewy, had to do that whole bite and yank thing with it....cute....  The meat lovers was mediocre tasting.  Nothing really stood out as delicious.  The atmosphere is strange.  The little lightning things everywhere?  What are those?  It is a majorly half-assed "space theme" I guess.  Very bright lighting, boring cold interior.  It's too bad because the porch seems kind of cute and the outside makes it look like it's going to be a really cute pizzeria inside.  What a let down.

reviews.name: Leslie R.
reviews.review: I've passed this place for years and decided to give them a try. Not worth the price by far.

reviews.name: Stefanie M.
reviews.review: We've been three times in the past couple of months and we've decided that it is really just hit or miss.  We got the fried mushrooms the first time and they were amazing!!!  The second time we went for them baked.....meh.  Third time we went back to fried and received the wrong dipping sauce (once you've tried the sauce you'll understand why the wrong sauce is such drama!) and they seemed really full of water or something (but not grease).  If I were to guess?  They had been sitting in the walk-in for too long so the mushrooms absorbed a lot of moisture?  We've had a pizza or two which were good (pricey!) and one or two of the pastas and everything is good.Service is interesting......it's never bad, but also never warm and fuzzy???...for lack of a better phrase!

reviews.name: Caitlin P.
reviews.review: I would have to say the advertised boneless wings should really be described as bites. The smallest I've seen, they are tasty but tiny. Also a small pizza is really a personal pan, 4slices. I was surprised but thankful that I had ordered a small pizza and a half order of wings with my partner for take out. The benefit of small portions is that I didn't feel badly having a scoop of homemade Icecream after this dining experience, or you could just head over to Menchies for a sweet treat post dinner.

reviews.name: Barry S.
reviews.review: Really good pizza. Me and my fiancée loved it. Ordered the Carnivore with fries. Awesome service as well.

reviews.name: Joan C.
reviews.review: Food: Ordered a "Greek" salad. It was pretty pitiful with just white chunks of what I think was romaine lettuce with some tasteless feta cheese and a lackluster dressing. I was excited to see they used kalamata olives instead of canned black olives but they tasted terrible! Just poor quality. I had the Herbivore pizza. The crust was okay and that's about all I can say about it. My friend had the Happy Family pizza and thought it was pretty good.Service: Our very young waiter was doing the best he could. He hasn't yet figured out how to make the most out of a trip from one area to another making service very slow. Restaurants just do not train wait staff very well at all anymore. Ended up spending  too much money on mediocre pizza!

reviews.name: Alexandria R.
reviews.review: I don't know why people complain about slow service when it comes to new people. Everyone is new at some point, give them a break.The pizza is always really good, the quality is excellent for not being a super fancy place. The cost is a little on the high side, but you're really paying for the portions. The food is excellent and they always give you a lot.Their wings are to die for. I love this place and I'm soooo not a pizza person.

reviews.name: Cara M.
reviews.review: Typically really good pizza. Little expensive so we only get it every so often. This trip I had a coupon that I provided over the phone. When i picked up pizza, they informed me it was only for dine in. The guy said he would use it but only this one time. Little annoying that they didn't tell me that on the phone, but whatever.

reviews.name: Samantha F.
reviews.review: WAAAAAY too over priced!! It's insane, then you think your getting quality food because it's so much but it's crap!

reviews.name: Laila S.
reviews.review: pretty good crust and sauce, but you pay for it. If you don't mind paying for good American style pizza, then check these guys out. close to work, so we sometimes go for lunch, never crowded (in fact the last 2 times there was a max of 3 tables)The Calzone is great, with even some leftovers.

reviews.name: Jason W.
reviews.review: Tried to order a pizza from Pie in The Sky tonight in Lenox Village. They no longer deliver pizzas unless your order is over $20. Our order was going to be $15. Since the refused to deliver we ordered from Papa Johns for $11 and they delivered. When I called back to talk to manager to make sure I was understanding correctly, she proceeded to tell me that the GM makes the rules and she has no say so. Asked how they can expect to compete with other pizza joints in area (Amico's, Jets, Papa Johns, Pizza Hut etc)...told her that was bad business practice and we would like to support businesses within the village but this makes it difficult. She said if people decide to order elsewhere then that is their choice. SO that will be our choice from now on.   I told her not only do they have poor service in dining area but now poor business practices for those that want to order pizzas from them for delivery. She said to make a complaint online if I wanted. Didn't even offer to have GM call me.While the pizza here is quiet good (better than Papa Johns, Pizza Hut etc) the service is typically really bad and customer service is non-existent.  Very inexperienced staff that has no idea how to run a restaurant.  It has been this way for at least the past 5 years.  No improvement.  Now with a minimum purchase of $20 required, don't expect to order just  large pizza and have it delivered, even if you live less than a mile from the restaurant.

reviews.name: Charles S.
reviews.review: My wife and I stopped by for a late lunch on a Saturday. There were two servers on and the restaurant appeared to still be picking up the pieces from a busy lunch. We asked to be seated outside, and every table was either seated or covered in the garbage left behind by parents with kids or groups of people having several beers. We ordered drinks and then our food, and waited probably 20 minutes to receive one small, thin crust pizza and the firecracker penne pasta. The pasta was sufficiently al dente, but the sauce was certainly more sweet than anything else; although there was a fair amount of Italian sausage and pepperoni in the dish, there was nothing that would inspire me to label it as a "firecracker". As a plus, the sauce appeared to be legitimately scratch made, there were considerable chunks of reduced tomato, albeit canned. The pizza was covered in cheese and toppings and the thin crust was quite crisp and flaky, my wife was thoroughly satisfied, although did question the value of the size and price equation.Considering what she was being asked to do, our waitress did an admirable job, but we definitely had to wait a bit to both request and then receive the check. Shortly before we received our food, it appeared there was a management shift change or perhaps a visit from the owner, because both servers and the duty manager came out and began to clean the wrecked patio. Just after we received our food, the server taking care of the table behind us came out the door with enough force to lose the pizza tray he was carrying and he dropped half a pizza on the floor. His reflexes were fairly quick, but the damage had been done, and I had a front row seat for the reaction from the table and the subsequent interactions with the manager. The restaurant handled it well from what I could tell, even though one of the guests was a bit prickly. Food+drinks+service+tax for this experience equaled just shy of 40 bucks. Not the best value, at least not on the weekend I guess.In short, I've been to this location and the one in Cool Springs, and had been relatively satisfied in the past. This particular experience was lacking, but I will certainly give them another try if I feel like pizza.

reviews.name: Libby B.
reviews.review: You will never, ever leave here hungry. In fact, someone will probably have to roll you out to your car. Coming here pretty much ensures that you are going to eat your weight in food, and be absolutely thrilled about it.I have by no means tried everything on their menu, but what I have had was superb. The White Pie, with the extra thin crust, is heavenly. And since it's thin crust I can convince myself it's healthier! I have also indulged in their shoestring fries, which are ever so tasty, especially with their apple cinnamon ketchup! The spiral cheese bread is also very tasty, and you can get it for free with a foursquare check-in and a bill over $25! Always ask for their homemade ranch to dip your fries or chips in, it really is to die for. The spinach dip is also a favorite, and will not last very long on a table!The service here is impeccable. I have never waited too long or had a bad experience with any of my servers. And I highly recommend sitting out on the patio when the weather is nice, it's a lovely place to unwind from a hectic day!

reviews.name: Green D.
reviews.review: This was my go-to place for carry-out or a reliable good meal.  Love the portobello wrap/sandwich and the stuffed shrooms; the spinach salad is one of the best I've had!  Pizza is outstanding too!!  I've missed it much since my move to Baton Rouge!!

reviews.name: Chris C.
reviews.review: We have been going to this restaurant since it opened, however it has been going downhill.  Tonight was the last straw.  After reviewing our drinks we were informed that they were out of mozzerella cheese.  So we had to alter our order.  We're then notified that one of the replacement items we ordered was 86'd as well.  But the worst is before we left heard the cooks asking each other if they were really out of mozzerella and one said there was some put back in the back.  As we were about to leave saw the cook making a pizza and then run to the back to grab some mozzerella .  When I asked to speak to the manager she quickly tried to cover their tracks saying it was not mozzerella, never apologized or anything just said I did not know what I was talking about.  We said it didn't matter that we would not be coming back and all she said was "oh, okay". And as we got in the car she was surrounded by all the employees talking about us.  Anyway, they will not be getting any more business from us not anyone else we know.

reviews.name: Robert U.
reviews.review: Neat place, nice staff, decent food, but the pizza is not amazing.  The dough has a good texture (thin, but not too crispy), but it is essentially flavorless.  Have you ever had Johnny's New York Pizza (a large chain)?  This pizza is very similar.  Not bad, but very much not special at all.As others have noted, the specialty pizzas are ungodly expensive.  A family can easily bust the $60 barrier.

reviews.name: Melissa A.
reviews.review: Definitely will NOT be coming back here. We were here on 9/12/14 at around 6:30 p.m.  Restaurant was only about half full, so you would expect to have fairly decent service because it wasn't busy. Wrong! Service was terrible. We were about to get up and leave after waiting almost 10 minutes to even be acknowledged by a waiter. We saw the manager realized no one had been to our table and we saw him ask a waiter if it was his table, so we decided to stay.  Service never got any better. Waiter never checked on us after food came, we sat for 15 mins after finishing eating before he looked our way so we could flag him down for our check, etc. We asked to talk to the manager to let him know that we were very disappointed in our first experience.  His response was, "I'm sorry, I'll talk to him. I hope we will see you again, but if not I understand." Really?!? That was it. Nothing to restore any satisfaction to the customer. Very disappointing. Wasn't looking for a free meal, in fact we had already paid before the manager came over, but I would have expected a more sincere response than that. Food - We ordered the Philly cheesesteak pizza and there was so much oil that it was puddled up all over the pan. Not just greasy coated, but actually puddles of oil on the pan. Flavor was ok, but not great. Sausage pizza was pretty good. We won't be going back or referring anyone to this place. Food was not good enough to make up for the terrible service.

reviews.name: Felicia C.
reviews.review: Disgusting. Nothing but a pile of greasy, over seasoned mess. I really wanted to like them. Impossible. Overpriced garbage.

reviews.name: Riley M.
reviews.review: Use to enjoy this place, came 4-5 times. The past 3 times I've came during the week, it's not been busy but the service and kitchen time was unreasonably slow. I didn't even order pizza but the roasted portabella sandwich.  One of those times it actually came out cold, the bread was actually cold as if it had never been toasted or warmed (on a grilled sandwich).I'm not coming back again, considering the prices (which are a bit high for what you get) and the quality (which to me has tapered off)  I'd rather drive somewhere else.

reviews.name: Kristin R.
reviews.review: My husband and I have been to Pie in the Sky before and loved the pizza, so we decided to go back this past weekend because we heard they have a good beer deal.  The service was really friendly, but that was about the only plus of the entire visit.  There were only about 5 tables in the restaurant, and our food still took FOREVER.  We ordered this breadstick appetizer thing, which would have been good had the cheese not melted all over the plate instead of staying inside the breadstick.  About 25 minutes after our appetizer we received the pizza we ordered.  We got a small because we had the appetizer and didn't need much more to eat.  But that pizza was so dang small, even though we were filled with non-cheesy breadstick, we could have eaten about 3 more of those pizzas.  All of this could have been written off as a bad day, but the pricing, they cannot write off.  We spent over 30 dollars and had a bad breadstick, 4 tiny pieces of pizza, a soda, and a couple of beers.  Not acceptable.  Sorry Pie in the Sky.  We will not be back.

reviews.name: Mark C.
reviews.review: Just left this store and will never return as the food and service have fallen to new lows!  After speaking with the manager he only confirmed for me that they really don't care about quality or service. So long as the place is packed with kids and parents who don't care then Pie will never find this patron there again.  There are just to many better places that warrant my dollars.Too bad as Pie used to stand for both quality and service, apparently no more.Giving them a single star is way too much credit.

reviews.name: Cal E.
reviews.review: The service in the bar is bad on good days. The bartender used to be very good but he seems to have left and the woman they have now is possibly the worst bartender I've experienced. The food used to be great, then it went to good, these days it's wholly meh and more times than I like, I have to send it back to get warm food instead of cold.Maybe the other location is better but I'm sad that this once used to be one of my favorite hangouts and now I can't even get a decent rink there.If you have other options, take them.

reviews.name: William M.
reviews.review: I live nearby and have been reluctant to write this review for quite a while now. I don't want the place to fail because it's actually a really good spot and could be and should be much more successful.To start, I moved to Lenox Village before Pie In The Sky was even a blue print. When it first went in it was a hit! It has good, fresh food that doesn't make you feel sick after you eat it, like some pizza and Italian restaurants do. Even though a few select dishes are excellent, I think they could really step up their use of seasoning because the other dishes, even though they are fresh, could use a little more love from the chef who created the menu. They should have that certain unique punch that you can't get anywhere else which makes you crave it and want to come back and pay the prices they command. With regards to the decor, it's not bad. It's actually quite interesting and a great place for the family early on and a group of friends to gather or couples to go for date night.The biggest negative I personally give Pie In The Sky Lenox Village is the lack of attention to detail. Even though the place is clean and I have personally witnessed the managers hold the staff to their closing duties, the owners neglect to maintain the decor. There are marks on the wall and places that could use a little spackling. Let's be realistic...how much does it really cost to touch up a freaking wall of a place that makes you $? Also, there has been at least one lightening bolt decoration in the main dining room that has been out for about the last two years. Really? How much does that cost to replace? My guess is it's too cheap to ignore, but yet the owner has had time to hang up beer neon signs which are really tacky for the type of establishment Pie is geared for. Don't get me wrong, I like going out for a little late night bar crawl from time to time, but Pie is not it. They close early and appear to get most of their business from families, early dinner parties, and date night couples, not bar goers. I'm sure anyone who drives by pie knows it serves a reasonable selection of beers. Marketing the bar isn't really that necessary, IMO. My last biggest annoyance is the floors, especially the concrete. When Pie first opened it had a nice finished concrete floor, now it is so worn out, it's pretty much raw...ugly...concrete. In the past ~5 - 6 years  that Pie has been opened, the floors have never been refinished or recovered. At least the kitchen floors look great, but I just can't understand why this has been neglected. I can't understand why businesses don't realize that letting things go often shows sign of a failing place and people don't want to come back and be a part of that. If you want to command premium pizza prices then you have to create and maintain a premium experience! It's pretty simple.Ok, I am done ranting about the negatives, so I will finish with my overall review. I recommend this place. The food is good, the staff is friendly and above average on service. The prices are a tad above what you may expect but are still reasonable. The place is clean and it has a great patio, so you won't be disappointed. I just hope the owners are reading this and will update/maintain the restaurant better than they are doing. They may want to set their DVR to bar/restaurant rescue and pick up a few clues.

reviews.name: Laura F.
reviews.review: Wish I could review the food... But we never got any!I went with my husband on a Sunday evening (also happened to be St. Pattys Day).  They were not empty, but not busy by any means.  When we walked in the door, two waitresses were standing with their backs to the door.  Neither acknowledged us.  It took the hostess a few minutes to get back to her station, but she was sweet, seated us promptly, and told us she would send a waitress to get our orders.  We waited about 10 minutes with our menus closed, looking around patiently (and the check from the previous customers still sitting on the table) before we gave up and walked out to go to Burger Republic. The hostess that had just sat us waved to us on our way out the door and told us to have a nice evening...I'm sure we could have flagged someone down, but if they aren't motivated to take our order- it doesn't bode well for the rest of the meal.

reviews.name: Mrs. B.
reviews.review: Love this place!  The spiral bread is a must and everything I've ever had has been great!  I've been to this location (usually for carryout) and the Galleria location many times and the only thing I would say that I have been disappointed with on the rare occassion, is speed of service.  I would understand if they were busy but I've been enough times when they haven't been busy and the food just seems to take longer than it should.  On a recent visit, we ordered a Greek salad and it took 15 minutes - really?!  But the servers are always friendly, the food is always yummy, so I will continue to go back!  One of these days I have to save room for dessert...  Now I'm hungry, great!

reviews.name: Eric N.
reviews.review: The best American pizza I've had. I'm very picky about my pizza, as I lived in Italy for 10 years. This place was great; a wide variety of pizza choices, a build your own option, and various crust options, to include a gluten free crust. Just wish they had a vegan crust option. Vegetarian and Gluten-Free options.

reviews.name: K T.
reviews.review: I have been here several times.  We usually get the carniovre.  The crust was burn this time.  The pizza ingredients are good quality product.  It has a lot of potential. More and more pizza restaurants pre-cook their crust, which could cause disaster.  The chicken wings were large but it is not great.

reviews.name: Pete N.
reviews.review: We ate at Pie In The Sky (PITS) again last night. It was happy hour so I ordered the 2-for-1 Miller Lite and both were brought to my table at the same time. I am not a fan of warm beer so I felt the need to drink the first one rather quickly, which came back to haunt me when I was thirsty half way through the pizza.We started with the stuffed mushrooms which come with a chipotle ranch dipping sauce. I am a firm believer that everything is better with chipotle so the shrooms were actually the highlight of the meal.For the pie we had sausage, mushroom, and banana peppers. It was good, but when my card is run for $45 I just don't feel that it was that good. It was just pizza.

reviews.name: Travis A.
reviews.review: I mostly get delivery from these guys.  The pizzas are good.  I try to stay away from the "specialty" pizzas because they are a little bit pricey and are very hit or miss.  Nothing to write home about.I prefer their regular thin crust and a few toppings.  They have the perfect amount of sauce in my opinion, which is probably slightly above what an average chain place would give you.The chicken wings are good.  The salads are solid.  Avoid the meatballs, they are kinda terrible.  I had a meatball sub from there and they just tasted old and mushy.Also, they have this cheese bread swirl appetizer thing.  I was expecting a lot more from a "signature item."  Just not very impressed with the taste.

reviews.name: Megan W.
reviews.review: I've been eating here for a few years now, but I haven't gone back so much in the past year or two. Your habits just change, you know? Also, I cut dairy out of my diet so pizza joints aren't my favorite place to go anymore, hah.Anyway, the food here used to be incredible all the time. Like every single time I ate here, the food was fantastic-everything I had was perfect...but then I went back after a while and I noticed the food started to get a little bipolar on the quality. I've never had anything flat out terrible here, but you notice when your food isn't what it used to be.My favorite dishes here are their BBQ Chicken pizza, the BBQ Chicken hoagie, their meat lasagna makes my soul sing (at least the last time I had it, which has been a while ago now), the pepperoni pizza, and the Spiral Breadsticks are awesome, but sometimes there isn't enough cheese in it. Also, the "grilled cheese" sandwich for kids is something I used to get alllllll the time. I'm starting to drool just thinking about it now...alas, no more cheese for me *sigh*.Service is pretty darn good every time I go here, no complaints. I don't drink in restaurants hardly at all so I can't say anything about their bar, but they do have 3 TV's up there if anyone wants to know...or they did the last time I went in.As for the prices here, I do happen to know they use more gourmet ingredients than your typical pizza joints, but food prices are on the rise anyway so yeah...not much you can do about that. Some other people have pointed this out, but despite the fact that their speciality pizzas are a little pricey, if you split it between three or four people the cost is pretty reasonable. Plus, I don't think they charge for refills so yay!It can be a little annoying when there are kids running around, but that is the fault of the parents not paying attention. They do have the "dough bar", but kids even find ways to get wild and crazy with the dough; they start throwing it against the windows and if you're walking by, it may bounce off the glass and hit you (I've seen it happen).P.S. If you're looking to get more value for your money, go with the regular crust: it's more for your money.

reviews.name: Chris F.
reviews.review: The restaurant itself was comfortable and clean. The pizza was some of the better pizza I've had in Nashville. We got the plain cheese and the Carnivore. (which has italian sausage, hamburger, pepperoni and regular sausage. It was thick and very tasty! They are generous with the toppings and the crust was crispy on the bottom and soft in the middle.

reviews.name: Patten F.
reviews.review: I've driven by this Pie In The Sky several times, but finally was invited to park my butt there last night.First off, the name is a total lie. When you walk in there are exactly zero pies on the ceiling. I was disappointed at that.As for the restaurant itself, we had a table of 10 and they put us in our own little private room at the side. I felt classy...it was like a wholesome champagne room.We ordered a couple of spiral breadsticks - I highly recommend doing this. It's a giant breadstick with cheese in it. Seriously, it's good. Do it.For my meal, I ordered the buffalo chicken pizza. I was a little disappointed that it came with shredded lettuce on top of it, but the pizza itself was quite good and the crust had that perfect bit of crunch right before you hit the soft part.It's a little pricey, but it's easy to get to, the pizza's good and the service is friendly.

reviews.name: A R.
reviews.review: Dirty restaurant that doesn't seem to have air conditioning. Food was forgettable and cheaply made.

reviews.name: John H.
reviews.review: I hate to give out bad reviews but just have to honestly say that there are much better restaurants than this one. Food is average and overpriced. Had wine and the glass still had a lipstick imprint on it. (They kindly replaced it but more as a matter of fact rather than apologetically.) They also got the bill wrong -- overcharging me with many mistakes. Again, there was a "sorry for that" but no big deal. Also heard the manager apologizing to some customers that just walked in. Cannot recommend this place, and I've been twice. Only went the second time because my 5-year-old wanted to on his birthday.

reviews.name: Dustin R.
