reviews.review: No thank you.  We tried this place. Order a large gourmet pizza two drinks and a desert; price: nearly 50 dollars. wow.  There are way better pizza places in nashville that have better prices.

reviews.name: Lindz B.
reviews.review: I love my food every time, and I have been going to Cool Springs and Midtown for years! Get the happy hour beer, a white pizza, and some cheesy garlic bread and you will not be disappointed!

reviews.name: Joshua B.
reviews.review: Pie in the Sky is just seconds from my house and it was such a happy discovery when I finally tried it a couple years ago.Apparently some of the reviewers and I don't go to the same Pie in the Sky because I couldn't disagree more.To me, the crust is perfect.  A think a nice, thick outer ring is nice.  Lets you have something to hold onto the pizza with.  The thickness under the toppings is about as perfect as you can get with a normal, hand tossed pizza.  The sauce is very fresh and there are chunks of tomato in there which is wonderful.  The cheese is great - a perfect amount in my opinion.  Some pizza places have too much, some have too little.  To me, its the perfect amount.  The toppings are the best.  I love the Pepperoni and Italian sausage pizza there.  The Italian sausage isn't those little balls you get at other places like Dominos and Pizza Hut, etc.  Its SLICED sausage.  And when put in the over the edges get crispy.  Sooooo good.  You also have to try the Spiral Breadstick - its to die for in my opinion.  Also, I always ask for a side of the pizza sauce so I can dip my crust into it (like breadsticks and pizza all in one!).A friend of mine thinks the Fettuccine Alfredo is to die for.  I'm not as much of a fan but I'm not a huge fan of Alfredo - so, hard to tell.Also, they have drink specials there frequently!  The drinks are ok - usually very strong.  But you can tell the bartenders are more used to pulling a draft beer than mixing a cocktail.  And that's fine.  Just be aware.If you want - you can sit up in what they call the 'star bar' on the elevated section of the restaurant or you can go out to the patio.  I LOVE going to the patio on cool spring/fall nights (too hot in the summer).  So nice to have a slice of pizza or two, a couple cocktails - and sometimes they even have live music out there.  Really, a great spot to hang out.Price is up there - but me and 3 friends get a spiral breadstick and a large pizza and total, out the door, is less than 30 dollars.   7-8 dollars a person for pizza and appetizers along with a soda or water - that isn't bad in my opinion.

reviews.name: Jason J.
reviews.review: Pizza is average.  Spaghetti and meatballs had a sweet flavor to it and I just don't care for sweet meat balls (lol). The best item I've had here is the Caesar Salad.  That should say enough.

reviews.name: Samuel L.
reviews.review: So, I've been twice. The first time I went, there was a family of six thousand there, with there kids running all over the goddamn place. This is not the fault of the place, it is just a family friendly establishment. They did however leave a giant mess all over the restaurant, and it never got cleaned up.The second time I went in, the place was dirty in the dining room also. There was food pieces on the floor, dirty tables, etc.. Now for the food, I tried the pizza the first time. It was pretty damn bad, they sold by the slice which was good, but the pizza was awful. The sauce was bad, the crust was bad, the cheese was bad. The second time, I knew better than have the pizza, so I got their big garden salad again. Failure occurred yet again, I know there is a general problem with tomatoes right now, but these tomatoes were just horrible. They obviously came from a very cheap food supplier. The place gets 2 stars, because the servers I had were very attentive and filled my beverage up a crapload of times. The service was excellent. The rest of everything, was bad. It takes a lot for me to bitch about food too, but this is pizza that I will never eat again. I might try them again for a calzone or something, but seeing as that is just a folded pizza with the same dough and shitty ingredients, I doubt it. C'mon people, stop fucking up salads, you just have o throw shit into a bowl.

reviews.name: N G.
reviews.review: A thirty minute wait for two sandwiches. And still one was missing one of the main ingredients, and the other was over-cooked.  The restaurant is also overcrowded and messy. Maybe stick to the pizza (maybe?), and check your food.

reviews.name: Eddie D.
reviews.review: Excellent! We'll be back to try the thin crust!

reviews.name: Noelle T.
reviews.review: I love this place.  It has a great atmosphere, live music, laid back service, and it's family friendly.  I love that I can go have a drink at the bar and walk home too=bonus!I'm a fan of the crust and a huge fan of the balsamic vinaigrette.  We would go more often but it is pretty expensive.  We like the big thick pizza that takes forever to make and the price tag on this pie is over $40.

reviews.name: Collin K.
reviews.review: sombody please hel with the service here asap !!! food is come some times then bad some times never consistent and lacks alot sometimes with uncooked wings i alwas have to ask for the wings to be well done... i love this place but the kitchen needs help!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! pizza is the bomb !!

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: I love pie in the sky but this location gets three stars. I'd rather eat at the one downtown. Although it is the same place, the crust taste better at the one downtown Nashville in my opinion. The location is a cute getaway spot though since it is close to my house.

reviews.name: Greg S.
reviews.review: Pretty cool place.  Very modern, industrial, kind of like a Starbucks look.  Alot of kids, but obviously, it is pizza.  For the price I would'nt take them here.  Kids need to go to CiCi's.  This place has the feel that its going for an upscale pizza parlor.  But they have a full bar, big flat screens everywhere.  The pizza in my opinion is nothing out of this world.  They put a good price on a low quality pizza.  Its not frozen pizzas.  I can honestly say that I like Little Caesars is better. The salad selection isn't to bad.  Very fresh.  But for a nice place/location.  I think it's a good addition for that part of town.  Why not?  I mean you got a Sushi place across the street, a mexican restaraunt in the same vicinity.  Throw an expensive pizza joint in the mix.

reviews.name: Rahel K.
reviews.review: I have been here 3 times because it is near where I live.  I think the crust tastes like cardboard and it is WAY over-priced.  But it is a good bar atmosphere with large screen tvs.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: Disappointed in delivery service, customer service, and management. NOT RECOMMENDED, go to another place.

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: My rating is for the calzone - the pizza is more 3-star, but the calzone are delicious.  The service is attentive, thought sometimes the food takes a little while (hey they get busy).  Nice covered patio too. (the picture on this entry is not the Lennox Village site, as of this writing, so don't be surprised when you drive by)

reviews.name: John G.
reviews.review: I give them 2 stars for their pizza, but 4 stars for the rest of the menu.  I, too, am not a big fan of the pizza here, and think the crust is way over rated.  I think it is corn meal that they add, but whatever it is, I think it tastes gritty.  I usually get the roasted chicken salad, and/or the Pestofredo Penne Pasta. These two things have always been good.  I don't think the lasagna is very good, just FYI.I also like that they let me, uh... I mean my daughter, play with dough while waiting for the food. If it wasn't so close to my house I don't think I would go out of the way to come here.

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: Used to eat at this location years ago.  Moved to townhome in Lenox Village so thought I would try again.  Nothing has improved.  Very dirty, slow service, ok pizza & no one cleaning tables for new customers coming in.  Will not return.

reviews.name: Brad B.
reviews.review: 2 for 1 on tap all time.  yazoo, blue moon, cheap stuff.pizza prices are def higher than normal --- a large one topping pizza & spiral breadstick came to $24.  a nice place to get a meal though -- well designed to keep the kids entertained while the food is prepared.  kids enjoyed the dough bar and watching the cooks working.should have ordered the thin crust pizza -- the regular tends to come out as all crust (at least an inch wide).  not the best pizza in SE Nashville -- Angelo's Picnic Pizza at Murfreesboro Rd/Bell Rd is still the standard -- but you have to like the drink specials and the atmosphere makes for a nice meal.

reviews.name: kristen p.
reviews.review: I enjoyed my tiny pesto pizza, the fruit tea, and the great patio. Just not the price tag. I'm not against going back. But only if you are paying.

reviews.name: Da Deacon H.
reviews.review: My only wish is THAT THIS PLACE NEVER GOES AWAY!!Let me jump right into it THE BANANA NUT BREAD IS AMAZING!!!...ok,..I'm calm nowLocated conveniently in the Lenox village shopping area, Grounds 4 Inspiration offers a quite, relaxing atmosphere the contains two leather sofa couches along with very comfortable table and chair setups. GREAT customer service! No matter who is at the counter they are always smiling and engaging in conversation. Very clean establishment which is what i look for the most when it comes to a place serving food, and i love the hours of being open till 10pm 7 days a week! cause that gives me time to grab some BANANA NUT BREAD on my way home....YES I AM A FAN!

reviews.name: Jenn Z.
reviews.review: I visited here during a festival in our neighborhood, the place has been taken over by new management/ownership and I had not been back in since. The young lady at the front was nice, but not very engaging. One couple stood at the counter for a very long time after she disappeared I'm not sure where. The old decor is still up and looks fine I wouldn't have changed that much either, the counter where the cream and condiments are could use some cleaning however. There is an old cooler that is out of order and covered in trash bags which might be better off retired elsewhere. My iced latte was decent, and we bought a few cookies which after trying them were obviously from Kroger or Walmart's bakery. I could see and hear the staff/owner in the back the entire time, that was a bit off-putting. I realize they may still be settling in, but there wasn't anything about my experience that would bring me back in which is unfortunate considering its in walking distance to my house.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: Dang this place is hard to get to.  Yes, for the people who live near by this must be a real bonus, but it is a real chore for anyone who comes from any further than Old Hickory Boulevard.But the place is attractive, the coffee is nice, and the people clearly are into the idea of customer service.  They are constantly very friendly, and really roll out the welcome mat for the people that come into the store.  They're the only place I know that lets you pour your own coffee, then drop a couple bucks into the jar all without being supervised.Their wifi is pretty good, and they've got a couple electrical outlets to charge your laptop or cell phone.I am not into the roast.  Never heard of it, not really doing it for me.  But they pull good shots, and make the coffee work nonetheless.  This is a coffee shop that I could see visiting a lot if it weren't twenty miles from where I lived.

reviews.name: Frank S.
reviews.review: The chicken salad  is great - so tasty!  Very friendly atmosphere and definitely a nice gathering place! I'll definitely be back to try more items from the menu.

reviews.name: Geoff T.
reviews.review: When I moved to Lenox Village last year, it had almost everything I desired within walking distance. There were all the casual restaurant types I needed - Mexican, Pizza, burgers, dessert. There was a decently-priced gas station a block away. There was a pet grooming shop, a dry cleaner, and a small doctor's office. There was a neighborhood pub with karaoke on Saturdays.The one thing it did not have was a coffee shop, and boy did it need one. Other than a couple Starbucks that required a drive of several miles in Nolensville/Old Hickory traffic, this area was a veritable coffee desert. That's why I was incredibly excited to see Grounds 4 Inspiration open its doors late last year. From my first visit in November, the staff has been friendly, the lattes have been quality for the price, and the location cannot be beat. The coffee drinks are standard variety - Lattes, Cappuccinos, Mochas, etc. - but they are well-made with Vienna Roasters beans and capable baristas. The baked goods are tasty, and while I haven't yet tried their lunch offerings, word on the street is that they hold the line well.My one wish with this shop is that they might somehow create a space for live acoustic music on Friday and/or Saturday evenings. The location and layout of the room would be perfect for a singer with an acoustic guitar to play. There's a ton of musicians in Lenox Village that might welcome an opportunity to play close to home (me included). Just a thought.

reviews.name: Shay G.
reviews.review: Great location, good coffee and menu sounds enticing.  One area of potential improvement is the kiddos.  When we have been in they have been a bit loud which can be distracting when trying to work or hold a meeting.  I hope this place stays and continues to improve!

reviews.name: Nomar A.
reviews.review: Great new shop. Really good brew and nice pricing. Friendly service. Hope they do well.

reviews.name: Andre P.
reviews.review: Love this place. I go everyday coffee is always great and their breakfast sandwiches are awesome. Michelle is awesome and takes the time to greet and learn everyone's name. Cannot wait till they bring back the lunch menu. Also wish they were open on Sunday : /

reviews.name: Marcy O.
reviews.review: A charming, warm & friendly cafe with delicious coffee and scrumptious homemade baked goods. Very nice owner. So happy to have this cafe in the neighborhood! This is a winner in my book!

reviews.name: Jenny E.
reviews.review: Love this place! Great coffee and food selection. Great prices also.

reviews.name: Hall W.
reviews.review: The pizza is okay - nothing special. They also got my order wrong (I do kind of understand since it was a super busy at the bar... but still a knick against customer service). It was basically a level below Mellow Mushroom. I mean if you were drunk downtown, this could be a great hangover food, but trust me, there are better pizza and food spots in town.

reviews.name: Kelly Ann W.
reviews.review: One lone star- because the ambiance was cool. Waitress was short (and I don't mean height wise) and very unhappy. Asked her how the chic parm was and added- we are from NJ, and she wasn't amused. Assured us it was good. (I realize how foolish to take the opinion of a Nashville girl on Italian food)The Italian dressing on the salad was terrific....I mean really. It was the best thing I ate here. He ordered the chicken parm and it was fair at best. I make a better chicken parm in my sleep. Too thick, too dry, the cheese was a deli slice melted. Meh.I got the Caprese salad. Awful just awful. The cheese tasted something like a tofu cheese substitute. Nothing like Motzerella...NOTHING. No need to discuss the bland tomatoes or the brown 'balsamic' dressing since the cheese IS Caprese. Finally we ordered cheesy garlic bread. There was dry Kroger Italian bread with bleck cheese and perhaps it was smoked paprika? Since something smelled like smoked and not like garlic or cheese. Awful! I will NOT go back here.....EVER.

reviews.name: Todd J.
reviews.review: Nice place right off Broadway.  Cozy atmosphere, each booth has their own personal TV at the table.  Food was ok. What makes this place only 2 stars? The service.  Not rude, but not overly concerned either.  Also slow getting our order out. Place has potential though.

reviews.name: Ashwin M.
reviews.review: I don't understand the hate for this place. The pizzas were good, and the ambiance was quite interesting. I felt like I was in an old Jewish deli in New York. Vegetarians have a couple of choices, and they were willing to make half the pizza one style. Beer selection leaves much to desire for, but it wasn't too bad.

reviews.name: Christine S.
reviews.review: Food was good but service was really shitty at the end of the night when they practically shoved us out the door and made us feel awful for being there at closing.

reviews.name: Ryan D.
reviews.review: Pizza was terrible. Not even sure there was sauce on my slices. Also, $4 for a slice is pretty steep, especially for this low quality of a slice. Service was pretty good though.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: This is one of the worst slices of pizza i've ever had. The cheese and sauce were extremely low quality and disgusting and the crust was soggy. It was a disgrace to the name of pizza and you have to not care about your customers or your business to serve that slop. My friend said it tasted like the chef boyardee make your own pizza kit but i thought it was more like the horrible lunchables pizza packets. Luckily our server knew they have bad pizza and had no problem removing my slice from the bill. I can only imagine that they are still in business because of the location, serving alcohol and drunk people on broadway not caring what food tastes like.

reviews.name: Jeff K.
reviews.review: I'll start off giving one star for being open late after a concert, another star for a kick ass DJ spinning good tunes and a third star for shaker cheese, red pepper flakes and salt to mask the taste of the worlds worst pizza one can eat. Sadly there isn't enough salt to hide the tasteless frozen-like cardboard tasting umtum sauce. The shaker cheese might have been a perfect addition if it wasn't cheap fake ass shaker cheese and the pepper flakes were window dressing that never changed the thin crusted saltine like thickness of skin on a bullied high school teen.I knew what I was getting into because I read Yelp but needed someplace to eat in spite of the lousy stars and reviews. They lose one of the three for serving a MeatLovers pizza that couldn't even satisfy an Ethiopian vegetarian. (Down to two stars at this point in the review). They lose another of the stars with the help situation. Waiter never came back to check on us because I'm sure he didn't want to hear how lousy and skimpy our medium Meat"less" Lovers pizza. Don't pay the price ( overpriced for the Kroger, stop and shop, Meyer or Walmart 10 for $10 frozen pizza specials) but instead find a sausage cart if you're desperate like we were.

reviews.name: Anita P.
reviews.review: Great location Downtown! Very loud atmosphere  there's a TV in every booth ours was tuned to cartoons and we had to ask twice to get it changed  :(Pizza lacked toppings I think I counted 3 Italian  sausages on my half of pizza. Service was up and down when we needed napkins our server had disappeared. When we were ready to leave we had to flag her down again.  Good place to go if you want quick eats before a Downtown event

reviews.name: Massimo F.
reviews.review: 5 starts for the service - 1 star for food, makes an average of 3, right?Good.Go there if you don't have any better place where to go, but don;t be afraid of going there, there are much worse place you could end up going.

reviews.name: Kristie T.
reviews.review: My favorite thing about this place is that since it's off the beaten path, you are more likely to get seated quicker than the places on the strip.  We ordered a pretty simple pizza and a cocoa porter.  They both came quickly and the staff was friendly.  The pizza was tasty and hot.

reviews.name: Brandon H.
reviews.review: Good atmosphere and fast service.  We were seated quick and our waitress did a great job.       We ordered cheesy garlic bread.  Hmmm how do you mess that up.  Then we ordered the City Special Pizza.  No taste on either item.  It was very very very plain.  Nothing special about this place.       Luigi's probably gets a lot of tourist traffic and one time visitors.  I would assume they don't get a lot of second visits from people.  We tried to enjoy it, and make the best of it.  In conclusion the food wasn't bad per say.  But it was not at all good.  May as well have stayed home and had dry toast or rice cakes.  About the same amount of flavor.

reviews.name: Courtney H.
reviews.review: Nothing extraordinary, but the pizza is delicious. The pizza we got was the New Yorker... Highly suggest it! We also are the caprese salad which was good. It's a good lunch spot with good service.

reviews.name: Emily H.
reviews.review: Pasta was way over-cooked. Pizza looked like it had been sitting all day. And, we got our salads AFTER our meal. In what world is that okay?

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: Pizza, beer, TV's in downtown Nashville?!? Yes!! I live downtown and my first visit when they opened would seem in line with other reviews but I would say "they've pulled it together".  This is probably my 8th time here and I really enjoy it.  I'm such a junkie for carbs and I feel their pizza has such a great New York chew (added bonus with a side of sauce).  The beer selection covers the board from The Curious Traveler to Budlight. I haven't ordered anything except the soup, pizza, and cheese sticks but they all have me craving more! To think they sell slices?!? Huge plus!!

reviews.name: Simone S.
reviews.review: I ate here with my mom while visiting Nashville. I should have looked at the Yelp reviews first. We were just very hungry and overwhelmed by Broadway. The pizza came out room temperature, the crust tasted like cardboard, and the pizza we ordered had hardly any toppings and was supposed to have a lot. The draft beer was also pretty flat. Although the restaurant is fun and inviting and was packed with people.

reviews.name: Blake W.
reviews.review: I came here during the CMT awards, and my experience, from a food perspective was pretty bad.  I've worked in a restaurant before, with over 7 years experience so I understand things go wrong.  However, this was something avoidable.  I ordered a Caesar salad to start, which came out with grilled chicken by accident, and the bartender was nice enough to ask if that was ok, and I said sure.   1st bite was good, 2nd bite had a small chicken bone in it, and so did the 3rd.  Sent that crap back immediately, bartender did apologize, not her fault.  I ordered a slice of pizza that came out and  basically was waterlogged dough and just shit.  The drink was the best thing I had, and this is no fault to the bartender.  I wouldn't recommend this place to my friends or family so do it if ya dare or you're just hammered and hungry, otherwise you will be disappointed.This place sucks!

reviews.name: Azinda M.
reviews.review: Meh pizza place. There are a bunch of places to eat in downtown Nashville, but I have actually only been here for food.My family and I shared 2 salads and 2 pizzas. The salads were good to share and fresh. The pizzas I had mixed feelings about. We ordered one white pizza with spinach, and the luigi combo. The white pizza was good - garlicy, spinachy, and nice. The combo was blah. Because of all of the toppings and perhaps their sauce, the pizza was super soggy on the bottom.Service was slow, too.

reviews.name: Ren L.
reviews.review: I woke up late and some friends led me here. Beer was pretty good. I ordered a Pepperoni and Mushroom pizza, but I got a Cheese Pizza with some Pepperoni and Mushrooms on top and reheated. That would have been fine, but they really skimped. =(. Cool late night or after a bar and nice server, but I expected more.

reviews.name: Lowell R.
reviews.review: Meh.  Undercooked, canned sauce, undesirable cheese.  It's pretty much $5.50 for a slice of grocery store pizza.  One good thing though, it did fill me up.  1 slice, and I really didn't want to eat again until the next day.  I guess that's a plus.  Poor service.  Not a pizza joint for the locals.

reviews.name: Caroline M.
reviews.review: Bad: Service sucked. The hosts didn't welcome us and our waiter was inconsiderate. The pizza is definitely not anything special. And they charged $2.00 extra for a splash of cranberry juice in my vodka soda...Good: The atmosphere is very Broadway and the TVs in the booth are convenient. They also have a small stage that changes to a dj booth on the weekends.

reviews.name: Noelle T.
reviews.review: We stumbled into Luigis after the County Music Marathon.  The front of the house is open, sunny, and fun but we got shoved into a dark, bland room in the back.  The front and the back look like two completely different restaurants.We both ordered slices but our server suggested we order a small pizza fresh from the oven so we did.  The pizza took almost an hour to arrive which was actually fine because we were having fun but I found it odd that our server did little to apologize or check on us within that time frame.  The pizza was fine.  It was a nice New York style crust but I wouldn't say it was bursting with flavor.  I loaded it down with parm and pepper to spunk it up a bit.  I feel like we may have had a different experience sitting in the front with better service.  I would be open to eating here again but wouldn't go out of my way to eat at Luigis.  Also, it is pretty inexpensive for a downtown restaurant.  Our small pizza with two drinks came to $18.  Not bad at all.

reviews.name: Sanchez H.
reviews.review: Much to my chagrin we started reading reviews for this place after we were seated; yes, I know,  timing is everything.  We should have left but we were tired and hungry and didn't want to wander around looking for some other place. We got Chicken Parmesan & Cheese pizza. Both were edible but not worth a return trip. Pizza was too doughey for me & pasta on the chicken parm was too mushy. The place definitely smells better than the food tastes. The waiter was pretty quick & attentive. The interior is nice,  very cool light fixtures but place is VERY loud! This place was just OK,  I'm sure there is a better pizza joint in Nashville.

reviews.name: MK W.
reviews.review: Waiting about 30 minutes to eat due to CMA Fest in town. Smelled so good while we waited but the actual food was just mediocre. Sauce is very watery and runny. Garlic bread was good though.

reviews.name: Jenn W.
reviews.review: We went on a busy night during the CMA festival after LP field concerts. They had a DJ playing some old school dance songs which patrons sang and danced along with. A fun atmosphere with despite being very busy a friendly staff. We had a BBQ chicken pizza that was hot and hit the spot after a night of drinking! The grapefruit "sangria" drink was The only bad part of our stop.

reviews.name: Christy R.
reviews.review: Wanted something besides BBQ during my 2 week stay. Worst pizza I've had in a while, and the service was sub par.

reviews.name: Sumner G.
reviews.review: Great New York style pizza and fun decor make this a great place for lunch or dinner. But the best part is that Luigi's is located next to the Johnny Cash Museum and Goo Goo Shop - both a must see!

reviews.name: Derek H.
reviews.review: I've been in Yelp for along time and have never written a review... until now.  I just wanted a quick bite to eat, so I stopped into this place to grab a slice of pizza.  It was terrible. I guess I shouldn't be surprised.  It's not like Nashville is known for its pizza.  But... if you are going to have a pizza place, then come on, at least serve some decent pizza.  I mean, this place is called Luigi's pizza.  I am not really writing this to deter people from going.  I am mainly writing this with hopes that this establishment will hear or see this post and try to fix the way they make their pizza.  The taste was poor, the pizza was cold and it didn't look very appealing.  They can definitely do better.  Better ingredients would be a good place to start... and more effort in preparing and serving their pizza is needed.  UPDATE: 15 mins later...my stomach hurts.  I had a feeling this was coming.

reviews.name: Barbara V.
reviews.review: It was Sunday and at home we do pizza and salad.  This place fit the bill.  Our server was over and beyond the expectation.  Food was a nicely assembled anti pasto salad. Pizza thin and crispy!  We liked it.

reviews.name: Greg D.
reviews.review: Not the worst pizza we've had...certainly not one of the best. Was really disappointed with the pizza and cheesy garlic bread. Service was sub-par. Server not very attentive. Don't waste your time. The one pleasant surprise was 4 of us dined for roughly $30.

reviews.name: Evan K.
reviews.review: Great service. The staff was very attentive and suggested a great meal. We had the Spinach calzone and side salad. I have to say it Rocked! Great looking girls working behind the bar too...I will be back for sure. Try the garlic knots!

reviews.name: Jason T.
reviews.review: Great place, great atmosphere..sure we had to wait ten minutes but it's worth the wait.

reviews.name: Todd G.
reviews.review: Our pizza was really good.  We got the cheese pizza and added mushrooms.  They were canned mushrooms which I prefer because they don't dry out in the over.The waitress who might have also been the bartender was so nice and helpful. It was a bit pricey, but it is downtown and expected. They offer slices, which I don't know where else to get a slice in downtown after 5pm and they are open until 3am the day I was there.The caesar salad was just so-so and only an entree size.  No side salads so we split one.Lunch special until 4pm was 2 slices and a coke for $7I also wish we had control to change the channel on our table side TV.

reviews.name: Bridget C.
reviews.review: Service was wonderful. Our waiter John was personable, attentive & fun. Pizza and salads were good.

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: Eh....went here for lunch during work day.  The place was cool, good service, and great location on 3rd Ave just off broadway.  The pizza was OK just a little to greasy for lunch.  I'd probably go here for couple of slices after downtown bar hop.  Wasn't bad, wasn't special either.

reviews.name: Cait S.
reviews.review: I can't really say much about the horrible pizza because I'm near Chicago so we're a little spoiled in that area anyway. However, go buy a frozen pizza from a grocery store and it will taste better. Just saying. The host greeted us with "We're closing in 30 minutes so you can only get a slice at the bar". Okay? That's fine...So we sit down at the bar and the bartender throws us some napkins & asks "What do you want"? I would like a new bartender first of all....We got our pizza and she never came over once to ask us for refills or how our pizza was which is probably a good thing because we were so irritated with the horrible service.

reviews.name: Tommy C.
reviews.review: The pizza is great, the beer is cold, and the staff is nice. That's our review- Philly boys. Perfect way to close our night every night we've been here.

reviews.name: David K.
reviews.review: Faux Italian withOUT a flareWorst downtown or Italian experience of my life. I have nothing good to say about this waste of time and money except that the building they occupy would be really sweet with a real restaurant in it.Poor quality food with poor quality ingredients. Overpriced and tasteless.We ordered a pizza, a meatball sandwich and a couple of beers. The draft beer was warm and got sent back. The pizza had no taste at all. The meatball sandwich has literally 2 meatballs in in sliced up to look spread around a little. Barely any sauce at all and I had to request more.Hated Hated Hated this place. I may go stand outside for awhile just to warn people to go somewhere else, anywhere. They wont make it to the end of the summer. YUK !

reviews.name: brandon s.
reviews.review: I went to Luigi's with a group of 9 people a few days ago and had high hopes. The pizza wasn't bad, the beer was cold, and the prices were pretty reasonable, but my biggest complaint concerns what happened after I left. For parties as large as ours Luigi's automatically adds an 18% gratuity. This isn't a problem and I completely understand. My issue is that the server added an additional $10 tip (which I did not authorize) to my ticket on top of the included 18% gratuity. I called the restaurant about this and the manager assured me that he would call me back within 24 hours to fix it. I never did hear back from him and ultimately had to file a dispute with my credit card company to resolve the issue. Unbelievably, this also happened to somebody else in my party and he was told by the manager to fax a copy of his signed receipt to the restaurant in order to get a refund for being overcharged.I had hoped to make Luigi's a frequent stop before or after Predators games, but after my first experience here I'll never be back.

reviews.name: Carmen H.
reviews.review: The antipasto salad was a sad excuse. It didn't even come with cheese as the menu indicated, the salami was so thick that I could hardly cut it and the croutons were the hard out of the box kind. Just yuck and disappointing!

reviews.name: Jeremy P.
reviews.review: I work nearby and have given Luigi's 3 shots. And I'm over it. They have decent inexpensive slices of pizza if you don't want to walk North of Broadway to Sbarro, but that's about all. My Caesar salad looked like it came off fast food dollar menu. My fettuccine was spaghetti noodles in a heavy bland sauce. And lastly, I had to ask for my breadsticks which come with the meal according to the menu. They brought out two partially frozen Sister Schubert rolls covered in a thick garlic butter paste that was less than appetizing. I had hoped for good things but I'm not planning on going back.

reviews.name: Clay W.
reviews.review: Great location off Broadway. Small TV in every booth and 3 TVs at the bar. Friendly staff. Strengths:Great lunch spot for visitors or anyone who works downtown. Pizza by the slice. Opportunities:At times it can be loud so it is not the best place for business oriented lunches. Summary:Good place to stop and eat. Won't blow you away but it's not bad either.

reviews.name: Meredith G.
reviews.review: Worst service I have ever experienced. We arrived and were told that the wait would be 15 minutes...an hour later we were seated. An hour and a half after being seated we finally received our food. Three of the orders were incorrect. Our drinks were left empty the whole time. On top of the poor service the food was subpar, definitely not worth it.

reviews.name: Konrad D.
reviews.review: The food was average at best (not to mention the waiting time) and their unsweet tea was so watered down that it tasted like water

reviews.name: Sierra T.
reviews.review: I always enjoy visiting to Luigis City Pizza after wandering around Broadway! It's one of my go to spots to grab a quick slice of pizza for lunch or a beer while watching the game. I love coming when Krystina is behind the bar, she's quickly gotten me addicted to their garlic knots... :-)

reviews.name: Doug B.
reviews.review: I had the pepperoni pizza and really liked it. The service was good and the price was extremely reasonable for downtown Nashville. I heard others talking favorable about this place and was surprised to see the negative reviews on yelp.

reviews.name: Randy R.
reviews.review: If you are eating here sober, I would wager to bet that it is pretty poor quality pizza.  If you've had a few - or more than a few - drinks at the myriad watering holes nearby first (as I had), the pizza isn't terrible.  Even then, not great, but it will do the greasy trick.

reviews.name: Sandy G.
reviews.review: Horrible service. Pizza was good, but I had to ask 2 times for a fork because I got a salad as well. Finally my husband got one from the bar. There were 5 employees at the bar and not paying attention to their customers. The TV at the table was on Cartoon Network. The manager said he couldn't change it due to a technical problem, but we had to ask 3 times before we found that out. We will not go back.

reviews.name: Jeff H.
reviews.review: Terrible experience.  Services sucks, beer is cool not cold, and  pizza is marginal.  Bathroom is filthy...n o soap in dispenser which means employees are not washing their hands before returning to work.  You money should be spent elsewhere.

reviews.name: Eleanor W.
reviews.review: I was going to say what Azinda said with "meh." Funny I thought the same. Frozen would have been as good. Even the iced tea is watery and tasteless. I'd pass on by....

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: Just lazy pizza. Nothing original on the menus, cheap ingredients, nothing tasted fresh, and the cheesey garlic bread was almost as cold as my bud light. Just wait until Dominica Pizza gets in town. That's real pizza.

reviews.name: Otis G.
reviews.review: Smells great so stepped in.  The fam got a pepperoni and a cheese pizza.  Delivered extremely fast.  We all thought the NY style pizza was good. Good service for us too.  But has tourist trap prices. $4 for a Bud light draft??  Come on! Pizza was way expensive too. Men's room was a mess, water all over the floor, no paper towels, and the layout is such that there is a wide open view to the urinals from the hallway when the door opens,  with staff walking by with a full view while you're standing there - pretty weird. All in all a mixed bag of a restaurant. Probably won't be back.

reviews.name: gina s.
reviews.review: Our family of 7 came and the service was great! My daughter and I loved the wings- not very hot but really good ! I didn't 't try the pizza but the rest of the family loved it. Don't really understand the bad reviews- you should come and try for yourself.

reviews.name: Renee S.
reviews.review: Rip off. Way over priced. Poor judgement to charge that much. Only reason why I gave 2 stars is because the pizza was okay. It might survive outside of downtown if menu was in right price range and service was 10X better than what I experienced. Tourist trap. I think the $6 draft beer I had was 8 oz. Again... Rip off. Go somewhere else.

reviews.name: Mike N.
reviews.review: Was here on January 19th, 2015. The pizza was decent at best, pretty good crust and sauce but the sausage wasn't too good, cheeses wasnt bad. Oddly, when we ordered we were told that we could only order pizza, no apps or salads, but no explanation as to why. Nice enough inside, tvs in every booth, and NO live entertainment, which was actually nice, not that I dislike it, but nice to be able to find a place without it once in a while. Our waiter was decent at best, not very outgoing but got the job done.

reviews.name: jenn m.
reviews.review: Came in after Preds game at 9:45. Said closed. Ok with that besides hours posted were until 12.

reviews.name: Rob C.
reviews.review: Worst pizza, they are not from ny but maybe a place that uses canned sauce and mottza bread pizza crust.  We went there sat night to pay $8 for a drink $2 for tonic to be added to the drink and $4 for a slice.  I don't mind paying that but let me pay for the food not a downtown location

reviews.name: R C.
reviews.review: If I could give zero stars, I would.  The menu is horrible ... It barely describes what the options are.  Something as basic as what size the pizzas are isn't included.  I don't know if a deep dish pizza is available; I bought a slice of pepperoni pizza (thin crust) and there was nothing special about it.I also ordered a Caesars salad ($10!), which was served with typical, boring foodservice croutons and sprinkled with Parmesan cheese.  It was severely overpriced.The service was slow.  We sat at our table for almost 6 minutes before being greeted by anyone, and then it took another 5 minutes to get water.  I don't blame the waitress, she was hustling!  I blame management.They will benefit from CMAs this weekend (first of June) due to the volume of people in Nashville. I don't expect them to last much longer.

reviews.name: Tina C.
reviews.review: I should have read the reviews before we went in. The food smelled delicious but we never got to eat it. They weren't even busy but we waited for our food for over 45 minutes. Our server never came back to check on us, refill our drinks, or tell us why our food was taking so long.

reviews.name: Scott A.
reviews.review: The past reviews are all accurate. Food was decent microwave quality and service was bad. Waiters were nice but forgot things and screwed up orders.

reviews.name: Jason B.
reviews.review: Stay away! The only thing this place has got, going for it is the location. Service is horrible and extremely slow. Stay away; there are much better spots in Downtown Nashville to eat!

reviews.name: Grayson W.
reviews.review: Okay, service but not great at all. The food is pretty good but the parmesan on the table was moldy.

reviews.name: Rachel M.
reviews.review: Nothing to write home about.  We had a party of about 20, service was ok.  I had the anti pasta salad & some chicken wings.  I wasn't hungry when I left, but I didn't feel like I had eaten a good meal.

reviews.name: Terrelle M.
reviews.review: This review is strictly for the service pizza is GOOD!!  Visited there the evening of 9/19 about 6pm wasn't very busy downtown had not picked up yet. We asked the host to sit at the table by the window he looked  at us with disgust and stated I was gonna sit you in a booth. I said again can we have that table a hostess approached at that time and said yes she sat us promptly. Our serve stopped by the table about 5 mins later she didn't introduce her self she stated what yall want to eat we gave our order. She returned about 5 mins later with our drinks and only brought 3 straws for 4 people and stated oh well I forgot one and never bothered to grab one. She asked if we were ready we stated a few more mins please she rolled her eyes and said ok. About 10 mins later she returned and said yall ready now... we ordered 2 pizzas asking for one with no chz due to one guest  having a medical condition this also made her mad.  Our pizzas took about 15 mins she brought  plates out prior and bumped into one of our guests and didn't say sorry. She didn't bother to ask us if we needed or wanted refills at that time which she could clearly  see our glasses were empty. Our pizzas were delivered hot and fresh, we had to request a refill of drinks which she wasn't happy about having to get them. At the end of our meal she asked all together or separate we said separate please 3 of us had Waters one had a soda she split the sodas on all checks. She tossed the checks on the table bumping into my friend again no apology. She returned for our cards took her about 5 mins to run our cards when she returned our cards to us she ran them for wrong  amounts and she tossed them on the table stating I don't know who's is who's  and walked away. Sadly this person was tipped very little by some of us and none by others which are servers and left a note that this maybe isn't the field for her.

reviews.name: Stephanie W.
reviews.review: Poor draft beer selection, dirty silverware, tasteless pizza, no reason to return.

reviews.name: Teri R.
reviews.review: I'm originally from NJ. this pizza was the closest you can get to NJ PIzza still no contest though LOL. Very good pizza...better than I expected.

reviews.name: Will M.
reviews.review: A few weeks back on a Saturday night we were downtown walking around after dinner and noticed this place.  It looked nice and it was busy.  Being "busy" can mean the place is good, but location and timing makes a big difference too.  We wanted to come back.  We did on September 7th at about 9:00 pm.  It was as busy as before. The place is just around the corner of Broadway, so people are everywhere. If they get repeat business, it means they are good and not just lucky to be where they are.  I usually don't do many reviews, but I did want Luigi's to know that they are lucky to be where they are.  Sure, the food was great and the staff was good (to my face), but even great food is not enough to keep the doors open and the management needs to learn that.  While eating, we observed the place was a lot like Mafiosa's on 12th Ave.  It will not have the same crowd, but it stays open late, it's a place people will go to do a lot of drinking while eating, and it's loud.  However, this place is much louder than Mafiosa's. For that reason alone, this is NOT a place for a family dinner. But they are not trying to be Pizza Hut.  They have a small dance floor area and it is much more of a bar than Mafiosa's would ever consider being.  We ordered meatball's as an appetizer.  They were served with a lot of sauce which was both tasty and useful for dipping our pizza crust in. I think the meatballs are better than Mafiosa's and the pizza was as comparable as well.  Another similarity between Luigis and Mafiosa's is that their bathrooms are not up to par.  HOWEVER, Louigi's bathroom was MUCH MUCH worse than anything I have seen in a restaurant that looked so nice from the outside.  Clearly, no one from the place checked the restrooms since lunch.  There were no paper towels in either dispenser.  There were plenty of them on the floor, sink, and urinal. There were empty beer bottles on counters and here and there.  This looked worse than many college bar restrooms at MTSU.  If any of the cooks used the bathroom, I bet they did not wash their hands.  The counter was soaked with water.  There was hardly a dry spot on the floor.  I don't have a clue what the toilets looked like, but I would bet the floor was wet and who knows what the seats would look like?  I was very irritated about it and as I walked out, I saw a fat lady in her late 30's who looked as though she may have been a supervisor of some sort.  I asked to speak to a manager and she said she served as one and could help.  I told her the bathroom was totally unacceptable and some of the reasons why.  She said she would send someone to look into it and I walked away.  My wife saw me talking to her and asked what the problem was.  Apparently, as I walked away, the fat lady was making faces behind my back and her body language indicated to my wife that this lady was dismissive of my concerns while talking to another employee.  Apparently the fat lady did not know my wife saw all that.  We decided that we would not let this ruin our dining experience.  But then my wife went to the bathroom before we left.  She came out a bit upset too.  I sent her in to take pictures, but it was too dark and crowded to take good photos.  The women's bathroom was trashed and the soap dispenser was off the wall and sitting on the countertop.  I don't guess the female employees wash their hands either.If you want great food in a convenient location (assuming you are already downtown on foot) then this is a decent choice.  The food was great.  The price is what you'd expect to pay at this location.  But if you go, be sure to use the bathroom somewhere else first.

reviews.name: Jim R.
reviews.review: good service nothing to brag about here.

reviews.name: M Q.
reviews.review: Should have looked at the reviews before we said "let's get some pasta"..... We will never return. Young lady that waited on us was by far the worst in Nashville! Training needed for all. Mushy pasta, mystery meatballs, not sure how they are made, had to ask twice for silverware, order was brought out wrong and then asked  "do you want me to fix it or is it OK"......dropped off the check in a "run by", left hungry

reviews.name: Jay H.
reviews.review: Service was slow at first, but improved once we engaged the bartender. Pizza is pretty standard. Menu could use a little help as it's confusing. We were told that the pasta was really good by the bar tender, but there was no mention of pasta on the menu nor was it posted anywhere. Nevertheless, I'm down with pizza and beer and will be back since it's only a few blocks from where I live.

reviews.name: Greg M.
reviews.review: This is the WORST pizza that I've ever eaten!!!! The staff was great and the restaurant looks awesome. This means one thing...management sucks!!!Old, greasy, and stale....and that"s just the manager. The pizza is worse!! ....the place is struggling!

reviews.name: Bobby T.
reviews.review: Great pizza but has gone way up in price to gouge tourists.  $30 for a large half plain/half pepperoni and an order of cheese sticks?  C'mon man.

reviews.name: Adam Y.
reviews.review: So.... The food is not "New York pizza" the service was slow and horrible although they were dead.... 2 small pizzas ordered at the same time, 1 came out the other did not and the waitress stated "sorry he didn't see the other order it will be out soon". The top to the Parmesan came off onto my pizza, servers comment "oh no that's too funny". Asked for a to go box for friends remaining pizza there was a fruit fly in the box. Manager came by to ask how it was ... So we told him.... He proceeded to say "oh I'm sorry" in broken English and walked away. You can hear the bass thumping from the club next door. The only good thing was the beer. This place sucks!!!!

reviews.name: Dave S.
reviews.review: This place blows.  Rude staff. Horrible pizza.  I've had better pizza at Cicis pizza.   Stay away. Better yet. Never mind. They won't be around long enough to even make a impression on anyone. Too dark. Can't read the menu. Oh well the menu is only 4 things anyway and 1 of those pizzas they don't even make!!!  Spend your time elsewhere. Try Demos down the street. Better lighting. Tremendous food and excellent staff!!!

reviews.name: Jake X.
reviews.review: I went for lunch today, and I will cut them some slack on their slow, unattentive service since the place just opened, but the food was not very impressive at all.  The pizza tasted EXACTLY like Sbarro's.  Literally indistinguishable.  Doughy, barely any sauce or toppings, and mediocre.  On top of that, the busboy's body odor was terrible.  Save yourself a few bucks and go to Sbarro's on second avenue; you might pass a Luigi's employee on his way out with a few boxes of pizza.

reviews.name: Ginny H.
reviews.review: Great venue and cool atmosphere to have an event around 50 plus and good sushi for Nashville ...

reviews.name: Steve S.
reviews.review: I've been here two times now as a guest. First time was actually my Birthday and was with a group celebrating upcoming Birthdays as well. Second time I was there for a showcase.Now as a guest I learned you have to be a member of this place. As you see not very many reviews, why? Because this place is meant to be private and secluded. Whether you're business, a country star, or just someone wanting privacy from the public eye, I think this is a great idea. I can understand there are those that just want to get away and relax in a place feeling like it's your own.Only way to get in is by thumbprint that unlocks the door. Or just know someone!As a member the staff is required to know who you are by name and it has a LA style atmosphere. DJ and dance floor included with nice tucked couches and booths giving you the freedom without judgement.They do have a menu to balance out your drinking. You can rent out the place or just pick a spot with your friend's membership.

reviews.name: Suz J.
reviews.review: Citizen as a subdued retreat from the party action of other M Street venues is AOK. It's a semi private club which is part of the building complex holding Virago, Rosewall and Saint Anejo. We spent an abbreviated time in Citizen taking a breather while partying on  M Street celebrating New Years eve. Citizen is a bit staid, especially compared with the noisier other places on the street.

reviews.name: Marie B.
reviews.review: I have been to this location a few times for take-out but this time I decided to dine-in with a co-worker for lunch. We were greeted by a nice gentleman who sat us promptly & introduced us to our server, Ricky. Ricky was pleasant who brought us fresh rolls & took our drink orders. I went to the restroom to wash my hands and the female restroom was clean. When I arrived back to the table Ricky was ready to take our order. I ordered the anything & everything salad with no bacon & honey mustard dressing. My co-worker ordered the salmon with a baked potato & side salad. As we waited on our food I kept swatting a fly & gnats that maybe were attracted to my water with lemon and/or the sweet rolls, nevertheless; I was getting annoyed. I was pressed for time so we couldn't leave. Our food arrived & I was pleased with the presentation of my salad that looked fresh & it was delicious. Unlike my co-worker's overcooked salmon & lukewarm potato that she sent back. The manager came out and was able to rectify her order & she was pleased. Good food and service but could use a gnat fumigation.

reviews.name: Eden H.
reviews.review: This location in particular could really use some work, I've seen tables who have not been greeted for MINUTES.These people literally look so confused, and they look around waiting to be welcomed into the restaurant.It's technically supposed to be thirty seconds after the people are sat.The server will finally get there with slightly burnt bread, and ask if they'd like to try a roadhouse tea.That wait couldn't even be cured by one of those.I saw this couple wait for their food for almost fourty-five minutes, and their rolls were cold.You could see that they were infuriated the whole time, and very displeased with their server's work ethic.They signed their check, and their faces were cherry bomb red.----------------------------------------------This is a prime example of bad management, they put their favorites on the best sections and drive out their good servers. I wanted to let everybody know that I saw this from the inside, yes, I worked there.It was miserable to watch this happen.I even offered to take that table as soon as they sat down, but the server was ignorant enough to make them wait forever.-------------------------------------------------------They saw that I was good, but the old management drove me out, my co workers were rude and everybody only gave a damn about themselves. Here is the reason for all the bad reviews:They don't have a team, just an army of dumb people.

reviews.name: Van H.
reviews.review: I have eaten here on several occasions and each time I leave disappointed. Today's particular concern was that my server, Tracy, was not particularly frequent and visiting my table, but more importantly was not frequently checking to see if my food was ready to bring to the table. How ordered a salad as a side to Monterey and I ordered an appetizer in addition to my entrée. The entrée came out first. I asked about the salad and he told me they were still in the back making them. Somehow the kitchen was able to cook 16 ounces of ribeye quicker than I could make a Caesar salad. After my entrée came out, I asked about my appetizer. I was seated near the rear kitchen door. He went into the kitchen and produce them immediately upon being reminded. So I ate my entrée first, followed by my appetizer. I had to ask yet again about the Cesar salad. And I have never ate a meal in reverse before. I came here about once or twice a year over the last four years. I'm guessing I have made about 6 to 7 visits to this location. Each time the service is just disappointing.

reviews.name: Dave B.
reviews.review: After a frustrating nite trying to find a place to have a drink we found Logan's and the godsend Wendy our waitress made the bite complete thanks so much for great nite!

reviews.name: Holli H.
reviews.review: Super fun place to go to! They have a lot of traditional foods, but also some fun quirks. Peanuts to much on at the table and you can throw the shells on the floor. Itty bitty bucket sundaes that are delicious!!! The rolls are pretty amazing unto themselves. Good drink selection, servers were beyond friendly. Just a good joint all around. Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Tiffany B.
reviews.review: First time Here and it was not pleasant. The women's bathroom was nasty. Toilets was nasty wirh stuff all over the floor. The waitress was slow and all we order was burgers and salad.

reviews.name: Tim H.
reviews.review: It was very slow. The service was not up to standard at all. It took a very long time to get the order. The waitress just didn't stop by as one would expect either. I was disappointed as I usually like Logans.

reviews.name: Rene R.
reviews.review: We got there at about 8:10 with a group of 15.  It was about an hour later everyone had arrived and we were seated at the back and Matt was our server. He was helpful as we re-arranged the tables slightly. He took our drink orders and brought out boatloads of bread!! I will be the first to say had a few picky eaters in the group. He had pitchers of water as well as sweet and un-sweet tea on the tables and brought out plenty of glasses. That was a wonderful move! We really appreciated that. He took our orders quickly and in a way that was easy for him to later separate the checks. There were no complaints on the food when it came out. Except one and I hate to say it but it was mine. It was brought out about 10 min after everyone else's and it was cold. Matt removed it from our bill and I was fine with that. I did have a delicious side ceasar salad and enjoyed it. Here's why they only get 3 stars (in case a manager sees this and cares) When you have a group of that size it would be nice to have people helping to run food and drinks out. Serving 15 people especially when half the table is ordering from the bar is not easy. So why no one else was helping to run food or drinks is beyond me. This is when teamwork can not only come in handy but it can also result in more tips. And happier customers.

reviews.name: Susanna H.
reviews.review: I just can't seem to like Logan's very much, but it seems like this location is especially "meh".   The food seems to lack in quality and so does the service. When I have been before, I generally get the vegetable skewer and every time the veggies come uncooked.  Seems like they just throw it on a grill for 30 seconds and brush it with salty garlic butter.  The waiters seems to come across as inconvenienced by their patrons, which I have always found odd in a restaurant setting.  On one occasion, I saw one waiter smack our waitress on the butt, then go right back to serving the hot rolls.  I don't care about the butt smack, but I'm not too interested in butt smack hand hot rolls.  I think most of the issues could be fixed with better overall management, but who knows.  I doubt I will go back... unless it is against my will.

reviews.name: Jeanne O.
reviews.review: Don't waste your time or stomach space.  There are so many great restaurants in Nashville, and this is NOT one of them.  It was a beautiful Tuesday night, and I wanted to sit outside.  The hostess handed me a menu and silverware and told me to seat myself. There weren't many tables outside that weren't occupied, full of dirty dishes, or wobbly.  After seating myself, I waited a good 15 minutes before anyone even approached me.  I thought about leaving and wish I had.  They were out of the lemon shandy beer on special.  They were out of Blue Moon.  They had Sam Adams Oktoberfest.  Not really what I want in August.  I was left with a disappointing choice of a few weak American beers. The waitress brought bread which was greasy, wet and pale, almost looked raw.  The outdoor seating is also where all of the people congregate who only want to drink and smoke. One guy was even stumbling around with his own bottle of Hennessey in hand. I had the cedar plank salmon with "moonshine sauce", which was OK, but didn't come with a little cup of sauce as it was shown on the menu.  I had mashed potatoes and the veggie skewer.  Also just OK, that's why I'm giving it one star.  Also, the waitress did feel bad and try hard to serve me once she discovered that I was there.  Still not worth it.  I mainly wanted a place I could walk to from the Homewood Suites hotel so I could enjoy some adult beverages without driving.  If you are in the same boat, walk down the street to J. Alexander's, an unimaginable million times better.  Or take Uber downtown to someplace with good reviews.

reviews.name: Danielle M.
reviews.review: PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE STAY CLEAR OF THIS PLACE...IF YOU DO GO. DONT SAY I DIDNT WARN YOU!!We just left the hospital and stopped for a bite to eat to celebrate a new addition to the family with other family members, were from Jax Fl. So this was our first experience at Logan's since we don't have them where were from. When we first got there we were seated and waited 15 min for a waitress to take our drink order. Waited another 10 min for  our drinks to come out. We put our orders in and explained we were going to also order a to go order and asked if it could be ready by the time we were leaving and the waitress assured us it was not a problem, we asked our waitress questions about the menu since it was our first time portion sizes and things to that nature. She had no answer for any of our questions and had to leave the table 4 different times to get the answers. On her 4th trip back to the kitchen the adults decided we would all order fish to make it easy on her, the kids all had steak tips cooked medium and the to go order was chicken strips, we asked for our side salads to come out before our meal. That did not happen. When our meal came out 2 sides of broccoli were missing she promised to bring them right out but they NEVER came. The kids steak tips were over cooked. My tilapia was ok, but I added on a grilled lobster tail that was also VERY VERY over cooked and very rubbery. My husband and son had salmon and they both said that was excellent, after waiting over 45 min for our meal and sides that never came and being fed up with the whole ordeal we asked for the check and to go order we waited another 10 min for the check and another 20 min for our to go order bc she forgot to put it in. On our way out of the place I noticed everyone had a basket of dinner rolls that looked AMAZING unfortunately I will never know what they tasted like bcuz our waitress never brought us any, I was curious if she was new so I could at least excuse some of her actions but when I asked I was told she had been there over a year! 10 min into.The car ride back to the hotel my stomach was in knots I asked my husband to pull over and threw my meal up. Guess it was the lobster! Very disappointed with the whole experience and food, I will NEVER EVER eat at this place and highly recommended no one else does either!

reviews.name: Sara M.
reviews.review: Good food! Great service! Their rolls are amazing! I had the blackened chicken salad and the chicken was very good but the salad was a little watery. It was still good. The fellas had steak and ribs. The ribs were falling off the bone and tasted amazing. We'd eat there again.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: There was no host to greet us The bar service wasn't very friendly at first. Then Walt came on for his shift! He was a ball of energy and fun! Their happy hour is top notch! Food can be labeled as traditional bar food.

reviews.name: Megan R.
reviews.review: This place was terrible. The service was slow. The waiter was distracted and left us sitting for over 20 mins unattended. I had to go to the bar to get a beer because he didn't come check on us. We wanted to get our food to go so that we could get back to the hotel after 7 hours of driving ... thinking it would be quick. It took over an HOUR to get food only to get back to the hotel and realize my steak was WAY overcooked, salad was weak and we got TWO rolls. Texas Roadhouse is so much better for quick steak meals. Glad I'm not from Nashville. What a disappointment.

reviews.name: Charles B.
reviews.review: Excellent service from our waitress Austin. The food came out quickly and was exactly what we needed after a long night out for New Years.

reviews.name: Kim P.
reviews.review: We had great service,  probably the best we have experienced in a while.  The food was also excellent and very reasonably priced.   We would highly recommend this place.

reviews.name: R C.
reviews.review: A friend and I went about noonish. Had to wait 5 minutes for a table to get cleaned off, which was no big deal. When our table was ready the hostess gave us the menus and pointed us to where we needed to go. She did not seat us or give us silverware. We waited on our waitress to get us drinks and tired of waiting we finally went up to the bar to grab waters. The food was very good, the service was not.

reviews.name: Bonnie H.
reviews.review: For a franchise the food was tasty and plentiful. The service is top notch, very friendly and fast. They have a good happy hour.

reviews.name: Tim A.
reviews.review: First off, I have never been a fan of the decor of the "Roadhouse" restaurants. Peanut shells all over the place do not make for a quirky experience, they make for a lack of cleanliness. Fortunately, this particular Logan's is pretty well-swept, but the murals are a whole other kind of creepy.That being said, the dining experience was not totally regrettable. In spite of  the lackluster caesar salad, my Steakhouse Sirloin Melt was actually pretty tasty. The chipotle mayo meant it was actually pretty flavorful, and the beef was far from overcooked, a major phobia of mine at chain restaurants (and in general). Folks in my party who actually ordered steak entrees actually got medium rare steaks when asking for medium rare. Outback should take notes.Nothing about the experience was particularly mind-blowing, and I almost wanted to dislike it more for its chainliness...but the food was pretty good. I certainly won't actively avoid eating here.

reviews.name: Daniel S.
reviews.review: I visited this Logan's Roadhouse twice within a three-day period. Upon entering the door on our first trip in the hostess was taking a personal call. After being seated, we got our drink orders in and later food.Refills on the first night were awfully slow, if we were to get any at all. When the food did arrive, it was delightful!We just needed to wait an extended period. The quality of the food that night compensated for the very slow service we received. Our second trip in, hostess was great. However, the first thing our group saw entering this time was a cook on his cell phone! Awesome (sarcasm)!Service was moderately better. Food was good, though unfortunately my meal and my wife's on the cold side. In short, Logan's has a great line of food, but fair personnel who fail to provide the service that would allow this restaurant to be more than three stars.

reviews.name: Char D.
reviews.review: We just left after waiting over 30 mins for a burger, just one burger. The waitress was nice but the kitchen needs to get it together!

reviews.name: Alicia M.
reviews.review: Visited this place, again, two weeks ago.  My family was here in Nashville to attend the funeral of my aunt and this is where they decided to eat by suggestion of my uncle.  They were already here and seated when I arrived.  This time there was no hostess present when I walked in the door and a couple was there waiting to be seated as well.  Found my family and they had already ordered.  20, maybe 25 minute wait just for salads even after I arrived.  I did not order, I just observed.  My mother, who is EXTREMEMLY picky about where she eats was not pleased with the wait for a salad. Everyone was pleased with the food and I was praying while they were eating that noone had slipped their hands down their pants before serving my family.  I will say the server was friendly and very prompt.  Not trying to give this place a hard time but....come on......

reviews.name: Becky H.
reviews.review: Service is good but really slow. Nice vibe but again service is slow.  Food is average. If you are close not a bad place just not the best.

reviews.name: Sphinx D.
reviews.review: Great simplicity. Peanut buckets. We had burgers. The fruit iced tea was magnificent. I ordered my burger all kinds of ways that were different and our server didn't even flinch. Southern hospitality is a welcome change from New York City. Would come again if I ever see another Logan's!

reviews.name: Robert U.
reviews.review: This seems like a good Logan's, better than some.  If you've been to a Logan's, you know what to expect in terms of decor, the menu, and the peanuts.This location seems clean and well run.  I've gotten good service here.  It's also walking distance from the Centennial Sportsplex, so next time you're camped out at a swim meet or hockey tournament, don't give up your hard-earned parking spot just to get a bite.  Just walk here!

reviews.name: Bud M.
reviews.review: Went by last night with three others.  We were seated in the bar area, even though the place wasn't crowded.  Nearly ten minutes before anyone came to take our drink order.  When they did show up we were ready to order entrees but the waitress wasn't, had to give drink order first.  Waitress was all blood-shot and glassy eyed.  When we finally were able to get the order in, we had to wait nearly 30 mins for the food.  My burger was over cooked, the potato was smaller than the bun, and black from sitting in the steamer all evening.  The person that ordered a steak had to sent it back, it was way over cooked also.    The quickest thing we received was the check.BTW Logan's, you should tell your staff not to stand outside the door talking about going to smoke some dope and holding their crotch.  I hope they weren't the cooks.  My last time ever going to that location.

reviews.name: Neil G.
reviews.review: Everything was great till the roaches started crawling around our booth. We told the waitress and she went to tell the manager. Instead of coming out and speaking with us he told the waitress that our food was free and we could leave. I would expect the manager to at least come out an speak with us instead of leaving a waitress and her trainee to handle such an embarrassing situation. I believe she said "I'm sorry but you know, it happens, it's a restaurant." I'm sorry but no, roaches don't crawl by my wife's head while she's eating in most restaurants. Judging from the reviews this is a common problem that's needs to be addressed here.First and last check-in here!

reviews.name: Lennae P.
reviews.review: They were very busy over lunch, but the food was excellent and service was quick.  Every staff member was friendly & helpful - especially our server Austin.  One member of our party ordered the sirloin. It was tender and perfectly cooked to medium rare.  If you like a little heat, the Spicy Nashville chicken sandwich is a frat choice. The chicken was moist and the pepper sauce had wonderful flavor.

reviews.name: Dee B.
reviews.review: Rate: 0Didn't stay long because as soon as we sat down, there were roaches crawling around at the booth we sat in. Gross! Not to mention the staff was really rude.No, this establishment location will not have any future check-ins from me.

reviews.name: Helen L.
reviews.review: I wasn't totally surprised when I went to Logan's Roadhouse. It reminded me of Texas Roadhouse. The deco was great with wooden furniture and neon lights. Each table came with a huge bucket of peanuts and peanut shells all over the floor. The staff was friendly and attentive. They serve a really large 2 pieces of bread that is light golden on the outside with a glaze over the top. The inside is SOOOOO SOFT... SOOO soft! I have never had such light and soft bread. They have a variety selection of appetizers, sides, desserts, burgers, salads, steaks, ribs, and combo entrees. The side of broccoli was VERY SAD and limpy. The half rack was fall-off-the-bone and the mac and cheese was comforting.

reviews.name: Andy W.
reviews.review: Found an earwig in my caesar salad after eating half of it.  Nearly threw up.  It really really sucked.

reviews.name: Evelyn S.
reviews.review: Completely awful experience.  We had a party of 8 (6 teen age boys to celebrate my son's birthday).  Despite our server (Tim)'s best efforts it was the most regrettable dining experience we have ever had.  The management (Stewart); the kitchen and the food were all terrible.  They ran out of Lemonade, we observed a little boy run to the bathroom covering his moth (throwing up) we should have bailed at that point.  We got bread, then waited another 20 minutes for more.  When our food finally came, it came in 2 waves (literally half the table got food, the other didn't) then when the other food came, we were missing  Broccoli - when it finally came (were were done eating) it was BROWN and awful.  One of the boys ordered a chicken tenders salad with blue cheese dressing; he got sick (as in vomiting) almost immediately.  Threw up close to the bathroom.  The staff just walked around it - no one helped us or cleaned it up (Until I went and got a staff member).  The manager - Stewart came to the table (about the Broccoli) took $20 off the meal and was not nice at all.  it was awful, we will NEVER dine there again; and we are reporting our experience to the health department.

reviews.name: Maya M.
reviews.review: The ribs were amazing!! The salad and burger were also pretty good, but the ribs were WONDERFUL!! Friendly staff & reasonably priced. Not many options for lighter / vegetarian fare or the speediest service... but I'd definitely go back for more of those fall-off-the-bone ribs!!

reviews.name: Bridget S.
reviews.review: Hungry...mmmm OK I have been here on several occasions, but today was awful. The most salty steak that I have ever had. Our server told the manager..his reply: "We use a heavy seasoning. Next time tell them light on the seasoning". Wow...no discount..no sorry..no discount for future time....I felt bad for the server who was wonderful. I wish I had the managers name...I have eaten the same meal meal here many times and never had a SALTY steak.

reviews.name: Leslie W.
reviews.review: I went to a private event at this establishment.  I have no complaints other than the pre-set menu was all fried and breaded foods. But that was poor choice of the hosts, not the restaurant.  The food was decent for what was ordered.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: The parents decided to take me and my brother out to eat and after seeing the completely packed lunch places across the street we sold out and decided to go to Logan's.  I tend to avoid big chains just because the food tends to be bland and boring but I know it is a decent chain and the parents like it.  So we went.First off, the waitress we had was super nice and friendly and she put up with my brother acting a fool so that's extra points for her!  Since I am trying not to pig out too much for the next couple of months I decided to order from the healthy menu (selections found on the back of the menu).  So I got the Southwestern tilapia which comes with steamed broccoli and a side garden salad with fat free vinaigrette.  My brother and dad got ribs and fried shrimp and my mom got the meatloaf with mac and cheese.So you can just imagine how the healthy menu tastes.  They cook it without butter or anything good so of course it was damn near tasteless.  That's not their fault, that's just how it is.  Southwestern flavor on the tilapia was non-existent and the fish was kind of dry but no big deal because I didn't expect much.  Broccoli was fresh and verrrry plain.  The salad was decent sized and had the dressing on the side and overall it was pretty tasty.  The ribs were apparently a hit - both my dad and my brother said they were good.  Tried the mac and cheese and it tastes like regular old cafeteria mac and cheese.  Not bad just not amazing.  The rolls though - ommmmmnomnomnom those are the BEST!  Definitely not on the diet plan but soooo good when slathered in butter!Overall I'd say Logan's is a decent chain where you can please the family without overdoing it on the wallet.  Just go when you don't have to diet and you can get the ribs!!

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: In the world of chain steakhouses you are pretty safe to try this Logan's.The staff is friendly, and the parking lot is pretty big, so its not hard finding a space.The food is decent with good prices.  You aren't going to end up with the same quality as say Ruth's Chris or Stoney River, but that's no surprise. And, if you really like Peanuts. They have A LOT of them.

reviews.name: Clay P.
reviews.review: TERRIBLE - Food was 2 star & service was minus 2. Slow and clueless from mgr right on down. We were group of about 20 and don't think any of us would return. Couple of staff were trying but this place was just a mess. Friday night - not very busy and for good reason I guess. Best advice if you go - sit and eat at the bar - at least you'll get your drink order

reviews.name: Nate S.
reviews.review: I've eaten here a couple of times- everything is what you'd expect out of a Logan's. Food was good, servers good. I've had no issues with the restaurant.

reviews.name: Scott K.
reviews.review: Well, the decor is kinda interesting here. The peanut shells on the floor, which makes for an interesting texture as you sitting at your booth.  I think they should sweep kinda earlier.  The steaks here have a chain taste, they are not very thick therefore it unable to obtain it nice crusty goodness on steaks without being well done on the inside.  The apps are probably the best part of the meal so load up on those.

reviews.name: Shawn H.
reviews.review: This is a great place to unwind. They have a nice selection of draft beer, and yes the steaks are awesome! Just the right amount of meat to fat ratio, then grill can be seen from the waiting area, and it is very clean. The service is always great, I always get greeted with a smile and they keep my cup full. The Rolls are always hot and plentiful and the peanuts are a very nice touch. If you have never eaten at a Logan's you do toss the shells on the ground, which is very cool, but they do frown if you toss your uneaten food on the ground :P. All in all stop by and have a drink, they do have outdoor seating with a fire pit, which is awesome in the fall! Beer and steak by the fire! Awesome!

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: Roadhouse iced tea, regret, more roadhouse iced tea, peanuts, cab

reviews.name: Lender W.
reviews.review: I love the people and staff.  The food is fantastic,  get it any way you want it.  I love this place.

reviews.name: Lai-Yee B.
reviews.review: Holy crap - bucket o'peanuts.My father and I were traveling to Clarksville for my brother's wedding and had just gotten out of the airport, when my father had a huge craving for ribs.Actually, he said "REEEEEBS. We need to get RRREEEEBBBBSSS. We're in Tennessee, aren't they supposed to have ribs here?"So I pulled off the highway and we basically walked into the first place we saw that looked like it would have ribs.And, wow, they were good! I also liked the veggies on skewers. The salad, however, was 1/3rd shredded cheese. Ooookay, then.These ribs also resulted in my pops getting a rack to bring home to family in NY. He really, REALLY liked these.
