Slice of avocado on each taco, the fish isn't battered so it gave it a really light, fresh taste! The tacos are mini size so I recommend at least 2-3 tacos for a serving.I got it to go and didn't get a chance to try anything else, but I will definitely be back.Service...hmmm, the second time I went, they NEVER came back to give us our bill. When we went to the counter they said our server went on break. Not cool after waiting an hour, but I will let it slide since the pitcher of martguerita was tasty and the tacos were A+.If you sit indoors, bring a sweater, it's freezin' in this place!

reviews.name: Peter C.
reviews.review: Dived (dove?) into the deep end and found pearls. I decided to order the tongue ("lengua") in an unusually adventurous mood, and it was buttery, succulent and flavorful beyond words. If their "weird foods" is this good, imagine the staples!!  A very exciting find, looking forward to trying the whole menu.  Oh yeah, super affordable too.

reviews.name: Winnie L.
reviews.review: Great restaurant if you want to sit and eat when you don't have much time. Food is great and you won't break the bank. Would not recommend take out B/C the food is not like taco bell which would probably survive a nuclear blast with all of the

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: If there is one thing Nolensville Road is known for, it's being packed with dozens of authentic Mexican and Tex-Mex style restaurants.  And of all the choices Nolensville has to offer, this one is undoubtedly my favorite.  The servers are polite and quick, the food is delicious and cheap, and the margaritas are oh so tasty.Honestly, La Hacienda isn't exactly big on atmosphere.  The whole restaurant is basically one large cafeteria style room, the floor is tiled and the mural behind the cash register isn't exactly expertly painted (although I like it).  But despite the sub par atmosphere, the food is some of the best that can be found in the area for the price.The staff at La Hacienda is very sweet, and I enjoy my meal every time I'm there.  It's a pretty great spot to go with a large group of friends (especially if you're looking to have a margarita or two).  I know that Nashville is packed with authentic (and allegedly authentic) Mexican joints, but this one is honestly in my top five...and that's saying something.

reviews.name: John W.
reviews.review: I feel like i was sold a bill of goods by all the Yelpers who claimed this is the best Mexican food outside of Mexico. I expected a much more authentic experience. The homemade tortillas are good, but not great. The margaritas are weak. Another strikeout for Mexican food in the 'ville.

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: With so many Mexican food restaurants around (and I wish I could try them all), I've found that there are certain ones I go to when I'm craving a particular dish.  Each one seems to have their specialties, and I have found that to be true with La Hacienda.   While there are many items on their menu that I have not tried yet, there are a couple that already stand out.    Their tacos are some of the best I've had, especially the chicken tacos.  They are served on two small corn tortillas with just the meat, diced onions, and cilantro.  All you have to do is squeeze on some lime juice or their salsa verde to make them excellent.  Nothing elaborate, just basic and good.  I would also highly recommend the breakfast dishes, which are served all day.  In particular, the Chorizo con Papas.  The chorizo is mixed in with diced potatoes, and they get the chorizo and potatoes nice and crispy.  The dish is served with the standard rice, beans, and tortillas.  Very filling and exactly like a dish made for me by a Mexican friend.   I haven't seen that exact dish on the menu anywhere else in Nashville so far.

reviews.name: jerry a.
reviews.review: Hands down my favorite place to get AUTHENTIC Mexican food, not the run of the mill Americanized version you find in most Mexican joints.  This is a family run business and they definitely know what they are doing and do it well.  They also host my local car club get-to-gethers for us even when asked to do so during busy weekend hours, we really appreciate that.  Bring your taste buds, bring an appetite and enjoy.

reviews.name: Chris R.
reviews.review: I love this place!! Great food, nice staff.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Excellent Mexican food. I ordered the lunch fajitas for dinner and still had some to take home. I'm still looking for a place in Nazzy that has soft sopapillas (no cinnamon sugar please!) ready for lots of honey.

reviews.name: Jason N.
reviews.review: I have had lunch here many times and it is above average.  Where this place really shines is Sunday morning breakfast.  They have a great variety of authentic mexican dishes.  I usually get the Chivo(Goat) Stew but also switch it out with the Chorizzo con Papas(Sausage and potatoes) and a few other dishes.  When the wife asks me where I would like to have breakfast, this is nearly always my answer.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: I kind of feel like if I am going to a restaurant that serves ethnic cuisine, I really like to be in the minority. It's the whole go where the locals go kind of ideal but for ethnic food. Alas I want to see a whole lot of Latino people if I am going for Mexican. Taqueria is definitely the real deal and if you have a hankering for Mexican and you don't want a speedy Gonzales then please give this place a try. The menu has meal options but they also have a # of A ll carte items that my husband and I end up getting. Tacos, quesadillas, etc.. However, the thing my husband and I love to get are the papusas. They are deep fried tortillas with your choice of meat and cheese inside. They then bring you a side of cabbage relish to top it. The whole combination is stunning. I got a burrito thing (I forgot the name) and for $3.50 it's ginormous and the sauce combinations are amazing. The dining room is small ,the service is extremely efficient and there is a little grocery attached so you can get some staples for your kitchen if you need.

reviews.name: Elise L.
reviews.review: I'm not impressed with this place at all. I visited on a Sunday night around 8:40pm. Upon sitting down the waiter asked for our drink orders and I asked her to bring waters while I take a quick look at the drink menu. She said I needed to hurry because they were getting ready to close at 9. Now I can understand not letting anybody in after 9, but you don't tell a customer what time you close! We ordered 16 oz magaritas for about $6. The mix was not good, and it didn't have much alcohol in it at all! It's one thing for it not to taste great, but not to get a buzz either is two strikes!. Lastly the food was small and overpriced. I ordered the shrimp quesdilla for $4 which is not expensive by any means, sut for what I got was not worth it at all! I got a small maybe 8 or 10 inch tortilla with shrimp and cheese. Taste was ok, but so not worth it. Best thing was salsa, which was a little spicy but had good taste. Don't waste your time and money here. Las Palmas, Las Maracas, and Pancho Villa Grill are much better choices. I guess that's what I get for trying something new.

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: La Hacienda seems to evoke varying opinions and emotions in people. I think this stems from the expectations that we Nashville diners have from a Mexican restaurant. Here is the way I have come to think of it: if you want the standard fare of meat enveloped in some sort of tortilla, covered with cheese and sour cream, don't eat here, pick almost anywhere else.If you would like to eat Mexican food that Mexican people eat, eat here. Here you will find tacos that are resplendent in their simplicity: meat, (steak or chicken) onions, cilantro, lime. Note that there is no cheese, lettuce, or sour cream to dull the flavors. If you want fantastic shrimp cocktails, fish tacos, or ceviche, eat here. Contrary to other opinions, I say La Hacienda is a fine place for a first or second date, having actually done that. It's a place that although is lacking in romantic ambiance, has an authenticity perfect for finding out just the right things about that new person. Share a 60oz margarita (made and served best by waiter Margarito - that really is his name). If you go here often, the staff will remember you and spoil you accordingly.  On a recent birthday celebration we got free shots of Petron and general merriment. Other things to try are the guacamole, which is truly delicious. The classic burrito is a meal in itself for only $3.99. One of my favorite tricks is the shrimp quesedilla with added lime and cilantro.I will admit that dining at La Hacienda is all about knowing what to order. The best way to do this is sit, order some guacamole and a margarita, and watch what comes out of the kitchen. If you're feeling especially adventurous, you can even order tripe or tongue!

reviews.name: Casey P.
reviews.review: I finally got around to checking out my new neighborhood, and La Hacienda was first on my list. I couldn't be more stoked that I have an awesome Mexican restaurant less than a mile away from my house. I've had the ceviche, most of the burritos, and the tacos so far, and I haven't been disappointed yet. Always had good service, tasty food, and a freaking awesome price. Needless to say, I'm a BIG fan of this place, and will be heading there again soon!

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: Not that thrilled really. My first impression from any Mexican joint is made from the salsa. Naturally it's the first thing to hit the table and if the salsa is good, the rest of the meal typically is aswell. In this case, I was a little let down.  The salsa was very watery,lacked flavor and spice. Sadly, the rest of the meal followed suit. With so many Mexican places in the area I sincerely doubt I will return.

reviews.name: traveler t.
reviews.review: After all the great reviews here and on Google, I gave it a try, but lunch today was the most disgusting meal so far in Nashville, so I don't know what everyone else is smoking. This is Gringo food that no Mexican person would touch.  Nearly everything was straight out of the can, and that was the best part.  Whatever they prepared from scratch was awful:  dry, crumbly chicken; old, mud-flavored fish, etc.  The service was bored and distracted, and the ambience was cheap, smelly and grim--why were all the lights out at lunchtime?  I don't know, but I could barely see my menu.  Every other slightly-Mexicanish, faux-fiesta, Gringo-haven in Nashville is better than this.  Put it another way:  I did not see any Latino customers here at all, and I understand why.  They go where the food is fresh, like the various taco trucks, the incredible Carniceria San Luis on Harding Pl, or Los Primos in Franklin.  Mexican people stand in line at those places, and I will gladly follow them.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: Though I cannot attest that "Authentic Mexican" exists in Nashville, I can tell you that after a 60oz. margarita you could be eating Chinese food and not notice. For those ardent telenovela fans, La Hacienda makes sure that you will never have to miss an episode due to persistent burrito cravings. On a side note.... I'm not sure if this is my California snobbery coming through, after all I was raised in the land of burritos, nachos, and tacos, but why is it that Nashville Mexican food places refuse to put my rice and beans in the burritos where they should be? Oh well, I guess I'll have to go through the extra effort of mixing the rice, beans, tortilla and meat together in mouth myself. Back to La Hacienda. I think as far as Mexican Food in Nashville goes, this place bodes well. I'm giving it four stars mostly due to the fact that their servers are always friendly and keep the previously mentioned margaritas flowing. Their fajitas are, in fact, delicious, but nothing else stands out. I'm a big fan of 'queso' but due mostly to the fact that it's just melted cheese, I cannot in good conscience tell people to come to La Hacienda for just the 'queso'. I can, however, in good conscience tell you to come for the margaritas and good environment.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: I'm going to give La Hacienda four stars. Mostly because everyone I know says this is the best Mexican food in Nashville. I have to say, it is pretty good, and cheap and fast which is what I usually expect out of a Mexican joint. It's also a step up from a lot of places in town.For some reason, I just don't love La Hacienda, though. Other reviewers have talked about the lack of ambience. I don't really think that's it since I've mostly been during the day for lunch with people from work and ambience isn't really an issue. La Hacienda was right down the street from where I used to work and people were going there all the time. This one kid just absolutely loved it. I'm starting to think I just got spoiled by my trips to Texas, New Mexico, and Arizona and got really used to the tasty Mexican food out there. I'd definitely recommend La Hacienda if you are looking for good Mexican. The service is very friendly, and they don't have a problem with big groups for lunch. I had a chilie relleno which was good, but I think I'll still keep hoping I find some Mexican that blows me away.

reviews.name: Carla C.
reviews.review: Went for lunch and had the fish taco and carne asada taco. The carne asada was the tiniest taco I've ever seen but it was not bad. The fish taco was forgettable. My husband had the enchiladas which were pretty good. The service was good but the food was just okay. Being from Texas, we're pretty picky about Mexican food. This was more Tex-Mex rather than authentic Mexican food.

reviews.name: Suz J.
reviews.review: Fresh tables are coming soon from Mexico, but the real Mexican food continues. A fresh remodel after a fire, and some new menu items help keep this one-restaurant tradition interesting. New molcajete with meat, cactus, banana peppers and goat cheese, and new quesadillas are nice additions. La Hacienda Taqueria stands alone - back like a phoenix!

reviews.name: Emi C.
reviews.review: Best steak tacos ever. Ever.

reviews.name: Neil V.
reviews.review: My friends and i used to frequent La Hac a fair bit before we got a Las Palmas location that was even closer (and cleaner than their west end spot).  The atmosphere at La Hacienda is a little bland, feeling more like a high school cafeteria than a real dining establishment, but the food has always been pretty good.  As far as "tex mex" goes, this doesn't rank too high on my list.  I grew up an hour from Mexico in south texas, and the flavor at la hacienda is a little bland and lacking in the spice/heat department.  The enchiladas are decent with the green sauce, but nothing special.  Breakfast burritos were always the safest bet in my opinion.  Drinks are good and cheap - they have a HUGE margarita option for something like $9, which made it a great place for friends to go celebrate hurricane Rita hitting our homes in texas a few years back...

reviews.name: D.T. B.
reviews.review: Delicious, big portions, of fresh home-made Mexican!  Fast and friendly service.  Great chips and salsa.  Getting hungry just thinking about it.

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: While its not Mexico, I think they're doing a really great job.  Probably the best Mexican I've had in Nashville.  Milanesa sandwich is very good and the atmosphere is very comfortable.  Definitely worth checking out.

reviews.name: Oliver G.
reviews.review: Order off the first couple of pages of the menu, and it's hard to go wrong.  Avoid the combination dinners or Fajitas unless you want Tex-Mex, because it's easy to order wrong at these places.  Tortillas are not fresh, nor is the salsa.  Check them out on weekends for authentic soups and stews like menudo and pozole.

reviews.name: Dallas T.
reviews.review: Food was good but not great. Unless you are here for the margaritas (huge, cheap, and handover-inducing), you should drive a little further down Nolensville to Las Americas for better food.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: This is a cute little place off of Nolensville Road, and the guys that drug a friend and I here assured us not to be put off by the area. Once inside, I could see how it would be easy not to worry about it anymore. It was cozy, and kind of set into the ground. They have some great fish tacos, and authentic Mexican beer. If you order the nacho platter, find someone to share it wish. And if you do order a beer, ask for the dark one. It's super yummy.

reviews.name: Theresa D.
reviews.review: Great service, pretty fast, and we've never had to wait for a table,   Pretty authentic food, would definitely recommend the carnitas.  Sometimes the parking lot gets crowded, but street parking isn't too bad.

reviews.name: Emily Y.
reviews.review: Like some of my other reviews, I also give this restaurant a 4 stars, because it is the best of its kind in the Nashville area . . . or at least our favorite.  There's a few other sister stores, but this one is the best and most consistent in quality of food preparation.Some items to try:--beef soup - very good w/ the added fresh chopped onions and lime--ceviche - a little fishy, but at least you can get it--shrimp coctail - the "cocktail' that it comes in is a mild tomatoey taste . . . a must try on the saltines.--shrimp cameroon (??) - very cheesy and greasy

reviews.name: Graham S.
reviews.review: a nashville institution that turned into an incorporation! nice. they taught me everything I know about mexican food....and drink. Horchata....yum.

reviews.name: Matt K.
reviews.review: First timer and this place was GREAT!! What a great change from typical fast food places with a huge menu and good food!! Had a wonderfully prepared burger along with onion rings and hush puppies, and a thick chocolate shake that was perfect fry dipping!!

reviews.name: Susanne H.
reviews.review: I was a little skeptical when our friends asked us to meet them here.  Walking in I figured out why.  You can get an entire meal for $5.00.  It is great when you bring kids, my kids can share one meal, it is more than enough for them.Don't expect high class or amazing food, it is a general fast food joint with that type of food.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: 3 stars - the food0 stars - service(*** Check out the "unrecommended" section of this thread.. Those reviews are SPOT ON)This is a mind blower.I went for a late night burger, after doing some Christmas shopping and my experience was fucking dreadful.I ordered: bacon/cheeseburger with everything except tomato.Order of fries.  that's it. nothing else.My order came up within minutes.This time, I sat inside and took a bite of my burger and opened the sandwich up to find no cheese.Took it up to the cashier and said, "There's no cheese."She took it.  I went and sat down. She yelled my number again. I went and got it.Sat down, bit into it, opened up the sandwich and the bacon was missing.Went back up to the cashier and said, "There's no bacon."A guy came out and said, "I'm going to make it myself."I went and sat down, drank my water, munched on some fries.He brought it out to me and said, "Maam, I made it myself."I thanked him, opened it up and tomato seeds were dripping out of it.The bacon and cheese were there, and so was the tomato, I didn't order.I couldn't go through that, again.  I pulled the tomato out and ate it.To say that I speak another language, would be incorrect.To say that they did not understand english, would be incorrect.To say that there is something very, very wrong with employees that can't get a damn burger right....All I can do is shake my head and bite my tongue and not say something that will come back and bite me in the ass.Expect the unknown.That's all I can say.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: I hardly ever eat fast food, but when I do, it's Cookout! I guess because of that reason, I haven't realized just how much prices have gone up lately, but you can get an entire meal with a drink (that's a sandwich and TWO sides) for only $5. They also carry more (random) items like hush puppies and corn dogs. The best thing about Cookout, however, are their shakes and their dozens of flavors. The line is almost always backed up, but their shakes are always worth the wait.

reviews.name: Roberto H.
reviews.review: Go to Wendy's instead. No idea why there are such huge lines here every day?Burger options here aren't interesting, flavor is MIA and they're smaller than your average fast food chain.  Chicken tenders may have been Tyson brand had they not had so much breading.  Lastly, the grilled chicken sandwich has an odd, almost sour taste.  If we head back it'll be to try the milk shakes.

reviews.name: Danny L.
reviews.review: Was on my way to Chic-fil-a up the street,but saw this place and decided to give it a try. I ordered their double burger and the cashier asked if I wanted the "tray" that included two sides. I agreed but was surprised to find their tray is a standard foam to-go container. It seems all their burger patties are the small McDonald's sized 2 oz. They have a pretty decent grilled taste, but being so thin makes them basically always over well done. No lemon slices for ice tea, just packets of lemon juice. It should be illegal to serve those as substitutes for sliced lemon, especially south of the Mason-Dixon line in sweetened iced tea. I witnessed an employee that cleaned tables pick an unused ketchup packet off the floor and return it to a bin on the counter. I always wondered if employees were doing that in the fast food business. Anyway, Cook Out has a great idea but seems to be missing a lot. Maybe they should send a few employees to an In-N-Out Burger t see how it's really done.

reviews.name: Caitlin C.
reviews.review: Anyone who goes to cook-out and expects anything more than fast food quality has got another thing coming.  My boyfriend literally squealed with delight when I told him Cook Out was coming out west to Nashville. We have gone to both the midtown and East Nashville locations. Cook-out has a cult following in the southeast, I have never seen anything like it. People get more crazy about Cook Out than people in the west get over In-n-Out. Do yourself a favor and get a milkshake and hush puppiesUnderstanding the cult cook out following might make you like it more, or hate it more - this is the best and most accurate article on cook-out I have ever read:deadspin.com/5883076/i-h…

reviews.name: Ruth L.
reviews.review: When this location first opened it would have gotten 5+ stars but it has gone down hill fast. The location to get in and out of is a nightmare. No light but right next to one at a busy intersection so you can't even pull out into a lane for that light if there is one car waiting already and it's always busy.They prices are super cheap and food good but unlike when they first opened they now can't get your order right ever! The last 8 OUTTA 10 times they screwed up and left off toppings on the burgers. Small portions but I think for the price you can't really complain on that one. Most every milkshake the bottom has a half inch layer of what is suppose to be mixed into the drink. They didn't blend them long enough. Yes I know things sink to the bottom but this much is beyond normal. (I'm a milkshake junkie)The hours are great if you are a night owl staying open til 2am.Good food, good prices, just dont expect to ever get your order right.

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: Food was always good service is 100 times better than McDonald's and the prices are good.

reviews.name: John P.
reviews.review: Great shakes, burgers, onion rings!Super fast service and a nice clean place.Will be back

reviews.name: DeAndre H.
reviews.review: Cook Out is chill, I like the taste of the burgers. Nice char on them. I go a little late when they're not busy, they always keep the place clean which is great. The reason for the 4 stars is because there's always room to do better. The menu for instance, I feel that it's too busy. Needs images or something, but that's all I have to say. Great restaurant overall.

reviews.name: Lance P.
reviews.review: COOK OUT SUCKS! BAD! I don't get this new sad ass fast food place called Cook Out in my hood. They didn't even have the one, halfway healthy thing on the menu I ordered. My buddy ordered chicken nuggets after we already paid and they made up some lazy, lame ass excuse not to ring them in and serve them. Then, here's the real kicker. Wait for it, wait for it....we got home and they forgot to put the meat on a chicken sandwich! Just an empty bun with lettuce/tomato. Seriously!? And they want a higher minimum wage!? Great first impression! Smh, never going back! Reminds me why I never go to any fast food place....other than Chipotle. Why why why couldn't it be a Chipootle instead in E Nash instead!?

reviews.name: tron d.
reviews.review: Look it's fast food but it's the best fast food on gallatin. I like the burgers and quesadillas. Cheerwine float is a must at least once.

reviews.name: Jeremy C.
reviews.review: It is worth every penny  and it's only $4.99 it tastes like you just got it off the grill at your house these expensive restaurants like old Charley's and Fridays their burgers taste like s*** compared to these these are really good wish I'd known about this place a long time ago this location just open and I will be a regular there for sure

reviews.name: Shawntay C.
reviews.review: I decided to try this place because it is almost always a full parking lot and I can understand some reasons why. I ordered a regular BBQ burger with cheese and chili cheese fries for $6.31 to be exact! :-)  I felt the price was spot on for the quality of food. The burger was delicious and really reminded me of a home grilled burger with just the right amount of juiciness! The fries however were uninspiring. The chili just didn't do anything for me and neither did the cheese on second thought.  My third thought concerning fries is that they should consider sweet potato fries as another alternative. Overall I'll return and I'll definitely get a milkshake then!!

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: The food is average, better than McDonald's, but there are many better burger places in town.  There wasn't a lot of flavor in either my burger or my chocolate shake, but they were edible. The meal was quite reasonably priced, so I guess you get what you pay for.  All that said, the service is abysmal here.  I was ignored at the counter for a while until someone deigned to take my order. My burger eventually came, but the workers were oblivious that there should have been a milkshake with it. When I brought this to their attention, they acted as if I was imposing on them or something.

reviews.name: Bud M.
reviews.review: What I like about this place?  Fast service, value for the money and the HUGE tea.  Yeah it's fast food but the price/quality/quantity ratio are right on.  Get there early, the place is busy with working folk like myself getting a meal for their hard earned buck.

reviews.name: Justin B.
reviews.review: My wife and I love Obie's!The pizza is delicious, and their menu prices are pretty close to unbeatable. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Gary M.
reviews.review: Hey, wake up midtown Nashville!!  Obies is the best place in town to grab a slice. Obies is a long-time fixture for take-out pizza near Vanderbilt and the mid-town hospitals. However, it appears that those of us living and working around Elliston Place have forgotten how convenient and declicious it is to pick up a great slice of pizza for lunch.Since working around here, I have been to Obies about 10 times in the last couple months, and every time I have enjoyed a perfect piece of pepperoni pizza. Nothing fancy. Traditional New York Style, chewy crust, zesty sauce and plenty of cheese. One piece and a drink is under 5 dollars, and will not slow you down in the afternoon. Excellent value. The dine in area is clean, cool and a great place to people-watch through the wrap-around picture windows. There are a lot of newer, hipper restaurants around, but it should be mandatory for any self-respecting Nashvillian to drop by Obies for a simple but stellar meal.

reviews.name: Lucas M.
reviews.review: Obie's pizza is some freakin underrated Nashville pizza.From the moment me and my friends walked in, the guy working, Nash, was. the. HOMIE. It was late night on a Wednesday, and the guy was real personable and very happy we walked in, even when it was close to closing time. Helped us pick right what we wanted off the menu, and told us a little about the history of the place. All in all, service was great. But that pizza though...Great pizza. We ordered the BBQ and Greek Gyro and they both were super scrumptious. The sauce was runny and that's exactly how I like it. They're open until 4 AM on weekends AND they deliver.5/5

reviews.name: Ryan M.
reviews.review: Seriously one of my best experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. Pizza was great! And the service was fantastic! I can't rate it high enough.

reviews.name: Mark A.
reviews.review: Best pizza and wings hands down,They should change their name from Obie's pizza to "Damn good pizza" cuz it's DAMN GOOD.

reviews.name: Andre M.
reviews.review: I went with the pepperoni pizza, thin crust. I was disappointed from the first bite. The crust was more hand tossed than thin and the sauce is not too appealing. The pepperoni was overcooked and had a strange taste to it. Only upside to this place was the decent delivery time.

reviews.name: C P.
reviews.review: It is good pizza, good service, in great timing!  The fact they deliver to my work place is fabulous and on point!

reviews.name: Jason C.
reviews.review: Good food, phenomenal, attentive customer service.

reviews.name: Mariah R.
reviews.review: The customer service is fantastic. They really care about the customers and go out of the way to make sure they are satisfied!

reviews.name: Laura B.
reviews.review: 1. This place does not have Chicago style pizza, and here lies all hopes and dreams of finding it in Nashville, shattered at this last stop. 2. This place does have pretty good pizza. Stopped in with a Chicago native to see if we could find the good stuff in Nashville. No go. The place is also mostly a take-out/delivery type of place, not really a lot of room inside, but the guys inside were kind, if a bit clueless as to what Chicago style pizza is. The pizza was good and I believe a large with pepperoni was about $15, it was certainly hearty but no true deep dish here. Still a delicious pizza and I would go back in the area!

reviews.name: Paul B.
reviews.review: Walked there on a Thursday afternoon looking to whet my whistle with some pipin hot za. This being my first time in Nashville, I was searching out a local establishment and going into it with an open mind. Closed at 1:30 on a Thursday with no hours posted on the door? What kinda orangutan do we have running this joint? I question the business practices of Obie P. Za and his barnyard crew of employees that think this is acceptable

reviews.name: Ruben M.
reviews.review: Ate food from here now.I really loved the pizza! Fries could've been better but good stuff!

reviews.name: Jason E.
reviews.review: Every once in a while I crave some nice and greasy pizza.  This place does well with satisfying that craving!  I actually like the pizza... It's pretty tasty I think.  My only issue with it is that they claim to have 'Chicago style' pizza... And even though they may shape the edges up like Chicago style... This is no Chicago style.  It's more like a New York style thin crust with big tall edges.  You pretty much have to fold it to eat it.  But still, I liked it. Can't say much for the atmosphere... Or the utensils, if you eat there.. But decent pizza, if you like that style.  The guys who work there are nice as well.

reviews.name: C W.
reviews.review: Horrible... Nothing like Chicago style pizza. If you are craving Chicago style pizza don't waste your time.

reviews.name: Ava P.
reviews.review: **The Obie's pizza recipe used here is not the same as the original if anyone remembers the place prior to the early 2000s**If any of you are like me, someone who frequented Obie's on Elliston Place but moved away prior to about 2001, you will be disappointed because the current Obie's pizza and the old Obie's pizza having nothing in common at all. You can get your hopes up because the place has the same name and is in the same location and is almost the same looking from the outside and practically identical in the inside (so much so it's like walking into a time-warp).I grew up on Obie's pizza and started coming as a baby in the 1980s. My parents were Obie's fanatics and were always there from the time it first opened in about 1979. The originator of the place was a young guy who was killed unexpectedly shortly after it opened. Obie's changed hands many times after that but the new operators always remained true to the original recipe. The place was called Obie's Flying Tomato Pizza back then. They served thin crust, pan, and deep dish Chicago style pizzas.All of us were such Obie's lovers that even though we moved away in the early 90's when any of us came back to Nashville we'd always bring several pizzas back on the plane (when you were allowed to do that sort of thing) for the rest of the family. The last time I did that was about 2001. A year of so after that we got a call from my aunt to forewarn us that Obie's had changed owners yet again and this time the pizza changed too.I decided to stop by recently even though I'd been told by other family who checked out the change not to go because there is no way I would like it they said. I couldn't resist the temptation. The owner was there and I just came out and asked him if his pizza was anything at all like the original Obie's. He said he wouldn't know because he never had the original Obie's but to please go ahead and try his. He also said the current Obie's pizza was a recipe he created. So we ordered and I found that the pizza wasn't bad; I thought it was just okay judging it objectively not comparing it to the original. My aunt was with me and was surprised that the recipe had changed yet again from when she was there in about 2007.At the end of our meal the owner asked me if his Obie's pizza tasted anything like the original. I told him it tasted nothing at all like the original but was still decent pizza which was the truth and he seemed happy with that.If anyone out there happens to know the recipes for the ORIGINAL (circa 1979 - 2000) Obie's Flying Tomato deep dish and pan pizzas let me know!!

reviews.name: Melissa L.
reviews.review: My husband was craving a Chicago style deep dish pizza and thought he remembered Obie's having one so we looked it up, called and confirmed then headed out from Brentwood.When we got there the place was EMPTY though everyone had to be somewhere because there was no parking to be found anywhere nearby.  However, after watching the action in the kitch, it was obvious this place is not much of an eat in place but does one heck of a delivery business.We ordered our pizza and they told us to sit a the table with a heater on it.  It's not pretty to look at but it's well worn with age.  This place has character!He told us our pizza took a little longer because of the thick crust and that it would be about 20 minutes.  He brought our pizza to the table piping hot and w couldn't wait to dig in.I don't know if this is a true Chicago style pizza as I've only had the 'chain' versions before but I can ay that it was a good pizza.  The crust was well done and not doughey.  The sauce was nice and had a nice balance of zesty and acid, not sweet which I detest.  Toppings and cheese were plentiful.What's more, these ar people that care about their food and about your experience.  It feels good to eat at a place like this where they care so much.  That alone makes it worth the drive and fight for a parking space.

reviews.name: steven c.
reviews.review: Ok, so it was all a misunderstanding.  I called them again and the guy misunderstood my address.  So, I guess their only guilt is not paying attention.Pretty good pizza, too.

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: Obie's earns four stars for one simple reason: they stay open late!  Super late!  I'm talking 2:00 a.m. late!  They even deliver until around 1:00 or 1:30 (at least on weekends), and while it isn't the best pizza in the city, it's certainly pretty tasty.Obie's is on the ever-popular Elliston Place right between The End, The Exit/In, Samurai Sushi and a half-dozen other extremely cool bars, restaurants and places of interest.  Obie's is a pretty small shop, but there's enough room to dine in if you're not there when they're slammed.  They have pretty cheap prices on most of their pizzas and other items (calzones, meatball subs, et cetera), and the staff is always quite nice.We really need an Obie's on the East Side.  Their Italian cuisine is pretty run-of-the-mill, but they certainly know how to please the late-night stoner/barfly/musician crowd.  And the location is absolutely prime.  If you're on Elliston and looking to eat during the day, you might as well hit Rotier's, the soda shop or Jersey Mike's.  But if it's late at night and you're fiending for a nice, greasy slice of pizza, this is your spot.

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: Ugh.....I don't even want to write this review, because I think it might make me sick to my stomach. After spending all day at the Music City' Brewers Festival, my friends and I needed something to soak up all that beer. As we were headed back to my friends hotel on Elliston, we saw that Obies was open. So, we decided to grab a few pizzas. Why we didn't eat at Gold Rush next door is a mystery to me. The fact that drunk people thought this stuff was bad, is really saying a lot. Because when I'm drunk, I'll usually eat anything. I would not recommend eating here. That the end of this review b/c I'm not feeling well now.

reviews.name: Courtney B.
reviews.review: Obie's was a staple to me in my college days, and has remained being so in my post-college Nashville life.  They are the only place in town that delivers late (we're talking 1 am late) and this combined with their unbelievably extensive menu was a saving grace for me during many a late night cram session.  Their physical location in the popular Elliston Place area makes them incredibly convenient for the late night munchies.  They are right next door to The End and across the street from Exit/In and because of such, are very popular with the after show crowds.  Their building is small, but inviting, decorated with an unmissable mural declaring them the home of the flying tomato on their exterior.  I will admit though that the majority of my experiences with Obie's are based on their delivery service.  Their menu is one of the most eclectic in town and they hands down offer the most options for delivery.  While their food isn't the best in town, it is all cooked fresh and the taste reflects that.  They have a great selection of pizzas and calzones with a pretty awesome provision of toppings to choose from.  But they're not limited to just that, they also offer sandwiches, salads, 'platters', appetizers, even Mexican food, each genre of food with more than enough options to choose from.  The prices are great and the portions are plentiful.  Most anything you order can easily be split with a friend or function as multiple meals if you're ordering alone.  Their menu is a great solution for when you're not sure what you feel like eating, or even if you're craving something different from your friends.

reviews.name: Layne S.
reviews.review: The pizza here is gross. The mozzarella cheese was separated like it was spoiled, and the tomato sause was from a strange jar. Don't eat here.

reviews.name: Jarrett J.
reviews.review: This was the least enjoyable pizza experience I ever had. The service was terrible, food was served COLD, and the place itself was dirty. I'll never go there again.  How in the WORLD do you run a business like that for so long!? It's pizza...it's not THAT hard to get it right!

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: Obie's is the best late night eatery around Vanderbilt.  It is situated in a tiny building and it is open until 2:00 A.M.  Located near The End and alot of other bars,  Obie's is a mandatory stop for me after hitting up the bars around the area.Be warned:  this is not food for people afraid of grease.  Obie's pizza is so greasy that grease oozes from the crust, no joke.  Not that it is a problem for me, because when it's 2 A.M. and I am hungry, Obie's is the most satisfying thing on the planet!

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: Obie's is more than just a great college pizza place. Yes, the pizza is delicious and the calzones are heavenly but you can eat here on a diet as well. I love their Black Bean Chicken salad without the sour cream and the Grilled Chicken Salad. More than just salads, their Grilled Chicken Platter comes with Rice, House Salad and Garlic Bread (ditch the bread and you're having a filling healthy meal). A friend of mine loves their Mexican burritos, the Bean and Cheese to be specific, but I've never had the honor. The pastas are also pretty good. They do deliver to Music Row as well, which is very nice. Although the only place I can find their menu online is campusmenus.com. I've never actually dined in here but I do love their delivey!

reviews.name: Stacy A.
reviews.review: Love this hidden lunch spot. Great food, good service and nice atmosphere. I highly recommend the low and slow and either the chips or fries. Great spot!

reviews.name: James M.
reviews.review: This is a good lunch spot for the Marriott Drive business crowd. It's always pretty interesting to see the options they have on their "quick lunch" buffet bar and they seem to have some creative vegetable options every day.The quick lunch bar is the only option I've tried from here. it's not your usual simple southern lunch or anything and can serve as a solid solution for the business crowd. Personally, my favorite so far has been the fried chicken on a biscuit. This place does tend to offer heavier meals without much regard to healthy options. Pros:A bit more creative than your typical lunch spot on this side of town. The best thing about this place, in my opinion, are the sides and veggies.Cons: Freshness has been an issue. This was especially true  on burger day the last time I went in. I just was not impressed by how long the burger was left out in the open. They should keep the bar refreshed a little more often.Overall:They offer flavorful, quick lunches every day from the team behind RIff's Food Truck.  Check their Facebook and Twitter feed (Carlos from Riff's) to see if they post what their lunch is that day.

reviews.name: Becky S.
reviews.review: This place is only okay if you are in need of eats and there is no where else to go. The food tasted like reheated leftovers and did not taste fresh. The service was quick and friendly which is the only reason there are any stars here in my rating. I had the pork tacos and would not get them again.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: Solid place for lunch. And a MUCH needed addition to the desert of tasty lunch options that is the industrial park in and surrounding Elm Hill Pike. It was quite difficult to find out where the heck this cafe is located due to it being in a business complex jungle with poor signage and addresses. For anyone who is also lost...the building says "2" out front if that helps you. Also, I found it a bit odd that they were located where they were... Being off Elm Hill Pike would have a ton more visibility and convenience for people...but maybe they are just trying to cater to that one specific office complex? Once we parked we came inside to see what looked good. I tried the Korean BBQ tacos and the bahn mi pork sandwich with a side of tomato soup. It was a pricy lunch for what I normally spend on the rare occasion I go out but it was a ton of food and I was stuffed. I have to admit that the tacos were a TAD salty and had quite a bit of mayo on them, but the flavor was good and they were huge. I preferred the bahn mi sandwich. The soup was very tasty also, and I grabbed a soy latte for the road before we came back to work. All in all, I'm glad this spot is so convenient to me. They offer a half sandwich/soup option that is cheaper and I think I will try next time. Their dessert case is quite extensive as well. Next time I'll have to try one out before I get myself too full!

reviews.name: Craig L.
reviews.review: Just left here for lunch with three co-workers.  Other than the one person that had the burger nobody was happy at all with their meal. I would not recommend this place. The burger was good but just your normal pan fried burger and a small one at that. Two of us had the "hot" chicken that was nothing more than an extremely overcooked large chicken tender with some average store bought spice blend and honey poured over it. For $9.00 they can't even give you a whole breast??There is too much REAL hot chicken in this town to have to eat something like this. Now for the sides. Their homemade chips were highly touted only to be nothing more than average. The macaroni and cheese looked great only to disappoint with little flavor. We won't be back.

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: Love riffs! Always new and exciting items and friendly staff. Way to go guys! I work next door and I no longer have a lunch hour while you are open but when I get a break I normally seek over for a baked treat or a lattee. The honey bee is my favorite latte. Sweet and spicy.

reviews.name: B W.
reviews.review: Had lunch there today, the menu has changed since I had last been there a few months back.  My favorite menu item, Sick-em on a Chicken, was no longer listed.  None of the other items were appealing so I went with the Bob Marley.  It came in a wrap and was composed mostly of rice.  There was very little chicken on it.  I was pretty disappointed, especially for the cost of $8.00.  I could have gotten something just as good at half the price at Taco Bell, such as the Fresco Burrito Supreme.I had the pasta salad as my side item.  It was okay, a little heavy on the Parmesan though.Some other changes that I noticed on my visit was the absence of the coffee menu and dessert items.  I did not inquire if they were still available or not.I used to enjoy going there, but I think I'll look around for a new specialty lunch location...mainly due to my lack of interest in their menu selections.

reviews.name: Meg P.
reviews.review: This place is not only affordable but delicious and fresh. I had the bob Marley wrap and it was amazing! Hands down one of the best wraps I have ever had. The hand cut fries on the side were cooked to perfection. This little gem is in an office building and am a little jealous of everyone that works near by.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: My first frustration with this Riff's place was trying to gain access: the first time I went, I found that it closed at 3pm.  The second time, I got there before the closing time, but was told that none of the equipment was working, so they wouldn't be able to sell me anything.  They didn't seem disappointed that they had ceased serving at least a half-hour early, and that lack of empathy really got under my skin.  So, finally I made it back to the establishment today.On top of my frustrations of getting in, I found that Riff's is like Barista Parlour, and if you've read my review of the latter, that's not a compliment.  They use Intelligensia coffee, and I'm not a huge fan of this brand.  They are pretentious and they only chat with their buddies.  The other thing about them is they don't stock enough food.  I heard a guy say they ran out of hamburgers and soup.  It was close to closing time, but they had neither left for the hapless customer.I was just frustrated with the high-mindedness.  They are the haughty coffee place for haughty people.  Not my thing.  Others will love it: not me.

reviews.name: Bob S.
reviews.review: Gave it try for the first time on Monday. I had the Korean BBQ Pork Taco's... they were a home run.  There were so so yummy! My only complaint, Guys go buy a couple more table and chairs.... you have room in there. Will be back!!

reviews.name: Rebecca P.
reviews.review: Food was fair. I had a chicken salad sandwich. The chicken wasn't cut up very small, but it was still in the "alright-to-good" category. Be warned if you are using GPS to get here: You will be led to a non-descript office park. The restaurant is in the bottom corner of one of the office buildings. Just look for the logo pasted on one of the tinted windows. Also, note that they stop serving breakfast at 11.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: By the airport Marriott, Riffs is Donelson's fresh cafe for breakfast and lunch. Riffs fine pastries are always available and the rest of the food changes frequently. The flavorful Squash Fritters with veggie garnish and a cup of their Intelligentsia coffee almost made  me do the happy dance. Happy, but the coffee didn't make me feel smarter. I think that the coffee's more intelligent than I. On different days I might find Korean tacos, chicken soup, local greens salad or waffes if I'm lucky. The sandwiches tend toward a fun unconventional mix of ingredients.

reviews.name: John M.
reviews.review: The service was great!  One of my pet peeves is asking about menu items and the server not knowing anything about them.  Server at the counter answered all questions with good knowledge of what I was asking and also made some great suggestions.  Friend had the Tophat burger and it was good but the fries stole the show on that plate.  Hand cut, double fried.  These people know how to treat a potato.  I had the Printers Alley and it was also very good but the collard greens again stole the show.  The desserts almost cost me my diet as they looked incredible.  One day I will try them.  The only thing keeping me from giving this gem a 5th star is the portions.  The sandwiches are a little pricey for a sandwich that is between a standard burger and a slider.  For a price north of $10 for a sandwich, 1 side and a small glass of tea I expected more.  Otherwise, great place to eat.

reviews.name: Janis K.
reviews.review: Visiting Nashville for the first time and we were looking for some great live music.....well in the first two day's we were here twice!  The music is great....have listened to several very talented groups (Points West, JD Shelburne and a young woman who played with them....can't remember her name but, how talented at a young age)Most of the bars we visit are filled with girl bartender's, not super friendly and that's ok...guess doing their jobs.  BUT.....Tequila Cowboy has a great guy, Jimmy!  Really a nice, genuine person.  We had a great time talking with him....not to mention he's really great at his job.  We watched as he balanced a busy bar, mixing and serving drinks and managed to keep a great conversation with us too.  Thanks Jimmy!!Visit this location for the talent...great drinks and bar food....and our friend Jimmy!!

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: My first time here and probably my last. I got invited here by some lady friends that were in the mood to dance. I don't typically hang out much on the Broadway scene as it's so touristy and I had no idea what to expect but I'm open-minded. The music was just dance pop and generic mainstream hits. Nothing I listen to as my tastes lean indie but if I have a few drinks in me I can tolerate it for a bit. So if you don't have mainstream preference in music might not be a place you enjoy. But that's not the reason for my 1 star, my reason is because of one extremely rude bartender. It's a rare day that I come across a service staff so rude that I am seething with anger. I had an open tab. I go up to him and say "gin and tonic, I have an open tab and give my name". I had to repeat this a few times. Then he rudely yells in my face "what do you want?" Like I'm some bumbling moron when I said what I wanted for the 3rd time. Then at the end of the night I go to close my tab and the ass**** literally ignores me. He serves everyone else around me and pretends I'm not even standing there. I've never been treated like that in any venue in my life. I went to a different bartender, a lady and she was very fast and served me with a smile. But that one guy there deserves to be fired and totally tainted my experience. So between the lame music and bad experience with the bartender, I'd never return this place again. And if this bartender happens to be reading this, two middle fingers right at you.

reviews.name: Quinn B.
reviews.review: Being my first time to Nashville, I came in with an open mind. A local public service agency was sponsoring a 2-hour event here while in town for a conference. The only good thing about this place is the size and potential (too bad they don't use that potential). I like lists, so here's my list...Pros:-Big placeYep, that's it.Cons:-Sad choices in beer (Only the big American standards, Bud, Miller, Coors,etc.) $4.75, BOTTLE ONLY-Staff.....meh.-Music...Ok-Upstairs has limited view of the stage. I could only see the legs of the singer from any point upstairs. You can lean over the railing to see below, but you'd better have a strong grip on your drink, otherwise the person below is getting a head full of your cocktail or worse, a trip to the trauma center.There are plenty of choices along Broadway, so we left after the event and headed to Robert's. This place absolutely ROCKS, but I'll save that for another review.

reviews.name: Rachelle S.
reviews.review: Loved this place! From wonderful live music, to great food (which I wasn't expecting from a bar atmosphere), to a very attentive server. Everything exceeded my expectations!

reviews.name: Ryan E.
reviews.review: So went in one side which was a karaoke bar, pretty funny to take a break from the pro's on the strip and watch fellow tourists give it a shot. Main side of the bar had a great bad our night there, then turned into a dance club later on and we had an awesome time.

reviews.name: Brian M.
reviews.review: Stopped in for a drink and possibly a bite to eat on Saturday afternoon and even though there was a good crowd we quickly found a seat at the bar close to the stage. The atmosphere here is fun and festive, however the lighting is dark. When I arrived shortly after noon, only the downstaris was open however there was live music playing which made enjoying a nice ice cold beer all the better. Our bartender was friendly and quickly brought us a food menu, however after looking over it we decided to just stick with our beer and eat elsewhere. Food was typical bar fare, and just didnt sound all that appealing.After we finished our beers we cashed out our tab, which for two Bud Lights was $9.50 (without tip), which seemed rather excessive however Broadway is more of a touristy section of Nashville so expect to pay a little bit more. However no cover and free music during the day helped make up for the $4.75 bottle.I can see this place being populat at night, especially with live music and the upstairs being open and overlooking the stage. Apparently there is also a mechanical bull located upstairs, however we didnt have a chance to see that during our visit.

reviews.name: Cindy P.
reviews.review: I wish I could say something better about this place but I just can't!  With so many places to choose from, they really need to step up the game.  As visitors from out of town, our patronage doesn't have much impact on their stability so maybe that's the way they look at things.  No matter what, they'll get people in the door because of location and appearance, bringing them back in those doors is going to be the problem!I loved the layout of the place, very open and nice long buddy bars along each side. The stage is all the way in the back so no competition with the in and out traffic and the sound carried through the bar perfectly. Service was pitifully slow for the amount of customers in for lunch compared to the amount of workers. It took forever for first time service and then to get anything else we had to chase our server down!  She was sweet and friendly, just super super slow and inattentive. I might as well talk about the food in this same paragraph because it was pitiful too! Everybody's food was cold but mine was exceptionally cold! I had to actually send it back - no way you can enjoy cold onion rings and chicken strips! We had a blast wandering up and down Broadway and will do it again next time we're in Nashville (which I hope is soon)!  We won't be stopping in Tequila Cowboy though, not worth the risk!

reviews.name: Michael R.
reviews.review: We live in Ohio and a new luigi's was opened at Polaris, same great food as in Nashville. These places are also attached to Wanna B's karaoke and Tequila Cowboys. Spent the evening for dinner, then went to watch a good country band then finished up the evening singing some karaoke. Good night with our friends.

reviews.name: Jenny L.
reviews.review: Cool vibes, but my Tom Collins was served to me with bourbon instead of gin.... the bartender saw me make a face after drinking it, and immediately came clean saying she didn't know how to make it. She then asked me for the recipe. Why not just look it up instead of faking it? Or ask that I order a different beverage? Weird.

reviews.name: Tim C.
reviews.review: Should have paid attention to the others who ranked this appropriately low but was walking by and decided to stop in.Very dark and the staff was more interested in chit-chatting among themselves than helping me.  I asked for a beer list and they did not have one so I said I would just take a Miller Lite while I tried to read the taps in the dark room.  They were out, yup thats right OUT of Miller Lite, one of the most basic beers in every bar.So here is the kicker, the bartender, Tiffany, pops open a bottle for the guy next to me and the cap flies into her open ice container.  She starts to panic, looks for it, digs through all of the ice with her dirty hands.  Several minutes later I am not sure if she found it or not but she grabs ice from this area and uses it to pour a drink for another customer.  Completely disgusted by how dirty and unclean this single act was, I got up and left.

reviews.name: Thiviyah R.
reviews.review: I came here while I was in Nashville for a weekend to see my boyfriend. I definitely enjoyed the music here. They had different dance floors with different genres and dancefloors. The place itself was lively and packed with a good crowd.There are two levels which in my opinion makes a bar a lot more interesting to be at. You can come to just sit and have drinks or you could go all out. There is plenty of space to dance as well!

reviews.name: Danica L.
reviews.review: 1. Drinks are definitely overpriced, even by Broadway standards. Our group went to most bars on the street, and this was by far our least favorite. 2. Crowd was sketchy at best. A lot of pushy men with high expectations. I actually had to forcibly push one man off of me and hide in the bathroom from many others.3. Bar employees were very pushy at the end of the night. Overall, worst bar that I have been to in downtown Nashville.

reviews.name: Paul G.
reviews.review: In Nashville and went up and down broadway looking for a good bar   What a disapointment UNTIL we found Whiskey Bent Saloon  Drink dance and have fun  Good live music and great Jack Daniels, they even make a decent Jack Daniels Lynchberg Lemonaide!! Hard to find anyone that even knows what that is   Lol

reviews.name: Jay R.
reviews.review: Very fun atmosphere, lots of friendly people, tremendous bartenders, great band, and an incredible taste to the dishes! In a loud atmosphere, my waitress took great care of me, gave me a hot brisket sandwich (that didn't get messy) as well as sweet potato fries without any errors, and also with sincerity! There are nice decorations, and the location is right in the center of Broadway. Come!

reviews.name: Emily R.
reviews.review: This place is pretty good. Like most of the bars in downtown Nashville the music was great. They had tunes you can really dance to especially if you like country. Unfortunately, we only got to hear one song before the band took a break. However, what we heard was good. The staff was nice enough but lacked personality. They just kind of handed me my drinks with no smile or anything. The place was very busy so I wasn't expecting any long, stimulating conversations, but a smile or a thanks would have been nice. The employees looking miserable is not good for business especially a bar. The drinks were pretty good, but overpriced. I think that is something to be expected in any city though. All in all the scenery was nice and when I am in Nashville again I would go back, however, I think with the vast amount of great bars along the strip Tequila Cowboy falls a little short.

reviews.name: Lindsey R.
reviews.review: I loved tequila cowboy! It really made the day trip to Nashville. Yes the drinks are expensive but what can you expect from an extremely tourist-y part of the city... The awesome atmosphere and music definitely makes up for it! We heard an amazing artist named Steven Clawson and the food was really good. My boyfriend said his burger was the best one he's ever had. I'll miss tequila cowboy but I'll definitely be back!!

reviews.name: Amanda C.
reviews.review: Great country music, GREAT atmosphere! The bartenders are sweet and attentive. Tequila Cowboy is very clean and a great place to spend your time on Broadway.

reviews.name: V W.
reviews.review: I loved the venue and the music. It was nice that I could actually have a conversation while also enjoying the music. The burger I had was surprisingly good as were the overpriced mixed drinks. My biggest complaint was the wait staff. It was lunch time and painfully slow on a Sunday yet the bartenders seemed rushed and annoyed when we asked for anything. It wasn't just us. I watched them do the same to everyone. If I decide to ever go back I'll take my chances at a table instead of the bar.

reviews.name: Jonathan F.
reviews.review: Pretty cool country bar with a big stage for musical acts. I was here on a Friday and it was a pretty happening joint. Great music playing. (J.D Shelburne) you should look him up! The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was the lack of a diverse food menu for dinner. I know I know....it's just a country bar. I just want a side item other than fries or onion rings or Cole slaw. This is a minor complaint. The servers are fantastic. We had a very sweet girl who was quite accomodating and friendly. Give this place a go for a Friday night. I just wouldn't reccomend a sit down dinner here at night.

reviews.name: K Y.
reviews.review: Good bartender. Awesome live band! Rocking sound system playing Johnny cash and takin requests

reviews.name: Joshua R.
reviews.review: Went here on a Saturday night. Pretty solid bar on broadway, definitely less congested with plenty of space relative to others, so if you are out with a large group and are looking to meet up or hang out somewhere, this is definitely a good one.Oh yeah, and there's a mechanical bull, if you were desperately looking for a bar that has that. Its on the second floor and is generally not too crowded

reviews.name: Tina H.
reviews.review: They were out of a lot of beers and didn't have an updated drink menu, so ordering was a guessing game.  I was hoping the band was going to be much better.  It was a guy on a piano, which I usually enjoy but a lot more emphasis was put on showmanship and gimmick than playing good music.

reviews.name: Dallas T.
reviews.review: We stopped by this establishment because it was one of the only places on Broadway that had open tables. After the service received we realized why. When asked what kind of vodka we wanted in our drinks, we CLEARLY did not receive absolut, and was instead given well drinks. We were in a hurry so we didn't complain. After our first round our waitresses disappeared and we had to seek out the bartenders to put in another order. The food was ok, nothing special, but it took way too long to come out. One of the guests in my party had to have her nachos returned and remade, and had to find another staff member yet again, which then took an additional 25 minutes from the time of reordering. We weren't offered refills, the quality of our food wasn't checked on, and we practically had to go on a scavenger hunt to find anyone to serve us since our servers were nowhere to be found. Would not recommend, and will not return.

reviews.name: Sally G.
reviews.review: Great place! Brought our young son around 2pm. Very mellow, enjoyable music, great service, and great food!

reviews.name: Matt S.
reviews.review: I will preface this review by saying I did not eat at Tequila Cowboy, the wife and I made this a stop on our night out drinking down Broadway. I let her pick where she wanted to drink, and this was her first choice as we walked by. I was very excited to see plenty of seating available, so we pulled up to the bar and were greeted within 10 seconds by the bartender.We ordered a couple of beers and a few shots, and proceeded to spend the next few hours enjoying some great live country music, a lot of alcohol, and had a great time here. There were two bartenders who did a great job of taking care of us (and all the other patrons) by keeping our drinks full, cold, and being generous with the booze.Great stop on Broadway to enjoy a night out- great service, good prices, great music, and a great place to make some new friends. Had a fun time here, definitely recommended, and especially on the slower nights when you can find seating!

reviews.name: Mike D.
reviews.review: We really liked this place.  We arrived on a late Friday night and were lucky enough to find a table.  The fact that it was in front of the speakers did not cross my mind and we were kinda blown away when the band started up.  Either way it was a good vibe and nice stage.  Service was pretty darn good for being so packed.  Food was average.

reviews.name: Marlene R.
reviews.review: Drinks and entertainment were great! I really enjoyed the band And they took requests. Would definitely return. Went for a company event and had a fun time.

reviews.name: Maria J.
reviews.review: Have never eaten here but the live music is great as you would expect in Downtown Nashville. Cool bar atmosphere. Not too crowded.

reviews.name: Johnna M.
reviews.review: I chose tequila rain at random for a quick lunch and beer, and didn't really have high hopes. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of food and service. Like most of the Honkey Tonks, it featured a fun little cover band and plenty of space. My steak quesadilla was quite good and reasonably priced. The staff were all super friendly-the bartender even learned my name! There is nothing really unusual to separate this from other Broadway establishments, except for fine food and friendliness. What more could you want?

reviews.name: Scott S.
reviews.review: Sat outside where they have like six table.  Great people watching!!!!!    Great drinks.  The burgers were good, little spicy.  The music was excellent.  Very great time.  Good service

reviews.name: David J.
reviews.review: $5 cover for a dirty over-priced bar. Took 30 minutes to get a drink. Every employee we encountered couldn't have cared less about us. Acme is a bar 2 blocks down on Broadway with way more to offer, way prettier girls, is clean, has awesome beers, and has everything from a live band on first floor to a DJ on the rooftop. If you're thinking about going to tequila cowboy, just go to Acme and love your life instead.

reviews.name: Long N.
reviews.review: Beer-awesomeAtmosphere-outstanding!!!!Live music-excellent!!Food-could be betterIf the food was better I would of gave it more star but unfortunately it was just ok

reviews.name: Erin G.
reviews.review: Wonderful atmosphere and great performers!Service is a bit lacking. Took us 30 min just to locate our server so we could get the check.If you go there for lunch, don't get the veggie quesadilla. It's an 8$ appetizer portion that consists literally of cheese, jalapeños, and onions. Hardly deserves the "veggie" in the name.I would recommend this place only for drinks and entertainment. Not the best place for a meal.

reviews.name: Maria G.
reviews.review: Excellent service by our waiter Kevin, despite the busy Saturday night crowd. We are from NJ, and the pizza was the best we have had since we've been in the south.

reviews.name: Athenapex C.
reviews.review: This was our first and favorite stop for music.  We happened to go in the afternoon and there was a singer who was performing solo with a guitar and his voice and musical abilities were wonderful.

reviews.name: Nikki S.
reviews.review: HELL YEAH!!!  Tequila Cowboy rocked my ass off!  I can't give a single complaint, great staff, good local beer selection and the bands were ALL awesome!!!  Stopped here before Eric Church and had a blast!

reviews.name: Jenn K.
reviews.review: Worse service ever!! The guy with top knot blows!! Yummy food. Crap service. #hateassholes

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: Could not believe the drink prices in this bar.  They were way over he top even considering it being downtown Nashville!

reviews.name: Maki S.
reviews.review: There's nothing more exciting than walking into a karaoke bar for the first time in Music City. It's spacious and has a nice vibe, although the drinks are kind of pricy ($5 for Yuengling?!). I decided to wait until the next bar to drink, while taking in the sounds of country karaoke. Some of the singes were AMAZING, and others were...well, you know. Haha. All of a sudden a Korean dude got up on stage and blew us all away. Meanwhile, his friend approached me and bought us over 7 drinks. That was a nice start!If you want to get a snapshot of Nashville regulars, this is a good place to start. Everyone is friendly, and a lot of them have talent :D

reviews.name: Brittany B.
reviews.review: Not your typical Nashville bar, plays more pop & rap then country music. Great DJ and light system and there's a dance floor. 2 storis so plunty of room to enjoy yourself

reviews.name: Heather P.
reviews.review: From the looks of the place, it's one of the classier places in Nashville...until you go into the bathroom...yuck. The music was a male and female country singer/guitar player and they were really good. Our waitress was very slow, my husband walked to the bar to get refills. I probably would've given it three stars but the pulled bbq chicken nachos were excellent. I'd go back and sit at the bar and hope the service was better.

reviews.name: Jessica R.
reviews.review: Live bands, dancing, drinks, mechanical bull, and loud people! Love love loved it!! I was visiting Nashville for the first time, and this place def made my visit so much more memorable! If you're debating going here, GO!

reviews.name: Rob W.
reviews.review: Wow- just got denied entry because "you have a plain white tee(shirt) on." I was likely , really? Not to sound arrogant, but I'm an educated professional preppy guy who dresses well. After waiting 5 minutes in line the bouncer said I couldn't enter because I was wearing a plain white tee.And for those skeptics, no I was not drunk nor obnoxious. Sober and polite as usual. I find it laughable that such a mediocre establishment would deny a preppy guy due to a plain Tee-shit (which looked nice by the way, thank you very much :) haha)Disappointing service.

reviews.name: Jessica Z.
reviews.review: Let me preface this with saying my review is not about the restaurant. I didn't eat there, just had drinks (late night) and rode the mechanical bull. I've rode quite a few mechanical bulls and have experienced different operators. This operator was terrible! When I was signing the waiver she says "Remember the better you tip the better ride I'll give you." Seriously?? How about you give me a good ride because no one has rode your bull for the past half an hour. She also gave me a left-handed glove (I'm right handed) and when I tried to grab a right glove she says "No, use that one." This makes no sense at all since you should use your dominant hand to hold the rope. I know not many people will care about a mechanical bull review, but I was a little perturbed with how rude the operator was!

reviews.name: Martha C.
reviews.review: One of the more decent bars in Nashville's tourist areas. Friday night we headed here after hearing some great live music coming from the venue. We had been next door enjoying some karaoke, but decided to leave when it started to get messy. The band that night at Tequila Cowboy, Smoke N' Guns, was awesome; we were all digging their music selection and their stage presence! They pulled us in and after they had finished, the great DJ kept us there. The music was pumpin' and the hips were poppin'. We liked it so much we went back the next night. That being said, the one thing that was not poppin' was the bathroom situation. Both nights we were there something was up with the ladies room. The first night a toilet overflowd everywhere and the next night someone had thrown up in the bathroom and it was left unattended. I usually don't like places that have bathroom attendants, but in this case I think one might be necessary.

reviews.name: Melanie J.
reviews.review: Sweet potato fries with a tad of sugar....omg!  With a Cajun grilled sandwich....delicious.  Wait staff very attentive and food delivered quick.  Asked for a spicy Bloody Mary and a beer with an empty glass = michelada and they accommodated!  Thumbs up for sure with live background music!

reviews.name: Andrea Jane L.
reviews.review: It's a bar with live music. It's loud, old, and dirty.  However, the band was great and the atmosphere was fun. I only ordered cranberry juice so I can't score the bartenders. The bathroom once again had an attendant which honestly was more than a little irritating. It was already a tight squeeze adding this only made it worse. There's a mechanical bull upstairs and those who participated looked to be having fun. I can even now say I was kicked by a bull rider who was thrown off. In all it was just okay. Nothing aside from the music really stood out.

reviews.name: Judy R.
reviews.review: The Tequila Cowboy has good Country Music, good Margaritas... However we thought the drinks were pricey compared to the other bars and they have NO Happy Hour!! the food smells good .... I didn't taste it but the plates left empty !!   The dance floor is big and there is a mechanical bull upstairs !!  Nashville offers a variety of bars, eateries & live bands so you can certainly find what you like !!  It's a fun place to visit !!

reviews.name: Jed M.
reviews.review: I spent New Year's Eve, 2013, here.  There were two confusions associated with the evening:  one that benefitted us and one that did not.  The first was that my girlfriend and I had prepaid for "general admission" to the NYE party, but were accidentally given "VIP" wristbands at the door.  Once this was discovered by us, we indulged in the free food and drink discounts that came with VIP status.  This was an oversight on TC's part, and I don't know how many others before us got the same deal, but the couple behind us were stopped when the bouncers had realized their mistake.  The second was the VIP discount on domestic beers and bottomshelf liquor.  It was adverstised to be cheaper than prices actually were, by twice the money.  And when the bartender was out of bottomshelf liquor he made drinks with good stuff and didn't tell us until we paid our tab.  The bartender also wouldn't give us a discount on Yuengling because he claimed it wasn't domestic although it's made in PA.  Now, I don't care about the drinks because I wasn't drinking and we didn't pay for the VIP discount anyway, but my girlfriend was super frustrated about it.  Overall, they put on a pretty good party.

reviews.name: Jen S.
reviews.review: The nachos were fabulous with the barbecue chicken. Friendly and fun atmosphere.  Would definitely go back.  The country singer playing was singing some throwback Clapton and it was great!  Great selection of bottled beer as well. I got the Shandy and it was sure tasty.

reviews.name: Travis P.
reviews.review: The atmosphere was alright, but couldn't sit on high chair. Not recommended for high chair enthusiasts.

reviews.name: Bianca B.
reviews.review: Really rude bartenders. Don't waste your time or money on this place. There are plenty of other bars to go to along Broadway with friendly staff. Asked for a 'dressed' tequila shot and the bartender didn't seem to know what that meant. I was served a shot of tequila with a salt shaker and a cup with a lime in it. Really dude? Never going back.

reviews.name: Justin J.
reviews.review: Your standard country bar on Broadway. The music is top notch but the bar is just your standard venue. Would recommend for a few drinks and some good music if you are down on broadway.

reviews.name: Kelly S.
reviews.review: loved this place! two of my favorite things just in the name - tequila and cowboys!! the staff was great in terms of bartenders and security!but warning for the girl working the mechanical bull - she made it clear your ride would only depend on your tip, despite the $5 charge and waiting in line just to make it on! or the fact that you're being sexualized and made into entertainment by her commentary!despite my uncomfortable experience with the one employee, I had a great time here! our bartender, Tara, was awesome! very fun and enthusiastic - great employee!came twice - once in the afternoon and once at night. great live music both times - especially Steven Clawson!I would recommend coming here && I look forward to coming back myself!

reviews.name: Jay G.
reviews.review: The actual bar is quite stunning. Somebody paid a lot of $$ to build this beautiful bar and unfortunately that's about the best of it. I'm a tequila drinker and the margaritas I had were "meh". The two areas that were a total failure.. the band was almost as much of a mess as the men's bathroom. The band seemed to have a bunch of female fans which is good i suppose but they shouldn't be on stage falling down drunk while the band is trying to perform. These guys seemed like they had the parts, a singer a few fiddle players but they sounded like a lame midwest college band. If I had a few more drinks in me I would have given them a $20 and tell them to invest it in a metronome. Anyway I needed to use the bathroom and when I walked into the men's room it was like walking onto the set of Das Boot. There was a solid 1" deep puddle of water/piss everywhere. the trashcan was overflowing so there were wads of paper towel everywhere. The sink counter top area was such a mess one could clean a fish there and I bet no one would notice.  Unbelievable. After being subjected to the mediocre band and swampy bathroom I suggested we move on.

reviews.name: Maly N.
