reviews.review: Hee Haw!! I love this bar. The place is huge and was packed with people having a damn good time, girls in sundresses and cowboy boots two stepping, dancing on stage and the band kicked ass. Nashville is so fun and I can't wait to come back.

reviews.name: Zach B.
reviews.review: Staff was friendly and quick but the food was horrible. I ordered a simple burger and fries and it was probably the worst burger and fries I've ever had, so bad I wasn't able to eat either. I'm not sure how you screw up a simple burger but they did. The fries tasted like they'd been sitting in the frier for weeks and the burger was extremely over seasoned. It tasted like I was chewing on a mouthful of pepper. Skip this place.

reviews.name: Randy H.
reviews.review: Tequila Cowboy is a great place to check out if you're in Nashville. It's right on the main strip with the rest of the bars. They have great drink specials every so often and live music. The venue is pretty large and great for big groups. They have DJs and live music. So this venue is great for everyone!

reviews.name: Kat G.
reviews.review: This place is interesting. Stopped in on a Saturday night and it had a dance club feel. Great DJ, crowded, took a bit to get a drink, but overall it wasn't bad. The bathroom attendant was my favorite part because she kept that long line entertaining. On Sunday night, the tone was completely different. There were tables where the dance floor was. The stage no longer had a dj but an actual band that sounded good and did mostly cover songs (like most of the bars in downtown). It was a chill place that I might visit again with different friends.

reviews.name: Michael H.
reviews.review: Holy loud. Hard to hear anything over the music acts, but I guess it brings people in. How you run out of domestic bottled beer on a game weekend is inexcusable. Whoever is doing the hiring of bartenders should get a raise.

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: Tequila Cowboy, formalled called the Cadillac ranch, is really a great bar for a few reasons..  It is in a great location, nestled in among the rest of Nashville's fantastic bars located on the Broadway strip..Fantastic sound system, perhaps the best on the strip and they always have excellent talent playing their large stage..BIG bar with very good service..  Food is served, I did not eat here but it is a greta place to have a cold beer and see some great bands..I would highly recommend a stop in here while visiting Music City..Below based on five stars      SERVICE                    ****LOCATION                 ****MUSIC                        ****FOOD                       Available but did not eat hereATMOSPHERE         ****OVERALL                 ****

reviews.name: Christy B.
reviews.review: Stopped into the Tequila Cowboy  making our way down Broadway. It was so fun! The music was excellent Monte James was playing and he is awesome!! The bartender was very friendly and patient as we decided what we wanted mixed with our moonshine! Very fun night.  The only disappointing thing was the kitchen closes at nine so if you're hungry don't wait to eat!

reviews.name: Jen M.
reviews.review: My fave bar in Nashville.  This place is huge, it has great live music, and the bartenders work their tails off to get drinks for you.  Pretty great crowd, too.  We had a blast dancing and drinking a good majority of our night.

reviews.name: Carly S.
reviews.review: Not so much. No draft drinks. Margaritas suck. Food was cold and service slow due to an event at Bridgestone; which management should probably do a better job anticipating and staffing appropriately. Plus the band for the night was not good. This is music city; at least find some good music.

reviews.name: Kevin K.
reviews.review: Good place to watch entertainment and drink. That's all we did here.

reviews.name: Vanessa P.
reviews.review: Wasnt impressed.  Wasnt feeling the band that was playing and it was so loud you couldnt hear anyone you were with talking.  Now I get it, you're in Nashville and live music is everyone and its supposed to be loud BUT when you're not lovin the band it just makes it an unpleasant time.  We finished our one drink and moved on.

reviews.name: Mandi R.
reviews.review: TOURIST TRAP. Ugh.  If I'm going to be so packed like a sardine, please, just drag me to The Stage instead!

reviews.name: Rebecca H.
reviews.review: I'm hardly a souther girl, but I must say two of my favorite things Tequila and Cowboys. The Bar is really spacious so even on a packed night you have space to move around. The drinks are strong and the music was great. The food was eh-okay but thats to be expect when your eating bar food.

reviews.name: Michael G.
reviews.review: Solid bar.  Live music of course... large dance floor!

reviews.name: Michelle M.
reviews.review: One of my favorite bars in Nashville! Prepare for something a tad different than most bars you saunter into- hip hop music, woah! Very spacious, 2 floors. Upstairs you will find the mechanical bull. Definitely a "must-do" when you're out in Nashville. Very cool place!

reviews.name: Elise S.
reviews.review: This was such a nice place! The band was really good, and played requests right away (Sweet Caroline!!!). The bartender was nice, and recommended the cherry limeade with tequila, which was definitely a good choice. The drinks were a little pricey, but overall a good atmosphere and a nice live music venue

reviews.name: Wayne M.
reviews.review: Great Music but that's only par for Nashville.No draft beer and limited variety of bottled beer.  We chose to eat lunch here because we could have immediate seating.  Bad choice.  Hamburger was anemic and tasteless;  onion rings were inedible and made me nauseous.Sidewalk seating was great.

reviews.name: Jordyn G.
reviews.review: I recently visited Nashville on a fraternity's Spring Formal from Florida State and Tequila Cowboy and the entire staff made my weekend unforgettable! Definitely the best bar, food and service on Broadway. Everyone in my group of 10 could not stop raving about the food, everything was cooked perfectly. The atmosphere with live music and local talent made my night so fun. One of the best bars I've been to!

reviews.name: Andrew R.
reviews.review: We had two experiences at this place.First the good.  When we arrived in Nashville Saturday day, we wanted to hear some country music and grab some bar food.  The guy playing was real good and entertaining, food was just what you would expect at a bar.(decent)  we had a good time drinking, eating and listening.When we came back on saturday night to check it out, there was no band, and it was somewhat of a club, with loud bass rap.  Not what we expected.  And it was very empty.   So we left right away.

reviews.name: Jamie W.
reviews.review: We were there Labor Day weekend. Music was good. However the girl signing the guys songs should stick to the girl only songs. She's really good singing those songs. We sat at the barto right when you come in. NO one EVER asked us if we wanted a drink. My husband went to the bar every time we wanted a drink. The nachos looked good. Thanks to the bachelorette party that was there, they made the Subday afternoon entertaining. We would go back bc it wasn't smokey which we loved.

reviews.name: Wes B.
reviews.review: For a family outing with a young child...  this was a great choice.  The animatronics and sounds made for an intestine meal for kids and parents alike.  Service was pretty good and staff is very child friendly.Trade off from the profits going into the expensive atmosphere is the lack of high quality recipes.  Kids food was the quality you would expect.  The entrees (burger and Taste of the Islands) were a mixed bag.  The meats were very well prepared and good.  The sides. ..  fries. ..  "Caribbean rice" ...  and seasonal veggies were not all that.  Taste profiles were off and the veggies were actually a little greasy...

reviews.name: Carolina A.
reviews.review: The excitement of going into the Rainforest Cafe cannot be denied. This location is smaller than the one in Disney Village in Orlando, FL but it's adorable.  The merchandise is limited due to its size but satisfactory. We ate at the bar because we didn't have a lot of time, and although the staff was friendly, they weren't much for creating that Rainforest Cafe "magic".   I had the Rainforest Burger with fries, Donnie got the California Chicken and Heather had the chicken tenders. The food was good and tasty although the wait was about 45 minutes after we ordered. Since it was so busy, I can understand. I think it's a nice place to go if you're in the Nashville area.

reviews.name: Candace R.
reviews.review: We had a birthday party for my nephew who just turned 4 and we had a party of 16 with us and even though there was plenty of room they sat us at 2 separate tables. I think if they couldn't accommodate that they should have told us previously. I completely understand that there are fire codes to go by but we were completely not in the way of anyone's safety. The staff was rude when we  asked if we could push our tables together so the family could be together to celebrate his birthday. You would figure since this a kid friendly atmosphere they would designate an area or at least try to accommodate a larger party considering the amount of money you are going to spend in this establishment. Not to mention this is an every year thing.

reviews.name: Rhys F.
reviews.review: While my children (2&4) loved this restaurant, I remain unimpressed. The food was good,not excellent, and the selection was odd. Not just rainforest themed or something like that. There was no apparent theme, just strange choices. Same with the music selection. Be aware, the "storm" that goes off ever 15-20 min. with the roaring animals scared my 2 year old quite a bit and it took some doing to get her to enjoy it. Also, they no longer put the sparkler in the volcano desert, which is very disappointing. Finally, be sure to make a reservation as wait can be quite long.

reviews.name: Chrissie S.
reviews.review: I absolutely adore ALL Rainforest Cafes. I have since I was a kiddo myselfie :) There is not a thing in that restaurant that will bore the eyes. Animated animals everywhere on the walls, fishies in tanks, & servers disguised as Safari guides. So much fun even just for a visit into the gift shop. I, myself, am partial to the queso cheese dip for appetizer & the Pastalaya for my Entree. If you ever have a sweet tooth, treat yourself to their Chocolatey Caramely super fantastic Sparkling Volcano dessert. It is so so gud! :D The gift shop has nice items for everyone of all ages & very reasonable prices. I am a fan. Always will be. This place is tha bomb no matter where you visit :) This specific location was particularly very clean. The very very kind employees in the gift shop let my husband & I take all the time we needed to get our little girl the perfect souvenirs :)

reviews.name: Yolonda S.
reviews.review: We enjoyed 4th of July lunch here. The service was great, however the food was basic. I had a cheese burger w/ no bun. It was nothing to really brag about but they did fix it med. well as requested. That's a great win! However, the kids loved the rainforest scenery and our waiter was great. Will def vist again.

reviews.name: Christie B.
reviews.review: I give this place 5 stars on atmosphere! WOW! Very creative, pretty, adventuresome and fun! It's a experience and my grandson was completely mesmerized! The food was just ok, it gets 3 stars. We had the Ruben, nachos, chicken kids meal and one lizard cup filled with a icey drink. My Ruben was better than the nachos. Our server Jaime was over the top great and made us feel very special. I would not go for the food but the experience and the look on Masons face will make me bring him again. Being in the mall, if you like malls is also a plus if you are wanting to shop. The mall is very nice with several good stores.

reviews.name: Crystal O.
reviews.review: It took our server 15 mins to come and say hello and take our drink order. The food was mediocre and VERY over price!!! Neat atmosphere for kids but not worth the $ or wait.

reviews.name: Rebecca L.
reviews.review: We took the kids here today. Our service was excellent. Zach did everything right. The food was good, not great. $ 100 ticket for the four of us. Well worth the memories.

reviews.name: Namzio C.
reviews.review: Definitely worth a visit at least once.I don't understand the negative food ratings but I had the potluck Beef and Mash.It was literally the best thing I ate in America! The beef was soft and tender....easily came apart  when I picked at it...the sauce and vegi's was delicious.....great if you love home cooked meals!I would be hesitant bringing really young kids as every 30 minutes there is a 'thunderstorm' with flash lights and thunder sounds....it's AWESOME but I can imagine taking a 2 year old and them either LOVING it or screaming like a dying ferret.Great place for the adventurous at heart!*side note: order the volcano! ;)

reviews.name: G E.
reviews.review: Salmon was awesome. Tortellini was very good. Service was very good. Kind of pricey. But overall, would recommend it. Very entertaining with the "live animals" and the aquarium live fish also interesting.

reviews.name: Jamie B.
reviews.review: My husband & I took my brother & his family to dinner here during our visit to Nashville, TN. My sister in-law suggested making a reservation since the wait is apparently long all of the time. She was right, 1 hour, 15 minutes. I would definitely make sure you have a reservation. Despite having a reservation, we still waited about 30 minutes for a seat. They don't have the typical buzzing circles that alert you to your awaiting table, they text you. The nice thing is, they're in the mall, so you can walk around a bit plus they have a very interactive store where you can shop around while you wait. Our table of six was seated at the back right of the restaurant between the kitchen entrance and the bathroom entrance next to the Tiger Family display. Not an idea place to sit. Every 1-3 minutes someone is coming out screaming 'Volcano" or singing Happy Birthday to a guest. If possible, you might consider requesting another seat. The ordering process is easy enough. The waitress seemed to really know what was on the menu & was confident in her suggestions. The restaurant seemed to be out of at least one ingredient for every drink my husband tried to order. As a side note, their mixed drinks are quite week. Might be best to stick with beer/wine. It's a very nice touch to get to keep the glass though! My husband and brother both got a rib meal that neither seemed to really enjoy. I had a primavera that wasn't too great, just too much oil. My sister in-law had a turkey wrap which was good and the kids thoroughly enjoyed their meals. All in all, I would say it's over priced for sure, but you pay for the experience I guess. The kids loved the animal & rainforest noises throughout dinner but they too hated sitting at the kitchen door hearing the staff scream 'volcano' every few minutes. We shopped in the store after dinner and took some photos. It was a nice time over all for us.

reviews.name: Samantha B.
reviews.review: I came here with my family last year and my husband this year. It's so much fun to eat in here. The food is pretty good but it can be bland at times. Last year, I got the Pastalaya and it was spicy but had no flavor. I've been told it may have been an off day and I should try it again but it's so expensive and we rarely come here so I probably won't unless I find myself here a lot. We also got the Sparkling Volcano last year and it was delicious. Of course, the most entertaining part is screaming "Volcaaaaaanoooooooo" with everyone in the restaurant like they do every time they bring one out.This year my husband and I shared the Lava Nachos and the Rasta Pasta (with added sausage). Both were excellent and filling. My husband also got the Iceblaster Cherry and enjoyed it. It's enjoyable to sit and watch the animals move whenever a "thunderstorm" comes through. Our waiter, Robert, was very good as well. My family will be back eventually. When we do I really want to try one of their coconut shrimp dishes next time I come. Favorite Things: Lava NachosSparkling Volcano Ok: Rasta PastaNot as good: Pastalaya

reviews.name: Susan T.
reviews.review: First. You better be a Landry Select Member or be ready to go to the food court to eat a snack while you wait. And be kid friendly if you eat or work there. And buy your new Coach merchandise first. You may not be able to afford it unless you use a credit card. But my grandson enjoyed himself. Only for a child's entertainment would I go through the loud dinner we had. It's a place for kids of all ages, but not for me.

reviews.name: Tulané H.
reviews.review: My husband and I were so excited to eat here and check out their beautiful fish! The fish are really cool, they're the highlight of the restaurant. The decor is dated and dusty, the sound effects are loud and would scare me if I was a child. The worst part was the food. I ordered a wrap with grilled portabella, it was freezing cold, my husband's steak was lukewarm and his mashed potatoes were disgusting at cold. I think they need to really amp up the quality of the food, it was SO bad. We were very disappointed and will absolutely never go back.

reviews.name: Kyle C.
reviews.review: It's a chain restaurant, so what can you say. The theme of this place is obvious, in case you didn't notice it from its name. Notwithstanding this fact, it is definitely a good place to take the kids, as all of the scenery will keep them busy during the course of their meal.The food is simply so-so. There is absolutely nothing special going on with the food, but there's also nothing that is terribly wrong with it either. I got a burger the last time I was here, and it was actually cooked to the temperature that I requested, which was somewhat surprising. The fries that accompanied the burger were very lackluster and, again, nothing special. Another drawback to this place is their price point. The charges for the food that is served, is simply over the top for the lack of creativity, quality, and simple goodness that you would expect from fare at this price level.Bottom line, this place is good. And that's about it. The major draw to this place is the fun that your kids will have enjoying all of the scenery. The restaurant gets an A+ in this category, but their food falls far short of this mark.

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: Come for the dusty decor but I can't recommend staying for the food.  Had the Amazon Feast that tasted like it was prepared 6 hours before we arrived. Chicken was dry and unflavorfull. Ribs were bland and over boiled.

reviews.name: Daniel M.
reviews.review: The best part about the place is the ambiance. If I had children it would be a great place to take them.I do not. The food is overpriced and not very good, the menu is crowded and for this part of the country it was not at all expected. I guess its really a better menu for the locals who tire of the delicious BBQ food that is abundant. I felt the gift shop was also overpriced but I guess that's not a shock.The strawberry lemonade was actually the star of the meal somehow so I do recommend that, and again the animatronics and fish tanks were cool. We also did have a good waitress.If you don't mind bland food and are all about experience I recommend this restaurant to you. For me it was just OK.

reviews.name: Alyssa Y.
reviews.review: I must say this is a fun place to eat at. I've been here a few times and it never gets old. The food is delicious and the service is outstanding!! The wait can be rather long but it is worth it. Great place for a family dinner or nice date.

reviews.name: Biglaughngirl ..
reviews.review: Please save your money and stomach from severe diarrhea! This particular Rainforest Cafe at Nashville Opry Mills will seek its revenge on you in the worst way! The Servers have BIG cheesy smiles... but we were left running for the bathroom at lightening speed after the meal. We were suddenly overcome with chills, diarrhea, and almost vomiting. You have been WARNED!

reviews.name: Drew C.
reviews.review: Let me first off start by saying I loved Rainforest Cafe as a kid. Cool novel place. Food was good as I remember as a child. This was my first time eating at the Nashville location. The food was a little slow to come out, but it was understandable as they were packed. I wouldn't say it was anything spectacular, the fish-n-chips were sub par compared to most places I've eaten for cheaper. That wasn't really an issue for me because I went because my girlfriend loves the place. The problem was the food poisoning that I got 5-6 hours later, clutching my hotel toilet bowl. I've worked in the food industry, I can let everything else go...but either the fish or the tarter sauce was wayyyyy past its prime. One word: disappointed.

reviews.name: Lily W.
reviews.review: Ambiance is great! Food was just ok. Ordered an 'adult' drink and returned it as it was super sweet and I didn't detect any 'adult' in my super fruity drink.Would I go again? Only if kiddos requested for a birthday or special event.If you have kids, Go and know you are doing it for them!

reviews.name: Lisa S.
reviews.review: Not sure why the average is 3 stars ... I loved this place. Fast and super friendly service and the food is really good for a themed restaurant. Where else can you eat with animatronic elephants and gorillas?

reviews.name: Elisabeth W.
reviews.review: We  have visited there twice. The first time my daughter was less than 2 and she loved it. We just visited the gift shop then because we had eaten at another place and since my little girl loves animals we decided to check out their gift shop. She loved it then. But this time we decided to eat there. Food is not worth the price they charge and when their out of something they won't let you know ahead of time they will just omit it. They took my plate off my bill which made me love their service especially since I didn't compain to anyone about my meal. It is kind of loud and some young ones under the age of three might not enjoy this experience. My nearly three year old was kind of scared by how loud the animals were. We do love the aquarium restaurant their food is much better.

reviews.name: Sarah V.
reviews.review: Wonderful atmosphere for the kids, very life like mechanical animals that move every few minutes! Great food, even better appetizers- get the spinach dip!

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: Cool theme!We had some time to kill on our way to the airport so we decided to stop in Opry Mills. We were hungry and I was in the mood for something fun to start our vacation. We didn't have a reservation so we sat at a table in the bar area. It was very cool how the water was falling from above into the tray thing behind us. Yes I said tray thing because I have no idea what it's called. It was a long tray with something black in it and when the water hit it produced steam. There were several new dishes. I couldn't resist the honey glazed tempura mahi mahi and shrimp.  It was served with sticky rice and carrot slices and it was very good.  The service was great and it was a very enjoyable lunch.

reviews.name: Carol D.
reviews.review: Truly this is the most touristy, cheesy place I've ever been.  Event 15 year old daughter said she would've hated it when she was five.  So stupid.  Food is mediocre at best.  However, the strawberry lemonade was great!

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: The food here is okay, nothing really wowed me. Pork chop was raw and we had to ask them to recook for us. It's more like a place for kids and family. If you don't mind listening to gorillas roaring every 10 minutes and kids screaming, this is the place for you.2013/#2

reviews.name: John M.
reviews.review: Was just there yesterday and in my opinion the food is overpriced and portions are small. In essence, you are paying for the atmosphere. It's nice when the animals come to life and the thunderstorm that happens, other than that I'd save my money. A good place to take young kids though.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: Tony, Noel and I ate here and we were amazed. Absolutely love the decorations, love the jungle feel and love the robotic animals that move and make you feel like you are in a Zoo of some sorts.The food was good. The noise level high with the kids laughing and crying...the little boy near us was very upset about the gorillas near our table area...but the entire meal was entertaining and enjoyable.

reviews.name: Tabitha S.
reviews.review: The place is great for kids. The whole time we were there we the kids were just wide eyed and looking all around waiting for the next animal to come to life or the thunderstorm to come. The scene is pretty cool. Food is OK. Fries were just that, OK. The Rainforest burger was good and the bun was SO good! We also got the sampler appetizer. It was good and the spinach dip was very yummy. The kids ordered wings and they said they were good too.Since we were there for my daughters birthday dinner we decided to get the 13.99 volcano and they brough it out and sang to her. All four of us could not finish this thing! It says it served 6 people and yes it probably could. So if you are with a group I would go for it but if its just you and a guest then get ready for a doggy bag. You cant take the ice cream of course, but it also comes with 3 or 4 ( cant remember ) slices of this brownie chocolaty type cake. SO GOOD!The service was great too. I was nervous coming her and spending this much money after reading the fellow yelpers reviews but our experience was great. We expected to pay over priced amounts for the food considering its in a tourist attraction. But for the amount you get it really was not bad. 9.99 for a pound of wings, 11.99 for a burger ( big patty ) 15.99 for a pretty decent size appetizer, and 13.99 for the volcano cake ice cream mound of gooey goodness. Now, we wont just pop in here when we feel like we are hungry but we will definitely keep this place in mind for special occasions!

reviews.name: Angel C.
reviews.review: We took our daughter here for her 3rd birthday. The food was great, the service was AWFUL. One, it's a children's restaurant. You'd expect to be able to substitute items. Nope. You pay for something you/kid don't like and either eat it or they'll take it away-but you still have to pay for it and you can't substitute. Two, it was Thursday and empty, but they chose to sit the quiet 3 year old under the scariest animal they had. Meltdowns every ten minutes did NOT make for a HAPPY birthday-thanks a lot. Three, it was our daughters birthday. She was dressed up, she opened gifts at the table, she even had a flashing number 3...anyone care to explain why a $15-26 PER PLATE CHILDREN'S restaurant doesn't sing happy birthday, give cake, or even a darn scoop of ice cream?! I had MY birthday at Red Lobster and got a song and ice cream. My husband had his at a Mexican restaurant and got a song and flan, so imagine our surprise that a CHILDREN's restaurant does NOTHING. Not even SAY Happy Birthday! That was what irked me the most. I get we payed out the behind for the atmosphere, but I had assumed it was celebration friendly too. Apparently NOT.

reviews.name: Gina H.
reviews.review: We went for my daughter's.8th bday. At first.I.was.extremely excited. So much going on to keep the kids entertained. There was a 15 minute wait on a Tuesday but the.text alert allowed a visit to Santa while waiting (big bonus points). The.gift shop is.exceptionally priced and the hostess.(didn't get her name. Short, blonde hair, thin girl, early.20s) was very sweet as my daughter tried.telling her all about her bday, despite being busy.and me hurrying my daughter along. That's all the good I have to.say unfortunately. Once inside, our server spotted three kids and a mom and almost snarled. Look, I worked as a.server for six years, I get it but hide it. And usually even the most disgruntled server lightens up and compliments the kids for being well behaved. Becca never cracked even a half smile and in case it was us I.looked at her service for other tables, nope. Everyone has an.off night. Maybe this was hers?? The food was fairly fast but my well done burger was rare (which you can't serve in tn) I tried to eat it after one.bite of easily the worst fries ive ever tasted (not even warm.and not.good even by the low.bar.of.cold fry standards) but after three bites it wasnt happening. My daughter's alfredo looked....dry. you know.that odd dehydrated look kraft box macaroni has? Thats how her alfredo looked. My three.year old.did order the.macaroni and.refused to.eat after a.few.bites saying it.was "rotten". She calls everything.gross.rotten, it.was not spoiled). Now you have two people refusing.to eat. I.assume this happens a lot because at the check.a.few minutes.later.she refused to acknowledge the two full plates pushed.away and walked.away. at the end of the.meal she asked.if everything was.okay I said not really and got a "oh" and check. I fully planned on.paying full.price.but a.replacement to go or a.sorry would have raised me.to.a three or.four.star. servers should always question if food isnt eaten and protect their tip. I ended up leaving a 15% tip.when I have never left.less than 25% ever!!  She wasn't rude, per.se, but the.feeling that she.expected a bad tip and wanted us gone was obvious. They did.sing.to my daughter though, that was a nice.surprise. the.con was all three kids asked to.go back to aquarium restaurant (where we ate two.weeks ago)

reviews.name: Khara L.
reviews.review: Rainforest Cafe is one of my favorite restaurant chains. If you go -- ORDER THE MAI TAI! Seriously. Best mai tais of my life. Bartenders super, super friendly and conversational. The servers at the table were awesome. Food was awesome. I'm a fan.

reviews.name: Katie D.
reviews.review: Be prepared: on weekends (or during holidays, etc.) you'll have a wait. But since it's in a mall, it's not a huge deal if you plan ahead. Plus, you can make a reservation to avoid having to wait later.What prevents me from giving them five stars is they took their delicious crab dip off the menu, so boo to them.Firstly, their food. The fish and chips are great. I almost always get the chicken Bamba's barbecue wrap. It is soooo good. Very different flavour. I normally hate raw onions (especially red onions, ugh) but they work in this dish and couldn't imagine asking them to leave them off. The barbecue sauce is a little smoky and a little fruity, very nice. Love the addition of cilantro too, it just makes for a totally different dish you can't get anywhere else. Plus, it's HUGE. When you get it, it looks okay. But trust me, you can't finish it (or at least I never can). You'll either need to split it with someone or get a doggy bag.I don't get to go as often as I'd like so I've not been able to try everything, but they do have some stuff that you can't get at other places, at least not at other chain restaurants, like macadamia crusted tilapia, dynamite scallops, and their Tuscan chicken.Their service is great, and the ambiance is nice. The music is a little loud, but it's definitely aimed to keep little kids entertained. It's not necessarily the kind of place you'd go on a date, but otherwise it's fine even if you don't have kids with you. Between all the fish and the fake animals on the walls and such, it's usually enough to keep the kids at other tables entertained so you don't have to deal with squealing kids or anything. It actually can end up being quieter than places like TGI Friday's as a result.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: So fun for families! Servers are great! Food tasty and fresh, tho pricey.... But worth it for the atmosphere!

reviews.name: Green D.
reviews.review: Considering the price points and the fact that Landry's owns other restaurants of much higher caliber (Claim Jumper, Oceanaire, Mortons, etc) this place is nothing but the restaurant counterpart to an amusement park.  You are paying for the surroundings.  Perhaps a great place to take children. . . once.  If you are looking for value or food beyond the average meal this place should not be on the list.

reviews.name: Jones B.
reviews.review: I guess it's good once if you have small children...but not to small or they will be completely freaked out by the animals.  The food isn't great and I'm guessing the only reason people go is well because it's in a rain forest...

reviews.name: Xaben P.
reviews.review: All goodWaiter Ricky was very attentive

reviews.name: Frank M.
reviews.review: First time. Ordered the turkey wrap. Good. The slaw was better. Great place for kids and families. Lots of things to see and hear.

reviews.name: Char D.
reviews.review: I was in today with 3 and a toddler. We were seated fast but ended up waiting for 10 mins before our waitress came up and acknowledged us saying she'd be right back. Before she made it back the gentleman who sat us noticed we still didn't have anything on our table and came up to see what was up and our waitress came up and said this is my table and then said she told us she said she was going to be right back, what did we want right now. She had such a bad attitude and rolled her eyes as she walked off. We just got up and left. 2 of us are waitresses and we were both shocked that she treated us like she did. We normally love this place and always make it a must while shopping but after this no way. Never again.

reviews.name: Ryan B.
reviews.review: Big, loud, colorful experience. Take your kids. Prepare to overpay, but take your kids.Good service. Take your kids.

reviews.name: Stacy S.
reviews.review: I ordered the pizza and it was a frozen pizza that tasted just like cardboard.  I have never had a good experience with their food. It's not fresh, it's out of a freezer and then cooked.  The waitress was very attentive and the atmosphere is cool for kids but definitely not if you like quality food.

reviews.name: Wook Gems ..
reviews.review: My kids love this place!  The atmosphere alone can occupy children for an hour.  We walk around the cafe to make sure we see everything including the gift shop.  It's a fun place that has a great location to easily park and get in.  (very stroller friendly)  The service is very friendly and the menu is giant.  I had the biggest fish tacos ever!      With kids I like to eat at places that are extremely clean.  Top to bottom every time we go this place is spotless.  The bathrooms are kid and baby friendly, which goes a long way when you have babies and toddlers.  I enjoyed my last visit and will enjoy the next.  However, because of prices I can't give 5 stars.  And can only go but every 2 or 3 weeks.

reviews.name: Jane S.
reviews.review: News flash: Do not eat here unless you have young children!  For some mind boggling reason, I saw many couples trying to enjoy a romantic dinner at Rainforest Cafe.  Do not waste your time.To put it simply, the food is bad.  It's like they don't even try.  My 8 yr old son had the kids' popcorn shrimp and when they set it down in front of him he gave me a look like "you are kidding!".  We were starving after driving all day so he ate them, but they looked exactly like frozen shrimp that were cooked in a toaster oven.  The other two entrees at our table were no better.  Having been to a RC years ago, I knew the food wasn't the star of the show, but this was far worse than I remembered. Prices aren't crazy high, but certainly a few dollars higher per meal than a comparable place.  Compared to the quality of the food, they are a total robbery. All of that said, the kiddos did enjoy seeing the "animals" and hearing the thunderstorm. That made it kind of worth it.  My advice is to go, spend a long time in the gift shop to give your kiddos the experience and then go eat in the food court.

reviews.name: Sarah M.
reviews.review: Stopped in for lunch on a quiet Tuesday afternoon. My son was initially freaked out by the decor but we persuaded him to wait it out. Our server was very friendly and helpful, and attentive! Lunch was delicious, although I wish I had ordered something smaller because portions were gigantic. We were very well taken care of, the manager even strolled by our table and we bought the restaurant membership (the server the night before at Aquarium tried selling it to us, but after his pushy behavior we just said "no" to everything at a certain point) But it was a pretty great deal, really, and we'll eat at those places sometime or another so why not? :)Server (sorry, can't remember his name!) was very attentive to our kids, and brought applesauce a'la carte, though it didn't come with the noodles or pizza we ordered, and he made sure we had everything we needed. It was nice to receive friendly service at such a touristy place- a lot of times, that is forgotten in the hustle and bustle. We'd come back here if we drive this way again someday.

reviews.name: Savannah S.
reviews.review: Great for kids!  love the setup and the food.

reviews.name: Steve S.
reviews.review: I've come to the conclusion that you don't go to the Rainforest Café for the food.  You go for the atmosphere.  To further this notion, I'd say you go there for the kids as it really is a dining experience enjoyed more by children than adults.  The proof is in the silly animatronic animals and the fact that the wait staff refer to themselves as safari guides.  I do however enjoy the beautiful saltwater aquariums full of vibrant fish like tangs, trigger fish, and parrot fish.My wife and I stopped in while shopping at Opry Mills.  We decided to share a pizza and that was a big mistake.  Before tasting it, I could tell it was a cheap frozen pizza.  Taking a bite proved the theory.  We could even finish half of it and we decided against taking any home for left overs.  That's pretty bad considering I love left overs.The service was good and everything was clean.  I won't be returning if I can avoid it in the future.  My kids seem to like it, but their reasoning has nothing to do with food.  They like it because of the experience and I think that's what the Rainforest Café is striving for.  I wish they'd work at providing higher quality food escpecially with the high price tag that accompanies most of their menu items.

reviews.name: K S.
reviews.review: i wish i would have kept our receipt so that i could include our waitresses name .. she's the reason for the poor review.i absolutely love rainforest cafe, & i was so excited to get to eat here .. but our service was poor. the food was good, not great. i've had better at other rainforest cafes - but it could be just what i ordered. i got the "awesome appetizer adventure" .. the chicken tenders were the best part of it. the spinach dip was ok. the cheese sticks were good, but i wasn't in the mood for em (my boyfriend wanted em, so that was fine ..) .. i'm pretty sure the southwestern style egg rolls were missin a dippin sauce for em, because otherwise, they were kind of dry .. my boyfriend ordered the fish & chips, and quesadilla appetizer. he said his was ok .. we both enjoyed the quesadillas though ..i usually just get the lava nachos when goin to a rainforest cafe .. & that's what i originally planned on gettin .. should've stuck to my gut.nonetheless, i don't give up hope on any rainforest cafe in general .. just the waitress we had ..

reviews.name: Jewel M.
reviews.review: I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 because the food price and food taste don't match. I can get better food for much cheaper. I go here for the scenery. It's lovely. I like the thunderstorms they have going. If you ever go, get a seat by the fish tanks, they are so pretty!

reviews.name: Christina D.
reviews.review: Food was good, but expensive. Kids had a great time. CService was really good.

reviews.name: Matt H.
reviews.review: I haven't been here for awhile now, but when my family and I stopped in we liked it very much. They have a giftshop when you walk in and once you get in the restaurant it is very cool! It looks like you are in a jungle and every once in awhile all the animals react and make noises to the environment, they play great music otherwise. Like I heard some of my favorite...Bob Marley and other great reggae or tropical music, etc. The food was good and like these other reviews I do remember it being kinda pricey and limited, maybe they've changed that by now! I would like to come back here when I get a chance, I enjoyed every bit of this place!

reviews.name: Stacey C.
reviews.review: I would say average food and service, but overpriced for quality recieved.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: This is a national tourist chain, so you should expect overpriced poor quality food. I went with a group of friends a while back because we thought it would be cute. Believe me, it was not. They adult beverages sound fun but they are not. It was empty and we were ignored, the service was so bad. I literally almost got up and left. I was pissed. I'd rather walk over to the food court and grab Subway or Sbarro.

reviews.name: Shaun C.
reviews.review: No. Never again. The servers were not familiar with the menu (the 3 that I asked).The food is extremely over-priced for the portions.The food is mediocre at best. This place is merely an attraction with little or no detail taken for customer care or any love of cooking or serving. -Shaun

reviews.name: James F.
reviews.review: I had lunch here today with my family. Although it lists this restaurant with a $$, it's actually a $$$. I didn't see any regular menu items (other than sandwiches and burgers) for less than $15. For our 7 family members, our bill was almost $170. That;'s insane to me. Also, the food was not that good. I had the Pot Roast, and it was not that good...uncooked carrots and some sort of onion mix, and some sauce...that was about it. My wife had the Tuscan Chicken, and the chicken looked good, but what looked like Zuchinni turned out to be cold cucumber...YUK... Thanks, but no thanks. Then we ordered the Volcano...which was nice, but every time one was ordered, ALL the servers would start YELLING  "VOLCANO!!!!!"....scared the living %$^# out of me and the kids. What's up with that? No, I was LESS than impressed with this venue....loud animal noises constantly, just not satisfied at all with what we got, the atmosphere, anything....This will be my last visit to Rain Forest Cafe........

reviews.name: Ryan P.
reviews.review: My wife and I ate here for dinner. She had a cheeseburger that was "just ok" and I had the Jungle Steak & Shrimp which was a 4 oz or so steak, 4 shrimp scampi, and 4 cocunut shrimp. The steak was cooked perfectly but the flavor was just ok. The scampi was tasteless and the cocunut shrimp was very dry. I probably wouldn't eat here again.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Children sit wide-eyed and slack mouthed (except when chewing) gleefully pressing their little noses against the walls of the giant acquarium while they eat. The fish stare back, licking the glass. Tourists from Tennessee, Alabama and beyond support the Nashville economy in this family themed restaurant.

reviews.name: Melissa F.
reviews.review: Considering I live in the condos right behind the 404 for the past two months I figured it was time to try out the 404.  I went on a Salsa night so the atmosphere was just right for a Saturday night out with friends. There was an instructor and the great salsa music.  Not to mention the food was fantastic. I had the veggie burger and sweet potato fries. The house Chardonnay was on point. Constructive criticism: there was not a drink menu and the server didn't know if there were drink specials. I just believe the 404 would be perfect with signature drinks and specials. I will be going back. Just a hop and a skip away. No DUI for this chick.

reviews.name: Laceey M.
reviews.review: Best red beans and rice. Happy hour from 4-7 big patio out side smoking. Cajun kitchen menu plus burgers and what ever you get is going to be delicious Come book your event with us we have the space for all of your event needs.

reviews.name: Terranise C.
reviews.review: Very unprofessional and slow service. Enter at your own risk when it comes to a group of unfiltered lazy servers. Food wasn't bad but the experience outweighed everything

reviews.name: Whit L.
reviews.review: Bad place. Do not go....One of owners called my friend a b**** because she turned him down. The bartender added a an extra beer to my bill.

reviews.name: Shaun S.
reviews.review: I stopped in on a Friday for early dinner. Had the House Burger which was so so, came with fries which were not good. The burger is described as a half pound of chuck but I don't see it, and the flavor of the patty was plain. The bun was okay, the lettuce and other innards were good. Service was nice, atmosphere is relaxing. Not much  parking.

reviews.name: Chloe H.
reviews.review: Absolutely loved the cajun pasta with grilled chicken and the parmesan garlic chicken wings! They also have a great selection of wines. The prices are low, and it has a great neighborhood vibe. Denny is the best. Definitely give it a try!

reviews.name: Courtney A.
reviews.review: Went on one of their first opening nights. A nice place to grab drinks with friends. Love the "lounge area" with couches. Good atmosphere and decorated really nice. The bartender and waitress were extremely nice. Didn't get to try a meal, but enjoyed my margarita and shrimp cocktail.

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: Great food, still new and needs some work. We went to the Blue Cactus for the first time in the new location and overall, the food was great. Short falls were the service (our waitress was good, but others needed training), ambiance and and the details. The Cajun fondue was off the chain.  Never got the extra bread, as the server said I ordered it several times, "I do not know if you will get it. Do you want me to try one more time?  I'll go check on it".  The only check I got was the bill. Update - see below. The lighting was harsh and bright.  The ceiling was leaking water. The noise was loud with no baffles.  Now the food. The food is excellent.  With great service and atmosphere, this place could be 5 stars. Really has potential. Oh - there is one server (bar escalator?) that is cold and could use training. She did not crack a smile and looked annoyed or put out that she had to deliver our drinks. Be careful of her Yelpers. Not our server, but the one who apparently delivers drinks.  Brrrrr.,.  Salmon tacos great, rattlesnake pasta, spicy ( I was told and very happy with the space level)Keep trying guys. I'll be back. Please be successful, as the last 2 restaurants in this location have failed. Update - as we received our bill the manager came over and explained that the extra bread was a mix up in the kitchen and they compensated us for it.  Bonus! - extra tip for our server for recognizing the issue and bringing it to managements' attention.Upping my raining one star from 3 to 4 based on follow up. Please do well Blue Cactus. I am a huge fan of local owned establishments!

reviews.name: Cristy H.
reviews.review: I ate here a few days after they opened. I ordered chips and salsa - the chips were fresh, hot and very good. The salsa looked appealing but surprisingly, it did not have much flavor. It tasted like tomato-based water. I also ordered the chicken bang bang tacos. Again, very appealing on the plate but sadly lackluster in taste. There was just not enough flavor/seasoning in the dishes I ordered.The staff was polite enough. A waitress took our order and a waiter brought out my food. The silverware did not look very clean. The bill was a little over $16 (closer to $20 w/tip) Overall, my 1st impression wasn't a really good one. However, I'm giving 3 stars because a friend wanted to try it out so I went back for a 2nd lunch. The blackened grilled chicken sandwich was very good. It was flavored nicely and the chicken was cooked perfect. The battered fries were good. Sandwhich was large in size - they could have added a few more fries but it was still very fulfilling. The bill for this lunch was a little over $12 (closer to $16 w/tip).I will give this restaurant more tries. It's new and I'm sure they're working through issues that all new restaurants face.

reviews.name: Andi B.
reviews.review: Loved it!! Drinks were great, very reasonable price. Food portions were big, we left tipsy and full for under $50. We will be regulars. Love the patio! Great service.

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: Great, slightly hot salmon tacos and the chicken quesadillas were fantastic!! We'll definitely be returning!

reviews.name: Renee A.
reviews.review: I ate here for the fist time on September 26, 2015  and ordered the Goat  Cheese Shrimp pasta- it was a nice portion and the flavor/taste was good but the shrimp was tough so needless to say I ate less than half of the dish which was mostly  pasta w/the goat cheese.  We were seated outside under the covered patio next to the wall when it began to rain really hard causing the rain to bounce off the wall and splatter on us, so we moved to a different table.  When our waitress came back we told her why we moved and she looked at us like she didn't understand what she just told her. Honestly, she just seemed odd and as if she didn't want to be there.  Shortly after  I noticed the hostess kept seating people along the same wall we were sitting that were now wet from the rain and each time the couple would get up an move. After the 3rd  couple moved finally one of the staff came and wiped off the tablesThe staff seems nice enough but not all are welcoming and don't really communicate. Maybe I caught them on a bad day, I'm not sure, but I don't think I'll go back.

reviews.name: Didge C.
reviews.review: It truely is the best place to eat in Murfreesboro......

reviews.name: Melissa C.
reviews.review: Try the chicken pesto sandwich it was amazing!!! Great happy hour prices and excellent beer selection. It was a little crowded but they can't help that they're popular! :)

reviews.name: Denise R.
reviews.review: I ate here on July 1st.. FOOD Food is tasty and I must applaud the owners for not fooling us with generous portions during the opening and then cutting back later on.. nope , instead , you got less than enough!  The salsa and cheese dips  were  good.  Chicken bang-bang tacos  were good.   Fajitas ok. small portions   pesto rice, not so much..  Chips and salsa are not free and must be ordered off the menu.PORTIONSI ordered  steak fajitas and I received three -6 inch homemade tortillas and  five -2 inch  by 1/2 inch  strips  of flank steak.  My first two small size fajitas were good and had 2 pieces of steak in them but maybe they were just teasing me with the third tortilla because I couldn't make anything with it. (just one little 2 inch strip of steak left)   I asked the server if this was a mistake and he said he would ask the owner ...he came back and said, "the owner is busy and doesn't have time to talk with you."  wow!   ATMOSPHEREWe ate on the patio and we were led to a wobbly plywood table .  in all fairness, there was a black check holder stuffed under one leg... the table was very small and already covered with the advertising and silverware .. i went to pick up my fork and the silverware slid off the table. great..  The tables are so close together that one server tried to squeeze between the seven inches of space and her stomach and personal business were resting on our table within inches of our food!!! Ugh!  SERVICENot very good..  I'm sure it was because they were busy and overwhelmed.  Service was slow and we weren't treated with any kindness and  there was no personal attention.. It was my birthday so I wanted it to feel special..  but it was quite the opposite.   I always ask myself would i eat here again?  NO!  . Too many great Mexican restaurants with great service in Nashville to bother with this one.

reviews.name: Lynn W.
reviews.review: Great food! This is a Cajun tex/mex type menu. Many choices. I have had the shrimp and grits, talapia tacos and tonight had chicken chimichanga.  Also had chips and queso. Very fresh food. Great presentation and taste. Great atmosphere! Staff very friendly!

reviews.name: Meagan B.
reviews.review: One of my favorite lunch places around my apartment! They have great salad and sandwich options. I always get the Strawberry Fields salad with grilled chicken, and my boyfriend always builds his own salad. He loves the chicken salad on top! The salads are a good size - they actually fill me up!Not the cheapest lunch around.. My salad comes out to about $13. BUT the Sesame Vinaigrette is one of the best dressings I've ever had! I crave the strawberry salad with that dressing. Just found out at my last visit that they actually sell the dressing, so I'll definitely be getting that!

reviews.name: Krystal T.
reviews.review: I am a regular customer as I often go here for lunch. I love the highly customizable sandwich menu, which it's pretty quick to negotiate by circling your choices on a form. This is in contrast to the "choose one from this massive sign" and choose other options from this other sign, and try to tax your short-term memory (I'm looking at you, Which Wich).The salads are also pretty decent. I was a fan of the strawberry fields take away until I got one with a huge ball of cold, slimy cheese. A pretty pricey throwaway at about $9 for a salad. I recommend building your own salad and having them package it to go rather than relying on the to-go salads in the refrigerator.Honestly, this place is a little on the pricey side for a deli, but the ingredients are fresh and highly customizable.They can be a little slow during the lunch rush as you wait for back-up at the registers. So try to avoid 11:30-12:30, if you can.

reviews.name: Bob C.
reviews.review: I had a cinnamon bagel with lox and cream cheese. It came with cucumbers, tomatoes, capers and red onions. I did like having the extras but it was extremely difficult to eat. Not something you could take on the road.The bagel was sort of pricey 10.99.

reviews.name: Stacie F.
reviews.review: I was already a fan of this place and their food, but wanted to share a story.... I'm currently rocking a bald head due to cancer treatment and today the gentleman behind the counter gave me my sandwich and tea for free. It just made my day! Thank you, Bread & Co.

reviews.name: Anna J.
reviews.review: I normally don't write too many updated reviews but must do so for this one. I love the strawberry fields salad here, especially with the sesame dressing. I've been eating this salad since college, for over 8 years, yes, it's that good, or it used to be that good. Last night, I picked up the salad and noticed that everything was different. Honey pecan chicken salad was runny, blue cheese crumbles had a weird taste, and the worst part... the sesame dressing was just oil, it had no acidity and barely any sesame taste. I am SO disappointed. What happened?! I am probably not going back again.

reviews.name: Travis B.
reviews.review: Overpriced as hell!  Cookies are the only legitimate item there.  But for $5 for 3 of them, they aren't that good!

reviews.name: Evan W.
reviews.review: - Pricey, Terrific Sandwich, Quality Ingredients - Came in after seeing positive yelp reviews and hearing good things from my coworkers.Ordered the San Franciscan, terrific!.The Fruit Tea is also a MUST Staff was all friendly and helpful. The food is great but for $9 I expected some of the sandwich options to be larger....

reviews.name: Jennifer S.
reviews.review: Let me begin this review by saying that I used a HUGE fan of B&C--loved their breads, breakfasts, sandwiches, cookies, etc. And I ate lunch there frequently because it is close to work. But ever since First Watch bought B&C a few months ago, I have noticed a significant decline in the quality of food. Bread seems more processed. Sandwich ingredients are not as fresh. I've had 2 cookies from them that were stale. Really, really disappointing.

reviews.name: Jennifer C.
reviews.review: This place has delicious sandwiches, and I'm always pleased with my meals. This morning, the cashier brightened my day with her countenance. Thank you for the lovely greeting, Ms. Tina; and thanks to the staff that prepared my sandwich! :)

reviews.name: Kate F.
reviews.review: Stopped by while sightseeing and grabbed a scone and fruit tea. The scone style was sweet and buttery, which is my preference -- maybe a little crumblier than perfect, but still quite good. Fruit tea was pleasing -- sweet, more like a fruit juice than a tea and pretty addictive -- I'm sure I would drink it all the time if I was a local. The cashier handled the large group of high school athletes in line in front of me politely and quickly, which I thought was impressive early on a Saturday morning.

reviews.name: Lyrad V.
reviews.review: Bread and Company is the best of the best when it comes to the bakery/cafe type of establishments in this area. It's a local establishment with three locations in Nashville (I'm quite sad that the Cool Springs location closed as that was the closest one to my house). However, I still randomly eat at all three Nashville locations when i can.There are so many things to rave about. Here's a rundown.1. They have THREE types of chicken salad. Talk about decisions! They are all good, but my favorite is the almond tarragon chicken salad.2.On the make your own sandwich (or 1/2 sandwich) you can choose all the fresh veggies you want, and you can choose TWO cheeses with no extra cost! Hello muenster AND provolone!3. Unique spreads for your sandwich. My favorites are the artichoke spread and sun dried tomato aioli. The always will put some artichoke spread on the side for me to dip my chips in. Healthy, I know...4. Amazing salads. I've never been able to finish one because they're so big. My favorites are the Belle Meade and Strawberry Fields. They also have amazing homemade salad dressings. You can buy them by the bottle there.5. The best fruit tea around. I get my money's worth when I dine in. However, you'll need to take out a small loan to buy it by the gallon!I never leave here hungry. 1/2 sandwich fill me up. It can be pricy though. And at this location, good luck finding parking! The lot is always full due to it's location.

reviews.name: Megan K.
reviews.review: One of my favorite lunch spots in all of Nashville. Large and airy, great location on West End (however, parking is typically a pain... Always a busy area!). I love the Iroquois (chicken salad sandwich) with a fruit tea. Their soups and salads are also wonderful. It's a little pricier than I typically spend on lunch (~$12), but worth it. Fresh and tasty every time--also a great place for a business lunch or meeting! Be forewarned, the baked goods in the cabinet are super enticing :)

reviews.name: Eric W.
reviews.review: I stopped here for lunch last Friday, and wasn't really impressed.  I'm definitely not a fan of the ordering process.  When I have to ask someone how to place my order, I should have just walked up to Panera.  I got a half corned beef on rye with potato salad.  The sandwich was ok, just not very big, and with all the sandwich/deli places in the area, I probably could have done better.  The potato salad was very bland.  Got a water, kettle chips, and a pickle spear with it.  Bill was just short of 8$.   I can't say that I'd come back for this.They do have a lot of soups, pastries, etc, so I can see the appeal.  Just not my cup of tea.  YMMV

reviews.name: Hilary H.
reviews.review: This place is delicious and has lots of options. We like going for work lunches because big groups can always find something everyone likes.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: This is a solid lunch spot if you can find parking in the always packed lot!I tend to be impatient and choose alternate spots due to the parking conundrum but if and when I find a spot, the food has been consistent and service is generally good. I dig the Create Your Own Salad option (up to 6 toppings for $7.99) and also the Boulder Veggie (sans cheese) for around $8.50. You may also create your own sandwich too. It's fairly easy to maneuver through the menu as a vegan, so I appreciate that!Prices are a bit on the high side but I think the quality of food matches the price tag.

reviews.name: jacki R.
reviews.review: I go to eat lunch here just because it's close to work and the food is great . It's not a cheap place but it's worth it .they all kinds of fresh sandwiches and salads and breads and pastries . I love their chicken gumbo soup .

reviews.name: Cindy E.
reviews.review: I made the mistake of ordering the Faucon salad. It is advertised as a mixed green salad but that means it has romaine/iceberg mix as the base. My error was reading mixed greens and thinking leafy greens. My salad came with huge chunks of iceberg, only a few romaine pieces were on my plate. The bacon was stuck together in cold greasy wads, the bleu cheese dressing, hard boiled egg, and cranberry bread croutons were fine, but the lettuce and bacon was so off putting, I only ate part of the salad. When I asked the manager about it, she said that I must have wanted the  Mesclun mix. She offered to remake my salad, but I declined-lost my appetite. Next time I want lunch, I am going to Fido's.

reviews.name: Christine R.
reviews.review: I tried the Award Winning chicken salad and I honestly didn't taste anything.  Very bland.  The sauce on my friends Turkey Sandwich was non-exsistent and the turkey was dry.  Also, the bread was very difficult to chew and was not good for a sandwich.  I will no be going back.

reviews.name: Pamela S.
reviews.review: My sister, son, and I were in Nashville for a week and found this little gem of a lunch spot right around the corner from our hotel. Well needless to say due to the delish salads, baked goods, AND the AWESOME customer service, this place turned into our breakfast spot too!  Inside is opened and airy, ingredients were fresh and satisfying and I find myself trying to make an excuse as to why I need to go back to that area again... High Recommend!

reviews.name: J S.
reviews.review: I used eat at B&C 2-3 times a week. The made to order sandwiches were delicious. The quality of the food is very good.Pricing is high. The ordering system is not intuitive. The wait to get your sandwich made can be very long, especially at lunch time and when school (Vandy) is in.

reviews.name: Will H.
reviews.review: We went to this location of Bread & Company for breakfast on Sunday morning.  We were thinking about pastries and coffee.  The selection of pastries at this location was paltry, and they weren't really all that good.  The real thing that I found offensive was that they don't serve espresso at this location.  What kind of breakfasty place at this price point won't sell someone a latte?  To top it off, the staff members were inattentive and rude.  If you find yourself here, go a couple of doors down to you-know-where for your caffeine and carbs.

reviews.name: Kimberly B.
reviews.review: This was my go-to place in college. Now that I'm no longer a proud owner of a Vandy card, I don't eat here as often.My favorite sandwich is the Fresh Mozzarella, which is basically a caprese salad on fresh bread. Their tomato basil soup is also delicious. My one issue is that although I pretty much always order the same thing, my bill is never the same twice. Sometimes I get a steal, and other times I leave scratching my head wondering how the hell half a sandwich can cost so much.

reviews.name: Saira K.
reviews.review: I enjoyed my sandwich - the tarragon chicken salad on cranberry pecan bread. Would be nice if it was cozier - so many people, sandwiches and salads made quickly and served - my first time in Nashville, I was looking for a more laid-back comforting place - not so...high maintenance.

reviews.name: Dee B.
reviews.review: I think the fact that Bread & Company is well known to being pricy and expensive... It's really no different from going somewhere else for a similar product. Everytime I pick up a salad from here and bring it to work, I get told.. Ooh wow, that is an expensive salad. But what's the difference from ordering take out from Tazzo or Salad from Chili's?  It's all about $10 each. All I can say is that the fat free vinegerette  dressing is tasty. The greens are always fairly fresh, and you can't beat a $7.99 salad with up to 6 toppings. Even if you got a salad from Ruby Tuesdays, you will pay about the same price. So, it's all about what you want. I would also reccommend the cranberry bread. The soups are pricey for the amount you get, but Turkey chili and Turkey sage soup is fabulous, plus winter  season is right around the corner...  Don't knock it till you try it...

reviews.name: Karen T.
reviews.review: Salad was pretty good, service was pretty quick and straight forward. They have slips for sandwiches and salads so that you can make it exactly how you want (i.e. this but not that). Prices were higher than I would have thought, but it was pretty good. I was somewhat surprised that the salad didn't come with a roll, ala Saladworks for instance, but overall if I was in the area and wanted a salad, I might come back again.

reviews.name: Mike A.
reviews.review: As a guy in the west end, I love going into B&C on a Saturday or Sunday morning, enjoying an omelette, coffee, and catching up with the Nashville Scene. This has become routine for me over the years.  B&C fits a specific role in the community. It's a Vandy kind of place....very smart and of high quality. You'll see students, professors, and other West End folk like me in there. The other locations are equally as good I'm sure but this is where I primarily go. My only complaint is I feel like the waffles and toppings are a bit expensive for what you get. I would like to order that more than I do. On the flip side, the omelettes are an excellent value. Parking can be tricky if you're there at a peak time. Highly recommended for breakfast!

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: I had a nice sandwich at Bread & Company.  It was on sourdough bread, and on it was chicken, avocado, sun dried tomato aioli, and some nice greens.That was a pretty boring review of a sandwich, huh?  Well, though the sandwich (and tomato soup) I had were both fine at Bread & Company, I'm not running back to B&Co.  The ordering process is somewhat confusing; if you only visit B&Co. once every two years you have to be reminded each time what ordering paper goes where and where to pick up what item.  As for flavors - the sandwich was good.  Just.. good.  Maybe Bread & Company just has the misfortune that I ate there after I recently ate at our local A Matter of Taste, where I had not a good sandwich but a WONDERFUL sandwich.  I can see myself going in to B&Co. to try some desserts and pastries which were absent from my current visit.  There was a beautiful beebee crème brulée and vanilla panna cotta and other yummy delights for sale.So to sum it up, the bread, and its company, are pretty good.

reviews.name: Amanda A.
reviews.review: I find a lot of the other reviews on here really frustrating. Because I heart this place so hard that I can't make sense of how people can feel so negatively. So first I will acknowledge what I think *are* real problems here: 1) The Setup. Yes, it's confusing. Yes, there has to be a better way. It would make much more sense to have one register for the custom food orders and another for coffee and baked goods. But wait! There is! Only thing is, it's not always open and it's still pretty damn confusing which one you should go to.2) The Coffee. It's terrible. I've gotten coffee here a couple of times, once regular coffee, another time a latte. Once my friend ordered a chai and I ordered a soy latte, and we seriously couldn't tell the difference between them. I don't know how this is possible. They have a big fancy espresso machine back there, but it seems like maybe they're using coffee beans to make espresso? Who knows. I suggest you stick with tea, water, or soda. Regular coffee if you must. It says online that they use Bongo Java. I'm going to have to try it again, as I've gotten it at the end of the day, and perhaps it was bad because it was sitting there too long.But now, on to what this place is best at: FOOD.Their breakfast sandwiches are ginormous and so damn tasty. You can custom build them on croissants, bagels, or any of their fresh baked breads. It's $5.50. This might seem expensive for two ingredients, except when you realize that it's 2 ingredients *in addition to* eggs (and you can get egg whites no extra charge).The breakfast choice FTW, though, is the french toast. People, this is the best french toast I have had in my entire life, and a ton of food for its $7.19 price, which is totally reasonable for a breakfast entree. If you don't want one of the main breakfast things, you can't go wrong with their baked goods. Everything I've had has been incredible, including their desserts. As far as the lunch options, the sandwiches are killer. To be honest, I've only ever had the farm bread, because it's so amazing I can't bring myself to order anything else. I crave the Fresh Mozzarella sandwich all the time, and that's my default order, but the Boulder Veggie is also good. And they do a 1/2 sandwich + soup or salad special, which is a little cheaper and still plenty filling. I would very much like to disagree with statements made about their food not being higher quality than places like Panera. For me, the difference is night and day. Bread & Co is high quality, with the focus on freshness, rather than completely shorting out your system by loading on as many flavors as possible. I would never choose Panera or Provence over Bread & Co.A great option they have is their grab-and-go case, which stocks tons of sandwiches so you can cut out part of the waiting. Sadly I've never seen the Fresh Mozzarella in the prepared sandwich case. If they sold it that way, I'd probably be running in to grab and go far more often. I definitely recommend this place for brunches or late/early lunch and dinner. It can get very crowded with students around lunch, since it accepts Commodore Cash.The most prohibitive thing about Bread & Co is the parking situation. This lot just isn't big enough for the amount of businesses here. If you can find street or meter parking, I recommend that. I've witnessed a screaming match between people vying for the same parking spot here.  Please try this place out and be willing to wait in line for a short bit.  Yes it can be annoying, but I promisepromisepromise it's totally worth it.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: This place is all right.  I went in at about six pm, and left with two big loaves of bread, plus a cuppa joe for about $6.  Sometimes I'm looking for a deal, and when bread comes cheap and is tasty, I can make it on that.  If you don't mind that the bread is 12 hours old, that's the best time to get it, since it's 2 for 1.The coffee is all right.  A little bitter.  But they guy behind the counter was very nice and had a good sense of humor.  So this place is good people.

reviews.name: Matt D.
reviews.review: Simply put; it's an overpriced sandwich served in a very industrialized setting. The sandwich is good, just not $9 good. I love to try new places, but unfortunately Panera has you beat. A good example of "great idea, poor execution."

reviews.name: Jason B.
reviews.review: i like this place but only had coffee. i plan to go back soon. i read how all the reveiws said lunch crowd was crazy. i went bc i needed an early morning coffee house. music was a bit louder than i anticipated but stellar from my very brief experience.JEANS: OK by farORDER: at counter

reviews.name: Jenna W.
reviews.review: It's Wednesday and it's lunch time. I am hungry and I feel like a yummy sandwich/salad combo to fill my grumbling belly. I have already had my fill of Panera this week so I thought I go to Bread and Co. for a little something different. I had a half sandwich with nothing special on it and a salad with straight veggies in the works. I went to the cashier to pay for my meal. For a typical half sandwich and salad plus small drink scenario I was expecting somewhere around $10 for my lunch...Nope, I paid $16 for half of a sandwich, a salad and a small drink. $16 freaking dollars! I am pissed!! And the guy behind me I overheard his total was $17 and all he had was a salad!!!! Are you kidding me?! It wasn't like my meal was even all that gourmet! A measly sandwich and a salad cost me as much as a decent dinner somewhere else. I am furious!! Do yourself and your wallet a favor and just go to Panera down the street. Ridiculous.

reviews.name: Bill J.
reviews.review: I think they should rename this place Dry Bread & Company.  For a place that states on the menu that they bake their own bread fresh every day, the bread better be really good.I got the "award winning" tarragon chicken salad on rye.  The bread was very dry...I'd be shocked if it was actually baked on the day I got it. Not sure what sort of award the chicken salad won, but it was nothing to get excited about.  I ate a little over half of the sammich and tossed the rest.  I would not go back here, there are better places within walking distance.

reviews.name: B L.
reviews.review: ok sandwich.  The restaurant itself was disorganized, and I waited over 30 minutes.I recently visit the Bread and Company on West End for lunch.  It is in the same building as Barnes and Nobles and Starbucks - across from Centennial Park.  Parking, of course was a pain - but I found a spot in the garage behind, and they validate for 2 hours, so that worked out well.  I had never been here before, so I wasn't exactly sure how it worked.  There were several groups of people milling around, so I just asked.  Turns out, you fill out a sheet of paper indicating what you would like and they make it fresh for you.  I like the idea of that, but in practice it does not work well here.  The sandwich counter was completely disorganized.  The papers were scattered all around and there were no less than 20 people standing around waiting on sandwiches.  They also have a soup counter (no one was working at that counter), a hot food counter (again, no one working at this one), a salad counter, a bakery counter, and a separate area for drinks.  If you would like to eat, for example, a half sandwich and salad with a drink and cookie - you have fill out 2 pieces of paper and to go to 4 different areas of the store.  It took 23 minutes to make my chicken salad sandwich on wheat and another 8 minutes to stand in a separate line to pay for it. (I timed it).  I didn't have the time to wait for anything else. The sandwich was ok, but it's not worth the trouble to me.  probably won't be back.

reviews.name: Bryan O.
reviews.review: Plain and simple, not very good.  The system for ordering is convoluted, at best.  The fact that you have to place a sandwich order at one counter, then get back into a long line to pay for the order, the same line that others are ordering breakfast/desserts, is ridiculous.  The quality of the bagels were mediocre.  I had the nova platter.  Let's say that they really like to use capers.  There had to be a whole jar on my bagel.  Of course, this was after I asked for no capers and no onion (onion was on it too, but much easier to remove).  I removed them myself as it took 30 minutes to get the order.I don't live here, but I'd never return to this place if I did or if I visit again.

reviews.name: Sai Aung L.
reviews.review: There are lot of healthy choices for customers. I had sandwich there. I really enjoyed it. The restaurant is very spacious and a very cool place to hang out with friends and family. As I am summer student at Vanderbilt University, the waitress there served me fruit tea for free when I asked her I would like a cup of fruit tea. I am so glad that I got a drink for free. Overall, I had a good time eating there and I would say it is good to go there once in a while.

reviews.name: Ruben M.
reviews.review: This place simply rocks! I'm unsure of the bad reviews because when I went JUST NOW, I thought it was awesome!You can build your Sammy the way you want it.. Food is freaking good... They have an awesome fruit tea (not a tea person but this is good!).. And it's cheap!Even more than being cheap is the fact that the portion sizes are big, and they accept vandy cards!Would've given it 5 stars easy,however the pastries are not so delicious :(

reviews.name: T K.
reviews.review: Descent food but expensive and very poor service.  Long lines at the register and the store is laid out poorly.

reviews.name: Jaycee L.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed the chicken salad sandwich-- it's won an award so I thought I'd give it a shot. I like the fact that you can write in your order and just give it to them. During a busy lunch hour it's pretty effective and makes for quick service. Lots to offer on their menu and they allow you to modify things to your liking. Def coming back here for lunch :)

reviews.name: Joanna F.
reviews.review: I've been here once, and  the salad I got was absolutely delicious. The cranberry-walnut croutons are amazing! The fruit tea was really good too, and I liked the mint that was infused with it. It gave it a nice, crisp taste. Perfect for a warm, spring/summer day.The place is clean, but there is not a lot of seating outside FYI.When I went in, I was severely confused at what the heck I was supposed to do. I looked around and tried to see what I was supposed to do, but I ended up asking another customer who seemed in a rush, but gave me some quick directions. Granted, it was lunch time, busy, and people were hurrying to get their food. You check items off on a sheet of paper that you want to go into the salad, or you can choose one of their menu salads instead of building your own. I handed it to the person who was making my salad. She didn't seem very happy, nor did she make very much eye contact with me. I was pretty excited about my salad as she made it, and she gave me a HUGE SERVING.  I was really surprised. She didn't say anything to me as she handed me my food. Maybe she was having a bad day? I got my drink and got in line to pay.The cashier was extremely nice and friendly compared to the other girl. I paid ~$10-11 for everything. A little steep in my opinion. But the salad was amazing.I was reading through reviews and came across Meredith C.'s review. And she mentioned that you're supposed to get a roll with your salad, but ask for it. Sometimes they don't give it to you.*pauses*I get a roll!? I didn't get one. Man, I really wanted to try their bread too... They also have soups, sandwiches, and other baked goods.Overall, I really, really like their salad. But I don't want to pay that much. Service was not very friendly. And like everybody else said, it can be a little chaotic/confusing when getting your food, especially during lunch time.

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: I finally resolved to go in here and figure out the layout in order to purchase something, anything.
